original: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: aa bhi dha rmma sarba du tstsha ya bh'a shum /
analyzed: aa bhi dha rmma sarba du tstsha ya bh'a shum /
translated: Abhidharma sarva du·π£·π≠a yabhƒÅ·π£u

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: chos mngon pa kun las btus pa'i bshad pa /
analyzed: chos mngon pa kun las btus pa'i bshad pa /
translated: Explanation of the Compendium of Abhidharma

original: bam po dang po /
analyzed: bam po dang po /
translated: Volume One

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to youthful Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´.

original: ci'i phyir bstan bcos 'di brtsams she na /üîΩphung po la sogs pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bstan bcos 'di brtsams she na / phung po la sogs pa las brtsams te /
translated: Why was this treatise composed?

original: du dang ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsam pa'i gnas rnams la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir brtsams so //
analyzed: du dang ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsam pa'i gnas rnams la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir brtsams so //
translated: It was composed in order to be skilled in the topics of thought, such as the number and purpose, beginning with the aggregates.

original: 'di ltar mkhas pa 'dis ni phan yon rnam pa gnyis thob ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mkhas pa 'dis ni phan yon rnam pa gnyis thob ste /
translated: Thus, by this skill, one obtains two kinds of benefits:

original: yid la byed pa'i phan yon dang / 'bel ba'i gtam gtan la 'bebs pa'i phan yon no //
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i phan yon dang / 'bel ba'i gtam gtan la 'bebs pa'i phan yon no //
translated: The benefit of mental attention and the benefit of determining discourse.

original: de la yid la byed pa'i phan yon ni zhi gnas kyi rjes su mthun pa dang / lhag mthong 'phel ba'i rjes su mthun pa rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la yid la byed pa'i phan yon ni zhi gnas kyi rjes su mthun pa dang / lhag mthong 'phel ba'i rjes su mthun pa rig par bya'o //
translated: Among them, the benefit of mental attention should be known as conducive to ≈õamatha and conducive to the increase of vipa≈õyanƒÅ.

original: zhi gnas kyi rjes su mthun pa ni gnas 'di dag la mkhas par byas pas the tshom med pas /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi rjes su mthun pa ni gnas 'di dag la mkhas par byas pas the tshom med pas /
translated: The conformity with serenity is that, by becoming skilled in these topics, one is free from doubt.

original: ji ltar rang gi dmigs pa la rtse gcig pa'i tshul gyis bde bar sems mnyam par 'jog pa'i phyir zhi gnas kyi rjes su mthun no //üîΩlhag mthong @2a * //
analyzed: ji ltar rang gi dmigs pa la rtse gcig pa'i tshul gyis bde bar sems mnyam par 'jog pa'i phyir zhi gnas kyi rjes su mthun no // lhag mthong @2a * //
translated: Therefore, it is in conformity with serenity because the mind is placed in equipoise in a pleasant way by means of the one-pointedness of mind on its object.

original: 'phel ba'i rjes su mthun pa ni rnam pa mang por shes bya yongs su brtags pas shes rab khyad zhugs par 'gro ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phel ba'i rjes su mthun pa ni rnam pa mang por shes bya yongs su brtags pas shes rab khyad zhugs par 'gro ba'i phyir /
translated: The conformity with insight is that, by investigating the objects of knowledge in many ways, one's wisdom becomes superior.

original: lhag mthong gi rjes su mthun no //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi rjes su mthun no //
translated: Therefore, it is in conformity with insight.

original: 'bel ba'i gtam gtan la 'bebs pa'i phan yon ni gnas 'di dag la mkhas pas 'dri ba thams cad lung ston pa'i mthu dang ldan pas mi 'jigs pa thob par blta'o //
analyzed: 'bel ba'i gtam gtan la 'bebs pa'i phan yon ni gnas 'di dag la mkhas pas 'dri ba thams cad lung ston pa'i mthu dang ldan pas mi 'jigs pa thob par blta'o //
translated: The benefit of resolving through discourse is that, by becoming skilled in these topics, one should be seen as attaining fearlessness, having the power to answer all questions.

original: bdag gi gzhi rnam pa lnga brjod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag gi gzhi rnam pa lnga brjod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the five bases of self are described.

original: zhes bya ba 'di la rnam pa bzhi ni bdag gi gzhi yin pas bdag gi gzhi'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la rnam pa bzhi ni bdag gi gzhi yin pas bdag gi gzhi'o //
translated: Here, the four are the bases of self because they are the bases of self.

original: lnga pa ni bdag gi mtshan nyid kho na ste /
analyzed: lnga pa ni bdag gi mtshan nyid kho na ste /
translated: The fifth is the very nature of the self.

original: gzhi yin pas bdag gi gzhir rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhi yin pas bdag gi gzhir rig par bya'o //
translated: It is the basis, and so it is to be known as the basis of the self.

original: lus yongs su gzung ba dang bcas pa smos pas ni phyi dang nang gi gzugs kyi phung po bsdus so //
analyzed: lus yongs su gzung ba dang bcas pa smos pas ni phyi dang nang gi gzugs kyi phung po bsdus so //
translated: The mention of the body with its appropriation includes the internal material aggregate.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa ni longs spyod la sogs pa nyid de /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa ni longs spyod la sogs pa nyid de /
translated: Feeling, etc., are just the enjoyments, etc.

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skabs su 'chad do //
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skabs su 'chad do //
translated: Their natures will be explained in the section on the teaching of their natures.

original: de dag gi gnas ni bdag gi gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi gnas ni bdag gi gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The abode of those is the basis of the self, consciousness.

original: lus yongs su gzung ba dang bcas pa la sogs pa de dag gi gnas ni bdag gi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: lus yongs su gzung ba dang bcas pa la sogs pa de dag gi gnas ni bdag gi mtshan nyid de /
translated: The abode of those, the body with its appropriation, etc., is the nature of the self.

original: gzhi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is synonymous with basis.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na phal cher rnam par shes pa'i phung po la bdag tu 'dzin lhag ma rnams la ni bdag gir @2b 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na phal cher rnam par shes pa'i phung po la bdag tu 'dzin lhag ma rnams la ni bdag gir @2b 'dzin to //
translated: Thus, in the world, the aggregate of consciousness is generally held to be the self, and the remaining aggregates are held to be mine.

original: lus yongs su gzung ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus yongs su gzung ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: By the body with its appropriation, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa dbang po drug dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul drug gis so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dbang po drug dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul drug gis so //
translated: The six sense faculties are the eye, etc. The six objects are form, etc.

original: 'das pa dang da ltar gyi nye bar spyod pa rnam pa drug ni rnam par shes pa drug ste /üîΩde 'dzin pa ni gnas dang dmigs pa'i dang pos 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar gyi nye bar spyod pa rnam pa drug ni rnam par shes pa drug ste / de 'dzin pa ni gnas dang dmigs pa'i dang pos 'dzin to //
translated: The six kinds of past and present experience are the six consciousnesses.üîΩThe sense faculties and their objects are called elements because they are the first to grasp the experience.

original: dbang po dang yul bcu gnyis ni de ltar de 'dzin pa'i phyir khams so //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul bcu gnyis ni de ltar de 'dzin pa'i phyir khams so //
translated: The twelve sense faculties and objects are called elements because they are the first to grasp the experience.

original: rnam par shes pa rnams ni nye bar spyod pa'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pas khams nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams ni nye bar spyod pa'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pas khams nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The consciousnesses should be understood as elements because they are characterized by experience.

original: skye ba'i sgo tsam yin pa'i phyir dbang po dang don tsam smos pas skye mched bcu gnyis kho nar rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: skye ba'i sgo tsam yin pa'i phyir dbang po dang don tsam smos pas skye mched bcu gnyis kho nar rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: The twelve sense fields are established by merely mentioning the sense faculties and objects because they are merely the doors of birth.

original: nye bar spyod pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par shes pa drug ni rnam par ma gzhag go //üîΩnye bar len pa ni 'dun pa dang 'dod chags te /üîΩde la 'dun pa ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar spyod pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par shes pa drug ni rnam par ma gzhag go // nye bar len pa ni 'dun pa dang 'dod chags te / de la 'dun pa ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: The six consciousnesses, which are characterized by experience, are not established as sense fields.üîΩClinging is craving and grasping.üîΩCraving is desire.

original: 'dod chags ni lhag pa chags pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni lhag pa chags pa'o //
translated: Grasping is attachment.

original: 'dun pas ni ma 'ongs pa'i lus 'dod pa'i sgo nas len te /
analyzed: 'dun pas ni ma 'ongs pa'i lus 'dod pa'i sgo nas len te /
translated: By desire, one appropriates a future body by way of longing for it.

original: des ma 'ongs pa'i phung po rnams 'grub po //
analyzed: des ma 'ongs pa'i phung po rnams 'grub po //
translated: By that, the future aggregates are established.

original: 'dod chags kyis ni da ltar gyi lus la lhag par chags pa'i sgo nas len te /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis ni da ltar gyi lus la lhag par chags pa'i sgo nas len te /
translated: By attachment, one appropriates the present body by way of excessive attachment to it.

original: des da ltar gyi phung po rnams yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: des da ltar gyi phung po rnams yongs su mi gtong ngo //
translated: By that, one does not abandon the present aggregates.

original: de bas na 'di gnyi ga yang nye bar len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di gnyi ga yang nye bar len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, both of these are called appropriation.

original: de la phung po bzhin du bshad do zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de la phung po bzhin du bshad do zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: It is explained like the aggregates, that is, it is associated with appropriation.

original: de'i phyir nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams su rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood as the appropriated phenomena.

original: reg pas gzugs su yod pas ni gzhan du 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: reg pas gzugs su yod pas ni gzhan du 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: By contact, it should be understood as having form, that is, as having a different form.

original: gang yul la zhes bya ba ni mngon du gyur ba'i phyogs la'o //
analyzed: gang yul la zhes bya ba ni mngon du gyur ba'i phyogs la'o //
translated: In the case of an object, this refers to the manifest aspect.

original: 'di dang 'di'o zhes bya ba ni keng rus la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po dang 'dra ba'i gzugs brnyan no //
analyzed: 'di dang 'di'o zhes bya ba ni keng rus la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po dang 'dra ba'i gzugs brnyan no //
translated: This and that refers to a reflected image that is similar to the entity called a skeleton, and so on.

original: 'di lta bu dang 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bye brag go //
analyzed: 'di lta bu dang 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bye brag go //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch and such‚Äù refers to the specific colors and shapes.

original: bkra bar 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: bkra bar 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'du shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo grasp at beauty‚Äù means to perceive in that way.

original: las dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa ni bde ba myong ba'o //
analyzed: las dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa ni bde ba myong ba'o //
translated: The result of evolution of virtuous actions is the experience of pleasure.

original: las mi dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa ni sdug bsngal myong ba'o //
analyzed: las mi dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa ni sdug bsngal myong ba'o //
translated: The result of evolution of nonvirtuous actions is the experience of pain.

original: gnyi ga'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa myong ba ste //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa myong ba ste //
translated: The result of evolution of both is the experience of neither pleasure nor pain.

original: 'di ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams kyi rnam par smin pa kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni rtag tu btang snyoms nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin @3a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams kyi rnam par smin pa kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni rtag tu btang snyoms nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin @3a * //
translated: Thus, the result of evolution of both virtuous and nonvirtuous actions is the store consciousness, which is always associated with equanimity.

original: te / btang snyoms de nyid rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: te / btang snyoms de nyid rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: That equanimity is the result of evolution.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal de ni rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa zhes nye bar gdags so //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal de ni rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa zhes nye bar gdags so //
translated: But pleasure and pain are designated as results of evolution because they arise from evolution.

original: mthong ba dang thos pa dang bye brag phyed pa dang rnam par shes pa'i don rnams la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mthong ba dang thos pa dang bye brag phyed pa dang rnam par shes pa'i don rnams la zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of what is seen, heard, distinguished, and cognized.

original: mthong ba ni gang mig gis myong ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba ni gang mig gis myong ba'o //
translated: Seeing is what is experienced by the eye.

original: thos pa ni gang rna bas myong ba'o //
analyzed: thos pa ni gang rna bas myong ba'o //
translated: Hearing is what is experienced by the ear.

original: bye brag phyed pa ni gang 'di dang 'di lta bur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis mngon par brtags pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag phyed pa ni gang 'di dang 'di lta bur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis mngon par brtags pa'o //
translated: Distinguishing is what is imagined by oneself, such as ‚Äúit is like this and like that.‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa ni gang so so rang gis myong ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni gang so so rang gis myong ba'o //
translated: Cognizing is what is experienced by oneself.

original: tha snyad 'dogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tha snyad 'dogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The expression is

original: mngon par brjod pa rnams kyis go bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa rnams kyis go bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: the understanding through verbal expressions.

original: gnas skabs sna tshogs rnams su zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs sna tshogs rnams su zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnams su'o //
translated: In various situations means in happiness, suffering, and so on.

original: mig gang gis gzugs rnams mthong bar gyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i rnam par shes pa nye bar spyod pa 'dzin pa nyid kyis khams nyid du ston to //
analyzed: mig gang gis gzugs rnams mthong bar gyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i rnam par shes pa nye bar spyod pa 'dzin pa nyid kyis khams nyid du ston to //
translated: The eye by which one sees forms shows that the past consciousness is the element itself through the function of grasping.

original: lta ba zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi rnam par shes pa nye bar spyod pa 'dzin pa nyid kyis khams nyid du ston to //
analyzed: lta ba zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi rnam par shes pa nye bar spyod pa 'dzin pa nyid kyis khams nyid du ston to //
translated: The so-called view is the element itself, as the present consciousness is shown to be the appropriator of the sense-fields.

original: mig de'i sa bon bsags pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa yang khams te /
analyzed: mig de'i sa bon bsags pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa yang khams te /
translated: The store-consciousness which is the seed-accumulation of that eye is also an element,

original: gang las phyi ma la mig 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang las phyi ma la mig 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: from which the eye will be established in the future.

original: rnam par smin pa'ang khams te gang las grub zin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'ang khams te gang las grub zin pa'o //
translated: The maturation is also an element, from which it has already been established.

original: sa bon rnam pa de gnyi ga yang mig gi rgyu yin pas mig gi khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa bon rnam pa de gnyi ga yang mig gi rgyu yin pas mig gi khams zhes bya'o //
translated: Since both of these kinds of seeds are the cause of the eye, they are called the eye element.

original: mig gi khams ni gzugs la dbang byed pa ste /
analyzed: mig gi khams ni gzugs la dbang byed pa ste /
translated: The eye element is the dominant influence with regard to form,

original: dbang po'i dbang gis phyi rol gyi yul 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i dbang gis phyi rol gyi yul 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the external object is established by the power of the sense-faculty.

original: rang gi rten dang dmigs pa'i bye brag can no //
analyzed: rang gi rten dang dmigs pa'i bye brag can no //
translated: It is distinguished by its own basis and objective support.

original: de ni khams bzhin du blta ste ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyor ro zhes bya ba ni mig gang gis gzugs rnams mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / de'i sa bon bsags pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de ni khams bzhin du blta ste ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyor ro zhes bya ba ni mig gang gis gzugs rnams mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / de'i sa bon bsags pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The eye by which one sees forms and the foundation consciousness that stores the seeds of that eye,

original: gang las phyi ma la mig 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang las phyi ma la mig 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: from which the eye will be established in the future.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúformed from the four great elements‚Äù means that derivative form is like the great elements.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa zhes bya ba la rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩ'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa ni skyed pa dang / rten pa dang / gnas pa dang / ston pa dang / 'phel bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa zhes bya ba la rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ji lta bu zhe na / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa ni skyed pa dang / rten pa dang / gnas pa dang / ston pa dang / 'phel bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: What is derivative form? It is that which is formed from the four great elements.

original: 'byung ba dag rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la rgyu rnam pa lnga'i @3b dbang du byas nas skyed pa la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba dag rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la rgyu rnam pa lnga'i @3b dbang du byas nas skyed pa la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid yin te /
translated: The great elements are the cause of derivative form in five ways: as the cause of generation, as the cause of support, as the cause of duration, as the cause of manifestation, and as the cause of increase.

original: 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid ni 'di dag med na de mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid ni 'di dag med na de mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro /
translated: The great elements are the cause of generation of derivative form because derivative form does not occur if the great elements are absent.

original: 'dug pa'i rgyu nyid ni 'byung ba rnams bsal na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la sogs shig tu yul gnod pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dug pa'i rgyu nyid ni 'byung ba rnams bsal na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la sogs shig tu yul gnod pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of endurance is that when the primary elements are removed, the derivative form, etc. are not capable of being destroyed.

original: rjes su 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyid ni 'byung ba gyur na de la gnas pa'i rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyang 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyid ni 'byung ba gyur na de la gnas pa'i rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyang 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of transformation is that when the primary elements change, the derivative form that is based on them also changes.

original: gnas par byed pa'i rgyu nyid ni mtshungs par 'byung ba'i dus na 'byung ba rnams kyi rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi rgyud rgyun mi 'chad pa'i tshul du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas par byed pa'i rgyu nyid ni mtshungs par 'byung ba'i dus na 'byung ba rnams kyi rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi rgyud rgyun mi 'chad pa'i tshul du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of maintenance is that when they occur in a similar way, the primary elements hold the stream of derivative form in a continuous manner.

original: 'phel bar byed pa'i rgyu nyid ni 'phel ba'i dus na 'byung ba rnams kyis rgyur byas pa'i gzugs yongs su rgyas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phel bar byed pa'i rgyu nyid ni 'phel ba'i dus na 'byung ba rnams kyis rgyur byas pa'i gzugs yongs su rgyas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of increase is that when they increase, the primary elements cause derivative form to expand.

original: sngon po la sogs pa gzugs rnam pa nyi shu rtsa lnga ni mtshan nyid dang / gnas pa dang / phan gnod dang / byed pa'i rten dang / byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyan dang / rnam pa drug gis rnam pa gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa gzugs rnam pa nyi shu rtsa lnga ni mtshan nyid dang / gnas pa dang / phan gnod dang / byed pa'i rten dang / byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyan dang / rnam pa drug gis rnam pa gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The twenty-five kinds of form, such as blue, are established by way of their characteristics, their location, their benefit or harm, their basis of activity, their function, and their adornment.

original: bzhi dang / bcu dang / brgyad dang / gcig dang / gcig go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: bzhi dang / bcu dang / brgyad dang / gcig dang / gcig go rims bzhin no //
translated: four, ten, eight, one, and one, respectively.

original: de la mngon par skabs yod pa zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa zlog par byed pa'i reg bya dang bral ba'i phyogs gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la mngon par skabs yod pa zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa zlog par byed pa'i reg bya dang bral ba'i phyogs gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, ‚Äúunobstructed space‚Äù is the part that is free from the tangible that obstructs it.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúSpace‚Äù

original: gang steng na sngon por snang ba'o //
analyzed: gang steng na sngon por snang ba'o //
translated: is the blue that appears above.

original: sgra ni mtshan nyid dang / phan gnod dang / rgyus rab tu dbye ba dang / bshad pas rab tu dbye ba dang / tha snyad kyis rab tu dbye bas rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sgra ni mtshan nyid dang / phan gnod dang / rgyus rab tu dbye ba dang / bshad pas rab tu dbye ba dang / tha snyad kyis rab tu dbye bas rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Sound is established by way of its characteristics, its benefit or harm, its classification by cause, its classification by explanation, and its classification by convention.

original: mtshan nyid ni rna ba'i dbang pos ga zung ba'i don gang yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni rna ba'i dbang pos ga zung ba'i don gang yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The definition is: that which is the object apprehended by the auditory faculty.

original: bstan pas rab tu dbye ba ni 'jig rten gyi grags pa la sogs pa gsum mo //
analyzed: bstan pas rab tu dbye ba ni 'jig rten gyi grags pa la sogs pa gsum mo //
translated: The classification by teaching is threefold: that which is well known in the world, and so on.

original: lhag ma ni ji ltar mthun mthun du rig par bya'o //üîΩde la zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lhag ma ni ji ltar mthun mthun du rig par bya'o // de la zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The rest should be understood according to their meaning.

original: ngag gi sgra'o //üîΩzin pa ma yin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ngag gi sgra'o // zin pa ma yin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among them, that which arises from the cause of the appropriated great elements is, for example, the sound of speech.

original: shing la sogs pa'i sgra'o //üîΩde gnyi ga ni 'di lta ste //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa'i sgra'o // de gnyi ga ni 'di lta ste //
translated: That which arises from the cause of the unappropriated great elements is, for example, the sound of trees and so on.

original: lag pa dang rdza rnga la sogs pa'i sgra'o //üîΩ'jig rten gyi grag pa ni /
analyzed: lag pa dang rdza rnga la sogs pa'i sgra'o // 'jig rten gyi grag pa ni /
translated: That which arises from both is, for example, the sound of hands and clay pots and so on.

original: 'jig rten pa'i skad kyis bsdus pa'o //üîΩgrub pas bstan pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyis bstan pa'o //üîΩkun tu brtags pa ni mu stegs pa can rnams kyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i skad kyis bsdus pa'o // grub pas bstan pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyis bstan pa'o // kun tu brtags pa ni mu stegs pa can rnams kyis bstan pa'o //
translated: That which is well known in the world is included in worldly language.üîΩThat which is taught by the accomplished ones is taught by the noble ones.üîΩThat which is imagined is taught by the tƒ´rthikas.

original: 'phags pas tha snyad @4a * //
analyzed: 'phags pas tha snyad @4a * //
translated: That which is conventional is the conventional usage of the noble ones.

original: btags pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin pas tha snyad btags pa ni /
analyzed: btags pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin pas tha snyad btags pa ni /
translated: The conventional is that which is designated by the ignorant,üîΩand that which is designated by those who are not noble.

original: mthong ba la sogs pa tha snyad brgyad kyi dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba la sogs pa tha snyad brgyad kyi dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the conventional is made up of eight kinds of designations, such as seeing, etc.

original: dri ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang / phan gnod dang gnas skabs kyi sgo nas rab tu dbye bas rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: dri ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang / phan gnod dang gnas skabs kyi sgo nas rab tu dbye bas rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Smell is established by way of its own characteristic, by way of its being beneficial or harmful, and by way of its being a condition.

original: ro yang de bzhin du rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ro yang de bzhin du rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Taste is also established in the same way.

original: de la lhan cig skyes pa'i dri ni /
analyzed: de la lhan cig skyes pa'i dri ni /
translated: Among these, the natural smell is

original: tsan dan la sogs pa'i dri'o //
analyzed: tsan dan la sogs pa'i dri'o //
translated: the smell of sandalwood, etc.

original: sbyar ba las byung ba ni bdug spos sbyar ba la sogs pa'i dri'o //
analyzed: sbyar ba las byung ba ni bdug spos sbyar ba la sogs pa'i dri'o //
translated: The smell that arises from combination is the smell of combined incense, etc.

original: gyur pa las byung ba'i dri ni shing tog smin pa la sogs pa'i dri'o //
analyzed: gyur pa las byung ba'i dri ni shing tog smin pa la sogs pa'i dri'o //
translated: The smell that arises from change is the smell of ripe fruit, etc.

original: reg bya'i phyogs gcig ni kun tu mnabs pa dang / kun tu gzhal ba dang / reg pa dang / kun tu btsir ba dang / 'dus pa dang / khams snyoms ma snyoms kyi rnam par gzhag go /
analyzed: reg bya'i phyogs gcig ni kun tu mnabs pa dang / kun tu gzhal ba dang / reg pa dang / kun tu btsir ba dang / 'dus pa dang / khams snyoms ma snyoms kyi rnam par gzhag go /
translated: One part of the tangible is established as being smooth, rough, heavy, light, cold, hunger, and thirst.

original: chu dang rlung 'dus na grang ngo //
analyzed: chu dang rlung 'dus na grang ngo //
translated: When water and wind come together, it is cold.

original: chu dang sa 'dus na 'dred do //
analyzed: chu dang sa 'dus na 'dred do //
translated: Water and earth, when combined, are slippery.

original: khams snyoms na ngal sos pa dang / nyams yod pa dang / spungs che bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: khams snyoms na ngal sos pa dang / nyams yod pa dang / spungs che bar 'gyur te /
translated: When the elements are in balance, one is refreshed, one‚Äôs strength is restored, and one‚Äôs body becomes plump.

original: sbungs che ba ni mi 'jigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sbungs che ba ni mi 'jigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that plumpness is a sign of fearlessness.

original: tshim pa ni gnyi ga'o //
analyzed: tshim pa ni gnyi ga'o //
translated: Satisfaction is a sign of both.

original: bkres pa la sogs pa lhag ma rnam ni khams ma snyoms par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bkres pa la sogs pa lhag ma rnam ni khams ma snyoms par rig par bya'o //
translated: Hunger and the rest of the remaining ones are signs of an imbalance of the elements.

original: bsdus pa las gyur pa ni rdul phra rab kyi gzugs so //
analyzed: bsdus pa las gyur pa ni rdul phra rab kyi gzugs so //
translated: The form that is derived from accumulation is the form of the most subtle particles.

original: mngon par skabs yod pa ni de nyid de //
analyzed: mngon par skabs yod pa ni de nyid de //
translated: The form that is capable of contact is the same as the previous one.

original: de las gzhan pa thogs par byed pa'i reg bya dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa thogs par byed pa'i reg bya dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is the form that is free from the resistance of other forms.

original: yang dag par blangs pa las byung ba'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: yang dag par blangs pa las byung ba'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs so //
translated: The form that is derived from a promise is the form of the non-informative that arises from a vow.

original: kun brtags pa ni gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs so //
analyzed: kun brtags pa ni gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs so //
translated: The form that is imagined is the form of a reflection.

original: dbang 'byor pa ni rnam par thar pa la bsam gtan pa'i spyod yul gyi gzugs gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang 'byor pa ni rnam par thar pa la bsam gtan pa'i spyod yul gyi gzugs gang yin pa'o //
translated: The form that is mastered is the form that is the domain of the concentration of the liberations.

original: tshor ba'i phung po ni gnas dang / ngo bo nyid dang / gnas sdom pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bas rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po ni gnas dang / ngo bo nyid dang / gnas sdom pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bas rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The aggregate of feeling is established by way of basis, nature, basis and object, affliction, and purification.

original: de la gzugs kyi gnas sdom pas ni lus kyi tshor ba rnam bar gzhag go //
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi gnas sdom pas ni lus kyi tshor ba rnam bar gzhag go //
translated: Among them, bodily feeling is established by the basis and object of form.

original: gzugs med pa'i gnas sdom pas ni sems kyi tshor ba rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i gnas sdom pas ni sems kyi tshor ba rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Mental feeling is established by the basis and object of the formless.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pas ni zang zing dang bcas pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pas ni zang zing dang bcas pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that feeling is established as having substance, etc. by affliction.

original: rnam par byang bas ni zang zing med pa la sogs par rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang bas ni zang zing med pa la sogs par rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that feeling is established as without substance, etc. by purification.

original: de'i srid pa dang mi ldan pa'i zhes bya ba ni mtshungs par ldan @4b pa ma yin pa dang bral ba'i rjes su mthun par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i srid pa dang mi ldan pa'i zhes bya ba ni mtshungs par ldan @4b pa ma yin pa dang bral ba'i rjes su mthun par rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand not associated with existence‚Äù means that it is in accordance with the absence of association.

original: tha snyad la mi mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: tha snyad la mi mkhas pa ni /
translated: Lack of skill in conventional expressions

original: skad ma bslabs pas gzugs la 'du shes ni 'byung na gzugs so snyam pa ni mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: skad ma bslabs pas gzugs la 'du shes ni 'byung na gzugs so snyam pa ni mi shes pa ste /
translated: The idea of form arises because of the non-training in speech, but the idea of form as form does not arise.

original: de'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the idea of signlessness.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings la snyoms par zhugs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba mtshan ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la 'du shes pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings la snyoms par zhugs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba mtshan ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la 'du shes pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The idea of signless nirvana is the idea of signlessness, free from all signs of form, etc., by entering the sphere of signlessness.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo la snyoms par zhugs pa'i 'du shes ni mi gsal bas dmigs pa la mtshan mar mi byed pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo la snyoms par zhugs pa'i 'du shes ni mi gsal bas dmigs pa la mtshan mar mi byed pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The idea of the summit of existence is the idea of signlessness, because the object is not made into a sign by the unclear idea of the summit of existence.

original: chung ngu ni 'dod pa'i khams la ste /
analyzed: chung ngu ni 'dod pa'i khams la ste /
translated: The idea of smallness is in the desire realm,

original: ngan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is inferior.

original: rgya chen por gyur pa ni gzugs kyi khams la ste de bas mchog tu gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgya chen por gyur pa ni gzugs kyi khams la ste de bas mchog tu gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The idea of greatness is in the form realm, because it is superior to that.

original: tshad med pa ni nam mkha' dang rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa ni nam mkha' dang rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la ste /
translated: The idea of immeasurability is in the sphere of infinite space and the sphere of infinite consciousness,üîΩbecause they are immeasurable.

original: mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are infinite.

original: de bas na de dag la dmigs pa'i 'du shes ni chung ngu la sogs pa'i 'du shes rnams su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de dag la dmigs pa'i 'du shes ni chung ngu la sogs pa'i 'du shes rnams su rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the notion that has them for its object should be understood as the notions of small, etc.

original: tshor ba dang 'du shes ma gtogs pa sems las byung ba dang / sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa thams cad ni 'du byed kyi phung po'i mtshan nyid kho na yin na /
analyzed: tshor ba dang 'du shes ma gtogs pa sems las byung ba dang / sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa thams cad ni 'du byed kyi phung po'i mtshan nyid kho na yin na /
translated: All the mental factors and all the entities not associated with the mind, with the exception of feeling and conception, have only the characteristic of the formation heap.

original: de bstan pa la sems pa nyi tshe smos pa ni de gzhan dag gi sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bstan pa la sems pa nyi tshe smos pa ni de gzhan dag gi sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of volition alone in the presentation of that is because it precedes the others.

original: gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir gang gi dge ba'i phyir yang sems par byed ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir gang gi dge ba'i phyir yang sems par byed ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate the reason, he says, ‚Äúbecause it is the cause of the formation of all the heaps.

original: de la dge ba ni dad pa la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: de la dge ba ni dad pa la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ba rnams so //
translated: ‚Äù There, the wholesome are faith, etc., which will be mentioned below.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: The defiled are the passions and the secondary passions, such as passion, etc.

original: gnas skabs kyi bye brag ni sems pas bskyod pa'i 'du byed kyi gnas skabs rnams la btags pa'i sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi bye brag ni sems pas bskyod pa'i 'du byed kyi gnas skabs rnams la btags pa'i sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams so //
translated: The specific state is the state of the formative forces that are set in motion by intention, and is designated as the mental factors that are not associated with the mind.

original: sems pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba rnams ni mtshan nyid dang / las kyis bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba rnams ni mtshan nyid dang / las kyis bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The mental concomitants such as intention should be understood as being described in terms of their: essential nature and function.

original: de la sems pa ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa yid kyi las te zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems pa ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa yid kyi las te zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: Of these, intention is the mental activity that is the formative force of the mind and is mental karma. This is the description of its essential nature.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams la sems 'jug par byed pa'i las can zhes bya ba ni bstan pa ste //üîΩ'di ltar ji ltar mngon @5a * //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams la sems 'jug par byed pa'i las can zhes bya ba ni bstan pa ste // 'di ltar ji ltar mngon @5a * //
translated: Its function is to cause the mind to engage with regard to virtue, non-virtue and the ethically neutral. This is the description of its function.

original: par 'du bya ba dge ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams la sems 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par 'du bya ba dge ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams la sems 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, in this way, the mind engages with regard to virtuous etc. dharmas in accordance with the formative influence.

original: dmigs pa la sems 'dzin pa ni de nyid la yang dang yang du gtod bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa la sems 'dzin pa ni de nyid la yang dang yang du gtod bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The holding of the mind to an objective support should be known as the repeated directing of the mind to just that.

original: de'i phyir yid la byed pa thob pa ni ting nge 'dzin thob pa zhes bya'o //üîΩrnam par shes pa 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir yid la byed pa thob pa ni ting nge 'dzin thob pa zhes bya'o // rnam par shes pa 'byung ba la /
translated: Therefore, the attainment of attention is called the attainment of concentration.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba 'byung ba dang mthun par dbang po'i 'gyur ba gang yin pa'i rnam pa de ni reg par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba 'byung ba dang mthun par dbang po'i 'gyur ba gang yin pa'i rnam pa de ni reg par rig par bya'o //
translated: The transformation of the sense faculty that is favorable to the arising of a feeling of pleasure, etc. , in the arising of consciousness is to be known as contact.

original: de dang de la ldan par byed 'dod pa nyid de zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang mnyan pa la sogs pa byed 'dod pa thams cad bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang de la ldan par byed 'dod pa nyid de zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang mnyan pa la sogs pa byed 'dod pa thams cad bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The desire to be engaged with this or that is the desire to engage in seeing, hearing, etc. , and it includes all desires to engage.

original: ji ltar nges pa bzhin du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba 'di ni de bzhin te /
analyzed: ji ltar nges pa bzhin du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba 'di ni de bzhin te /
translated: It is the apprehension of the object just as it is, not otherwise.

original: gzhan du ma yin no /
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin no /
translated: It is not otherwise.

original: zhes du ma yin no zhes smos pa'o //
analyzed: zhes du ma yin no zhes smos pa'o //
translated: It is not otherwise.

original: de'i phyir de gces su byed pa ni gzhan dag gis 'phrogs par mi nus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de gces su byed pa ni gzhan dag gis 'phrogs par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, the cherishing of that cannot be taken away by others.

original: 'dris pa'i dngos po ni sngon myong bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dris pa'i dngos po ni sngon myong bar rig par bya'o //
translated: A familiar object is one that has been experienced in the past.

original: rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i las can ni dran pas dmigs pa mngon par brjod par gyur na rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i las can ni dran pas dmigs pa mngon par brjod par gyur na rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its function is to prevent distraction, because when mindfulness is present, there is no distraction from the object.

original: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'o //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'o //
translated: One-pointedness of mind is the absence of distraction.

original: shes pa'i rten byed pa ni sems mnyam par gzhag pa na yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i rten byed pa ni sems mnyam par gzhag pa na yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It serves as the basis of knowledge, because when the mind is concentrated, there is knowledge of things as they are.

original: som nyi zlog pa ni shes rab kyis chos rnams rab tu rnam par dbye na nges pa rnyed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdad pa ni yod pa nyid la mngon par yid ches pa'i rnam pa dang / yon tan can la dad pa'i rnam pa dang / nus pa la bdag gi rnam pa thob par byed dam /
analyzed: som nyi zlog pa ni shes rab kyis chos rnams rab tu rnam par dbye na nges pa rnyed pa'i phyir ro // dad pa ni yod pa nyid la mngon par yid ches pa'i rnam pa dang / yon tan can la dad pa'i rnam pa dang / nus pa la bdag gi rnam pa thob par byed dam /
translated: It turns back doubt, because when one has certainty about the differentiation of things through wisdom, doubt is eliminated.

original: sgrub par byed nus so snyam du 'dod pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed nus so snyam du 'dod pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Faith is the mental factor that has the aspect of confidence in the existent, the aspect of faith in the virtuous, and the aspect of desire to obtain or accomplish what is possible.

original: ngo tsha shes pa la sogs pa ni go sla bas yang rnam par ma phye'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa la sogs pa ni go sla bas yang rnam par ma phye'o //
translated: Since shame, etc., are easy to understand, they are not analyzed further.

original: skye bas thob pa dang / thos pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba ni go rims bzhin du rnam par smin pa dang / lung dang rtogs pa'i shes par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skye bas thob pa dang / thos pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba ni go rims bzhin du rnam par smin pa dang / lung dang rtogs pa'i shes par rig par bya'o //
translated: The wisdom that is acquired at birth, that arises from hearing, reflection, and meditation, is respectively the wisdom that is the result of evolution, the wisdom that is from listening, and the wisdom that is from meditation.

original: brtan pa dang bcas pa'i shes rab ni so sor brtags pa'o //
analyzed: brtan pa dang bcas pa'i shes rab ni so sor brtags pa'o //
translated: The wisdom that is firm is the wisdom that is from contemplation.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams la mthu dang ldan pa dang / brtson 'grus dang ldan pa dang / spro ba dang ldan pa dang / brtul ba brtan pa dang / brtson pa mi 'dor ba zhes 'byung ba mdo'i tshig 'di rnams ni go cha la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa spro @5b ba'i dngos po rnams dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //üîΩyongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams la mthu dang ldan pa dang / brtson 'grus dang ldan pa dang / spro ba dang ldan pa dang / brtul ba brtan pa dang / brtson pa mi 'dor ba zhes 'byung ba mdo'i tshig 'di rnams ni go cha la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa spro @5b ba'i dngos po rnams dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro // yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni /
translated: The S≈´tra says that it is the wisdom that is powerful with regard to wholesome states, that is endowed with vigor, endowed with enthusiasm, with firm resolution, and with indefatigable effort. These words of the S≈´tra are to be applied respectively to the armor, etc., in order to show that they are the basis of enthusiasm.

original: ji ltar dngos gzhi la 'jug pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dngos gzhi la 'jug pa lta bu'o //
translated: The wisdom that is fully developed is like the wisdom that enters the stage of a bodhisattva.

original: yongs su bsgrub pa ni de nyid legs par yongs su sbyong ba byas pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su bsgrub pa ni de nyid legs par yongs su sbyong ba byas pa'o //
translated: The wisdom that is fully accomplished is the same wisdom that is well purified.

original: sgrib pa thams cad sel ba ni de'i dbang gis gnas 'gyur bar blta'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad sel ba ni de'i dbang gis gnas 'gyur bar blta'o //
translated: The removal of all obscurations should be regarded as the transformation of the basis through the power of that.

original: dge ba thams cad bsgom pa'i sngon du brtson 'grus la sogs pa bzhi po 'gro bas /
analyzed: dge ba thams cad bsgom pa'i sngon du brtson 'grus la sogs pa bzhi po 'gro bas /
translated: Since the four beginning with vigor precede the cultivation of all virtues,

original: de dag la bag yod par gdags te /
analyzed: de dag la bag yod par gdags te /
translated: they are designated as heedfulness.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams ni 'dir zag pa rnams dang zag pa'i gnas kyi yul rnams su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams ni 'dir zag pa rnams dang zag pa'i gnas kyi yul rnams su rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the dharmas with outflows should be understood as the outflows and the objects that are the basis of the outflows.

original: sems mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas ni btang snyoms kyi thog ma dang tha ma'i gnas skabs bshad de //
analyzed: sems mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas ni btang snyoms kyi thog ma dang tha ma'i gnas skabs bshad de //
translated: The beginning and end of equanimity are explained by the verse beginning with ‚Äúthe mind is even,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ltar btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i sems la bying ba la sogs pa'i mi mnyam pa med pas thog mar mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i sems la bying ba la sogs pa'i mi mnyam pa med pas thog mar mnyam pa'o //
translated: Thus, since the mind endowed with equanimity is even from the beginning because there is no unevenness such as laxity,

original: de'i 'og tu mngon par bya ba med par rnal du 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mngon par bya ba med par rnal du 'dug pa'o //
translated: after that it remains in its natural state without any effort.

original: de'i 'og du kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dogs pa med par lhun gyis grub par gnas so //
analyzed: de'i 'og du kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dogs pa med par lhun gyis grub par gnas so //
translated: After that, it remains spontaneously without any fear of affliction.

original: rnam par mi tshe ba ni zhe sdang med pa las gud na med pa'i phyir btags pa'i yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi tshe ba ni zhe sdang med pa las gud na med pa'i phyir btags pa'i yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since there is no lack of shame that is not included in the category of non-embarrassment, it should be understood as a nominal existence.

original: sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i las can zhes bya ni sred pa'i dbang gi nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i las can zhes bya ni sred pa'i dbang gi nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The function of generating suffering is because the five aggregates of attachment are established through the power of craving.

original: reg par mi gnas pa ni kun nas mnar ba'i sems yod pa sdug bsngal bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg par mi gnas pa ni kun nas mnar ba'i sems yod pa sdug bsngal bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Lack of patience is the function of abiding in suffering because of the existence of a mind that is tormented.

original: mi gus pa ni bla ma rnams dang yon tan can rnams la 'gying ba'o //
analyzed: mi gus pa ni bla ma rnams dang yon tan can rnams la 'gying ba'o //
translated: Disrespect is the function of being haughty toward superiors and those with good qualities.

original: sdug bsngal 'byung ba ni yang srid ba 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'byung ba ni yang srid ba 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The arising of suffering is the function of the arising of renewed existence.

original: log par nges pa ni phyin ci log tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: log par nges pa ni phyin ci log tu shes pa'o //
translated: Erroneous determination is the function of distorted cognition.

original: the tshom ni som nyi'o //
analyzed: the tshom ni som nyi'o //
translated: Doubt is the function of indecision.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba'o //
translated: The arising of affliction is the function of the occurrence of afflictions such as attachment.

original: de'i rten byed pa ni rmongs par 'gyur na nyon mongs pa thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rten byed pa ni rmongs par 'gyur na nyon mongs pa thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Its support is the function of delusion, because all afflictions occur when there is delusion.

original: bden pa rnams la yid gnyis za ba ni las kyi bden pa dang 'gog pa'i bden pa la ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
analyzed: bden pa rnams la yid gnyis za ba ni las kyi bden pa dang 'gog pa'i bden pa la ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
translated: Doubt about the truths is applied to the truth of action and the truth of cessation, as is appropriate.

original: des dge ba'i phyogs la mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: des dge ba'i phyogs la mi 'jug ste /
translated: It does not engage in the side of virtue,

original: nges pa ma rnyed na ma rtsol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa ma rnyed na ma rtsol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because when one has not found certainty, one does not make an effort.

original: dbu ma'i lam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called middle way

original: rtag ba dang chad pa spangs te rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: rtag ba dang chad pa spangs te rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba shes pa'o //
translated: is the knowledge of dependent origination, having abandoned eternalism and annihilationism.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul @6a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul @6a * //
translated: Morality and asceticism

original: zhugs ni lta ba ngan pa sngon du 'gro bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhugs ni lta ba ngan pa sngon du 'gro bar rig par bya'o //
translated: should be understood as preceded by bad views.üîΩExertion is fruitless,

original: ngal ba 'bras bu med pa ni des nges par mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngal ba 'bras bu med pa ni des nges par mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not lead to definite emergence.

original: sbyin pa med do //üîΩmchod sbyin med do //
analyzed: sbyin pa med do // mchod sbyin med do //
translated: There is no giving.üîΩThere is no sacrifice.

original: sbyin sreg med do //
analyzed: sbyin sreg med do //
translated: There is no offering into the fire.

original: legs par spyad pa med do //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa med do //
translated: There is no good conduct.üîΩThere is no bad conduct.

original: nyes par spyad pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'di rgyu la skur ba 'debs pa ste //
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'di rgyu la skur ba 'debs pa ste //
translated: This is the denial of the cause of that.

original: legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la skur ba 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la skur ba 'debs pa'o //
translated: The denial of the effect is the view that there is no effect of good or bad actions.üîΩ The denial of the object is the view that there is no world beyond,

original: 'jig rten 'di med do //üîΩ'jig rten pha rol med do //üîΩpha med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di med do // 'jig rten pha rol med do // pha med do //
translated: there is no other world,üîΩthere is no mother,

original: ma med do //
analyzed: ma med do //
translated: there is no father,

original: sems can rdzus te 'byung ba med do zhes bya ba ni byed pa la skur ba 'debs pa ste /
analyzed: sems can rdzus te 'byung ba med do zhes bya ba ni byed pa la skur ba 'debs pa ste /
translated: there are no spontaneously arisen beings.

original: 'jig rten gzhan du 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i byed pa dang / sa bon 'debs pa'i byed pa dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i byed pa la skur ba 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhan du 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i byed pa dang / sa bon 'debs pa'i byed pa dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i byed pa la skur ba 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it denies the activity of going and coming to another world, the activity of planting seeds, and the activity of rebirth.

original: 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yod pa'i dngos po 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yod pa'i dngos po 'jig pa'o //
translated: The denial of the existent is the view that there are no arhats in the world, and so on.

original: de las gzhan phyin ci log tu lta ba gang ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan phyin ci log tu lta ba gang ci yang rung ste /
translated: Any other view that is contrary to this is called wrong view.

original: de dag thams cad ni log par rnam par rtog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni log par rnam par rtog par rig par bya'o //
translated: All of these should be understood as wrong conceptualization.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa ni log par lta ba khyad par can las 'byung gi thams cad las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa ni log par lta ba khyad par can las 'byung gi thams cad las ni ma yin no //
translated: The severing of the root of the wholesome occurs through a special wrong view, not through all of them.

original: phung po lnga'i bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba la bdag dang bdag gi ngo bo nyid du sgro 'dogs pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga'i bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba la bdag dang bdag gi ngo bo nyid du sgro 'dogs pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
translated: The view of the aggregates as a self and as ‚Äúmine‚Äù is the afflicted view of the self.

original: bdag rtag go mi rtag go zhes khyad par du sgro 'dogs pa ni mthar 'dzin par lta ba'o //üîΩlta ba ngan pa la mchog la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag rtag go mi rtag go zhes khyad par du sgro 'dogs pa ni mthar 'dzin par lta ba'o // lta ba ngan pa la mchog la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The view of the self as permanent or impermanent is the extreme view.üîΩThe view of bad views as the best, etc. is the overesteeming of morality and certain types of spiritual practices.

original: de nyid la bdag po la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la bdag po la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The view of those very bad views as pure is the esteeming of views.

original: gcig ni phal cher la zhes bya ba ni log par rnam par rtog pa ni gdon mi za bar skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig ni phal cher la zhes bya ba ni log par rnam par rtog pa ni gdon mi za bar skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One is in relation to the majority, because wrong views necessarily involve denial.

original: mtshan nyid la brtags na ni mthar 'dzin pa dang log par lta ba gnyis las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mtshan nyid la brtags na ni mthar 'dzin pa dang log par lta ba gnyis las 'byung ngo //
translated: If one examines their characteristics, they arise from the extreme view and wrong views.

original: 'khor dang bcas pa la brtags na ni lnga po thams cad las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'khor dang bcas pa la brtags na ni lnga po thams cad las 'byung ngo //
translated: If you examine the self together with its retinue, it is found to be none of the five aggregates.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni bdag ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni bdag ma yin te /
translated: Form and so on are not the self,

original: mtshan nyid dang mi mthun pa'i phyir de dag ni bdag gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang mi mthun pa'i phyir de dag ni bdag gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: because they do not have the characteristics of a self.

original: de dag la bdag med de /
analyzed: de dag la bdag med de /
translated: The self does not exist in them,

original: gnas med na gnas @6b par mi 'gyur bas mi rtag pa nyid kyi nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas med na gnas @6b par mi 'gyur bas mi rtag pa nyid kyi nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it were to exist in them, it would be subject to the fault of impermanence, since it would be subject to arising and cessation.

original: gzugs ni bdag gi ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs ni bdag gi ba ma yin te /
translated: Form and so on are not the self‚Äôs property,

original: de dag la dbang byed pa med pas rang dbang med pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la dbang byed pa med pas rang dbang med pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be subject to the fault of being without independence.

original: de dag la gzhan na yang bdag med de lus med na bdag kun tu brtags par mi dmigs pas lus med pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la gzhan na yang bdag med de lus med na bdag kun tu brtags par mi dmigs pas lus med pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The self does not exist elsewhere than in them, because if it were to exist without a body, it would be subject to the fault of being without a body.

original: ci ste la la zhig bdag rnam pa de lta bur yongs su rtog na /
analyzed: ci ste la la zhig bdag rnam pa de lta bur yongs su rtog na /
translated: If someone were to imagine the self in this way,

original: de lta na yang gzugs la sogs pa med pa'i bdag mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de lta na yang gzugs la sogs pa med pa'i bdag mi 'thad de /
translated: then it would not be tenable that the self exists without form and so on.

original: lus la sogs pa'i 'ching ba med na /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i 'ching ba med na /
translated: If it were to exist without the body and so on,

original: rang gi ngang gis grol bar 'gyur bas sgrim mi dgos par thar par 'gyur ba'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis grol bar 'gyur bas sgrim mi dgos par thar par 'gyur ba'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because liberation would occur without effort, since it would occur by its own nature.

original: gzugs bdag yin par lta ba dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa bdag yin par lta ba de dag lnga ni bdag tu lta ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs bdag yin par lta ba dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa bdag yin par lta ba de dag lnga ni bdag tu lta ba'o //
translated: The five views that form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are the self are the view of the self.

original: bdag gzugs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba nas bdag rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i bar du lhag ma bco lnga ni bdag gir lta ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gzugs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba nas bdag rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i bar du lhag ma bco lnga ni bdag gir lta ba'o //
translated: The remaining fifteen views, from ‚Äúthe self possesses form‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe self possesses consciousness,‚Äù are the view of ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: 'brel bas bdag gir gyur ba ni 'di ltar de de dang 'brel bas de dang ldan par 'gyur ro //üîΩgzugs bdag gi yin pa zhes bya ba yin pa nas /
analyzed: 'brel bas bdag gir gyur ba ni 'di ltar de de dang 'brel bas de dang ldan par 'gyur ro // gzugs bdag gi yin pa zhes bya ba yin pa nas /
translated: ‚ÄúMine‚Äù is related to the self in the sense that it is connected to the self, since it is related to the self.üîΩ‚ÄúForm is mine‚Äù up to ‚Äúconsciousness is mine‚Äù is ‚Äúmine‚Äù in the sense of domination,

original: rnam par shes pa bdag gi yin pa zhes bya ba'i bar ni dbang sgyur bas bdag gir 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bdag gi yin pa zhes bya ba'i bar ni dbang sgyur bas bdag gir 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it is dominated by the self.

original: gang zhig sbyin pa'am bskob la gang gi dbang du 'gyur ba de ni de'i bdag gi zhes bya'o //üîΩgzugs la bdag gnas pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang zhig sbyin pa'am bskob la gang gi dbang du 'gyur ba de ni de'i bdag gi zhes bya'o // gzugs la bdag gnas pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: That which is controlled by something is said to belong to it.

original: rnam par shes pa la bdag gnas pa zhes bya ba'i bar ni tha dad du mi 'jug pas bdag gir 'gyur ba ste /üîΩbdag 'di ni 'di dag la rjes su zhugs shing rnam par zhugs nas bzhag pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la bdag gnas pa zhes bya ba'i bar ni tha dad du mi 'jug pas bdag gir 'gyur ba ste / bdag 'di ni 'di dag la rjes su zhugs shing rnam par zhugs nas bzhag pa ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe self is located in form‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe self is located in consciousness‚Äù is the self‚Äôs ownership because the self is not distinguished from them.

original: yan lag can yan lag gi rjes su song bar kun brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag can yan lag gi rjes su song bar kun brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The self is established as located in these aggregates because the self is imagined to be in the aggregates, as a whole is in its parts.

original: ma dpyad pa'i gzhi can ni gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid la kun tu dpyad na bdag tu lta ba'i skabs med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma dpyad pa'i gzhi can ni gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid la kun tu dpyad na bdag tu lta ba'i skabs med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The self is imagined to be the basis of the unanalyzed because when form and so on are analyzed, there is no opportunity for the view of a self.

original: dper na 'ga' zhig gis ma brtags par thag pa la sprul du 'dzin pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dper na 'ga' zhig gis ma brtags par thag pa la sprul du 'dzin pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: For example, it is like the apprehension of a rope as a snake when it is not analyzed.

original: thag pa yin par dpyad na de la sprul du mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thag pa yin par dpyad na de la sprul du mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When it is analyzed as a rope, it is not apprehended as a snake.

original: khro ba la sogs pa ni btags pa'i yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khro ba la sogs pa ni btags pa'i yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Anger and so on should be understood as imputedly existent.

original: khong khro ba la sogs @7a * //
analyzed: khong khro ba la sogs @7a * //
translated: Anger and so forthüîΩ

original: pa las gud na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa las gud na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because anger, etc. are not separate from it.

original: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni khros pa'i 'og tu'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni khros pa'i 'og tu'o //
translated: After that, i.e., after anger,

original: mi bzod pa zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi bzod pa zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam par mi byed pa'o //
translated: non-forbearance is the non-endurance of an injury.

original: 'di ni chos nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni chos nyid do //
translated: This is the nature of things.

original: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas na 'gyod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas na 'gyod par 'gyur te /
translated: When there is a transgression, there is remorse.

original: de'i phyir reg par mi gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir reg par mi gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that one does not remain in contact with it.

original: tshig rtsub mo brlang zhing drag pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi zher 'debs pa'i tshul gyis ngor lhangs  zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: tshig rtsub mo brlang zhing drag pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi zher 'debs pa'i tshul gyis ngor lhangs  zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Harsh speech is that which is rough, violent, and abusive, i.e., that which is cutting to the heart.üîΩThe non-abandonment of possessions is the non-renunciation of possessions due to avarice.üîΩThe non-abandonment of views is the non-abandonment of false views.üîΩThe non-abandonment of views is the non-abandonment of false views.üîΩThe non-abandonment of views is the non-abandonment of false views.

original: yo byad ma bsnyungs ba zhes bya ba ni ser snas yo byad mi mkho ba rnams kyang ba sogs pa las gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yo byad ma bsnyungs ba zhes bya ba ni ser snas yo byad mi mkho ba rnams kyang ba sogs pa las gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The non-abandonment of views is the non-abandonment of false views.üîΩThe non-abandonment of views is the non-abandonment of false views.üîΩThe non-abandonment of views is the non-abandonment of false views.üîΩThe non-abandonment of views is the non-abandonment of false views.üîΩThe non-abandonment of views is the non-abandonment of false views.üîΩThe non-abandonment of views is the non-abandonment of false views.üîΩThe non-abandonment of views is the non-abandonment of false views.üîΩThe non-abandonment of views is the non-abandonment of false views.üîΩThe non-abandonment of views is the non-abandonment of false views.üîΩThe non-abandonment of views is the non-abandonment of false views.üîΩThe non-abandonment of views is the non-abandonment of false views.üîΩThe non-abandonment of views is the non-abandonment of false views.üîΩThe non-abandonment of views is the non-abandonment of false views.üîΩThe non-abandonment of views is the non-abandonment of false views.üîΩThe non-abandonment of views is the non-abandonment of false views.üîΩThe non-abandonment of views is the non-abandonment of false views.üîΩThe non-abandonment of views is the non-abandonment of false views.üîΩThe non-abandonment of views is the non-abandonment of false views.

original: nges pa yang dag par skyong ba zhes bya ba ni /üîΩgzhan nas gzhan du sgyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nges pa yang dag par skyong ba zhes bya ba ni /üîΩgzhan nas gzhan du sgyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The non-abandonment of views is the non-abandonment

original: yang dag pa'i gdams ngag rnyed pa'i bar du gcod pa'i las can zhes bya ba ni bdag gi tshul yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi ston na gdams ngag gi 'os ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i gdams ngag rnyed pa'i bar du gcod pa'i las can zhes bya ba ni bdag gi tshul yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi ston na gdams ngag gi 'os ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The function of this is to obstruct the attainment of correct instruction, because one who does not reveal one's own faults as they truly are is not a fit recipient of instruction.

original: tshe ring ba'i mtshan ma bzung nas de la rnam par rtog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshe ring ba'i mtshan ma bzung nas de la rnam par rtog pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because one grasps the signs of longevity and then conceptualizes them.

original: mi 'chi bar rnam par rtog pa sngon du btang nas srog la rgyags pa skye'o //
analyzed: mi 'chi bar rnam par rtog pa sngon du btang nas srog la rgyags pa skye'o //
translated: Conceiving of oneself as immortal, one becomes intoxicated with life.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phun sum tshogs pa gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba ni rigs dang / stobs dang / gzugs dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / blo dang / longs spyod dang / phyug pa la sogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phun sum tshogs pa gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba ni rigs dang / stobs dang / gzugs dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / blo dang / longs spyod dang / phyug pa la sogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Any excellence that is contaminated means such things as family, power, form, intelligence, understanding, wealth, and riches.

original: dga' ba dang yid bde ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi dga' ba'i bye brag go //
analyzed: dga' ba dang yid bde ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi dga' ba'i bye brag go //
translated: Delight and satisfaction are specific forms of defiled joy.

original: sdug pa'i mtshan ma rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: sdug pa'i mtshan ma rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: The pursuit of the signs of beauty is a condition that is conducive to passion.

original: sngon dgod dgod pa dang / rtse rtse ba la sogs pa rjes su dran nas sems rnam par ma zhi bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon dgod dgod pa dang / rtse rtse ba la sogs pa rjes su dran nas sems rnam par ma zhi bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the mind is not calm when one remembers former laughter, play, etc.

original: le lo'i rten byed pa'i las can zhes bya ba ni ma dad na sbyor ba la 'dun pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: le lo'i rten byed pa'i las can zhes bya ba ni ma dad na sbyor ba la 'dun pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its function is to support laziness, because when one lacks faith, one lacks the will to apply oneself.

original: lus dang ngag dang sems kyi spyod pa la mi shes bzhin du 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba dang ldog pa la sogs pa la legs par ma brtags par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems kyi spyod pa la mi shes bzhin du 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba dang ldog pa la sogs pa la legs par ma brtags par rig par bya'o //
translated: It is the entry into the practice of body, speech, and mind without knowledge, which should be understood as the lack of proper reflection on going, returning, etc.

original: de ltar na 'di ni bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa mi shes pas ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa mi shes pas ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one falls into error because one does not know what should and should not be done.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi g-yeng ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga rnams te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi g-yeng ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga rnams te /
translated: Natural distraction refers to the five consciousness groups,

original: rang bzhin gyis nang du mnyam par 'jog mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis nang du mnyam par 'jog mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are by nature unable to remain in internal equipoise.

original: phyi rol du g-yeng ba zhes bya ba ni thos pa la sogs @7b pa'i dge ba la zhugs pa de la dmigs pa la phyi rol du 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag la sems 'gro bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du g-yeng ba zhes bya ba ni thos pa la sogs @7b pa'i dge ba la zhugs pa de la dmigs pa la phyi rol du 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag la sems 'gro bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Distraction to external objects is when the mind of one who is engaged in virtue such as listening goes out to the five sense-qualities.

original: nang gi g-yeng ba zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pa nyid kyi tshe de las nyams par byed pa bying ba dang / rgod pa dang ro myong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi g-yeng ba zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pa nyid kyi tshe de las nyams par byed pa bying ba dang / rgod pa dang ro myong bar byed pa'o //
translated: Internal distraction is when one who has entered concentration experiences sinking, excitedness, or taste-enjoyment and thereby loses concentration.

original: mtshan ma'i g-yeng pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis bdag la yon tan dang ldan par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i g-yeng pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis bdag la yon tan dang ldan par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: Sign-grasping distraction is when one is engaged in virtue in order to gain the confidence of others in one's possession of good qualities.

original: de'i mtshan ma ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mtshan ma ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: The sign of that is the sign of that.

original: dge ba la zhugs pa khad kyis de las nyams par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba la zhugs pa khad kyis de las nyams par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that one who is engaged in virtue gradually loses that.

original: gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba zhes bya ba ni ngar 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i gnas ngan len gyi dbang gis bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba byung ba rnams la nga zhes nga'i zhe 'am nga'o snyam du 'dzin pa'i phyir dge ba'i phyogs yongs su ma dag
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba zhes bya ba ni ngar 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i gnas ngan len gyi dbang gis bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba byung ba rnams la nga zhes nga'i zhe 'am nga'o snyam du 'dzin pa'i phyir dge ba'i phyogs yongs su ma dag
translated: The distraction of negative instinct is when, due to the power of negative instincts such as grasping at an ‚ÄúI,‚Äù one grasps at feelings such as pleasure as ‚ÄúI,‚Äù ‚Äúmine,‚Äù or ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩ

original: par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: par rig par bya'o //
translated: The distraction of negative reflex actions is to be known as the lack of purity of the side of virtue, because of the grasping of the feelings of pleasure, etc. , as ‚ÄúI‚Äù or ‚Äúmine‚Äù or ‚Äúmy self‚Äù through the power of negative reflex actions such as the grasping of ‚Äúme. ‚Äù

original: 'dzin pa ni thog ma nyid du de ltar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni thog ma nyid du de ltar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Grasping is the initial grasping in that way.

original: 'dres pa ni de'i 'og tu de dang sems kyi rgyud 'dres par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'dres pa ni de'i 'og tu de dang sems kyi rgyud 'dres par gyur ba'o //
translated: Mixing is the subsequent mixing of the stream of mind with that.

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni tshor ba de nyid la yang dang yang bkra bar 'dzin par rig par bya'o //üîΩyid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni tshor ba de nyid la yang dang yang bkra bar 'dzin par rig par bya'o // yid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The grasping of signs is to be known as the repeated grasping of those feelings in a vivid way.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / theg pa gzhan la brten pa snga ma las langs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / theg pa gzhan la brten pa snga ma las langs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The distraction of attention is to be known as the arising from the former meditative attainment and the support of another vehicle.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar du gcod pa'i las can zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar du gcod pa'i las can zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The function of sleep is to obstruct freedom from passion.

original: gnyid kyi rgyu zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste nyam chung ba dang / ngal ba dang lus lci ba dang mun pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pa dang / rtsom pa thams cad yal bar 'dor ba dang / de'i dus na yang dang yang goms pa dang /
analyzed: gnyid kyi rgyu zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste nyam chung ba dang / ngal ba dang lus lci ba dang mun pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pa dang / rtsom pa thams cad yal bar 'dor ba dang / de'i dus na yang dang yang goms pa dang /
translated: The cause of sleep is weakness, fatigue, heaviness of the body, the attention to the signs of darkness, the abandonment of all activity, and the repeated practice of sleep itself.

original: gzhan dag sngags kyi stobs kyis gnyid bro bar byed pa dang / de bzhin du lus mnyed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag sngags kyi stobs kyis gnyid bro bar byed pa dang / de bzhin du lus mnyed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The power of spells causes sleep in others, as does the massage of the body, etc.

original: gti mug gi char gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin las bye brag tu dbye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gti mug gi char gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin las bye brag tu dbye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is associated with delusion because it is a subdivision of concentration.

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i dngos po'i tshig ni gdon mi za bar gti mug gi bdag nyid ma yin no //üîΩdus zhes bya ba ni nam gyi gung thun no //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i dngos po'i tshig ni gdon mi za bar gti mug gi bdag nyid ma yin no // dus zhes bya ba ni nam gyi gung thun no //
translated: The words ‚Äúvirtuous, etc.‚Äù do not necessarily refer to the nature of delusion.üîΩThe time of sleep is the middle part of the night.

original: dus ma yin pa ni de las gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: dus ma yin pa ni de las gzhan pa'o //
translated: The non-time of sleep is the rest of the night.

original: rigs pa ni dus su ji ltar gnang ba dang / dus yin na yang na ba dang / las su rung bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
