analyzed: rigs pa ni dus su ji ltar gnang ba dang / dus yin na yang na ba dang / las su rung bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is that it is permitted at the proper time, and even if it is the proper time, it is for the sake of health and for the sake of being fit for work.
Reason is when one acts at the proper time, and when it is the proper time, one acts in order to be healthy and to be fit for work.

original: rigs pa ni de las gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa ni de las gzhan pa'o //
translated: Unreason is the opposite of that.

original: bya ba shor ba'i rten byed pa ni nye mongs pa'i bdag nyid kyi dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba shor ba'i rten byed pa ni nye mongs pa'i bdag nyid kyi dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
translated: The support of the loss of action is to be understood as being under the control of the nature of affliction.

original: bsams pa zhes bya ba ni legs par nyes par spyod pa'i byed pa las mngon par dga' ba sngon du btang ba'o //
analyzed: bsams pa zhes bya ba ni legs par nyes par spyod pa'i byed pa las mngon par dga' ba sngon du btang ba'o //
translated: Intentional action is that which is preceded by the delight of good or bad conduct.

original: ma bsams pa'i bya ba ni gzhan dag gis nan gyis byed du bcug ste byed pa'am /
analyzed: ma bsams pa'i bya ba ni gzhan dag gis nan gyis byed du bcug ste byed pa'am /
translated: Unintentional action is that which is done by being forced by others, or

original: nyon mongs pas zil gyis mnan pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pas zil gyis mnan pa ste /
translated: that which is done by being overwhelmed by afflictions.

original: ji ltar mthun mthun du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mthun mthun du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as appropriate.

original: gti mug gi char gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug gi char gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pas bsdus pa'o //
translated: That which is associated with delusion is that which is included in the secondary afflictions.

original: dus ni ji srid mi spong gi bar du'o //
analyzed: dus ni ji srid mi spong gi bar du'o //
translated: Time is as long as one does not abandon it.

original: dus ma yin pa ni de'i 'og tu'o //
analyzed: dus ma yin pa ni de'i 'og tu'o //
translated: Inappropriate time is after that.

original: rigs pa ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa ni gnas pa'o //
translated: Reason is to remain.

original: mi rigs pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi rigs pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: The improper is the improper place.

original: sems pa'am shes rab la rten zhes bya ba ni mngon par mi rtogs pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i gnas skabs dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: sems pa'am shes rab la rten zhes bya ba ni mngon par mi rtogs pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i gnas skabs dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: The support is intention and wisdom, respectively, in the case of non-realization and realization.

original: kun tu tshol ba'i rnam pa yid kyis mngon par brjod pa ni rtog pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu tshol ba'i rnam pa yid kyis mngon par brjod pa ni rtog pa'o //
translated: Imagination is the mental expression of the aspects of the search.

original: so sor rtog pa'i rnam pa ni spyod pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i rnam pa ni spyod pa'o //
translated: Discernment is the expression of the aspects of thorough understanding.

original: sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams ni /
analyzed: sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams ni /
translated: The formations dissociated from the mind are explained as:

original: gnas dang / ngo bo nyid dang btags pas bshad par rig par bya'o //üîΩde la dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas dang / ngo bo nyid dang btags pas bshad par rig par bya'o // de la dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the basis, the nature, and the designation.

original: gnas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gnas bstan pa'o //
translated: Among them, the basis is indicated by the words: ‚Äúthe wholesome, unwholesome, and undefined dharmas.

original: 'phel ba dang 'grib pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'phel ba dang 'grib pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin bstan pa ste /
translated: The nature is indicated by the words: ‚Äúincrease and decrease.

original: 'di ltar 'phel ba yod na dad pa chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phel ba yod na dad pa chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, when there is increase, one is said to possess great faith.

original: 'grib pa yod na chung ngu dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'grib pa yod na chung ngu dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When there is decrease, one is said to possess little.

original: thob pa dang rnyed pa dang ldan pa zhes gdags so zhes bya ba ni btags pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thob pa dang rnyed pa dang ldan pa zhes gdags so zhes bya ba ni btags pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase one is said to obtain and possess indicates the designation.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase in the same way, the others should be applied as appropriate means that the other meditative attainments should be explained in the same way as the meditative attainment of non-perception.

original: dge rgyas la 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dge rgyas la 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: The phrase one who is free from attachment to the stage of the wholesome summit means one who is free from attachment to the third meditative absorption.

original: steng ma'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: steng ma'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: The phrase one who is not free from attachment to the higher stages means one who is not free from attachment to the fourth meditative absorption.

original: 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'o //
translated: The phrase one who is preceded by the perception of emergence means one who is preceded by the perception of liberation.

original: brtan pa ma yin pa rnams zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pas bsdus pa rnams so //
analyzed: brtan pa ma yin pa rnams zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pas bsdus pa rnams so //
translated: The phrase those who are not steadfast means those who are included in the active forms of consciousness.

original: 'gog pa zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyis byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyis byas pa ste /
translated: The phrase cessation means that which is brought about by the mind of meditative attainment.

original: dus gzhan na sems dang sems las @8b byung ba brtan pa ma yin pa kun tu 'byung ba dang mi mthun pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag go //
analyzed: dus gzhan na sems dang sems las @8b byung ba brtan pa ma yin pa kun tu 'byung ba dang mi mthun pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag go //
translated: It is a particular state that is incompatible with the occurrence of unstable minds and mental factors.

original: 'dis 'gog par 'gyur bas na 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis 'gog par 'gyur bas na 'gog pa'o //
translated: It is cessation because it causes the cessation of unstable minds and mental factors.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la ni steng ma'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba zhes mi brjod de /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la ni steng ma'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba zhes mi brjod de /
translated: One who is not free from the attachment of the higher realms is not said to enter the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: de la srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dgra bcom pa yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dgra bcom pa yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there are arhats who are free from the attachment of the summit of existence.

original: brtan pa de dag las kyang kha cig ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyis bsdus pa rnams so //
analyzed: brtan pa de dag las kyang kha cig ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyis bsdus pa rnams so //
translated: Some of those who are stable refers to those who are included in the afflicted mind.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa 'di gnyis ni sa dang / yid la byed pa dang / gnas dang / ngo bo nyid dang / btags pas bsten to //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa 'di gnyis ni sa dang / yid la byed pa dang / gnas dang / ngo bo nyid dang / btags pas bsten to //
translated: These two meditative attainments are explained in terms of their stage, attention, basis, nature, and designation.

original: 'du shes med pa ni yid la byed pa ma gtogs par gnas la sogs pa de dag gis lhag ma gsum po dag gis bshad do //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa ni yid la byed pa ma gtogs par gnas la sogs pa de dag gis lhag ma gsum po dag gis bshad do //
translated: The state of composure without conception is explained in terms of the remaining three: stage, and so on, excluding attention.

original: ris mthun pa zhes bya ba ni tshe gcig gi phung po'i rgyun no //
analyzed: ris mthun pa zhes bya ba ni tshe gcig gi phung po'i rgyun no //
translated: A homogeneous collection is the continuum of aggregates in one life.

original: gnas pa'i dus nges par zhes bya ba ni ris mthun par 'dis lo brgya'am /
analyzed: gnas pa'i dus nges par zhes bya ba ni ris mthun par 'dis lo brgya'am /
translated: The time of its duration is fixed, meaning that it remains for a certain time in a homogeneous collection, either for a hundred years,

original: lo stong ngam /
analyzed: lo stong ngam /
translated: or for a thousand years,

original: dus ji srid cig tu gnas par bya ba ste /
analyzed: dus ji srid cig tu gnas par bya ba ste /
translated: or for some period of time.

original: las kyis byas pa'i nus pa'i bye brag go /
analyzed: las kyis byas pa'i nus pa'i bye brag go /
translated: This is a particular potency created by karma.

original: sems can gyi ris de dang der zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi la sogs pa'i sems can gyi skye ba rnams su'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi ris de dang der zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi la sogs pa'i sems can gyi skye ba rnams su'o //
translated: In that and that class of sentient beings means in the various classes of sentient beings, such as gods, humans, and so on.

original: lus 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par gcig pa'o //
analyzed: lus 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par gcig pa'o //
translated: A similar body means a similar form.

original: phyir rol gyi gzugs kyang skye ba dang ldan pas ris mthun pa tsam smos te sems can gyi rgyud la mtshan nyid gdags par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir rol gyi gzugs kyang skye ba dang ldan pas ris mthun pa tsam smos te sems can gyi rgyud la mtshan nyid gdags par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: External form also has birth, so it is merely called a homogeneous collection, in order to teach that the continuum of sentient beings is designated as a characteristic.

original: phyir rol gyi gzugs ni 'jigs pa dang 'chags pas rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: phyir rol gyi gzugs ni 'jigs pa dang 'chags pas rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: External form is distinguished by its destruction and formation.

original: nang gi 'du byed rnams ni skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pas rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: nang gi 'du byed rnams ni skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pas rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: Internal formations are distinguished by their birth, aging, and so on.

original: rgyun 'jig pa ni 'chi bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun 'jig pa ni 'chi bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The destruction of the continuum is to be known as death.

original: skye ba la sogs pa 'di dag ni skad cig re re la rig par bya ba ni ma yin gyi //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa 'di dag ni skad cig re re la rig par bya ba ni ma yin gyi //
translated: These births, etc. are not to be known in each moment,

original: rgyun gyi gnas skabs la bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun gyi gnas skabs la bya'o //
translated: but in the state of the continuum.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi tshig bla dags zhes bya ba ni mig dang rna ba dang lha dang mi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi tshig bla dags zhes bya ba ni mig dang rna ba dang lha dang mi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The words of intrinsic nature are such as eye, ear, god, man, etc.

original: khyad par gyi tshig bla dags zhes bya ba ni 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi tshig bla dags zhes bya ba ni 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa'o //
translated: The words of distinction are such as all formations are impermanent,

original: sems can thams cad 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: all beings will die, etc.üîΩThe letters are the basis of both of these,

original: de gnyi ga'i gnas yi ge rnams la zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par gyi tshig bla dags kyi gnas yi ge aa ai au zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i gnas yi ge rnams la zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par gyi tshig bla dags kyi gnas yi ge aa ai au zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: the letters a, i, u, etc. are the basis of the words of intrinsic nature and of distinction.

original: thams cad ni 'di dag tsam du zad de /üîΩ'di ltar ngo bo nyid dang / khyad @9a * //
analyzed: thams cad ni 'di dag tsam du zad de / 'di ltar ngo bo nyid dang / khyad @9a * //
translated: All of this is just this much:üîΩintrinsic nature,

original: par dang / de gnyi gar tha snyad gdags pa'o //
analyzed: par dang / de gnyi gar tha snyad gdags pa'o //
translated: distinction, and the designation of both of these.

original: de thams cad ni 'di dag gis tha snyad 'dogs te /
analyzed: de thams cad ni 'di dag gis tha snyad 'dogs te /
translated: All of these are designated by these names,

original: de'i phyir ming dang tshig dang / yi ge'i tshogs 'di dag rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir ming dang tshig dang / yi ge'i tshogs 'di dag rnam par gzhag go //
translated: therefore, these collections of names, phrases, and letters are established.

original: rnam grangs su gtogs pa gzhan du mi 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dper na mig ni mig ces bya ba'i rnam grangs de la gzhan pa 'dren byed dang / gsal byed dang khrid byed dang / lta ba la sogs pa rnam grangs su gtogs pa gzhan dag tu'ang 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam grangs su gtogs pa gzhan du mi 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dper na mig ni mig ces bya ba'i rnam grangs de la gzhan pa 'dren byed dang / gsal byed dang khrid byed dang / lta ba la sogs pa rnam grangs su gtogs pa gzhan dag tu'ang 'gyur te /
translated: In order to prevent the synonyms from changing, for example, eye is a synonym for eye, but it also changes into other synonyms such as leader, clarifier, guide, seer, and so on.

original: de dag gis kyang de shes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis kyang de shes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those also understand that eye.

original: de bzhin du aa a'i zhes bya ba'i yi ge 'di ni aa a'i zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs 'di ma gtogs par rnam grangs gzhan gyis bstan pa mi nus te /
analyzed: de bzhin du aa a'i zhes bya ba'i yi ge 'di ni aa a'i zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs 'di ma gtogs par rnam grangs gzhan gyis bstan pa mi nus te /
translated: Similarly, this letter a is not able to be indicated by other synonyms, except for this synonym called a.

original: de'i phyir rnam grangs gzhan du mi 'gyur bas yi ge rnams so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam grangs gzhan du mi 'gyur bas yi ge rnams so //
translated: Therefore, because the synonyms do not change, they are letters.

original: 'gyur ba ni 'gro bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba ni 'gro bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Change should be understood as going.

original: rgyun ma chad pa la 'jug par rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: rgyun ma chad pa la 'jug par rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: It is posited as uninterrupted engagement.üîΩ

original: skad cig gcig gam rgyun chad pa la de nye bar 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig gcig gam rgyun chad pa la de nye bar 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is established as uninterrupted because it is not designated as momentary or interrupted.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu tha dad pa zhes bya ba la 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu ni legs par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu tha dad pa zhes bya ba la 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu ni legs par spyod pa'o //
translated: Cause and effect are different. The cause of a desirable effect is good conduct.

original: mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu ni nyes par spyod pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /üîΩ'bras bu rnams ni so sor rgyu gzhan dang gzhan las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu ni nyes par spyod pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / 'bras bu rnams ni so sor rgyu gzhan dang gzhan las 'byung ba'o //
translated: The cause of an undesirable effect is bad conduct.üîΩEffects arise from individual causes.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu mthun pa ni gzhan yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu mthun pa ni gzhan yin du zin kyang /
translated: Cause and effect are concordant. Even if they are different,

original: gang gi 'bras bu gang 'os pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi 'bras bu gang 'os pa ste /
translated: whatever effect is appropriate.

original: 'di ltar sbyin pa'i 'bras bu ni longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyin pa'i 'bras bu ni longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the effect of generosity is the abundance of resources, and so on.

original: re re nas 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni cig car mi 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: re re nas 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni cig car mi 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It is said to arise individually, meaning that it does not arise simultaneously.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun tu 'byung bar gyur pa de la rgyu dang 'bras bu byung zin pa dang 'gags zin pa gang yin pa de ni 'das pa'i dus zhes gdags so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun tu 'byung bar gyur pa de la rgyu dang 'bras bu byung zin pa dang 'gags zin pa gang yin pa de ni 'das pa'i dus zhes gdags so //
translated: The past time is the time of the cause and effect that have already arisen and have already ceased.

original: gang ma byung ba de ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus zhes gdags so //
analyzed: gang ma byung ba de ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus zhes gdags so //
translated: The future time is the time of the cause and effect that have not yet arisen.

original: gang byung ba la ma 'gags pa de ni da ltar byung ba'i dus zhes gdags so //
analyzed: gang byung ba la ma 'gags pa de ni da ltar byung ba'i dus zhes gdags so //
translated: The present time is the time of the cause and effect that have arisen but not yet ceased.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bus phyogs la khyab pa la yul nye bar gdags ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bus phyogs la khyab pa la yul nye bar gdags ste /
translated: The place is designated in terms of the extension of cause and effect.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa ni phyogs la khyab par byed pa'i mthu med pas rgyu dang 'bras bu ni 'dir gzugs su bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa ni phyogs la khyab par byed pa'i mthu med pas rgyu dang 'bras bu ni 'dir gzugs su bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since that which is not material form is not capable of extending in a place, cause and effect should be understood here as included in material form.

original: so so tha dad pa la grangs shes bya ba ni tha dad pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid gcig pa la gnyis gsum zhes bya ba'i @9b grangs la sogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so tha dad pa la grangs shes bya ba ni tha dad pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid gcig pa la gnyis gsum zhes bya ba'i @9b grangs la sogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Number is designated in relation to individual things, because it is not tenable to designate one, two, etc., in relation to a single nature that is not distinct.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rkyen rnams 'dus pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rkyen rnams 'dus pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The collection of causes and conditions is as follows:

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i rgyu'i 'bras bu'i rkyen ni dbang po ma nyams pa dang / yul snang bar gyur ba dang / de skyed pa'i yid la byed pa nye bar gnas pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i rgyu'i 'bras bu'i rkyen ni dbang po ma nyams pa dang / yul snang bar gyur ba dang / de skyed pa'i yid la byed pa nye bar gnas pa ste /
translated: The causal condition of the effect called consciousness is the unimpaired sense faculty, the appearance of the object, and the convergence of the mind.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the others.

original: de ltar na sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyi chos 'di rnams ni gnas skabs dag la gdags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyi chos 'di rnams ni gnas skabs dag la gdags pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, all these phenomena that are not associated with mind are imputed in terms of their states.

original: thams cad kyang btags pa'i yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang btags pa'i yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they should be understood as imputedly existent.

original: de la dge ba la sogs pa 'phel ba dang / sgrib pa'i gnas skabs la ni gcig go //
analyzed: de la dge ba la sogs pa 'phel ba dang / sgrib pa'i gnas skabs la ni gcig go //
translated: Among them, one is in the case of the increase of virtue, etc.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba mi 'byung ba'i gnas skabs la ni gsum mo //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba mi 'byung ba'i gnas skabs la ni gsum mo //
translated: Three are in the case of the state in which mind and mental factors do not occur.

original: gnas pa'i gnas skabs la ni gcig go //
analyzed: gnas pa'i gnas skabs la ni gcig go //
translated: One is in the case of the state of abiding.

original: 'dra ba'i gnas skabs la ni gcig go //
analyzed: 'dra ba'i gnas skabs la ni gcig go //
translated: One is in the case of the state of similarity.

original: mtshan nyid kyi gnas skabs la ni bzhi'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gnas skabs la ni bzhi'o //
translated: Four are in the case of the state of characteristics.

original: tha snyad kyi gnas skabs la ni gsum mo //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi gnas skabs la ni gsum mo //
translated: Three are in the case of the state of designation.

original: ma thob pa'i gnas skabs la ni gcig go //
analyzed: ma thob pa'i gnas skabs la ni gcig go //
translated: In the state of non-acquisition, there is only one.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs la ni lhag ma rnams so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs la ni lhag ma rnams so //
translated: In the states of cause and effect, there are the remaining ones.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu ni 'dus byas thams cad du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu ni 'dus byas thams cad du rig par bya ste /
translated: Cause and effect should be understood in all conditioned things.

original: de las gzhan 'byung bas rgyu'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan 'byung bas rgyu'o //
translated: Because it arises from that, it is a cause.

original: gzhan las de 'byung bas 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan las de 'byung bas 'bras bu'o //
translated: Because it arises from another, it is an effect.

original: phung po la sogs pa kun tu 'byung ba la de'i sa bon yongs su rgyas pa ni bag chags zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa kun tu 'byung ba la de'i sa bon yongs su rgyas pa ni bag chags zhes bya'o //
translated: The expansion of the seeds of that in the arising of the aggregates, etc. is called the perfuming.

original: sa bon thams cad ces bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa de dag nyid 'byung ba'i sa bon dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩder chos rnams sa bon du 'du ba'am /
analyzed: sa bon thams cad ces bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa de dag nyid 'byung ba'i sa bon dang ldan pa'i phyir ro // der chos rnams sa bon du 'du ba'am /
translated: All seeds means that those aggregates, etc. are endowed with the seeds of their arising.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pas sems can du 'du ba'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pas sems can du 'du ba'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The store consciousness is so called because all things are collected in it as seeds or because sentient beings are collected in it as selves.

original: sngon gyi las las nges par byung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi las las nges par byung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: It is the consciousness that is the result of maturation because it definitely arises from previous karma.

original: yang dang yang nyid mtshams sbyor bar byed pas len pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //üîΩde ni sa zhes kyang bya ste //
analyzed: yang dang yang nyid mtshams sbyor bar byed pas len pa'i rnam par shes pa'o // de ni sa zhes kyang bya ste //
translated: It is the appropriating consciousness because it appropriates the body again and again.

original: chos rnams kyi bdag chags bsags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi bdag chags bsags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also called the ‚Äústore‚Äù because it stores the seeds of all the dharmas.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de yod par ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de yod par ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do we know that this consciousness exists?

original: 'di ltar de med na /üîΩlen dang bzod dang gsal ba dang // sa bon dang ni las rnams dang // lus kyis myong dang sems med pa'i //
analyzed: 'di ltar de med na / len dang bzod dang gsal ba dang // sa bon dang ni las rnams dang // lus kyis myong dang sems med pa'i //
translated: Because if it did not exist,

original: snyoms 'jug de bzhin 'chi mi rung //
analyzed: snyoms 'jug de bzhin 'chi mi rung //
translated: there would be no appropriating, no tolerance of frustration, no manifestation, no seeds, no karma, no experience in the body, no mindless samƒÅdhi, and no birth.

original: sdom pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i 'di'i rnam par dbye ba ni 'di lta ste rnam par nges par bsdu ba'i nang du byas so //üîΩrnam pa @10a * //
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i 'di'i rnam par dbye ba ni 'di lta ste rnam par nges par bsdu ba'i nang du byas so // rnam pa @10a * //
translated: The analysis of this verse on the summary is as follows:üîΩThe store consciousness exists because of appropriating, tolerance of frustration, manifestation, seeds, karma, experience in the body, mindless samƒÅdhi, and birth.üîΩThe store consciousness exists because of appropriating.

original: brgyad kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod pa nyid du rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: brgyad kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod pa nyid du rtogs par bya ste /
translated: If this consciousness did not exist, there would be no appropriating of the material organs.

original: 'di ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na lus nye bar len pa mi srid pa dang / gzod ma nas byung ba mi srid pa dang // gsal bar byung ba mi srid pa dang / sa bon mi srid pa dang / las mi srid pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na lus nye bar len pa mi srid pa dang / gzod ma nas byung ba mi srid pa dang // gsal bar byung ba mi srid pa dang / sa bon mi srid pa dang / las mi srid pa dang /
translated: Thus, if there were no foundation consciousness, appropriation of the body would be impossible, arising from the beginning would be impossible, clear manifestation would be impossible, seeds would be impossible, karma would be impossible,

original: lus kyis myong ba mi srid pa dang / sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mi srid pa dang / rnam par shes pa 'chi 'pho ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyis myong ba mi srid pa dang / sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mi srid pa dang / rnam par shes pa 'chi 'pho ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: experiencing with the body would be impossible, mindless meditative attainments would be impossible, and the consciousness at death would be impossible.

original: ci'i phyir lus nye bar len pa mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lus nye bar len pa mi rung zhe na /
translated: Why is appropriation of the body impossible?

original: smras pa / rnam pa lngas ste /
analyzed: smras pa / rnam pa lngas ste /
translated: It is said: in five ways.

original: 'di ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni sngon gyi 'du byed kyi rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni sngon gyi 'du byed kyi rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: Thus, the foundation consciousness arises from the cause of previous formative forces.

original: mig la sogs pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni da ltar gyi rkyen gyi rgyu las byung ba ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni da ltar gyi rkyen gyi rgyu las byung ba ste /
translated: The active consciousnesses such as visual consciousness arise from the cause of present conditions.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it says:

original: dbang po dang yul dang yid la byed pa'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dbang po dang yul dang yid la byed pa'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: Consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form, up to and including the mind and mental objects.

original: 'di ni gtan tshigs dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gtan tshigs dang po'o //
translated: This is the first reason.

original: yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ni dge ba dang mi dge bar dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ni dge ba dang mi dge bar dmigs pa ste /
translated: The six collections of consciousness are observed to be virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: 'di ni gtan tshigs gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gtan tshigs gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second reason.

original: yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag la lung du ma bstan par rnam par smin pas bsdus par 'gyur ba gang yin pa'i rnam pa mi dmigs pa ste //
analyzed: yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag la lung du ma bstan par rnam par smin pas bsdus par 'gyur ba gang yin pa'i rnam pa mi dmigs pa ste //
translated: The six collections of consciousness are not observed to be neutral, included in the karmic result of the non-learner.

original: 'di ni gtan tshigs gsum pa'o //üîΩyang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug 'byung ba ni gnas so sor nges pa ste //
analyzed: 'di ni gtan tshigs gsum pa'o // yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug 'byung ba ni gnas so sor nges pa ste //
translated: This is the third reason.üîΩThe arising of the six collections of consciousness is restricted to their respective locations.

original: gnas gang dang gang las rnam par shes par gang dang gang 'byung ba de dang de ni des zin par 'gyur gyi lhag ma ni ma zin par 'gyur te mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gnas gang dang gang las rnam par shes par gang dang gang 'byung ba de dang de ni des zin par 'gyur gyi lhag ma ni ma zin par 'gyur te mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible that consciousness would arise from any location other than the one that is its basis.

original: zin par yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: zin par yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is not possible that it would arise from both.

original: rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because consciousness does not exist.

original: 'di ni gtan tshigs bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gtan tshigs bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth reason.

original: yang dang yang lus 'dzin pa'i nyes par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dang yang lus 'dzin pa'i nyes par yang 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, it would be faulty to repeatedly appropriate a body.

original: 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa res 'ga' ni 'byung /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa res 'ga' ni 'byung /
translated: Thus, sometimes the eye consciousness arises,

original: res 'ga' ni mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni mi 'byung ngo //
translated: and sometimes it does not.

original: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin te /
translated: The same is true of the remaining [consciousnesses].

original: 'di ni gtan tshigs lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gtan tshigs lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth reason.

original: 'di ltar sngon gyi las dang da ltar gyi 'du byed kyi rgyu las byung ba dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba yin pa dang / de'i rnam pa mi dmigs pa dang / gnas so sor nges pa dang / yang dang yang lus nye bar len pas kyang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon gyi las dang da ltar gyi 'du byed kyi rgyu las byung ba dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba yin pa dang / de'i rnam pa mi dmigs pa dang / gnas so sor nges pa dang / yang dang yang lus nye bar len pas kyang mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, it is not tenable that the world is created by God, because it arises from the causes of previous karma and present compositional activity, because it is virtuous and nonvirtuous, because the aspects of that are not observed, because of the definite individual abodes, and because of repeatedly appropriating a body.

original: ci'i phyir gzod ma'i 'jug pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur zha na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzod ma'i 'jug pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur zha na /
translated: Why does the initial engagement not arise?

original: gal te la @10b la zhig 'di skad du /
analyzed: gal te la @10b la zhig 'di skad du /
translated: If someone were to say this:

original: ci ste kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod na de'i phyir rnam par shes pa gnyis cig car 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes zer na de la 'di skad du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ci ste kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod na de'i phyir rnam par shes pa gnyis cig car 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes zer na de la 'di skad du brjod par bya ste /
translated: If you say that because the foundation consciousness exists, two consciousnesses occur simultaneously, then you should say this:

original: nyes pa med pa nyid la khyod nyes par 'du shes par zad kyi //
analyzed: nyes pa med pa nyid la khyod nyes par 'du shes par zad kyi //
translated: You are mistaken in thinking that there is a fault where there is none.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa gnyis cig car 'byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa gnyis cig car 'byung ba nyid do //
translated: Because two consciousnesses do occur simultaneously.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na //üîΩ'di ltar kha cig cig car mthong ba 'dod pa nas /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na // 'di ltar kha cig cig car mthong ba 'dod pa nas /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar du 'dod pa la //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar du 'dod pa la //
translated: Because some desire to see simultaneously up to some desire to cognize simultaneously.

original: thog mar rnam par shes pa gang yang rung ba zhig 'byung ba mi rung ste //
analyzed: thog mar rnam par shes pa gang yang rung ba zhig 'byung ba mi rung ste //
translated: It is not possible for any consciousness to occur first,

original: 'di ltar de na yid la byed pa dang dbang po dang yul yang yod par bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de na yid la byed pa dang dbang po dang yul yang yod par bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in that case there would be no difference in the mental activity, faculties, and objects.

original: rnam par shes pa cig car 'byung ba med na ci'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig rjes su 'jug pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa gsal bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa cig car 'byung ba med na ci'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig rjes su 'jug pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa gsal bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If consciousnesses do not occur simultaneously, why is the mental consciousness that occurs simultaneously with eye consciousness, etc., not clear?

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe 'das pa'i yul myong ba rjes su dran pa de'i tshe yid kyi rnam par shes pa rgyu ba ni gsal ba ma yin la //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe 'das pa'i yul myong ba rjes su dran pa de'i tshe yid kyi rnam par shes pa rgyu ba ni gsal ba ma yin la //
translated: When one recalls the experience of a past object, the operation of the mental consciousness is not clear.

original: da ltar gyi yul la rgyu ba'i yid ni de ltar mi gsal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar gyi yul la rgyu ba'i yid ni de ltar mi gsal ba ma yin te /
translated: But the operation of the mental consciousness with regard to a present object is not unclear.

original: de'i phyir yang cig car 'byung ba dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa mi gsal bar yang rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang cig car 'byung ba dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa mi gsal bar yang rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is possible for consciousnesses to occur simultaneously, and it is possible for the mental consciousness to be unclear.

original: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug pa dag phan tshun gyi sa bon nyid ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug pa dag phan tshun gyi sa bon nyid ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are the six consciousnesses not the seeds of each other?

original: 'di ltar dge ba'i 'og tu mi dge ba 'byung la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba'i 'og tu mi dge ba 'byung la /
translated: Thus, the nonvirtuous mind arises after a virtuous mind,

original: mi dge ba'i 'og tu dge ba dang / de gnyi ga'i 'og tu lung du ma bstan pa dang / khams ngan pa'i 'og tu khams bar ma dang / khams bar ma'i 'og tu khams bzang po dang / de bzhin du khams bzang po'i 'og tu khams ngan pa dang /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i 'og tu dge ba dang / de gnyi ga'i 'og tu lung du ma bstan pa dang / khams ngan pa'i 'og tu khams bar ma dang / khams bar ma'i 'og tu khams bzang po dang / de bzhin du khams bzang po'i 'og tu khams ngan pa dang /
translated: after nonvirtue, virtue; after both, indeterminate; after a bad realm, an intermediate realm; after an intermediate realm, a good realm; after a good realm, a bad realm;

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'og tu zag pa med pa dang / zag pa med pa'i 'og tu zag pa dang bcas pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'og tu 'jig rten las 'das pa dang // 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'og tu 'jig rten pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'og tu zag pa med pa dang / zag pa med pa'i 'og tu zag pa dang bcas pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'og tu 'jig rten las 'das pa dang // 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'og tu 'jig rten pa 'byung ste /
translated: after that with outflows, that without outflows; after that without outflows, that with outflows; after mundane, supramundane; after supramundane, mundane.

original: de dag ni de ltar sa bon nyid du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni de ltar sa bon nyid du mi rung ngo //
translated: They are not suitable as seeds in this way.

original: rgyud kyi rgyun chad nas yun ring du lon pa yang yun ring zhig na 'byung bas de'i phyir yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyun chad nas yun ring du lon pa yang yun ring zhig na 'byung bas de'i phyir yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Also, it is not suitable because a long time has elapsed since the continuum of the mind was severed, and it arises again after a long time.

original: rnam par shes pa cig car 'byung ba med na ci'i phyir las mi srid ce na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa cig car 'byung ba med na ci'i phyir las mi srid ce na /
translated: If consciousness does not occur simultaneously, why is karma impossible?

original: 'di ltar mdor bsdur na las rnam pa bzhi ste //
analyzed: 'di ltar mdor bsdur na las rnam pa bzhi ste //
translated: In brief, there are four kinds of action:

original: snod kyi rnam par rig pa dang / gnas kyi rnam par rig pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i @11a * //üîΩrnam par rig pa dang / yul gyi rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: snod kyi rnam par rig pa dang / gnas kyi rnam par rig pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i @11a * // rnam par rig pa dang / yul gyi rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: the representation of the world, the representation of the place, the representation of the thought ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù and the representation of objects.

original: rnam par rig pa 'di dag ni skad cig gcig la cig car 'byung bar dmigs te /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa 'di dag ni skad cig gcig la cig car 'byung bar dmigs te /
translated: These representations occur simultaneously in a single moment, and are perceived as such.

original: rnam par shes pa gcig gis skad cig gcig la ni ngo bo tha dad pa'i las 'di lta bu 'di mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gcig gis skad cig gcig la ni ngo bo tha dad pa'i las 'di lta bu 'di mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible for a single consciousness to have such different actions in a single moment.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na ci'i phyir lus kyi myong ba mi rung zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar 'ga' zhig tshul bzhin nam /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na ci'i phyir lus kyi myong ba mi rung zhe na / 'di ltar 'ga' zhig tshul bzhin nam /
translated: If there is no store consciousness, how can the experience of the body not be possible?üîΩIn this way, someone may be thinking correctly or incorrectly,üîΩor may be thinking about something else,üîΩor may be thinking about something in the past,

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i sems sam /üîΩrjes su rnam par rtog gam /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i sems sam / rjes su rnam par rtog gam /
translated: or may be thinking about something in the future,üîΩor may be thinking about something in the present,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the present,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the past,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the future,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the present,

original: sems mnyam par bzhag gam /üîΩsems mnyam par ma bzhag kyang rung ba ste /
analyzed: sems mnyam par bzhag gam /üîΩsems mnyam par ma bzhag kyang rung ba ste /
translated: or may be thinking about something else in the past,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the future,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the present,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the past,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the future,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the present,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the past,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the future,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the present,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the past,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the future,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the present,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the past,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the future,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the present,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the past,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the future,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the present,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the past,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the future,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the present,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the past,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the future,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the present,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the past,üîΩor may be thinking about something else in the future,üîΩor may be thinking

original: lus kyis myong ba gang dag 'byung ba rnam pa du ma rnam pa sna tshogs mang po de dag 'byung ba dang dmigs par yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: lus kyis myong ba gang dag 'byung ba rnam pa du ma rnam pa sna tshogs mang po de dag 'byung ba dang dmigs par yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is not possible for the various kinds of many different kinds of experiences to occur and be perceived in the body.

original: de'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes par yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes par yod do //
translated: Therefore, the foundation consciousness exists.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na ci'i phyir sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mi srid pa dang / 'di ltar 'du shes med pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid lus las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i rigs nam 'das te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na ci'i phyir sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mi srid pa dang / 'di ltar 'du shes med pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid lus las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i rigs nam 'das te /
translated: If the foundation consciousness did not exist, then it would be impossible to enter the mindless meditative absorptions, and the consciousness of one who has entered the meditative absorption of nonperception would have to depart from the body,

original: de'i phyir 'chi ba'i dus byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'chi ba'i dus byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: because it would be impossible for the foundation consciousness to exist in the body without the active forms of consciousness.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As the Buddha said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de'i rnam par shes pa lus dang ma bral ba yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de'i rnam par shes pa lus dang ma bral ba yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe TathƒÅgata‚Äôs consciousness does not depart from the body.‚Äù

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na /
translated: If the foundation consciousness did not exist,

original: ci'i phyir 'chi 'pho ba yang mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'chi 'pho ba yang mi rung zhe na /
translated: why would it be impossible to die?

original: 'di ltar 'chi ba'i rnam par shes pa lus kyi stod dam smad du drod yal bar byed cing 'dor na yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni nam yang mi 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'chi ba'i rnam par shes pa lus kyi stod dam smad du drod yal bar byed cing 'dor na yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni nam yang mi 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Thus, when the consciousness at death causes the heat to leave and be lost from the lower or upper parts of the body, the mental consciousness never fails to occur.

original: de'i phyir yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa lus 'dzin pa nyid dang bral ba'i phyir lus drod yal ba dang / lus tshor ba med par yang dmigs kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa lus 'dzin pa nyid dang bral ba'i phyir lus drod yal ba dang / lus tshor ba med par yang dmigs kyi /
translated: Therefore, the body is observed to lose its heat and to be without bodily feeling, because the consciousness that holds the body is absent.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang bral bas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang bral bas ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not observed to be without mental consciousness.

original: de'i phyir yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, that is not reasonable.

original: yid ni nges pa'i tshig dang dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang 'byung ba'i dus kyis bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid ni nges pa'i tshig dang dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang 'byung ba'i dus kyis bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The mind should be understood as taught by way of its verbal definition, its object, its concomitants, and the time of its occurrence.

original: las mngon du gyur pa na de med pa ni don dam pa shes pa dang // bdag tu lta ba kun tu 'byung ba dang / shin tu mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las mngon du gyur pa na de med pa ni don dam pa shes pa dang // bdag tu lta ba kun tu 'byung ba dang / shin tu mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When action is present, it is not present, because it is incompatible with the knowledge of ultimate reality and with the occurrence of the view of self.

original: slob pas ni ma spangs pa'i phyir de'i 'og tu yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las byung ngo //
analyzed: slob pas ni ma spangs pa'i phyir de'i 'og tu yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las byung ngo //
translated: Because the learner has not abandoned the obstacle to the attainment of the cessation of ideation and sensation, it arises again from the store-consciousness.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ches zhi ba'i phyir de kun tu 'byung ba dang mi mthun @11b par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ches zhi ba'i phyir de kun tu 'byung ba dang mi mthun @11b par rig par bya'o //
translated: The attainment of cessation is to be known as the counteragent to the arising of the attainment of non-ideation, because it is more tranquil than the attainment of non-ideation.

original: 'gags ma thag pa yang yid du 'dod pas 'gags ma thag pa'i yid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gags ma thag pa yang yid du 'dod pas 'gags ma thag pa'i yid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The immediately preceding is also the mind, because the mind that has just ceased is accepted as the immediately preceding condition.

original: rnam par shes pa ni gnas dang dmigs pa dang ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni gnas dang dmigs pa dang ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Consciousness is to be known as established by way of its basis, objective support and own-being.

original: khams dang skye mched rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni logs shig du rnam par gzhag tu med de /
analyzed: khams dang skye mched rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni logs shig du rnam par gzhag tu med de /
translated: The characteristics of the elements and sense-fields are not established separately from the aggregates.

original: phung po bstan pa'i skabs su mig la sogs pa nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phung po bstan pa'i skabs su mig la sogs pa nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the eyes etc. are indicated in the exposition of the aggregates.

original: de bas na phung po rnams las dmigs kyis bton te //
analyzed: de bas na phung po rnams las dmigs kyis bton te //
translated: Therefore, they are extracted from the aggregates

original: khams rnams rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: khams rnams rnam par gzhag go //
translated: and established as elements.

original: khams rnams las dmigs kyis bton te skye mched rnams rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: khams rnams las dmigs kyis bton te skye mched rnams rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The bases are established by excluding the elements.

original: phung po rnams kyis gang ma bsdus pa 'dus ma byas pa de ni rnam pa brgyad du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyis gang ma bsdus pa 'dus ma byas pa de ni rnam pa brgyad du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The unconditioned, which is not included in the aggregates, is established as eightfold.

original: de bzhin nyid rnam pa gsum ni gnas kyi rnam pas tha dad kyi ngo bo nyid kyis tha dad pa ni ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid rnam pa gsum ni gnas kyi rnam pas tha dad kyi ngo bo nyid kyis tha dad pa ni ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The three kinds of reality should be understood as different in terms of their basis, but not as different in terms of their own-being.

original: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba nyid ces bya ba ni rtag tu dngos po rnams kyi bdag med pa nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba nyid ces bya ba ni rtag tu dngos po rnams kyi bdag med pa nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The unchanging is to be seen as the selflessness of all things at all times.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa mi rgyu ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de la dmigs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos po kun nas nyon mongs pas stongs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa mi rgyu ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de la dmigs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos po kun nas nyon mongs pas stongs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the defilements do not operate in it, because it is the object of the path of vision, and because it is the sphere of the purified view.

original: gang gi tshe kun nas nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba de'i tshe yang de la glo bur gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe kun nas nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba de'i tshe yang de la glo bur gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs par rig par bya ste /
translated: When it is said to be defiled, it is to be understood as being adventitively defiled.üîΩThe unconditioned is not to be understood as being either pure or defiled.

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: The reality of things is their natural luminosity.

original: mtshan ma rnams ni gzugs dang tshor ba nas byang chub ces bya ba'i bar du spros pa rnams te /
analyzed: mtshan ma rnams ni gzugs dang tshor ba nas byang chub ces bya ba'i bar du spros pa rnams te /
translated: Signs are the elaborations of things from form and feeling up to enlightenment.

original: de la de dag nye bar zhi ba'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: de la de dag nye bar zhi ba'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: Since they are completely pacified there, it is signless.

original: yang dag pa ni gang phyin ci ma log pa'o /
analyzed: yang dag pa ni gang phyin ci ma log pa'o /
translated: Correct is that which is non-erroneous.

original: de'i mtha' ni mur thug pa ste /
analyzed: de'i mtha' ni mur thug pa ste /
translated: Its limit is the ultimate,

original: bdag med pa las pha rol tu de kho na btsal du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa las pha rol tu de kho na btsal du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because beyond selflessness there is no other reality to be sought.

original: nam mkha' ni gzugs med ces bya ba ni gzugs nyid las bzlog pa gzugs med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul gang yin pa de ni nam mkha'o /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni gzugs med ces bya ba ni gzugs nyid las bzlog pa gzugs med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul gang yin pa de ni nam mkha'o /
translated: Space is the absence of form. The absence of form is the characteristic of a phenomenon that is the opposite of form. That which is the object of mental consciousness is space.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul ni chos kyi khams kyi skabs yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul ni chos kyi khams kyi skabs yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the object of mental consciousness is the occasion of the element of mental objects.

original: gzugs nyid ces bya ba ni rnam pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs nyid ces bya ba ni rnam pa'i phyir te /
translated: Form itself is the reason.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa dang thun mong ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid sel to //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa dang thun mong ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid sel to //
translated: The reality that is common to feeling and so on, the cessation that is not due to deliberation, impermanence, and so on are excluded.

original: ri bong gi rva la @12a * //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la @12a * //
translated: The horns of a rabbit,

original: sogs pa ni gtan med pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa ni gtan med pa ste /
translated: and so on, are absolutely nonexistent.

original: de dag las bzlog par ni mi shes so //
analyzed: de dag las bzlog par ni mi shes so //
translated: They are not known to be the opposite of those.

original: de ltar de dag ni gtan nas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni gtan nas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are absolutely nonexistent.

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa de dag ni gzugs yod pa 'di las bzlog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa de dag ni gzugs yod pa 'di las bzlog pa ma yin te /
translated: Those horns of a rabbit, and so on, are not the opposite of this existent form.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa dang thun mong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa dang thun mong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are common to feeling and so on.

original: de bas na gzugs nyid las bzlog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs nyid las bzlog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are said to be the opposite of form itself.

original: gang gzugs ma yin pa zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gang gzugs ma yin pa zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: What is to be called non-form?

original: med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshig gis tshor ba la sogs pa gzugs can ma yin pa rnams gsal te /
analyzed: med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshig gis tshor ba la sogs pa gzugs can ma yin pa rnams gsal te /
translated: The non-existent characteristic words clarify the formless, such as feeling, and so on.

original: de dag ni med pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni med pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not the characteristic of non-existence.

original: gang 'gog la bral ba ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni bag la nyal ma bcom pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'gog la bral ba ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni bag la nyal ma bcom pa'o //
translated: That which is not cessation is not separation, that is, the latent impressions are not destroyed.

original: bzlog pa ni bral ba'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni bral ba'o //
translated: The opposite is separation.

original: spang par bya ba de ni gnyis te /
analyzed: spang par bya ba de ni gnyis te /
translated: That which is to be abandoned is twofold:

original: nyon mongs pa rnams dang / de'i gnas su gyur pa tshor ba'o /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams dang / de'i gnas su gyur pa tshor ba'o /
translated: the afflictions and the feeling that is their basis.

original: tshor ba de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: tshor ba de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That feeling is also twofold:

original: 'gyur bar byed pa dang / 'gyur bar mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'gyur bar byed pa dang / 'gyur bar mi byed pa ste /
translated: that which is transformed and that which is not transformed.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa dang / go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa dang / go rims bzhin no //
translated: It is pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant, respectively.

original: de la nyon mongs pa spong bas so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa spong bas so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Among those, the cessation that is attained through analysis is posited through the abandonment of the afflictions.

original: tshor ba rnam pa gnyis spong bas mi g-yo ba dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa dang go rims bzhin du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: tshor ba rnam pa gnyis spong bas mi g-yo ba dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa dang go rims bzhin du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The immovable and the cessation of ideation and feeling are posited, respectively, through the abandonment of the two kinds of feeling.

original: de la nyon mongs pa spong bas na de'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i phyir gnas gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa spong bas na de'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i phyir gnas gyur ba'o //
translated: Among those, the transformation is due to the abandonment of the afflictions, because one is separated from the negative tendencies that are associated with them.

original: tshor ba spong ba ni de'i gnyen por gyur pa snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'i phyir gnas gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tshor ba spong ba ni de'i gnyen por gyur pa snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'i phyir gnas gyur ba'o //
translated: The abandonment of sensation is the transformation of the basis, because it is the antidote to the obscurations to meditative concentration.

original: de'i phyir bsam gtan gnyis par sdug bsngal 'gog pa la 'dus ma byas rnam par mi gzhag ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsam gtan gnyis par sdug bsngal 'gog pa la 'dus ma byas rnam par mi gzhag ste /
translated: Therefore, the cessation of suffering in the second meditative concentration is not posited as unconditioned,

original: 'gyur bar byed pa'i tshor ba ma lus par ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gyur bar byed pa'i tshor ba ma lus par ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because sensation that transforms is not completely abandoned.

original: gzugs kyi phung pos ni khams gzugs can bcu bsdus so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung pos ni khams gzugs can bcu bsdus so //
translated: The form aggregate includes the ten form elements.

original: chos kyi khams kyis ni de nyid bsdus so //
analyzed: chos kyi khams kyis ni de nyid bsdus so //
translated: The phenomena element includes that very element.

original: yid kyi skye mched kyis ni rnam par shes pa'i khams bdun bsdus te /üîΩde ltar na chos thams cad ni gsum du 'gyur ro /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched kyis ni rnam par shes pa'i khams bdun bsdus te / de ltar na chos thams cad ni gsum du 'gyur ro /
translated: The mind base includes the seven consciousness elements.

original: // / bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: // / bam po gnyis pa /
translated: Thus, all things are included in three aggregates, eighteen elements, and twelve bases.

original: phung po dang khams dang / skye mched de ltar rnam par gzhag pa la zhar las 'byung ba de bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang / skye mched de ltar rnam par gzhag pa la zhar las 'byung ba de bstan par bya'o //
translated: The incidental topic will now be explained, following the presentation of the aggregates, elements, and bases.

original: mig dang rna ba dang sna rnams so so la yang gnyis gnyis yod na khams nyi shu rtsa gcig tu ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: mig dang rna ba dang sna rnams so so la yang gnyis gnyis yod na khams nyi shu rtsa gcig tu ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the eyes, ears, and nose each have two parts, why aren‚Äôt there twenty-one elements?

original: de dag gnyis @12b gnyis yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: de dag gnyis @12b gnyis yod du zin kyang /
translated: Even though they each have two parts,

original: gnyi ga yang mig gi mtshan nyid yin pas mtshan nyid 'dra ba dang / gnyi ga'i bya ba mig gi rnam par shes pa yin par gcig pa'i phyir bya ba mthun pas khams gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang mig gi mtshan nyid yin pas mtshan nyid 'dra ba dang / gnyi ga'i bya ba mig gi rnam par shes pa yin par gcig pa'i phyir bya ba mthun pas khams gzhan ma yin no //
translated: they are not separate elements because they have the same characteristics, since both have the characteristic of eye, and they have the same function, since the function of both is eye consciousness.

original: rna ba dang sna la'ang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rna ba dang sna la'ang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the ears and nose.

original: gnyis su grub pa ni gnas mdzes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su grub pa ni gnas mdzes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are established as two because they are beautiful when separate.

original: 'di ltar ngos gnyis shin tu rnam par 'byed na gnas mdzes kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar ngos gnyis shin tu rnam par 'byed na gnas mdzes kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: In this way, they are beautiful when the two sides are clearly distinct, but not otherwise.

original: ci mig re re la brten te mig gi rnam par shes pa rtag tu 'byung ba 'on te gnyi ga la yang brten /üîΩsmras pa gsal bar 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci mig re re la brten te mig gi rnam par shes pa rtag tu 'byung ba 'on te gnyi ga la yang brten / smras pa gsal bar 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: Do eye consciousnesses always arise in dependence on each eye or do they arise in dependence on both?

original: gnyi ga la brten nas 'byung ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga la brten nas 'byung ste /
translated: They arise in dependence on both, because they apprehend a clear object.

original: dper na mig gnyi ga phye na gzugs 'dzin pa la gsal bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dper na mig gnyi ga phye na gzugs 'dzin pa la gsal bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: For example, when both eyes are open, the perception of form is clear,

original: gcig gis ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig gis ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: but not so when only one eye is open.

original: dper na khang pa gcig tu mar me gnyis bus na /
analyzed: dper na khang pa gcig tu mar me gnyis bus na /
translated: For example, when two lamps are lit in one house,

original: mar me gnyis la brten nas 'od rgyas pa cig gis shin tu gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mar me gnyis la brten nas 'od rgyas pa cig gis shin tu gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the light from both lamps combines to make the house very bright.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang tshul de ltar blta bar bya'o //üîΩde'i yul sna tshogs nye bar gnas par gyur na de'i rnam pa rnams la dbang po re re'i sgo nas rnam par shes pa rnams rim gyis 'byung ngam //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang tshul de ltar blta bar bya'o // de'i yul sna tshogs nye bar gnas par gyur na de'i rnam pa rnams la dbang po re re'i sgo nas rnam par shes pa rnams rim gyis 'byung ngam //
translated: The same should be understood here.

original: 'on te gcig gis cig car 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gcig gis cig car 'dzin zhe na /
translated: When various objects are present, do the consciousnesses arise in sequence through the doors of the individual sense faculties, or do they arise simultaneously through one sense faculty?

original: rnam par shes pa gcig kho nas cig car 'dzin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gcig kho nas cig car 'dzin te /
translated: The consciousnesses arise simultaneously through one sense faculty.

original: rnam pa ni sna tshogs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ni sna tshogs su rig par bya'o //
translated: The various aspects of the object should be understood.

original: lce la kham gyi zas reg na lca dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa rtag tu cig car 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lce la kham gyi zas reg na lca dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa rtag tu cig car 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: When the tongue is in contact with food, it should be understood that the tongue consciousness and the body consciousness always arise simultaneously.

original: sgra ni rgyun chad pa'i phyir yul gzhan dag tu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'byung ba'i rgyun gyis yul gzhan du 'gro ba med kyi 'di lta ste rang gi yul na 'dug cing thang cig 'byung ste /
analyzed: sgra ni rgyun chad pa'i phyir yul gzhan dag tu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'byung ba'i rgyun gyis yul gzhan du 'gro ba med kyi 'di lta ste rang gi yul na 'dug cing thang cig 'byung ste /
translated: Sound does not go to another place by a continuity that passes from one to another, because it is interrupted. It is like this: it abides in its own place and arises for a moment.

original: mar me'i 'od rgyas pa bzhin du sgra rgyas pa 'byung ba yang de ltar blta'o //
analyzed: mar me'i 'od rgyas pa bzhin du sgra rgyas pa 'byung ba yang de ltar blta'o //
translated: The arising of sound should be seen as like the arising of the flame of a lamp.

original: nye yang bar du bcad pa'i sgra gsal bar mi thos pa'i sgra de thogs pa yod pa'i phyir rtsig pa'i gseb nas chung ngu 'byung bar rig par bya'o /
analyzed: nye yang bar du bcad pa'i sgra gsal bar mi thos pa'i sgra de thogs pa yod pa'i phyir rtsig pa'i gseb nas chung ngu 'byung bar rig par bya'o /
translated: Sound is obstructed because sound that is not heard clearly when nearby, due to an obstruction, is known to arise in a small way from within the wall.

original: rnam par shes pa drug po dag las rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa na du zhig / rnam par mi rtog pa ni du zhig ce na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug po dag las rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa na du zhig / rnam par mi rtog pa ni du zhig ce na /
translated: How many of the six consciousnesses are conceptual and how many are non-conceptual?

original: rnam par rtog pa gsum gyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig pu rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ste //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gsum gyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig pu rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ste //
translated: The mental consciousness alone is conceptual, because it is associated with the three types of conception.

original: rnam par rtog pa gsum ni rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / mngon par spyod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //üîΩde la rang bzhin gyi rnam @13a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gsum ni rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / mngon par spyod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o // de la rang bzhin gyi rnam @13a * //
translated: The three kinds of conceptualization are: conceptualization as intrinsic nature, conceptualization as memory, and conceptualization as performance.

original: par rtog pa ni de ltar 'byung ba'i 'du byed myong ba na gang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //üîΩrjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
analyzed: par rtog pa ni de ltar 'byung ba'i 'du byed myong ba na gang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o // rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
translated: Conceptualization as intrinsic nature is the conceptualization of the form of the intrinsic identity of the formative forces that occur in that way.

original: gang sngon myong ba'i 'du byed kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gang sngon myong ba'i 'du byed kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Conceptualization as memory is the conceptualization of the formative forces that have been experienced in the past.

original: mngon par spyod pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi lkog tu gyur pa rnams la mngon par rtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par spyod pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi lkog tu gyur pa rnams la mngon par rtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Conceptualization as performance is the conceptualization of the realization of the hidden meaning of the past, future and present.

original: yang rnam par rtog pa bdun te /
analyzed: yang rnam par rtog pa bdun te /
translated: There are also seven kinds of conceptualization.

original: dmigs pa la rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / kun tu tshol bar byed pa dang / so sor rtag pa dang / nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i rnam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //üîΩde la rnam par rtog pa dang po ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa la rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / kun tu tshol bar byed pa dang / so sor rtag pa dang / nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i rnam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o // de la rnam par rtog pa dang po ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ste /
translated: The first is the conceptualization that engages its object spontaneously, the second is the conceptualization that is associated with signs, the third is the conceptualization that is not associated with signs, the fourth is the conceptualization that is a thorough search, the fifth is the conceptualization that is a thorough analysis, and the sixth is the conceptualization that is either afflicted or unafflicted.üîΩüîΩThe first conceptualization is the six collections of consciousness.üîΩ

original: dmigs pa la bkra bar ma bzung bar rang gi yul ji lta ba bzhin du rang gi dang gis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmtshan ma dang bcas pa ni rang bzhin dang rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa la bkra bar ma bzung bar rang gi yul ji lta ba bzhin du rang gi dang gis 'jug pa'i phyir ro // mtshan ma dang bcas pa ni rang bzhin dang rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: The first is the six consciousnesses, because they engage their objects spontaneously, without grasping their images.

original: da ltar dang 'das pa'i yul la bkra bar 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar dang 'das pa'i yul la bkra bar 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The second is the conceptualization of essential nature and memory, because they grasp the images of present and past objects.

original: mtshan ma med pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i yul yid la brnags pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i yul yid la brnags pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The third is the conceptualization that is directed toward a future object.üîΩThe fourth is the conceptualization of investigation, because it investigates names, classes, and so on.üîΩThe fifth is the conceptualization of analysis, because it analyzes substance, function, cause, result, generality, and individuality.üîΩThe sixth is the conceptualization of affliction, because it is associated with the three poisons.üîΩThe seventh is the conceptualization of non-affliction, because it is associated with the roots of virtue.

original: lhag ma rnams ni mngon par spyod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid du rig par bya ste //üîΩ'di ltar res 'ga' ni mngon par rtog cing kun tu tshol lo //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni mngon par spyod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid du rig par bya ste // 'di ltar res 'ga' ni mngon par rtog cing kun tu tshol lo //
translated: The remaining ones should be understood as having the nature of the conceptualization of manifest activity.üîΩSometimes they conceptualize and seek,

original: res 'ga' ni so sor rtog go //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni so sor rtog go //
translated: sometimes they discriminate,

original: res 'ga' ni nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: sometimes they are defiled,

original: res 'ga' ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin no //
translated: and sometimes they are not defiled.

original: gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa'i so sor rnam par rig pa'i rnam par shes pa de ci'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'i gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa'i so sor rnam par rig pa'i rnam par shes pa de ci'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'i gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes mi bya zhe na /
translated: When consciousness is aware of form, etc., why is it called visual consciousness, etc., and not called form consciousness, etc.?

original: tshig rnam par sbyar ba rnam pa lnga 'thad pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i tshig mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: tshig rnam par sbyar ba rnam pa lnga 'thad pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i tshig mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because the five kinds of analysis are valid and because the term form, etc., is not valid.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: mig la rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: mig la rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The consciousness in the eye is visual consciousness,

original: gnas kyi yul la rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas kyi yul la rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because consciousness arises in dependence on a location.

original: de yod na de'ang yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de yod na de'ang yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: because if that exists, that also exists.

original: 'di ltar mig yod na long ba ma yin pa rnams kyi mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig yod na long ba ma yin pa rnams kyi mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, if the eye exists, the visual consciousness arises in those who are not blind,

original: tha na mun pa na yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha na mun pa na yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they see even in the dark.

original: gzugs yod du zin kyang gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs yod du zin kyang gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Even if form exists, it does not necessarily arise,

original: long ba rnams kyis mi mthong @13b ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: long ba rnams kyis mi mthong @13b ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the blind do not see.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The visual consciousness is the visual consciousness.

original: gzugs ma gyur kyang de'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs ma gyur kyang de'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if form does not change, the consciousness changes because of it.

original: dper na mig ser gyi nad kyis btab na gzugs sngon po la sogs pa la yang mig gis ser po nyid du mthong ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mig ser gyi nad kyis btab na gzugs sngon po la sogs pa la yang mig gis ser po nyid du mthong ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when one is afflicted with jaundice, the eye sees a white shell as yellow.

original: mig las rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste //
analyzed: mig las rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste //
translated: The visual consciousness is the visual consciousness.

original: mig ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i sa bon dang 'brel ba ste //
analyzed: mig ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i sa bon dang 'brel ba ste //
translated: The eye is related to the seed of the visual consciousness,

original: de las 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established from that.

original: mig gi phyir rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste de la phan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gi phyir rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste de la phan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The consciousness that is for the sake of the eye is eye consciousness, because it is for the sake of the eye.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i myong bas dbang po la phan gnod du 'gyur gyi yul la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i myong bas dbang po la phan gnod du 'gyur gyi yul la ni ma yin no //
translated: In this way, the eye is benefited or harmed by the experience that is associated with consciousness, but the object is not.

original: mig dang mtshungs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: mig dang mtshungs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The consciousness that is similar to the eye is eye consciousness.

original: gnyi ga yang sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Both are included in the category of sentient beings.

original: gzugs ni gdon mi za bar sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs ni gdon mi za bar sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: But form is not necessarily included in the category of sentient beings.

original: ci mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ngam /
analyzed: ci mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ngam /
