translated: Does the eye see form?

original: 'on te rnam par shes pas mthong zhe na /üîΩchos rnams ni byed pa med pa'i phyir gcig gis kyang mi mthong la /
analyzed: 'on te rnam par shes pas mthong zhe na / chos rnams ni byed pa med pa'i phyir gcig gis kyang mi mthong la /
translated: Or does consciousness see?

original: cig shos kyis kyang mi mthong bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: cig shos kyis kyang mi mthong bar rig par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that neither sees, because phenomena are devoid of activity.

original: tshogs par gyur pa las mthong bar gdags so /
analyzed: tshogs par gyur pa las mthong bar gdags so /
translated: But seeing is figuratively designated as occurring when the two are assembled.

original: yang rnam pa drug gis ni mig gis gzugs mthong ngo zhes gtso bor rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang rnam pa drug gis ni mig gis gzugs mthong ngo zhes gtso bor rig par bya'o //
translated: Also, it should be understood that the statement ‚ÄúThe eye sees visible form‚Äù is primary in six ways.

original: rnam par shes pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not primary in the sense of consciousness.

original: rnam pa drug gang zhe na /üîΩ'byung ba'i rgyu'i phyir mig las de 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa drug gang zhe na / 'byung ba'i rgyu'i phyir mig las de 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: What are the six ways?üîΩThe eye is primary as the cause of arising because the visual consciousness arises from it.

original: de'i gnas kyi phyir mthong ba'i rten mig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gnas kyi phyir mthong ba'i rten mig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is primary as the support of seeing because the eye is the support of seeing.

original: mi g-yo bar 'jug pa'i phyir mig ni rtag tu rigs gcig pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: mi g-yo bar 'jug pa'i phyir mig ni rtag tu rigs gcig pa'i phyir ro//
translated: It is primary as the unmoving medium because the eye is always of the same type.

original: rang dbang du 'jug pa'i phyir skad cig re re la 'byung ba rkyen tshogs pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dbang du 'jug pa'i phyir skad cig re re la 'byung ba rkyen tshogs pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is primary as the independent medium because the eye arises in each moment without depending on the collection of conditions.

original: mdzes par 'jug pa'i phyir des gnas mdzes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdzes par 'jug pa'i phyir des gnas mdzes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is primary as the medium that is beautiful because the eye is beautiful as a support.

original: lung gi phyir mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lung gi phyir mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is primary as the medium that is indicated because the eye is indicated in the statement ‚ÄúThe eye sees visible form.‚Äù

original: ji skad du bshad pa de thams cad ni rnam par shes pa la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa de thams cad ni rnam par shes pa la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All of these explanations are impossible for consciousness.

original: 'di ni rnam pa mang por 'byung bas g-yo bar 'jug pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa mang por 'byung bas g-yo bar 'jug pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the mind faculty is engaged in movement because it occurs in many forms.

original: ji ltar khams rnams dang skye mched rnams la 'dus ma byas rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du phung po rnams la ci'i phyir rnam par ma bzhag ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar khams rnams dang skye mched rnams la 'dus ma byas rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du phung po rnams la ci'i phyir rnam par ma bzhag ce na /
translated: Why is the unconditioned not posited as a aggregate, as it is posited as an element and as a base?

original: phung po'i don med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzugs la @14a * //
analyzed: phung po'i don med pa'i phyir ro // gzugs la @14a * //
translated: Because it does not have the meaning of an aggregate.üîΩThe aggregates are described as heaps,

original: sogs pa ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis bsdus te /
analyzed: sogs pa ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis bsdus te /
translated: because form and so on are subsumed in their past, future and present aspects.

original: spungs pa'i don ni phung po'i don du bstan la /
analyzed: spungs pa'i don ni phung po'i don du bstan la /
translated: The meaning of a heap is the meaning of an aggregate.

original: de ni rtag tu yod pa ma yin pas phung po rnams la 'dus ma byas rnam par mi gzhag go //
analyzed: de ni rtag tu yod pa ma yin pas phung po rnams la 'dus ma byas rnam par mi gzhag go //
translated: But the unconditioned does not exist as a heap, because it is not always existent.

original: ci'i phyir chos 'di rnams phung po dang khams 'di rnams skye mched kyi sgo nas logs shig tu bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir chos 'di rnams phung po dang khams 'di rnams skye mched kyi sgo nas logs shig tu bshad ce na /
translated: Why are these phenomena explained separately as aggregates and as elements and bases?

original: gdul bya rnams bsdus pa dang / rgyas par bstan pa la mkhas pa bskyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gdul bya rnams bsdus pa dang / rgyas par bstan pa la mkhas pa bskyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: In order to generate skill in disciples regarding extensive and concise teachings.

original: 'di ltar phung po bstan pa la gzugs dang rnam par shes pa gang dag mdor bstan pa de dag khams dang skye mched rnams la rnam pa bcu gcig dang / rnam pa bdun du phye nas rgyas par bstan te ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po bstan pa la gzugs dang rnam par shes pa gang dag mdor bstan pa de dag khams dang skye mched rnams la rnam pa bcu gcig dang / rnam pa bdun du phye nas rgyas par bstan te ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, in the teaching of the aggregates, form and consciousness, which were taught in brief, are taught in detail in the teaching of the elements and sense bases, by dividing them into eleven and seven types, respectively, as is appropriate.

original: der tshor ba la sogs pa gang dag rgyas par bstan pa de dag ni khams dang skye mched rnams su chos kyi khams dang skye mched du bsdus te bstan to //
analyzed: der tshor ba la sogs pa gang dag rgyas par bstan pa de dag ni khams dang skye mched rnams su chos kyi khams dang skye mched du bsdus te bstan to //
translated: In the teaching of the elements and sense bases, those feelings, etc., which were taught in detail, are included in the phenomena element and phenomena sense base.

original: yang mtshan nyid tsam rnam par gzhag pas phung po bstan to //
analyzed: yang mtshan nyid tsam rnam par gzhag pas phung po bstan to //
translated: Moreover, the aggregates are taught by positing just their characteristics.

original: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba dang 'dzin par byed pa rnam par gzhag pas khams bstan to //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba dang 'dzin par byed pa rnam par gzhag pas khams bstan to //
translated: The elements are taught by positing the apprehender, the apprehended, and that which causes the apprehension of the apprehended.

original: 'dzin par byed pa skye ba'i sgor gyur pa gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa tsam rnam par gzhag pas skye mched bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa skye ba'i sgor gyur pa gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa tsam rnam par gzhag pas skye mched bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The sense bases are taught by positing the mere apprehended and the mere apprehender, which are the doors for the arising of that which causes the apprehension of the apprehended.

original: zhar las byung ba rdzogs s+ho /
analyzed: zhar las byung ba rdzogs s+ho /
translated: The digression is complete.

original: // /'di man chad du ni rtsa ba'i gzhung nyid kyi don bshad par blta'o //
analyzed: // /'di man chad du ni rtsa ba'i gzhung nyid kyi don bshad par blta'o //
translated: From here on, the meaning of the root text should be seen as explained.

original: dgra bcom pa tha ma'i mig go zhes bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus tha ma ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa tha ma'i mig go zhes bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus tha ma ste /
translated: The eye of the final arhat refers to the final moment of nirvana.

original: de ni mig gzhan gyi rgyu yin pas khams ma yin no //üîΩgzugs med par skyes pa'i so so'i skye bo'i mig gi rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni de nas shi 'phos te /
analyzed: de ni mig gzhan gyi rgyu yin pas khams ma yin no // gzugs med par skyes pa'i so so'i skye bo'i mig gi rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni de nas shi 'phos te /
translated: It is not an element because it is the cause of another eye.üîΩThe cause of the eye of an ordinary being born in the formless realm refers to the seed of the eye that exists in the foundation consciousness.

original: gzugs can gyi khams su skye ba'i mig gi sa bon kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la gnas pa las 'di ltar yang mig mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs can gyi khams su skye ba'i mig gi sa bon kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la gnas pa las 'di ltar yang mig mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: In this way, the eye is actualized.

original: yang phyir mi 'ong bas na 'phags pa rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang phyir mi 'ong bas na 'phags pa rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: However, it is not actualized by noble ones who are nonreturners.

original: lus kyi khams yin la lus ma yin pa la yang gzugs med par skyes pa'i so so'i skye bo'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba 'dir brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: lus kyi khams yin la lus ma yin pa la yang gzugs med par skyes pa'i so so'i skye bo'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba 'dir brjod par bya ste /
translated: The body element that is not the body is the cause of an ordinary being born in the formless realm.

original: sgo nga'i nang na 'dug pa la sogs pa la ni lus yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgo nga'i nang na 'dug pa la sogs pa la ni lus yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the body exists in the egg, etc.

original: lus zhig pa ni mi 'tsho ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus zhig pa ni mi 'tsho ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the body does not live when it is destroyed.

original: yid kyi khams yid la yid ma yin pa'ang yod ces bya ba la /
analyzed: yid kyi khams yid la yid ma yin pa'ang yod ces bya ba la /
translated: There is a mental element that is not mind.

original: 'dir 'du shes med pa la snyoms par zhugs pa ma smos pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir 'du shes med pa la snyoms par zhugs pa ma smos pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the attainment of the non-perception meditative attainment is not mentioned because the afflicted mind exists.

original: byung zhing skyes par gyur @14b zhes bya ba ni 'grub pa dang rgyas par 'gyur ba'i dbang du byas pa ste go rims bzhin no /
analyzed: byung zhing skyes par gyur @14b zhes bya ba ni 'grub pa dang rgyas par 'gyur ba'i dbang du byas pa ste go rims bzhin no /
translated: That which has arisen and is born refers to the establishment and the increase, respectively.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i yid kyis gzugs med pa na spyod par rang gis pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang shes so zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa nyan thos kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i yid kyis gzugs med pa na spyod par rang gis pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang shes so zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa nyan thos kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: The formless realm mind knows the formless realm mind that is of its own realm and also uncontaminated states. This is from the perspective of the noble hearer.

original: phyi rol gyi so so'i skye bo ni rang gi sa pa rnams nyid rnam par shes kyi chos 'di pa ni la la sngon thos pas yongs su bsgoms pa'i dbang gis sa gong ma la yang dmigs te bskyed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzugs ji lta ba de bzhin du myong ngo zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i dbang po dang / yul gnyis las bde ba la sogs pa'i 'tshor ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩtshor bar byed pa ji lta ba de bzhin du 'du shes su byed do zhes bya ba ni ji ltar myong ba de bzhin du mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi so so'i skye bo ni rang gi sa pa rnams nyid rnam par shes kyi chos 'di pa ni la la sngon thos pas yongs su bsgoms pa'i dbang gis sa gong ma la yang dmigs te bskyed pa'i phyir ro // gzugs ji lta ba de bzhin du myong ngo zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i dbang po dang / yul gnyis las bde ba la sogs pa'i 'tshor ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro // tshor bar byed pa ji lta ba de bzhin du 'du shes su byed do zhes bya ba ni ji ltar myong ba de bzhin du mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Ordinary beings of the external world perceive only their own level, but those of this Dharma, i.e., the noble ones, also perceive higher levels, because they generate them through the power of thorough familiarization with what was previously heard.üîΩJust as with form, so too with feeling: one experiences just as it is. This is because the feeling of pleasure, etc., arises from the two, the sense faculty and object that are to be experienced as pleasure, etc.üîΩJust as with the one who experiences, so too with the one who perceives: one perceives just as it is. This is because one apprehends the signs just as one experiences them.

original: ji ltar 'du shes su byed pa de bzhin du sems par byed do zhes bya ba ni 'du shes ji lta ba de bzhin du mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'du shes su byed pa de bzhin du sems par byed do zhes bya ba ni 'du shes ji lta ba de bzhin du mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as with the one who perceives, so too with the one who thinks: one thinks just as one perceives. This is because one forms manifest action just as one perceives.

original: sems par byed pa ji lta ba de bzhin du rnam par shes par byed de /
analyzed: sems par byed pa ji lta ba de bzhin du rnam par shes par byed de /
translated: Just as it thinks, so it cognizes,

original: de dang der nye bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mngon par 'dus byas pa'i yul rnams la 'gro ba gzhan rnams su rnam par shes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang der nye bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mngon par 'dus byas pa'i yul rnams la 'gro ba gzhan rnams su rnam par shes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and it goes to this or that place, because it goes to other realms due to the objects that have been accumulated.

original: gang ba kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus la'o //
analyzed: gang ba kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus la'o //
translated: In the body with its sense faculties, there is the process of defilement and purification.

original: myong ba gang gis zhes bya ba ni zang zing dang bcas pa dang / zang zing med pa la sogs pa dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: myong ba gang gis zhes bya ba ni zang zing dang bcas pa dang / zang zing med pa la sogs pa dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: By means of which experience, that is, with the support of the sense faculties, there is the experience of the desirable and undesirable objects, which are respectively agreeable and disagreeable.

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang mngon par 'du byed pa gang gis zhes bya ba ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa dang tshul bzhin du 'jug pas so //
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang mngon par 'du byed pa gang gis zhes bya ba ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa dang tshul bzhin du 'jug pas so //
translated: By means of which apprehension of signs and by means of which formative influence, that is, by means of the apprehension of signs and the formative influence that are due to incorrect mental activity.

original: gang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba ni sems gnas ngan len dang bcas pa dang gnas ngan len med par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba ni sems gnas ngan len dang bcas pa dang gnas ngan len med par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is called afflicted and purified is due to the mind occurring with and without negative reflex actions.

original: srid pa rnam pa bcu gcig gi skabs kyi gzugs la sogs pa 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa rnam pa bcu gcig gi skabs kyi gzugs la sogs pa 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that form, etc., in the context of the eleven types of existence are established by way of the categories of past, etc.

original: de yang bltas pa'i srid pa dang / mngon par dga' ba'i srid pa dang / lhag par chags pa'i sred pa dang / bdag la sred pa dang / yul la sred pa dang / 'dod pa la sred pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang /
analyzed: de yang bltas pa'i srid pa dang / mngon par dga' ba'i srid pa dang / lhag par chags pa'i sred pa dang / bdag la sred pa dang / yul la sred pa dang / 'dod pa la sred pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang /
translated: Moreover, there is the existence of viewing, the existence of delight, the craving of attachment, the craving of self, the craving of objects, the craving of desire, the craving of meditative attainment,

original: nyes par spyad pa'i sdug bsngal la sred pa dang / @15a * //
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa'i sdug bsngal la sred pa dang / @15a * //
translated: the craving of the suffering of bad conduct,

original: lags par spyad pa'i bde ba la sred pa dang / ring ba la sred pa dang / nye ba la sred pa ste /
analyzed: lags par spyad pa'i bde ba la sred pa dang / ring ba la sred pa dang / nye ba la sred pa ste /
translated: the craving of the pleasure of good conduct, the craving of the distant, and the craving of the near.

original: sred pa 'di dag gi dmigs pa nyid kyis go rims bzhin du 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam par sbyor bar bya'o //
analyzed: sred pa 'di dag gi dmigs pa nyid kyis go rims bzhin du 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam par sbyor bar bya'o //
translated: These cravings should be understood as being associated with the past, etc., in accordance with their order.

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan du na byung ba dang ma byung ba'i bye brag dang / 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i bye brag dang / phyi rol du bltas pa dang / nang du bltas pa'i bye brag dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i bye brag dang /
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan du na byung ba dang ma byung ba'i bye brag dang / 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i bye brag dang / phyi rol du bltas pa dang / nang du bltas pa'i bye brag dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i bye brag dang /
translated: Again, there is another enumeration: the distinction of having occurred and not having occurred, the distinction of the apprehending subject and the apprehended object, the distinction of being directed outward and being directed inward, the distinction of being defiled and being undefiled,

original: ring ba dang nye ba'i bye brag dang / 'das pa la sogs pa ji ltar mthun mthun du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ring ba dang nye ba'i bye brag dang / 'das pa la sogs pa ji ltar mthun mthun du rig par bya'o //
translated: the distinction of being remote and being proximate, and the distinction of being past, etc., as is appropriate in each case.

original: de la byung ba ni 'das pa dang da ltar ro //
analyzed: de la byung ba ni 'das pa dang da ltar ro //
translated: Of these, that which has occurred is the past and the present.

original: ma byung ba ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: ma byung ba ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
translated: That which has not occurred is the future.

original: 'dzin pa ni nang gi'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni nang gi'o //
translated: The apprehending subject is internal.

original: gzung ba ni phyi'o //üîΩphyi rol du bltas pa ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'i'o //
analyzed: gzung ba ni phyi'o // phyi rol du bltas pa ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'i'o //
translated: The apprehended object is external.üîΩThat which is directed outward is on the stage of meditative development.

original: nang du bltas pa ni mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa'i'o //
analyzed: nang du bltas pa ni mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa'i'o //
translated: That which is directed inward is on the stage of meditative equipoise.

original: lhag ma ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: The rest is easy to understand and so is not explained.

original: sdug bsngal ni shin tu rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid kho na'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la brten nas skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni shin tu rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid kho na'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la brten nas skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Suffering is the characteristic of the extensive because suffering such as birth is extensive in dependence on form, etc.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa khur khyer ba nyid kyi phyir te zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa khur khyer ba nyid kyi phyir te zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa /
translated: Affliction is the characteristic of the burden because affliction such as passion is the burden.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la brten pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la brten pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is the burden because it is carried by the body.

original: dper na 'jig rten na phrag pas khur khyer ba'i phyir lus kyi phyogs gang gis khur khyer ba de la phrag pa zhes 'dogs pa mthong ste dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten na phrag pas khur khyer ba'i phyir lus kyi phyogs gang gis khur khyer ba de la phrag pa zhes 'dogs pa mthong ste dang mtshungs so //
translated: For example, in the world, when a burden is carried by a part of the body, that part is called a shoulder.

original: chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi don to zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rgyu'i dbang du byas pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i don to /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi don to zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rgyu'i dbang du byas pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i don to /
translated: The meaning of seed of all things means that the store consciousness is the cause of all things, and it holds their individual natures.

original: 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos por 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni khams bco brgyad po dag la rnam par shes pa'i khams drug dang / dbang po dang don gyi khams rnam go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos por 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni khams bco brgyad po dag la rnam par shes pa'i khams drug dang / dbang po dang don gyi khams rnam go rims bzhin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe apprehension of things as effects and causes‚Äù refers to the six consciousnesses and the faculties and objects, respectively, among the eighteen constituents.

original: chos kyi rnam par thams cad bsdus nas 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde gzhan dag las sa'i khams la sogs pa dang / khams gzhan dag bstan pa dag kyang khams bco brgyad po 'di dag gi nang du ji ltar mthun mthun du bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam par thams cad bsdus nas 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde gzhan dag las sa'i khams la sogs pa dang / khams gzhan dag bstan pa dag kyang khams bco brgyad po 'di dag gi nang du ji ltar mthun mthun du bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe apprehension of all the aspects of entities‚Äù refers to the fact that the eighteen constituents include all the entities that are taught in the other s≈´tras as the constituents of earth, etc., and the other constituents.

original: sa bon gyi don dang chos kyi rnam pa thams cad bsdus pa'i don ni skye mched kyi don du yang rig par bya'o //üîΩgzugs la sogs pa ni dbu ba rdos @15b pa la sogs pa lta bu nyid de /
analyzed: sa bon gyi don dang chos kyi rnam pa thams cad bsdus pa'i don ni skye mched kyi don du yang rig par bya'o // gzugs la sogs pa ni dbu ba rdos @15b pa la sogs pa lta bu nyid de /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúseed‚Äù and the meaning of ‚Äúthe inclusion of all the aspects of entities‚Äù should also be understood as the meaning of ‚Äúbase.‚Äù

original: med pa dang / gso ba dang / gsog dang / snying po med par snang bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: med pa dang / gso ba dang / gsog dang / snying po med par snang bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúform, etc., are like a mass of foam‚Äù means that they are insubstantial, perishable, hollow, and essenceless.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di rnams kyi don ni bdag dang gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang rtag par phyin ci log pa'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di rnams kyi don ni bdag dang gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang rtag par phyin ci log pa'i gnyen po ste /
translated: The meaning of these words of the sutra is as follows.üîΩ

original: bdag med pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩji ltar du zhig ci'i phyir zhes 'dri ba gsum rnam par 'jog pa ni mtshan nyid dang / dngos po la rmongs pa dang / sgro 'dogs pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o // ji ltar du zhig ci'i phyir zhes 'dri ba gsum rnam par 'jog pa ni mtshan nyid dang / dngos po la rmongs pa dang / sgro 'dogs pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of these words of the sutra is as follows: The antidotes to the errors of self, purity, bliss, and permanence are, respectively, the words ‚Äúbecause of selflessness,‚Äù etc.üîΩThe three questions ‚ÄúWhat is it? Why is it? ‚Äù are posited in order to eliminate confusion about the characteristics and the entities, and in order to eliminate superimposition.

original: de la ji ltar rdzas su yod ces bya ba ni rdzas su yod pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pas de la rmongs pa spong ngo //
analyzed: de la ji ltar rdzas su yod ces bya ba ni rdzas su yod pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pas de la rmongs pa spong ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is it? ‚Äù is asked in order to eliminate confusion about the characteristics of substantial existence.üîΩ‚ÄúAll of them are substantially existent‚Äù eliminates confusion about the entities.

original: thams cad kyang rdzas su yod pa'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni dngos po la rmongs pa spong ba dag la rdzas su mngon par zhen pa spong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni sgro 'dogs pa spong ngo //
analyzed: thams cad kyang rdzas su yod pa'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni dngos po la rmongs pa spong ba dag la rdzas su mngon par zhen pa spong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni sgro 'dogs pa spong ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThe elimination of the superimposition of substantial existence‚Äù eliminates the superimposition of substantial existence.

original: de bzhin du gzhan rnams la'ang sbyor byar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan rnams la'ang sbyor byar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the other [four].

original: dbang po'i spyod yul brjod pa la mi ltos pa ni 'di lta ste gzugs dang tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ming bkra bar mi 'dzin par don gang yin pa 'dzin pa yin no //üîΩde las gzhan pa la mi ltos pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i spyod yul brjod pa la mi ltos pa ni 'di lta ste gzugs dang tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ming bkra bar mi 'dzin par don gang yin pa 'dzin pa yin no // de las gzhan pa la mi ltos pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Not depending on the expression of the sense-field means that one does not apprehend the colorful names such as form, feeling, etc., but apprehends the meaning.

original: don gzhan la mi ltos pa de'i blo 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: don gzhan la mi ltos pa de'i blo 'byung ba ste /
translated: Not depending on anything other than that means that the cognition of that meaning does not depend on any other meaning.

original: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa la ltos nas bum pa la sogs pa la bum pa la sogs pa'i blo 'byung ba lta bu ni ma yin no //üîΩkun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa ni kun rdzob tu yod pa'o zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'phel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa la ltos nas bum pa la sogs pa la bum pa la sogs pa'i blo 'byung ba lta bu ni ma yin no // kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa ni kun rdzob tu yod pa'o zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'phel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not like the cognition of a pot, etc., which arises in dependence on form, etc.üîΩThe object of defilement is said to be conventional existence, because defilement increases.

original: bdag ni kun nas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu'o snyam du mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: bdag ni kun nas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu'o snyam du mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro /
translated: The self is the cause of defilement.

original: rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa ni don dam par yod pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa ni don dam par yod pa ste /
translated: The object of purification is ultimate existence,

original: ye shes dam pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes dam pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the domain of the highest knowledge.

original: thams cad kyang don dam par yod pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyang de bzhin nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang don dam par yod pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyang de bzhin nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All exist ultimately, because all things are not other than reality.

original: gang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'o zhes bya ba ni sems las byung ba 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / dad pa la sogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'o zhes bya ba ni sems las byung ba 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / dad pa la sogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Affliction and purification are mental factors such as passion and faith.

original: de'i gnas skabs gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i gnas skabs dag la btags pa sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams so //üîΩrnam par byang ba gang @16a * //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i gnas skabs dag la btags pa sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams so // rnam par byang ba gang @16a * //
translated: The state of that is the state of form, mind, and mental factors, and is the designation of the dissociated formative forces.

original: yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas te /
analyzed: yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas te /
translated: Purification is the unconditioned.

original: de ni ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ni ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: This should be applied as appropriate.

original: yang shes pa rnam pa bcu gsum gyi yul gang yin pa de ni shes bya ste /
analyzed: yang shes pa rnam pa bcu gsum gyi yul gang yin pa de ni shes bya ste /
translated: The object of the thirteen aspects of consciousness is the knowable.

original: de dag ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa dang / don dam pa shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang /
analyzed: de dag ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa dang / don dam pa shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang /
translated: They are the consciousness arisen from hearing, the consciousness arisen from reflection, the consciousness arisen from cultivation, the consciousness of the ultimate, the consciousness of the mind of another, the consciousness of the Dharma,

original: rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / theg pa chen po shes pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / theg pa chen po shes pa ste /
translated: the subsequent consciousness, the consciousness of suffering, the consciousness of origin, the consciousness of cessation, the consciousness of the path, the consciousness of elimination, the consciousness of nonarising, and the consciousness of the Mahayana.

original: de dag ni go rims bzhin du mos pa'i shes pa la sogs par rig par bya'o //üîΩde la gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni gzhan gyi bdag nyid shes pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni go rims bzhin du mos pa'i shes pa la sogs par rig par bya'o // de la gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni gzhan gyi bdag nyid shes pa ste /
translated: They should be known respectively as the consciousness of aspiration and so on.üîΩThe consciousness of the mind of another is the consciousness of the self of another.

original: gzhan gyi bdag nyid kyi sems yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bdag nyid kyi sems yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind of another is its object.

original: chos shes pa ni 'og ma shes pa ste /
analyzed: chos shes pa ni 'og ma shes pa ste /
translated: Knowledge of the Dharma is knowledge of the lower stage.

original: bden pa rnams la thog mar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa rnams la thog mar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the truths occur first in the lower stage.

original: rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa ni gong ma shes pa ste /üîΩchos shes pa'i 'og tu 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa ni gong ma shes pa ste / chos shes pa'i 'og tu 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Knowledge of subsequent realization is knowledge of the higher stage.üîΩBecause it occurs after knowledge of the Dharma.üîΩKnowledge of the elimination of the passion for sensual desire is knowledge of the elimination of the passion for the desire realm.

original: rnam par sun 'byin pa'i phyir /üîΩkun nas mi ldang bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par sun 'byin pa'i phyir / kun nas mi ldang bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Knowledge of the nonarising of dharmas is knowledge of the nonarising of dharmas in the desire realm.üîΩKnowledge of the elimination of the passion for the form and formless realms should be understood in the same way.üîΩKnowledge of the elimination of the passion for the desire realm is knowledge of the elimination of the passion for the desire realm.üîΩKnowledge of the nonarising of dharmas in the desire realm is knowledge of the nonarising of dharmas in the desire realm.üîΩKnowledge of the elimination of the passion for the form and formless realms should be understood in the same way.

original: mi skye ba shes pa la mthar thug pa don chen po la shes pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par sun 'byin pa'i shes pa nas don chen po'i shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar du sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩdon chen po ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa la mthar thug pa don chen po la shes pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par sun 'byin pa'i shes pa nas don chen po'i shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar du sbyar bar bya'o // don chen po ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi phyir ro //
translated: Knowledge of the elimination of the passion for the desire realm is knowledge of the elimination of the passion for the desire realm.üîΩKnowledge of the nonarising of dharmas in the desire realm is knowledge of the nonarising of dharmas in the desire realm.üîΩKnowledge of the elimination of the passion for the form and formless realms should be understood in the same way.

original: rnam par mi rtog pas zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag gis so //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pas zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag gis so //
translated: Knowledge of the elimination of the passion for the desire realm is knowledge of the elimination of the passion for the desire realm.üîΩKnowledge of the nonarising of dharmas in the desire realm is knowledge of the nonarising of dharmas in the desire realm.üîΩKnowledge of the elimination of the passion for the form and formless realms should be understood in the same way.

original: rnam par rtog pas zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas so //
translated: Knowledge of the elimination of the passion for the desire realm is knowledge of the elimination of the passion for the desire realm.üîΩKnowledge of the nonarising of dharmas in the desire realm is knowledge of the nonarising of dharmas in the desire realm.üîΩKnowledge of the elimination of the passion for the form and formless realms should be understood in the same way.

original: rgyus zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pas so //
analyzed: rgyus zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pas so //
translated: Knowledge of the elimination of the passion for the desire realm is knowledge of the elimination of the passion for the desire realm.üîΩKnowledge of the nonarising of dharmas in the desire realm is knowledge of the nonarising of dharmas in the desire realm.üîΩKnowledge of the elimination of the passion for the form and formless realms should be understood in the same way

original: 'jug pa ni de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Engagement is the other consciousnesses.

original: rgyu mtshan ni dbang po dang don rnams so //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ni dbang po dang don rnams so //
translated: The objective perceptual object is the sense faculties and the objects.

original: rgyu mtshan las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: The objective perceptual object that is the cause is the consciousnesses that arise from the sense faculties and the objects.

original: mi mthun pa dang gnyen po ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa dang gnyen po ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The discordant class and its antidote are such as the consciousnesses that are associated with passion and those that are free from passion, those that are associated with hatred and those that are free from hatred, and so on.

original: phra ba'i rab tu phye bas zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes par dka' ba'i rnam par rig pa rnam pa bdun gyi bye brag gis te /
analyzed: phra ba'i rab tu phye bas zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes par dka' ba'i rnam par rig pa rnam pa bdun gyi bye brag gis te /
translated: The analysis of the subtle is the seven kinds of representations that are difficult to discern.

original: rnam par shes par dka' ba'i rnam par rig pa bdun ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes par dka' ba'i rnam par rig pa bdun ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The seven kinds of representations that are difficult to discern are as follows:

original: ma rig pa'i rnam par rig pa ni snod kyi rnam par rig pa phra ba ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rnam par rig pa ni snod kyi rnam par rig pa phra ba ste /
translated: The representation of non-knowledge is the subtle representation of the world,

original: dus thams cad du rnam pa yongs su @16b mchad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du rnam pa yongs su @16b mchad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is completely obscured at all times.

original: sna tshogs kyi rnam pa'i rnam par rig pa ni gcig gi rnam pa ni gcig dang sna tshogs te /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi rnam pa'i rnam par rig pa ni gcig gi rnam pa ni gcig dang sna tshogs te /
translated: The cognition of various aspects is difficult to establish as having a single aspect or various aspects.

original: rnam par gzhag par dka' ba'i phyir 'di ni phra ba nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag par dka' ba'i phyir 'di ni phra ba nyid do //
translated: This is its subtlety.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rnam par rig pa ni dus gcig tu 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa rnams ji ltar so sor rang gi yul ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su gcod pa rnam par gzhag par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rnam par rig pa ni dus gcig tu 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa rnams ji ltar so sor rang gi yul ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su gcod pa rnam par gzhag par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The cognition of simultaneous occurrence is difficult to establish as the various consciousnesses that occur simultaneously each determining their own object as it is.

original: phra ba nyid ces bya ba ni thams cad du sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phra ba nyid ces bya ba ni thams cad du sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúsubtlety‚Äù should be understood as applying to all of these.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gnyen po myur du 'byung ba'i rnam par rig pa ni ji ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching ba thams cad dang ldan pa'i sems te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gnyen po myur du 'byung ba'i rnam par rig pa ni ji ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching ba thams cad dang ldan pa'i sems te /
translated: The cognition of the rapid occurrence of antidotes to counteragents is the mind that is endowed with all the bonds of passion, etc.,

original: yud tsam nyid la thang cig tu 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yud tsam nyid la thang cig tu 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: but in an instant, in a moment, becomes free from passion, etc.

original: bag chags kyi rnam par rig pa ni ji ltar las kun tu 'byung ba rnams kyis sems la bag chags bsgo bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: bag chags kyi rnam par rig pa ni ji ltar las kun tu 'byung ba rnams kyis sems la bag chags bsgo bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The consciousness that is the latent impressions is the consciousness that is imprinted with latent impressions by the arising of karma.

original: de las bag chags gzhan pa'ang ma yin la de tsam nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: de las bag chags gzhan pa'ang ma yin la de tsam nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not something other than that, nor is it just that.

original: 'bras bu 'byin pa'ang rim gyis 'byung ba rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byin pa'ang rim gyis 'byung ba rnyed pa'o //
translated: The arising of the result is the discovery of the gradual arising of the latent impressions.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par rig pa ni ji ltar lus rnam pa du mar 'grub pa'i las kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa yod pa dang / de bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus na shin tu mi gsal ba'i tshe 'phral la las kyi bag chags gang yang rung ba zhig sad cing rgyas nas 'gro ba gang yang rung ba zhig tu nyid mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par rig pa ni ji ltar lus rnam pa du mar 'grub pa'i las kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa yod pa dang / de bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus na shin tu mi gsal ba'i tshe 'phral la las kyi bag chags gang yang rung ba zhig sad cing rgyas nas 'gro ba gang yang rung ba zhig tu nyid mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The consciousness that links to rebirth is the consciousness that is imbued with karma that establishes the body in many different ways, and when it is very unclear at the time of death, it is the consciousness that links to rebirth in any of the realms, having awakened and expanded any of the latent impressions of karma.

original: grol ba'i rnam par rig pa ni dgra bcom pa'i sems mchog tu spros pa med pa'i chos nyid thob pa 'khor ba na 'dris pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa'i rnam pa thams cad la yang dag par shin tu 'das pa ste /
analyzed: grol ba'i rnam par rig pa ni dgra bcom pa'i sems mchog tu spros pa med pa'i chos nyid thob pa 'khor ba na 'dris pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa'i rnam pa thams cad la yang dag par shin tu 'das pa ste /
translated: The consciousness of liberation is the mind of the arhat that has attained the ultimate reality free from conceptual elaboration and is completely beyond all the aspects of the conduct of cyclic existence that are associated with the outflows.

original: rnam pa 'dis rnam par gzhag par dka' ba'i phyir 'di phra ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'dis rnam par gzhag par dka' ba'i phyir 'di phra ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is subtle because it is difficult to establish by means of these aspects.

original: mthong ba po la sogs pa smos pas ni mthong ba po dang / nyan pa po dang / smon pa po dang / myong ba po dang / reg pa po dang / rnam par shes pa po zhes bya ba 'di dag bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba po la sogs pa smos pas ni mthong ba po dang / nyan pa po dang / smon pa po dang / myong ba po dang / reg pa po dang / rnam par shes pa po zhes bya ba 'di dag bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The terms ‚Äúone who sees‚Äù and so on should be understood to include ‚Äúone who hears,‚Äù ‚Äúone who perceives,‚Äù ‚Äúone who experiences,‚Äù ‚Äúone who touches,‚Äù and ‚Äúone who knows.‚Äù

original: mngon par shes par bya ba ni mngon par shes pa drug gi yul lo //
analyzed: mngon par shes par bya ba ni mngon par shes pa drug gi yul lo //
translated: The objects of the six forms of supernatural knowledge are called ‚Äúthat which is to be known by means of supernatural knowledge.‚Äù

original: 'gro ba'i bye brag gis rab tu phye ba'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bye brag gis rab tu phye ba'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa ste /
translated: The supernatural knowledge of supernatural power is so called because it is distinguished by the various forms of movement.

original: de'i yul ni kun tu 'gro ba'i phyir mngon par shes par bya ba nyid do /
analyzed: de'i yul ni kun tu 'gro ba'i phyir mngon par shes par bya ba nyid do /
translated: The objects of that are called ‚Äúthat which is to be known by means of supernatural knowledge‚Äù because they are the objects that are to be known by means of supernatural knowledge.

original: rna ba'i mngon par shes pas 'gro ba sna tshogs kyi sgra yang yongs su shes pas na rjes su thos pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba'i mngon par shes pas 'gro ba sna tshogs kyi sgra yang yongs su shes pas na rjes su thos pa'o //
translated: It is the superknowledge of the ear because it is the knowledge of the various sounds of the world.

original: @17a * // spyod pa la 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bcas pa'i sems shes pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'ongs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i tshe rabs gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'ongs pa zhes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @17a * // spyod pa la 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bcas pa'i sems shes pa'i phyir ro // 'ongs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i tshe rabs gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'ongs pa zhes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the knowledge of the mind of another because it is the knowledge of the minds of others that are accompanied by attachment and so on.üîΩIt is the knowledge of the recollection of former lives because it is the knowledge of the succession of lives in the past.

original: 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye bar 'gro ba shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye bar 'gro ba shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the knowledge of death and rebirth because it is the knowledge of the passing on and being reborn in the future.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni khams gsum las nges par thar ba dang / thabs shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni khams gsum las nges par thar ba dang / thabs shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the knowledge of the destruction of the impurities because it is the knowledge of the liberation from the three realms and the knowledge of the means.

original: thams cad kyang mngon par shes par bya ba dag go zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyang tha ma gsum gyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang mngon par shes par bya ba dag go zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyang tha ma gsum gyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All are to be known by the superknowledges because all are the objects of the last three.

original: gzugs ni chos de'i bdag nyid dang ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzugs ni chos de'i bdag nyid dang ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: Form is the nature and essence of that dharma.

original: de'i phyir de gzugs can yin gyi gzugs gzhan dang ldan pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de gzugs can yin gyi gzugs gzhan dang ldan pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is material because it is the basis of the other material elements, but not because it possesses other material elements.

original: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i bar du brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i bar du brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is called the essence of material form.

original: 'byung ba rten du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs gzhan dang ldan pa'i phyir yang gzugs can nyid du ston te /
analyzed: 'byung ba rten du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs gzhan dang ldan pa'i phyir yang gzugs can nyid du ston te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe great elements serve as its support‚Äù shows that it is material because it possesses other material elements.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni 'byung ba'i gzugs dang ldan pa dang / 'byung ba'i gzugs rnams kyang nang phan tshun ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni 'byung ba'i gzugs dang ldan pa dang / 'byung ba'i gzugs rnams kyang nang phan tshun ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Derived form is associated with the materiality of the great elements, and the great elements are mutually associated.

original: dga' ba'i kun 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni dga' ba nyid gang gi kun 'byung ba yin pa de gzugs can yin gyi /
analyzed: dga' ba'i kun 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni dga' ba nyid gang gi kun 'byung ba yin pa de gzugs can yin gyi /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe origin of pleasure‚Äù means that it is material because it is the origin of pleasure.

original: ji ltar tshor ba la sogs pa'i kun 'byung ba ni sngon gyi dga' ba dang / da ltar byung ba'i reg pa la sogs pa yang yin pa lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar tshor ba la sogs pa'i kun 'byung ba ni sngon gyi dga' ba dang / da ltar byung ba'i reg pa la sogs pa yang yin pa lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not like the origin of feeling, etc., which is past pleasure and present contact, etc.

original: phyogs dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni cha shas dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni cha shas dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwith its sides‚Äù means with its parts.

original: yul la khyab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phyogs rnams su lus kyis rgyas pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyul nye bar bstan du rung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phyogs che ge mo zhig na'o zhes bstan par nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul la khyab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phyogs rnams su lus kyis rgyas pa'i phyir ro // yul nye bar bstan du rung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phyogs che ge mo zhig na'o zhes bstan par nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it pervades objects‚Äù means that it extends throughout the directions.üîΩ‚ÄúBecause it can be demonstrated in a place‚Äù means that it can be demonstrated as being in a certain direction.

original: yul spyod yul du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phyogs 'ga' zhig na 'dug par dmigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul spyod yul du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phyogs 'ga' zhig na 'dug par dmigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is the domain of activity of objects‚Äù means that it is perceived as being in a certain place.

original: gnyis spyod yul du 'dzin pa mtshungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sems can gnyis mtshungs par dmigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis spyod yul du 'dzin pa mtshungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sems can gnyis mtshungs par dmigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause two can have it as their domain of activity‚Äù means that two sentient beings can perceive it.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: This is not so for the formless.

original: ji ltar bdag gis myong ba bzhin du gzhan dag gis shes par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gis myong ba bzhin du gzhan dag gis shes par mi nus pa'i phyir ro // 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because others cannot know it as one knows it oneself.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yang brgyud pas gzugs can nyid de /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yang brgyud pas gzugs can nyid de /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of its connection‚Äù means that eye consciousness, etc., are also material, because they are connected with the material sense faculties.

original: dbang po gzugs can dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is related to the material sense faculties.üîΩBecause it is related to the material form of the desire realm, because it is related to the material form of the first two meditative states, and because it is related to the material form of the third meditative state.üîΩBecause it is related to the material form of the fourth meditative state and the immaterial realm.

original: rjes su 'brel pa'i @17b phyir zhes bya ba ni gzugs med par skyes pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams la gzugs kyi sa bon rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'brel pa'i @17b phyir zhes bya ba ni gzugs med par skyes pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams la gzugs kyi sa bon rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is related to the material form of the fourth meditative state, because it is related to the material form of the immaterial realm, and because it is related to the material form of the summit of existence.üîΩBecause it is related to the material form of the desire realm, because it is related to the material form of the first two meditative states, and because it is related to the material form of the third meditative state.

original: rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa rnams dmigs pa la rab tu rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa rnams dmigs pa la rab tu rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is related to the material form of the fourth meditative state and the immaterial realm.üîΩBecause it is related to the material form of the fourth meditative state, because it is related to the material form of the immaterial realm, and because it is related to the material form of the summit of existence.üîΩBecause it is related to the material form of the desire realm, because it is related to the material form of the first two meditative states, and because it is related to the material form of the third meditative state.üîΩBecause it is related to the material form of the fourth meditative state and the immaterial realm.

original: gnod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga po dag la lag pa la sogs pas kun tu reg pa dang / mya ngan la sogs pas ji ltar mthun mthun du gnod par byar rung ba'i phyir te gnod par bya ba yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga po dag la lag pa la sogs pas kun tu reg pa dang / mya ngan la sogs pas ji ltar mthun mthun du gnod par byar rung ba'i phyir te gnod par bya ba yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is related to the material form of the fourth meditative state, because it is related to the material form of the immaterial realm, and because it is related to the material form of the summit of existence.üîΩBecause it is related to the material form of the desire realm, because it is related to the material form of the first two meditative states, and because it is related to the material form of the third meditative state.

original: go bar byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bstan pas don la rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go bar byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bstan pas don la rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is related to the material form of the fourth meditative state and the immaterial realm.üîΩBecause it is related to the material form of the fourth meditative state, because it is related to the material form of the immaterial realm, and because it is related to the material form of the summit of existence.üîΩBecause it is related to the material form of the desire realm, because it is related to the material form of the first two meditative states, and because it is related to the material form of the third meditative state.üîΩBecause it is related to the material form of the fourth meditative state and the immaterial realm.üîΩBecause it is related to the material form of the fourth meditative state,

original: bsags pa rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rdul phra mo las gong ma'i gzugs cha shas dang bcas par rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsags pa rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rdul phra mo las gong ma'i gzugs cha shas dang bcas par rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the establishment of accumulation, because form is established as having parts above the atom.

original: phyi rol du bltas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs 'dod pa'i yon tan la sred pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol du bltas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs 'dod pa'i yon tan la sred pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of looking outward, because form in the desire realm arises from craving the qualities of desire.

original: nang du bltas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzugs na spyod pa'i gzugs de snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems la sred pa las byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: nang du bltas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzugs na spyod pa'i gzugs de snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems la sred pa las byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because of looking inward, because form in the form realm arises from craving the mind of meditative equipoise.

original: de'i phyir 'di yid las byung ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di yid las byung ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that it arises from mind.

original: yun ring ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'i gzugs sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha'i mu rnam par gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yun ring ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'i gzugs sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha'i mu rnam par gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of its long duration, because the form of ordinary beings has no beginning or end.

original: yongs su chad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni slob pa'i gzugs 'khor ba'i mthar phyin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su chad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni slob pa'i gzugs 'khor ba'i mthar phyin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of its termination, because the form of trainees brings samsara to an end.

original: de'i dus kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa'i gzugs da ltar byung ba'i srid pa tsam zhig las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dus kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa'i gzugs da ltar byung ba'i srid pa tsam zhig las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, it is said, ‚Äúbecause of the past,‚Äù because the present form of the non-learner is only the result of existence.

original: nges par ston pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i gzugs ni kun tu ston pa tsam du zad kyi grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par ston pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i gzugs ni kun tu ston pa tsam du zad kyi grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúbecause of the demonstration,‚Äù because the form of the Buddha, etc. is only a demonstration, because it is not established.

original: thams cad kyang gzugs can dag go zhes bya ba ni gnod par bya ba'i gzugs can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang gzugs can dag go zhes bya ba ni gnod par bya ba'i gzugs can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All of them have form, because they have form that is to be harmed.

original: lhag ma rnams ni ci rigs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni ci rigs su rig par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood according to the appropriate method.

original: phyi rol du bltas pa la sogs pa gzugs can gyi rab tu dbye ba drug ni tshor ba la sogs pa dang thun mong bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du bltas pa la sogs pa gzugs can gyi rab tu dbye ba drug ni tshor ba la sogs pa dang thun mong bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The six divisions of form, such as looking outward, etc. should be understood as common to feeling, etc.

original: lhag ma'i rab tu dbye ba ni gzugs can bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs de'i bdag nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba rnam pa thams cad do //
analyzed: lhag ma'i rab tu dbye ba ni gzugs can bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs de'i bdag nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba rnam pa thams cad do //
translated: The remaining divisions are like those of form. All the aspects, such as ‚Äúbecause of the nature of that form,‚Äù are the same.

original: thams cad kyang bstan du yod pa dag go zhes bya ba ni bstan du yod pa dang 'brel ba la sogs pas gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kyang bstan du yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang bstan du yod pa dag go zhes bya ba ni bstan du yod pa dang 'brel ba la sogs pas gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kyang bstan du yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All of them are resistant. This is because the formless constituents are also resistant, since they are related to the resistant.

original: sgrib par byed pa dang @18a * //üîΩbsgrib par bya ba zhes bya ba la /üîΩ'gro ba'i gegs byed pa'i phyir sgrib par byed pa zhes de tsam du bstan pas bsgrib par bya ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gis 'od la sogs pa'i gzugs thogs pa dang bcas par rnam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: sgrib par byed pa dang @18a * // bsgrib par bya ba zhes bya ba la / 'gro ba'i gegs byed pa'i phyir sgrib par byed pa zhes de tsam du bstan pas bsgrib par bya ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gis 'od la sogs pa'i gzugs thogs pa dang bcas par rnam par 'jog ste /
translated: The resistant and the obstructed.üîΩThe term ‚Äúobstructed‚Äù is taught in the sense of ‚Äúthat which obstructs,‚Äù because it is an obstruction to the movement of sentient beings.

original: de ni bsgrib par bya ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni bsgrib par bya ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: The term ‚Äúobstructed‚Äù is used to refer to form such as light, etc., which is resistant, because it is that which is obstructed.

original: sgrib par byed pa ni ma yin no //üîΩ'di ni de'i rigs te /
analyzed: sgrib par byed pa ni ma yin no // 'di ni de'i rigs te /
translated: It is not the obstruction.üîΩThis is its nature.

original: 'di ni ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ni ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is its essential nature.

original: rdul phra rab las gong ma zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab gcig thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab las gong ma zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab gcig thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúabove the atom‚Äù means that the atom is not obstructed.

original: gang ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis ma bsgyur pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang bsgyur ba'i gzugs ni thogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis ma bsgyur pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang bsgyur ba'i gzugs ni thogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Form that is not transformed by the power of concentration is obstructed, because form that is transformed by the power of concentration is unimpeded,

original: sems mnyam pa'i lha bzhin no //
analyzed: sems mnyam pa'i lha bzhin no //
translated: like the form of a god who is of equal status.

original: rab tu 'khrug pa'i gzhi'i gnas ni gnas sam dmigs pa gang la zhe sdang skye ba ste /
analyzed: rab tu 'khrug pa'i gzhi'i gnas ni gnas sam dmigs pa gang la zhe sdang skye ba ste /
translated: The basis of disturbance is the basis or object of anger.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i don 'dis ni thams cad kyang thogs pa dang bcas pa dag go //
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i don 'dis ni thams cad kyang thogs pa dang bcas pa dag go //
translated: All are obstructed by this meaning of obstruction.

original: yang na ci rigs su sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni lhag ma rnams so //üîΩzag pa de'i bdag nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni zag pa rnams zag pa dang bcas pa nyid de /
analyzed: yang na ci rigs su sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni lhag ma rnams so // zag pa de'i bdag nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni zag pa rnams zag pa dang bcas pa nyid de /
translated: Or they are connected as appropriate.üîΩBecause they have the nature of defilements, defilements are associated with defilements,

original: zag pa'i ngo bo nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa'i ngo bo nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they possess the nature of defilements.

original: zag pa dang 'brel ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / mig la sogs pa zag pa dang ldan pa dang / gnas yin pa'i phyir te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: zag pa dang 'brel ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / mig la sogs pa zag pa dang ldan pa dang / gnas yin pa'i phyir te go rims bzhin no //
translated: Because they are the basis means that they are the basis of the contaminants, as appropriate.

original: zag pas bcings pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i dbang gis dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyang yang srid pa 'grub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pas bcings pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i dbang gis dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyang yang srid pa 'grub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are bound by the contaminants means that even the wholesome with-outflows establish a new existence by the power of the contaminants.

original: zag pa'i rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sa pa gzhan rnams kyang sa pa gzhan gyi zag pa'i gnas ngan len dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa'i rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sa pa gzhan rnams kyang sa pa gzhan gyi zag pa'i gnas ngan len dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are related to the contaminants means that even the other stages possess the negative reflex action of the contaminants of other stages.

original: zag pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len dang ldan du zin kyang zag pa med pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zag pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len dang ldan du zin kyang zag pa med pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are in conformity with the contaminants means that even though the factors that contribute to enlightenment possess the negative reflex action of the mental afflictions, they are still determined to be uncontaminated.

original: srid pa thams cad la rgyab kyis bltas pa'i phyir dang / de'i gnyen po la bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa thams cad la rgyab kyis bltas pa'i phyir dang / de'i gnyen po la bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they turn their back on all existence and because they are the antidote to that.

original: zag pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa rnams kyi phung po rnams tshe rabs snga ma'i nyon mongs pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa rnams kyi phung po rnams tshe rabs snga ma'i nyon mongs pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they arise from the cause of the contaminants means that the aggregates of the arhats arise from the afflictions of previous lives.

original: khams bco lnga ni tha ma gsum ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: khams bco lnga ni tha ma gsum ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The fifteen elements are the last three elements.

original: skye mched bcu ni tha ma gnyis ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched bcu ni tha ma gnyis ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The ten sense bases are the last two sense bases.

original: khams @18b gsum dang skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs ni 'phags pa'i lam 'khor dang bcas pa dang 'dus ma byas ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: khams @18b gsum dang skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs ni 'phags pa'i lam 'khor dang bcas pa dang 'dus ma byas ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The part of the three elements and two sense bases is the noble path together with its retinue and unconditioned phenomena.

original: mtshon cha len pa la sogs pa ni 'thab pa ste /
analyzed: mtshon cha len pa la sogs pa ni 'thab pa ste /
translated: Taking up weapons and so on is fighting.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni rgyu yin pas 'thab pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni rgyu yin pas 'thab pa'o //
translated: Attachment and so on are the cause of fighting.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa ji snyed pa 'thab pa dang bcas pa'ang de snyed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de'i rjes su 'brel par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa ji snyed pa 'thab pa dang bcas pa'ang de snyed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de'i rjes su 'brel par rig par bya'o //
translated: As much as is contaminated is also that much that is associated with conflict and so on. This should be understood as the corresponding connection.

original: yang srid pa la lhag par chags pa'i rgyu nyid de /
analyzed: yang srid pa la lhag par chags pa'i rgyu nyid de /
translated: It is the cause of attachment to existence itself.

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos la zhe sdang bas srid pa la lhag par chags pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos la zhe sdang bas srid pa la lhag par chags pa'i phyir ro /
translated: It is aversion to the factors of purification, because of attachment to existence.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la lhag par chags pa'i rgyu yin pas zhe na pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la lhag par chags pa'i rgyu yin pas zhe na pa'o //
translated: It is aversion because it is the cause of attachment to the five sense pleasures.

original: zhe sdang ci 'dra ba zhig gis de la lhag par chags shen /
analyzed: zhe sdang ci 'dra ba zhig gis de la lhag par chags shen /
translated: What kind of aversion is it that is attached to that?

original: mngon bar 'byung ba la zhe sdang bas so //üîΩ'dod pa bzhin du byed pas mngon du phyogs pa dang rgyab kyis lta ba ni 'dus ma byas la mi srid de /
analyzed: mngon bar 'byung ba la zhe sdang bas so // 'dod pa bzhin du byed pas mngon du phyogs pa dang rgyab kyis lta ba ni 'dus ma byas la mi srid de /
translated: It is aversion to renunciation.

original: rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The qualities of being directed toward and turning away from are not possible in the unconditioned because it is permanent.üîΩNor is it possible in the conditioned because it is impermanent.

original: 'dus byas kyang ma yin 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin pa ni 'di gnyis las gud na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyang ma yin 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin pa ni 'di gnyis las gud na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it possible in neither the conditioned nor the unconditioned because it does not exist apart from those two.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba ni 'di gnyis so zhes gang gsungs pa de ji ltar gnyis kho nar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba ni 'di gnyis so zhes gang gsungs pa de ji ltar gnyis kho nar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThe conditioned and the unconditioned are just these two.‚Äù How can it be just those two?

original: 'dod pa bzhin du byed pas mngon du phyogs pa dang rgyab kyis lta ba'i phyir 'dus byas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa bzhin du byed pas mngon du phyogs pa dang rgyab kyis lta ba'i phyir 'dus byas zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called conditioned because it is directed towards and turned away from in accordance with desire.

original: las dang nyon mongs pas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called unconditioned because it is not directly produced by karma and moral defilement.

original: gnyis las gud na med do //
analyzed: gnyis las gud na med do //
translated: It is not apart from the two.

original: de ltar snang ba zhes bya ba ni khams gsum par gtogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar snang ba zhes bya ba ni khams gsum par gtogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The appearance as that is the aspect included within the three world realms.

original: de bzhin nyid la sogs par snang ba ni gcig tu ma 'dris pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la sogs par snang ba ni gcig tu ma 'dris pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: The appearance as thusness etc. is supramundane because it is not familiar in the one sense.

original: phung po rnams kyi phyogs gcig ces bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa dang / rjes las thob pa 'jig rten las 'das par snang ba ma gtogs pa'o //üîΩde dag dang 'dus ma byas ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi phyogs gcig ces bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa dang / rjes las thob pa 'jig rten las 'das par snang ba ma gtogs pa'o // de dag dang 'dus ma byas ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: One part of the aggregates is that part which is included within the correct path and is supramundane appearance that is obtained subsequently.üîΩThe unconditioned should be regarded as being excluded from both of these and from the unconditioned.

original: de dag dang 'dus ma byas ma gtogs ba ni khams gsum dang skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag dang 'dus ma byas ma gtogs ba ni khams gsum dang skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs su blta bar bya'o //
translated: The unconditioned should be regarded as being excluded from both of these and from the unconditioned.

original: khams gsum pa'i gnyen po zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i gnyen po zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam mo //
translated: The antidote to the three realms is the noble path.

original: de yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i phyin ci log bzhi'i gnyen po yin pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i phyin ci log bzhi'i gnyen po yin pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: Moreover, that is supramundane for the ≈õrƒÅvaka and pratyekabuddha, since it is the antidote to the four errors such as permanence, etc.

original: phyin ci log tu rnam par mi rtog pas rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu rnam par mi rtog pas rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: It is nonconceptual because it is free from the error of conceptualization.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni /üîΩgzugs la sogs pa spros pa'i chos thams cad kyi @19a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni / gzugs la sogs pa spros pa'i chos thams cad kyi @19a * //
translated: For the bodhisattva,

original: gnyen po yin pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen po yin pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: it is supramundane because it is the antidote to all the phenomena of conceptual elaboration such as form, etc.

original: spros pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pas rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: spros pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pas rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: It is nonconceptual because it is free from the conceptualization of conceptual elaboration.

original: 'dus ma byas ni rtog pa thams cad kyi gzhi'i gnas ma yin pas rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni rtog pa thams cad kyi gzhi'i gnas ma yin pas rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: The unconditioned is nonconceptual because it is not the basis for any conceptualization.

original: dang po byung ba ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i dus na'o //
analyzed: dang po byung ba ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i dus na'o //
translated: The first occurrence is at the time of rebirth-linking.

original: rgyun gyis byung ba ni de'i phyin chad do //
analyzed: rgyun gyis byung ba ni de'i phyin chad do //
translated: The occurrence by continuity is after that.

original: rgyas pa las byung ba ni nyal ba dang / zas dang / tshangs par spyod pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rgyas pa rnam pa bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba ni nyal ba dang / zas dang / tshangs par spyod pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rgyas pa rnam pa bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: That which arises from development is the cause of the four developments: sleep, food, celibacy, and meditative concentration.

original: rten 'byung ba ni nang gi dbang po'o //
analyzed: rten 'byung ba ni nang gi dbang po'o //
translated: That which arises from support is the internal sense faculties.

original: 'gyur ba byung ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba byung ban de dang mthun par dbang po 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba byung ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba byung ban de dang mthun par dbang po 'gyur ba'o //
translated: That which arises from change is the change of the sense faculties in accordance with the arising of feelings such as pleasure.

original: yongs su smin par byung ba ni rgas pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: yongs su smin par byung ba ni rgas pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: That which arises from maturation is the stage of old age.

original: nyams par byung ba ni bde 'gro nas shi 'phos te ngan 'gror skye ba'o //
analyzed: nyams par byung ba ni bde 'gro nas shi 'phos te ngan 'gror skye ba'o //
translated: That which arises from deterioration is the birth in an evil destiny after death in a good destiny.

original: khyad par du byung ba ni de las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par du byung ba ni de las bzlog pa'o //
translated: That which arises from distinction is the opposite of that.

original: 'od gsal bar byung ba ni rtse bas rab tu slu ba rnams dang / yid rab tu sun 'byin pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang // gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams dga' ba mang ba dang /
analyzed: 'od gsal bar byung ba ni rtse bas rab tu slu ba rnams dang / yid rab tu sun 'byin pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang // gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams dga' ba mang ba dang /
translated: Those who arise in a luminous heaven are those who are deceived by play, those who are disgusted, those who delight in magical creations, those who control the magical creations of others, and those gods who enjoy the heavens of the form and formless realms.

original: longs spyod pa dang gnas la rang gis dbang bsgyur pa'i phyir te ci rigs su sbyor ro //
analyzed: longs spyod pa dang gnas la rang gis dbang bsgyur pa'i phyir te ci rigs su sbyor ro //
translated: They are so called because they have mastery over their own enjoyments and abodes, as is appropriate.

original: 'od gsal ba ma yin par byung ba ni de las gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba ma yin par byung ba ni de las gzhan pa'o //
translated: Those who arise in a non-luminous heaven are those other than those.

original: kun tu 'gro bar byung ba ni 'gro ba'i dus na'o //üîΩsa bon dang bcas par byung ba ni dgra bcom pa'i tha ma'i phung po ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu 'gro bar byung ba ni 'gro ba'i dus na'o // sa bon dang bcas par byung ba ni dgra bcom pa'i tha ma'i phung po ma gtogs pa'o //
