translated: Those who arise in a universal heaven are those who are born in the heavens of the desire realm.üîΩThose who arise with seeds are all those except for the final aggregates of an arhat.

original: sa bon ma yin par byung ba ni phung po tha ma pa rnams so //
analyzed: sa bon ma yin par byung ba ni phung po tha ma pa rnams so //
translated: Those who arise without seeds are the final aggregates of an arhat.

original: gzugs brnyan dang dbang 'byor ba dang / nges par bstan pa'i phyir byung ba ni shes bya'i dngos po dang mthun pa dang / rnam par thar ba las gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan dang dbang 'byor ba dang / nges par bstan pa'i phyir byung ba ni shes bya'i dngos po dang mthun pa dang / rnam par thar ba las gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs te go rims bzhin no //
translated: The arising of the reflection, the arising of mastery, and the arising of the teaching are, respectively, the arising of the thing that is known, the arising of the liberation, and the arising of the form of the Tathagata.

original: gcig nas gcig tu byung ba tshe rabs kyi rgyun no //
analyzed: gcig nas gcig tu byung ba tshe rabs kyi rgyun no //
translated: The arising of the continuum is the arising of the series of lives.

original: skad cig gcig nas byung ba ni 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid skad cig so so'i'o //
analyzed: skad cig gcig nas byung ba ni 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid skad cig so so'i'o //
translated: The arising of the moment is the arising of the characteristics of the moment of the formations.

original: phrad pa dang bral nas byung ba ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang bral ba'i dus dang / sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dus na'o //
analyzed: phrad pa dang bral nas byung ba ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang bral ba'i dus dang / sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dus na'o //
translated: The arising of the separation from contact is the arising of the time of separation from contact with the agreeable and disagreeable, and the arising of the time of the mind being free from passion and not free from passion.

original: gnas skabs gzhan du byung ba ni mer mer bo la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams dang / nad la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams su'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan du byung ba ni mer mer bo la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams dang / nad la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams su'o //
translated: The arising of the other state is the arising of the states of kalala, etc., and the arising of the states of disease, etc.

original: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye bar byung ba ni sems can gyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye bar byung ba ni sems can gyi 'jig rten no //
translated: The arising of death and birth is the arising of the world of sentient beings.

original: @19b 'jig pa dang chags par byung ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: @19b 'jig pa dang chags par byung ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten no //
translated: The world of the container is the world of the container that is created and destroyed.

original: sngon gyi dus na byung ba ni sngon gyi dus kyi srid pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi dus na byung ba ni sngon gyi dus kyi srid pa'o //
translated: The existence of the past is the existence of the past time.

original: 'chi ba'i dus na byung ba ni 'chi ba'i srid pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus na byung ba ni 'chi ba'i srid pa'o //
translated: The existence at the time of death is the existence at the time of death.

original: bar du byung ba ni bar ma do'i srid pa'o //
analyzed: bar du byung ba ni bar ma do'i srid pa'o //
translated: The intermediate existence is the existence in the intermediate state.

original: nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i dus na byung ba ni skye ba'i srid pa'o //üîΩgzugs dang 'du byed kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig ces bya ba ni dbang po'i mtshan nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i mtshan nyid de go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i dus na byung ba ni skye ba'i srid pa'o // gzugs dang 'du byed kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig ces bya ba ni dbang po'i mtshan nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i mtshan nyid de go rims bzhin no //
translated: The existence at conception is the existence at the time of rebirth-linking.üîΩThe form aggregate and one part of the formations aggregate are, respectively, the aggregate of form and one part of the formations aggregate that are the characteristics of the faculties and the characteristics of concomitance.

original: chos kyi khams dang skye mched kyi phyogs gcig go zhes bya ba ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi khams dang skye mched kyi phyogs gcig go zhes bya ba ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: One part of the element of mental objects and the sense-field of mental objects are, respectively, one part of the element of mental objects and the sense-field of mental objects that are the nature of concomitance.

original: za ba po ni bdag ste 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i yul rnams la dmigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: za ba po ni bdag ste 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i yul rnams la dmigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The experiencer is the self, which should be understood as the object of desire and aversion.

original: ma phrad par 'dzin pa ni mig dang rna ba dang yid do //
analyzed: ma phrad par 'dzin pa ni mig dang rna ba dang yid do //
translated: The non-contacting grasper is the eye, ear, and mind.

original: phrad nas 'dzin pa ni de las gzhan pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: phrad nas 'dzin pa ni de las gzhan pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The apprehension of the object through contact is the other sense faculties.

original: da ltar gyi rang gi mtshan nyid so so ba yul so sor nges pa 'dzin pa ni dbang po lnga las byung ba'o //
analyzed: da ltar gyi rang gi mtshan nyid so so ba yul so sor nges pa 'dzin pa ni dbang po lnga las byung ba'o //
translated: The apprehension of the present, of its own particular characteristic, and of the object as determined by the sense faculty is the apprehension that arises from the five sense faculties.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dus thams cad pa'i yul thams cad 'dzin pa ni dbang po drug las byung pa'o //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dus thams cad pa'i yul thams cad 'dzin pa ni dbang po drug las byung pa'o //
translated: The apprehension of the universal characteristic, of all times, and of all objects is the apprehension that arises from the sixth sense faculty.

original: rkyen tshogs nas rnam par shes pa las byung ba'i dbang du byas te btags nas 'dzin pa'i nye bar 'dogs par rig par bya ba'i yang dag pa'i don du na chos rnams byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen tshogs nas rnam par shes pa las byung ba'i dbang du byas te btags nas 'dzin pa'i nye bar 'dogs par rig par bya ba'i yang dag pa'i don du na chos rnams byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The apprehension that is designated as arising from the collection of conditions and consciousness should be understood as a designation of apprehension, because in reality, dharmas are without activity.

original: 'dzin pa gang yin pa gzung ba yang de yin no zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa yang yid kyi rnam par shes pas gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa gang yin pa gzung ba yang de yin no zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa yang yid kyi rnam par shes pas gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is the apprehension is also the object of apprehension, because the eye, etc., are also apprehended by the mental consciousness.

original: 'dzin pa'i spyod yul nyid ces bsnan pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i spyod yul nyid ces bsnan pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The addition of the phrase ‚Äúthe domain of apprehension‚Äù is to exclude mind and mental factors.

original: thos pa las byung ba dang / bsam ba las byung ba dang / de'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pas yongs su bsdus pa ni phyi rol tu bltas pa ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba dang / bsam ba las byung ba dang / de'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pas yongs su bsdus pa ni phyi rol tu bltas pa ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: That which is included in the Dharma that is in conformity with that is not turned outward.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i chos kyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i chos kyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises from the cause of the Dharma that is in conformity with that.

original: de'i dbang gis mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa la dmigs par blta'o //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa la dmigs par blta'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is turned inward because it has as its object nirvƒÅ·πáa, etc.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i chos ni sangs rgyas la sogs pas thugs su chud pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i brtan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i chos ni sangs rgyas la sogs pas thugs su chud pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i brtan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The Dharma that arises from the cause of the Dharma that is in conformity with that should be understood as the stable Dharma that arises from the cause of the realization of the Buddhas, etc.

original: khams bzhi ni sna'i rnams par shes pa'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / ro'i khams so //
analyzed: khams bzhi ni sna'i rnams par shes pa'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / ro'i khams so //
translated: The four elements are the nose consciousness element, the tongue consciousness element, the smell object element, and the taste object element.

original: skye mched gnyis ni dri dang ro'i skye mched do //
analyzed: skye mched gnyis ni dri dang ro'i skye mched do //
translated: The two sense bases are the smell sense base and the taste sense base.

original: de las gzhan pa dag gi phyogs gcig ni gang 'dod pa'i khams su bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag gi phyogs gcig ni gang 'dod pa'i khams su bsdus pa'o //
translated: One part of the rest is that which is included in the desire realm.

original: khams bcu zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i khams bdun dang / gzugs @20a * //üîΩdang sgra dang chos kyi khams so //
analyzed: khams bcu zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i khams bdun dang / gzugs @20a * // dang sgra dang chos kyi khams so //
translated: The ten elements are the seven elements of consciousness, the form element, the sound element, and the entity element.

original: skye mched bzhi ni gzugs dang sgra dang yid dang chos kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: skye mched bzhi ni gzugs dang sgra dang yid dang chos kyi skye mched do //
translated: The four sense bases are the form sense base, the sound sense base, the mind sense base, and the entity sense base.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu spyad zin dang zhes bya ba ni skyes zin pa dang / 'gags zin pa'i phyir te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu spyad zin dang zhes bya ba ni skyes zin pa dang / 'gags zin pa'i phyir te go rims bzhin no //
translated: The cause and effect have been used up means that they have already arisen and have already ceased, respectively.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar byed pa yang dag pa shin tu 'das pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa bzhin du sems kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /üîΩrnam par byang bar byed pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar byed pa yang dag pa shin tu 'das pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa bzhin du sems kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar byed pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of affliction and purification is completely transcended means that, like present attachment and so on and faith and so on, the mind lacks the power to be afflicted and purified.

original: rgyu yongs su bzung nas zhig zhes bya ba ni bag chags gzhan nas zhig pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: rgyu yongs su bzung nas zhig zhes bya ba ni bag chags gzhan nas zhig pa'i phyir ro//
translated: The cause is completely destroyed means that the latent states are completely destroyed.

original: 'bras bu dang rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba na di ltar gyi dus na des bskyed pa'i bag chags yod pa dang / de 'jog par byed pa'i rdzas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba na di ltar gyi dus na des bskyed pa'i bag chags yod pa dang / de 'jog par byed pa'i rdzas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe existence and non-existence of results and their own characteristics‚Äù means that at that time, the habitual tendencies produced by them exist, but the substances that establish them do not exist.

original: dran pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i mtshan ma la sogs pa ni mtshan ma ni dmigs pa tsam du yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i mtshan ma la sogs pa ni mtshan ma ni dmigs pa tsam du yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: The signs of conceptualized memory, etc. should be known as merely existing as objects.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig ces bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / 'dus ma byas ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig ces bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / 'dus ma byas ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne part of all‚Äù means excluding the future, the present, and the unconditioned.

original: rgyu yod kyang ma byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas las bye brag tu dbye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu yod kyang ma byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas las bye brag tu dbye ba'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúAlthough the cause exists, it does not arise‚Äù is for the purpose of distinguishing from the unconditioned.

original: de ni ma byung la rgyu dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma byung la rgyu dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: That is non-arisen and also not endowed with a cause.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ma thob pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ma thob pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúNot having obtained its own characteristic‚Äù

original: rang bzhin gyis ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is because it is not established by nature.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu ma spyad pa ni de'i sa bon gyi bya ba ma byas pa dang / de 'ang ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu ma spyad pa ni de'i sa bon gyi bya ba ma byas pa dang / de 'ang ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which has not yet performed its function as cause and effect has not yet performed the action of its seed, and that has not yet arisen.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu spyad zin pa dang spyad ma zin pa zhes bya ba ni yang mi 'grub pa dang yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'das pa dang ma 'ongs par rab tu gzhag pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba la brten te //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu spyad zin pa dang spyad ma zin pa zhes bya ba ni yang mi 'grub pa dang yod pa'i phyir ro // 'das pa dang ma 'ongs par rab tu gzhag pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba la brten te //
translated: That which has already performed its function as cause and effect is not established again, because it exists.üîΩThe cause of the designation of the past and future is the present.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs par btags pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs par btags pa'i phyir te //
translated: Because the past and future are designated in dependence on the present.

original: gang de'i gnas skabs thob par 'gyur ba de ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang de'i gnas skabs thob par 'gyur ba de ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
translated: That which has not yet obtained that state is future.

original: gang thob zin pa de ni 'das pa'o //
analyzed: gang thob zin pa de ni 'das pa'o //
translated: That which has already obtained it is past.

original: byed pa nye bar gnas pas kyang zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa'i gnas la sogs par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa nye bar gnas pas kyang zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa'i gnas la sogs par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, because the activity is present, the eye, etc. exist as the basis of consciousness, etc.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa bshad pa'i skabs kyis 'di'ang ston te //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa bshad pa'i skabs kyis 'di'ang ston te //
translated: This is also taught by the context of the explanation of the past, etc.

original: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'das pa la sogs pa gsum po nyid gtam gyi gzhir gtam gzhir rnam par gzhag gi mya ngan las 'das pa ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'das pa la sogs pa gsum po nyid gtam gyi gzhir gtam gzhir rnam par gzhag gi mya ngan las 'das pa ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why did the Lord establish only the three times, past, etc., as topics of conversation, and not nirvana?

original: mya ngan las 'da' ba ni so so rang gi rig par bya ba dang / brjod du med pa nyid kyi phyir te /üîΩbrjod par mu nus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' ba ni so so rang gi rig par bya ba dang / brjod du med pa nyid kyi phyir te / brjod par mu nus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because nirvana is to be personally experienced and inexpressible.

original: @20b byung ba dang 'byung ba dang da ltar ni mthong ba dang thos pa dang bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i tha snyad rnams kyi gnas ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @20b byung ba dang 'byung ba dang da ltar ni mthong ba dang thos pa dang bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i tha snyad rnams kyi gnas ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúcannot be expressed‚Äù is that it is not a basis for the conventions of seeing, hearing, distinguishing, and cognizing, because it is not a basis for the conventions of seeing, hearing, distinguishing, and cognizing.

original: khams bcu zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / gzugs dang sgra dang chos kyi khams so //
analyzed: khams bcu zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / gzugs dang sgra dang chos kyi khams so //
translated: The ten elements are the elements of visual consciousness, etc., the element of form, the element of sound, and the element of mental objects.

original: skye mched bzhi zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang sgra dang yid dang chos kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: skye mched bzhi zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang sgra dang yid dang chos kyi skye mched do //
translated: The four spheres are the spheres of form, sound, mind, and mental objects.

original: de dag nyid la zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid la zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those very elements are the elements of faith, etc.

original: rang bzhin gyis so sor ma brtags par zhes bya ba ni rang gi dang gis te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis so sor ma brtags par zhes bya ba ni rang gi dang gis te /
translated: By nature means spontaneously,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa'i stobs kyis ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa'i stobs kyis ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: not by the power of spiritual benefactors and so on.

original: 'dod pa kun tu gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni skye bas thob pa'i 'dod pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi //
analyzed: 'dod pa kun tu gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni skye bas thob pa'i 'dod pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi //
translated: The phrase abiding in all desires means not only in the desires obtained by birth,

original: dad pa la sogs pa dang lhan cig tu'o //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa dang lhan cig tu'o //
translated: but also in those that are cultivated.

original: dge ba sgom pa'o zhes bya ba ni thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa thams cad dge ba'i chos rnams su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba sgom pa'o zhes bya ba ni thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa thams cad dge ba'i chos rnams su rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase cultivating virtue means that all virtues, such as those derived from listening, are to be known as virtues.

original: mtho ris dang phyug po'i rigs su skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa gnyis kyis ni mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu ston to //
analyzed: mtho ris dang phyug po'i rigs su skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa gnyis kyis ni mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu ston to //
translated: The two perfections of taking birth in a high caste and in a wealthy family show the cause of high station.

original: rnam par byang ba'i rjes su mthun pa yongs su 'dzin pas ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rgyu ston to //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i rjes su mthun pa yongs su 'dzin pas ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rgyu ston to //
translated: The perfection of taking birth in a place that is suitable for spiritual practice shows the cause of attaining nirvana.

original: rnam par sun 'byin pa'i gnyen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ni 'og nas 'chad do //
analyzed: rnam par sun 'byin pa'i gnyen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ni 'og nas 'chad do //
translated: The antidote of suppression and the others will be explained later.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?üîΩThe counteragent of detestable

original: de la rnam par sun 'byin pa'i gnyen po ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'dus byas rnams la nyes dmigs su lta ba ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par sun 'byin pa'i gnyen po ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'dus byas rnams la nyes dmigs su lta ba ste /
translated: ness is the view of the disquieting nature of all conditioned states that are accompanied by impurity.

original: des nang dang 'bras la sogs pa'i rnam pas nye bar len pa'i phung po sun 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des nang dang 'bras la sogs pa'i rnam pas nye bar len pa'i phung po sun 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is so called because it detests the appropriated aggregates through the aspects of being internal, being a result, and so on.

original: spong ba'i gnyen po zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang de ma thag pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: spong ba'i gnyen po zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang de ma thag pa'i lam ste /
translated: The counteragent of abandonment is the path of application and the uninterrupted path.

original: de dag gis nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is so called because it abandons the afflictions.

original: gzhi'i gnyen po ni rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams te /
analyzed: gzhi'i gnyen po ni rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams te /
translated: The counteragent of the basis is the liberated path.

original: de dag gis spong ba'i thob pa kun tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis spong ba'i thob pa kun tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is so called because it maintains the obtainment of abandonment.

original: thag bsring ba'i gnyen po zhes bya ba ni de'i gong ma'i lam ste /
analyzed: thag bsring ba'i gnyen po zhes bya ba ni de'i gong ma'i lam ste /
translated: The counteragent of distance is the path that is higher than that.

original: de sngar spangs pa'i nyon mongs pa thag bsring ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de sngar spangs pa'i nyon mongs pa thag bsring ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is so called because it distances one from the previously abandoned afflictions.

original: de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rang 'khrungs ma yin pa gang yin pa dang / rang 'khrungs las ni nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong ba gang yin pa de mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rang 'khrungs ma yin pa gang yin pa dang / rang 'khrungs las ni nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong ba gang yin pa de mi dge ba'o //
translated: The other afflictions, secondary afflictions, and the instigation of misdeeds are nonvirtuous.

original: de las gzhan pa ni bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan par rig par bya'o //üîΩ'tshe ba sngon du btang nas gang du lug dang ma he la sogs pa gsod pa dang / lta ba ngan pa sngon du btang nas bsod @21a * //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan par rig par bya'o // 'tshe ba sngon du btang nas gang du lug dang ma he la sogs pa gsod pa dang / lta ba ngan pa sngon du btang nas bsod @21a * //
translated: The other is known as obscured neutral.

original: nams 'dod pa dang / mchog 'dod pa'i phyir gang du zas mi za ba la sogs pas nyon mongs pa der lha rten byed pa'o //
analyzed: nams 'dod pa dang / mchog 'dod pa'i phyir gang du zas mi za ba la sogs pas nyon mongs pa der lha rten byed pa'o //
translated: In a place where sheep, goats, etc. are killed after being led to slaughter, and in a place where a caitya is made for the sake of merit or for the sake of a boon after being led to a bad view, fasting, etc.

original: 'phen pa'am yongs su rdzogs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni ngan 'gro'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'phen pa'am yongs su rdzogs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni ngan 'gro'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: are the instigation or completion of misdeeds.üîΩThe instigation or completion of misdeeds is from the perspective of bad destinies.

original: bde 'gror ni yongs su rdzogs par byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: bde 'gror ni yongs su rdzogs par byed pa nyid de /
translated: In the happy realms, it is the completion of the wholesome.

original: gang gis 'dir skyes nas dbul ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal myong ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis 'dir skyes nas dbul ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal myong ba'o //
translated: For, having been born there, one experiences the suffering of poverty, etc.

original: dge ba'i bar chad byed pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad par tshogs kyi nang du 'du ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bar chad byed pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad par tshogs kyi nang du 'du ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Dharma that obstructs the wholesome is that which prevents the wholesome from arising.

original: khams brgyad ces bya ba ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / dri dang / ro dang reg bya'i khams so //
analyzed: khams brgyad ces bya ba ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / dri dang / ro dang reg bya'i khams so //
translated: The eight elements are the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, form, sound, and tangible-object elements.

original: skye mched brgyad ces bya ba ni de dag nyid do //
analyzed: skye mched brgyad ces bya ba ni de dag nyid do //
translated: The eight sense bases are the same as the above.

original: sdang ba yang ma yin dang ba yang ma yin pa'i sems su gyur pa zhes bya bas ni dge ba dang mi dge ba las bzlog pa ston to //üîΩde dag nyid kyis yongs su zin pa zhes bya ba ni de'i rnam pa yid la brjod pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdang ba yang ma yin dang ba yang ma yin pa'i sems su gyur pa zhes bya bas ni dge ba dang mi dge ba las bzlog pa ston to // de dag nyid kyis yongs su zin pa zhes bya ba ni de'i rnam pa yid la brjod pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwith a mind that is neither hostile nor clear‚Äù indicates the opposite of virtuous and nonvirtuous.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthey are embraced by those very ones‚Äù means that they are embraced by the mental consciousness.

original: de dag nyid brjod pa'i bag chags so //
analyzed: de dag nyid brjod pa'i bag chags so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe latent impressions of their expression‚Äù means that they are the seeds of the mental consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba ni ming gi tshogs la sogs pas phyi ma la mngon bar brjod pa 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ming gi tshogs la sogs pas phyi ma la mngon bar brjod pa 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The collection of names, etc.

original: sems la bag chags bsgos pa'o //
analyzed: sems la bag chags bsgos pa'o //
translated: are the latent impressions of the mind, because they cause the subsequent occurrence of verbal expressions.

original: de dag gis yongs su zin pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyis gang kun nas slong ba'o zhes bya ba ni sdang ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: de dag gis yongs su zin pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyis gang kun nas slong ba'o zhes bya ba ni sdang ba yang ma yin /
translated: The mind and mental factors that are associated with them are the motivating force, because they are the motivating force of the actions of body and speech.

original: dang ba yang ma yin pa'i sems su gyur pa'i ming la sogs pa mngon bar brjod pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis kun nas slong ba'o //
analyzed: dang ba yang ma yin pa'i sems su gyur pa'i ming la sogs pa mngon bar brjod pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis kun nas slong ba'o //
translated: The mind and mental factors that are associated with the collection of names, etc.üîΩare the motivating force of the actions of body and speech, because they are the motivating force of the actions of body and speech.

original: nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin dge ba yang ma yin pa'i sems dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /üîΩgal te nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin dge ba yang ma yin pa'i sems dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni / gal te nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin la /
translated: The mind that is neither afflicted nor virtuous is the motivating force.üîΩIf the mind is neither afflicted nor virtuous,

original: dge ba yang ma yin pa'i sems su gyur na /
analyzed: dge ba yang ma yin pa'i sems su gyur na /
translated: then it is neither afflicted nor virtuous.

original: de'i phyir spyod lam la sogs pa lung du ma bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir spyod lam la sogs pa lung du ma bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the indeterminate actions of deportment, etc.

original: gzhan du na dge ba'am mi dge bar 'gyur te ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na dge ba'am mi dge bar 'gyur te ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: are neither virtuous nor nonvirtuous, as is appropriate.

original: 'di lta ste so sor brtags pa ma yin pa la zhes bya ba ni dge ba las bye brag tu 'byed do //
analyzed: 'di lta ste so sor brtags pa ma yin pa la zhes bya ba ni dge ba las bye brag tu 'byed do //
translated: The phrase with a non-defiled mind distinguishes this from the unwholesome mental activity.üîΩThe phrase that is, through the possession of a body distinguishes this from the indeterminate mental activity that is related to deportment, since the latter is not related to the possession of a body.üîΩThe phrase that is, through the possession of a body distinguishes this from the indeterminate mental activity that is related to skill in the arts, since the latter is related to the possession of a body that is formed by the imprints of the repeated practice of the arts.üîΩThe phrase that is, through the possession of a body distinguishes this from the indeterminate mental activity that is related to the attainment of meditative concentration, since the latter is not related to the possession of a body.üîΩThe phrase that is, through the possession of a body distinguishes this from the indeterminate mental activity that is related to the attainment of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, since the latter is not related to the possession of a body.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyis zhes bya bas ni /üîΩmi dge ba las bye brag tu 'byed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyis zhes bya bas ni / mi dge ba las bye brag tu 'byed do //
translated: The phrase that is, through the possession of a body distinguishes this from the indeterminate mental activity that is related to the attainment of the cessation of ideation and feeling, since the latter is not related to the possession of a body.üîΩThe phrase that is, through the possession of a body distinguishes this from the indeterminate mental activity that is related to the attainment of the base of infinite space, since the latter is not related to the possession of a body.

original: yongs su 'dzin pas lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba ni bzo'i gnas la goms pa'i bag chags kyis de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩso sor ma brtags pas sman bsten ba zhes bya bas ni nad kyi gnyen pos nad med par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pas lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba ni bzo'i gnas la goms pa'i bag chags kyis de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro // so sor ma brtags pas sman bsten ba zhes bya bas ni nad kyi gnyen pos nad med par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase that is, through the possession of a body distinguishes this from the indeterminate mental activity that is related to the attainment of the base of infinite consciousness, since the latter is not related to the possession of a body.üîΩThe phrase that is, through the possession of a body distinguishes this from the indeterminate mental activity that is related to the attainment of the base of nothingness, since the latter is not related to the possession of a body.

original: rgyu mthun pas lung du @21b ma bstan pa gang zhe na sprul pa'i sems dang lhan cig skyes pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba gang gis rtse ba'i phyir sprul pa sprul pa ste /üîΩsems can la phan pa'i phyir na ni dge bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pas lung du @21b ma bstan pa gang zhe na sprul pa'i sems dang lhan cig skyes pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba gang gis rtse ba'i phyir sprul pa sprul pa ste /üîΩsems can la phan pa'i phyir na ni dge bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase that is, through the possession of a body distinguishes this from the indeterminate mental activity that is related to the attainment of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, since the latter is not related to the possession of a body.

original: bstan pas kyang dge ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: bstan pas kyang dge ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: And by teaching, he manifests virtue, etc.

original: gang sangs rgyas la sogs pas 'dul ba'i don gyi dbang gi phyir kun tu ston pa'o //
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas la sogs pas 'dul ba'i don gyi dbang gi phyir kun tu ston pa'o //
translated: He manifests for the sake of those to be trained by the Buddhas, etc.

original: mi dge bar ji ltar kun tu ston ce na /
analyzed: mi dge bar ji ltar kun tu ston ce na /
translated: How does he manifest nonvirtue?

original: chom rkun la sogs par sprul nas de las gzhan pa'i sems can 'jigs par bya ba'i phyir lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / mgo gcod pa la sogs pa kun tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chom rkun la sogs par sprul nas de las gzhan pa'i sems can 'jigs par bya ba'i phyir lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / mgo gcod pa la sogs pa kun tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having emanated as a thief, etc., he manifests the cutting off of hands, feet, head, etc., in order to frighten other sentient beings.

original: 'dod chags dang ma 'brel ba zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma 'brel ba zhes bya ba ni //
translated: He manifests nonattachment.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyi phyogs tsam dang yang mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyi phyogs tsam dang yang mi ldan pa ste /
translated: He does not even possess a mere semblance of nonattachment,

original: ting nge 'dzin ma thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ma thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: which means that he has not attained meditative concentration.

original: gzhan du na ni mi lcogs pa med pa yang 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni mi lcogs pa med pa yang 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the unrestricted access concentration would be associated with the realm of desire.

original: ting nge 'dzin thob ma thag tu spong ba la mngon par dga' ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur ba'i gnas ngan len spangs ba'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyi phyogs yod par rig par bya'o /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thob ma thag tu spong ba la mngon par dga' ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur ba'i gnas ngan len spangs ba'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyi phyogs yod par rig par bya'o /
translated: Immediately upon attaining concentration, one should know that there is a tendency toward freedom from attachment, because the negative tendencies that are adverse to the delight in abandonment are abandoned.

original: phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa ni 'dir 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i las kyi dbang gis grub pa'i phyir 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa ni 'dir 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i las kyi dbang gis grub pa'i phyir 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'o //
translated: The external form, etc., are associated with the desire realm because they are established by the power of the karma of those who are not free from attachment.

original: sems can thams cad kyi thun mong gi las kyi dbang gis 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams na yang 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i las kyi sa bon yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi thun mong gi las kyi dbang gis 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams na yang 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i las kyi sa bon yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement ‚Äúarising by the power of the common karma of all sentient beings‚Äù is made because the seeds of karma that are not free from attachment exist even in the form and formless realms.

original: khams bzhi zhes bya ba ni dri dang ro dang / sna dang lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
analyzed: khams bzhi zhes bya ba ni dri dang ro dang / sna dang lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
translated: The four elements are the elements of smell, taste, and the nose and tongue consciousnesses.

original: skye mched gnyis zhes bya ba ni dri dang ro'i skye mched do //
analyzed: skye mched gnyis zhes bya ba ni dri dang ro'i skye mched do //
translated: The two sense bases are the sense bases of smell and taste.

original: de las gzhan pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams kyi phyogs gcig go zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams kyi phyogs gcig go zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The other part of the aggregates, elements, and spheres means those of the form and formless realms and those that are uncontaminated.

original: khams bzhi dang skye mched gnyis ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: khams bzhi dang skye mched gnyis ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'o //
translated: The four elements and two spheres are excluded.

original: de las gzhan pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams kyi phyogs gcig go zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams kyi phyogs gcig go zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The other part of the aggregates, elements, and spheres means those of the desire and formless realms and those that are uncontaminated.

original: phung po bzhi zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phung po bzhi zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The four aggregates are feeling and so on.

original: khams gsum zhes bya ba ni yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes @22a * //üîΩba'i khams so //
analyzed: khams gsum zhes bya ba ni yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes @22a * // ba'i khams so //
translated: The three elements are the mind, mental objects, and the mind consciousness.

original: skye mched gnyis zhes bya ba ni yid dang chos kyi skye mched de /
analyzed: skye mched gnyis zhes bya ba ni yid dang chos kyi skye mched de /
translated: The two spheres are the mental and the mental object spheres.

original: de dag gi phyogs gcig ni 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi phyogs gcig ni 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: One part of those is the desire realm, the form realm, and the uncontaminated.

original: phyogs gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ces bya ba ni sa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ces bya ba ni sa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: Freedom from attachment to one part is from the perspective of the stages.

original: sa brgyad pa'i bar du nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa'i bar du nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because the aspects of affliction are abandoned up to the eighth stage.

original: mtha' dag las 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ces bya ba ni dgu pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' dag las 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ces bya ba ni dgu pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Freedom from attachment to all is because the ninth stage is abandoned.

original: yang 'jig tshogs las 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyi dbang du byas nas slob pa ni phyogs gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: yang 'jig tshogs las 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyi dbang du byas nas slob pa ni phyogs gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid do //
translated: Moreover, from the perspective of freedom from attachment to the appropriated aggregates, the learner is freedom from attachment to one part.

original: mi slob pa ni mtha' dag las 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa ni mtha' dag las 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The nonlearner is known as freedom from attachment to all.

original: rtog pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ces bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: rtog pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ces bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyis so //
translated: Freedom from attachment through conception is by the path of seeing.

original: gnod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ces bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: gnod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ces bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis so //
translated: The freedom from attachment to harm is by the mundane path.

original: legs par gnon pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ces bya ba ni 'jig rten la 'das pa'i phyir nyid kyis 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: legs par gnon pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ces bya ba ni 'jig rten la 'das pa'i phyir nyid kyis 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The freedom from attachment to the higher is by the supramundane path. The freedom from attachment to the higher should be understood as freedom from attachment by the supramundane path.üîΩThe freedom from attachment to the ten is the freedom from attachment to the objects of the five senses and the five action faculties.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bcu zhes bya ba 'di la mi 'phrod par 'dzin pa'i don ni 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyi don du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bcu zhes bya ba 'di la mi 'phrod par 'dzin pa'i don ni 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyi don du rig par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of not taking should be understood as the meaning of freedom from attachment.

original: gdon mi za bar spong ba'i don du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar spong ba'i don du ni ma yin no //
translated: But not in the sense of definitely abandoning.

original: thabs shin tu chen po thob pa thabs dma' ba la zhes bya ba ni grong khyer gyi gtso bo la sogs pa dang grong dpon la sogs pa lta bur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thabs shin tu chen po thob pa thabs dma' ba la zhes bya ba ni grong khyer gyi gtso bo la sogs pa dang grong dpon la sogs pa lta bur rig par bya'o //
translated: The lower means is like the chief of a city, etc., and the higher means is like the chief of a district, etc.

original: byis pa rnams mya ngan las 'das pa la zhes bya ba ni de la zhi ba nyid du mi shes pa dang / 'jig tshogs la mngon bar chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byis pa rnams mya ngan las 'das pa la zhes bya ba ni de la zhi ba nyid du mi shes pa dang / 'jig tshogs la mngon bar chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase children of the Buddha who are intent upon nirvana refers to those who do not understand nirvana to be peace and who are attached to the perishable collection.

original: mthong ba'i lam thob par khams gsum pa la zhes bya ba ni 'du byed sdug bsngal ba nyid du yongs su shes pa dang ldan pa zag pa dang bcas ba'i dngos po thams cad la yid 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam thob par khams gsum pa la zhes bya ba ni 'du byed sdug bsngal ba nyid du yongs su shes pa dang ldan pa zag pa dang bcas ba'i dngos po thams cad la yid 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase those who have attained the path of insight into the transcendent insight into the three realms refers to those who have attained the transcendent insight into the suffering of the formative forces and who are disgusted with all contaminated entities.üîΩThe phrase the virtue of those who are intent upon liberation refers to the training.üîΩThe phrase those who are intent upon liberation should be understood as referring to those who are intent upon attaining liberation.üîΩThe phrase those who are intent upon liberation should be understood as referring to those who are intent upon attaining liberation.

original: thar pa la brtson pa'i dge ba ni bslab par blta'o zhes bya ba ni tshogs bsags pa'i gnas skabs nas bzung ste /üîΩthar par bya ba'i phyir brtson par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thar pa la brtson pa'i dge ba ni bslab par blta'o zhes bya ba ni tshogs bsags pa'i gnas skabs nas bzung ste / thar par bya ba'i phyir brtson par rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase those who are intent upon liberation should be understood as referring to those who are intent upon attaining liberation.üîΩThe phrase those who are intent upon liberation should be understood as referring to those who are intent upon attaining liberation.üîΩThe phrase those who are intent upon liberation should be understood as referring to those who are intent upon attaining liberation.üîΩThe phrase those who are intent upon liberation should be understood as referring to those who are intent upon attaining liberation.üîΩThe phrase those who are intent upon liberation should be understood as referring to those who are intent upon attaining liberation.üîΩThe phrase those who are intent upon liberation should be understood as referring to those who are intent upon attaining liberation.üîΩThe phrase those who are intent upon liberation should be understood as referring to those who are intent upon attaining liberation.üîΩThe phrase those who are intent upon liberation should be understood as referring to those who are intent upon attaining liberation.üîΩThe phrase those who are intent upon liberation should be understood as referring to those who are intent upon attaining liberation.üîΩThe phrase those who are intent upon liberation should be understood as referring to those who are intent upon attaining liberation.üîΩThe phrase those who are intent upon liberation should be understood as referring to those who are intent upon attaining liberation.üîΩThe phrase those who are intent upon liberation should be understood as referring to those who are intent upon attaining liberation.

original: tshogs bsags pa'i gnas skabs ni mngon bar 'gro ba thar pa'i cha dang mthun par rig par bya'o //üîΩkhams bcu zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i khams bdun dang / gzugs dang sgra dang chos kyi khams rnams so //
analyzed: tshogs bsags pa'i gnas skabs ni mngon bar 'gro ba thar pa'i cha dang mthun par rig par bya'o //üîΩkhams bcu zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i khams bdun dang / gzugs dang sgra dang chos kyi khams rnams so //
translated: The phrase those who are intent upon liberation should be understood as referring to those who are intent upon attaining liberation.üîΩThe phrase those who are intent upon liberation should be understood as referring to those who are

original: @22b skye mched bzhi zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang sgra dang yid dang chos kyi skye mched rnams so //
analyzed: @22b skye mched bzhi zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang sgra dang yid dang chos kyi skye mched rnams so //
translated: The four sense bases are the sense bases of form, sound, mind, and mental objects.üîΩThe one who has completed the training is the arhat.

original: bslabs pa'i mthar phyin pa zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab ni bslab pa'o //
analyzed: bslabs pa'i mthar phyin pa zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab ni bslab pa'o //
translated: The training is the higher morality, the higher thought, and the higher wisdom.

original: mthar phyin pa ni dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mthar phyin pa ni dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The completion is the state of the arhat.

original: so so'i skye bo'i dge ba la sogs pa ni thar pa la brtson pa ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i dge ba la sogs pa ni thar pa la brtson pa ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The virtues of the ordinary man are those of the man who is not striving for liberation.

original: de ni bslab pa la slob pas slob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni bslab pa la slob pas slob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called the learner because he is training in the training.

original: slob pa'i nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba 'di la nyon mongs pa can ni mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: slob pa'i nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba 'di la nyon mongs pa can ni mi dge ba'o //
translated: The learner's defiled and neutral states. Here, the defiled is the unwholesome.

original: lung du ma bstan pa ni bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa ste /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa ni bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa ste /
translated: The neutral is the obscured neutral.

original: ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyor ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyor ro //
translated: They are to be applied as appropriate.

original: mi slob pa'i lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba ni ma bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba ni ma bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnon-learner indeterminate‚Äù should be understood as ‚Äúunobscured indeterminate.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi lta ba kun tu brtags pa rnams zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos ma yin pa nyan pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i lta ba lnga po dag go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi lta ba kun tu brtags pa rnams zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos ma yin pa nyan pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i lta ba lnga po dag go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe afflicted views that are imagined‚Äù refers to the five views that are preceded by listening to false doctrines, etc.

original: kun tu brtags pa smos pas ni lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa smos pas ni lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúimagined‚Äù is used to exclude the innate afflicted views of the belief in a self and the extremes.

original: mthar 'dzin par lta ba lhan cig skyes pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mthar 'dzin par lta ba lhan cig skyes pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How can there be an innate afflicted view of holding to an extreme?

original: mngon par rtogs pa la zhugs pa can nga'i bdag gang yin zhes skrag pa gang las byung ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa la zhugs pa can nga'i bdag gang yin zhes skrag pa gang las byung ba'o //
translated: It is the fear that arises in one who has begun to realize the truth and wonders, ‚ÄúWhat will become of my self?‚Äù

original: lta ba'i gnas zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams dang de'i sa bon no //
analyzed: lta ba'i gnas zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams dang de'i sa bon no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe basis of views‚Äù refers to the entities that are concomitant with views and the seeds of those views.

original: the tshom gyi gnas kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: the tshom gyi gnas kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe basis of doubt‚Äù should be understood in the same way.

original: lta ba log par zhugs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa dag ces bya ba ni lta ba'i sgo nas zhugs pa dang / de la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba log par zhugs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa dag ces bya ba ni lta ba'i sgo nas zhugs pa dang / de la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The afflictions and secondary afflictions that are engaged in by wrong views are those that are engaged in by way of the views and those that are the attachment to those views.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba dang / zag pa med pa ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba dang / zag pa med pa ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: One part of all is the part that is to be abandoned by the path of cultivation and the part that is uncontaminated.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe contaminated phenomena that are the opposite of those to be abandoned by the path of seeing‚Äù means those contaminated phenomena that are other than the afflicted views that are imaginary.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe contaminated phenomena that are other than the afflicted views that are imaginary‚Äù means those contaminated phenomena that are other than the afflicted views that are imaginary.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe contaminated phenomena that are other than the afflicted views that are imaginary‚Äù means those contaminated phenomena that are other than the afflicted views that are imaginary.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe contaminated phenomena that are other than the afflicted views that are imaginary‚Äù means those contaminated phenomena that are other than the afflicted views that are imaginary.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba las bzlog pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi lta ba kun tu brtags pa las gzhan pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩ'dir zag pa dang bcas pa smos pas ni /üîΩdes par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyang bsdu bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba las bzlog pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi lta ba kun tu brtags pa las gzhan pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // 'dir zag pa dang bcas pa smos pas ni / des par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyang bsdu bar rig par bya ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe contaminated phenomena that are other than the afflicted views that are imaginary‚Äù means those contaminated phenomena that are other than the afflicted views that are imaginary.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe contaminated phenomena that are other than the afflicted views that are imaginary‚Äù means those contaminated phenomena that are other than the afflicted views that are imaginary.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe contaminated phenomena that are other than the afflicted views that are imaginary‚Äù means those contaminated phenomena that are other than the afflicted views that are imaginary.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe contaminated phenomena that are other than the afflicted views that are imaginary‚Äù means those contaminated phenomena that are other than the afflicted views that are imaginary.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe contaminated phenomena that are other than the afflicted views that are imaginary‚Äù means those contaminated phenomena that are other than the afflicted views that are imaginary.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe contaminated phenomena that are other than the afflicted views that are imaginary‚Äù means those contaminated phenomena that are other than the afflicted views that are imaginary.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe contaminated phenomena that are other than the afflicted views that are imaginary‚Äù means those contaminated phenomena that are other than the afflicted views that are imaginary.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe contaminated phenomena that are other than the afflicted views that are imaginary‚Äù means those contaminated phenomena that are other than the afflicted views that are imaginary.

original: gnas ngan len gyi rjes su 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi rjes su 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe contaminated phenomena that are other than the afflicted views that are imaginary‚Äù means those contaminated phenomena that are other than the afflicted views that are imaginary.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe contaminated phenomena that are other than the afflicted views that are imaginary‚Äù

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go zhes bya ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni zag @23a * //üîΩpa med pa ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go zhes bya ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni zag @23a * // pa med pa ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: One part of all is to be abandoned by the path of vision.

original: phung po rnams kyi phyogs gcig spang bar bya ba ma yin pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dang / de'i rjes la thob pa'o //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi phyogs gcig spang bar bya ba ma yin pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dang / de'i rjes la thob pa'o //
translated: The part of the aggregates that is not to be abandoned is the supramundane path and what is obtained subsequently.

original: khams bcu dang skye mched bzhi zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: khams bcu dang skye mched bzhi zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dus ma byas so //
translated: Ten elements and four sense spheres, plus the unconditioned.

original: ci 'dra ba'i gzugs dang / sgra'i khams spang bar bya ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba'i gzugs dang / sgra'i khams spang bar bya ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: What kind of form and sound elements are not to be abandoned?

original: mi slob pa'i lus dang / ngag gi las kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lus dang / ngag gi las kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The form and sound elements that are the nature of the actions of the body and speech of one beyond training.

original: chos kyi khams dang skye mched kyi phyogs gcig ma gtogs par zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid do /üîΩ// / bam po gsum pa /
analyzed: chos kyi khams dang skye mched kyi phyogs gcig ma gtogs par zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid do / // / bam po gsum pa /
translated: Except for one part of the element of mental objects and the sense sphere of mental objects, which is the characteristic of the unconditioned.

original: bdag dang chos rgyu med pa dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung bar mngon bar zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang chos rgyu med pa dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung bar mngon bar zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to abandon the notion that the self and phenomena arise without cause, or that they arise from a cause such as a divine creator.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid gang gsungs pa ni 'di yod pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid gang gsungs pa ni 'di yod pas /
translated: The Lord has stated the characteristics of dependent origination as follows:üîΩ‚ÄúBecause this exists, that comes to be.‚Äù

original: 'di 'byung / 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba ste /
analyzed: 'di 'byung / 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba ste /
translated: The Lord has stated the characteristic of dependent origination as follows: ‚ÄúWhen this exists, that comes to be; from the birth of this, that is born.

original: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus, with ignorance as condition, there are karmic predispositions, and so on.

original: de la 'di yod pas 'di 'byung zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen las byung ba phyir te //
analyzed: de la 'di yod pas 'di 'byung zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen las byung ba phyir te //
translated: Here, ‚Äúwhen this exists, that comes to be‚Äù means that it arises from a condition that is not a mover,

original: rkyen yod na 'bras bu 'byung bar zad kyi 'bras bu 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir rkyen la g-yo ba ni ci yang med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rkyen yod na 'bras bu 'byung bar zad kyi 'bras bu 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir rkyen la g-yo ba ni ci yang med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because when the condition exists, the effect simply arises. It means that the condition does not move at all in order to bring about the arising of the effect.

original: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ste zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ste zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the birth of this, that is born‚Äù means that it arises from a condition that is impermanent,

original: ma byung ba'i rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma byung ba'i rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not established that an effect arises from a cause that does not exist.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nus pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nus pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i phyir ro /
translated: ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are karmic formations‚Äù and so on, because they arise from potential conditions.

original: g-yo ba med cing mi rtag pa yin du zin kyang rkyen gang yang rung ba las 'bras bu thams cad mi 'byung gi nus pa'i rkyen las 'byung ste 'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams 'byung ba nas skye ba las rga shi 'byung ba'i bar
analyzed: g-yo ba med cing mi rtag pa yin du zin kyang rkyen gang yang rung ba las 'bras bu thams cad mi 'byung gi nus pa'i rkyen las 'byung ste 'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams 'byung ba nas skye ba las rga shi 'byung ba'i bar
translated: Even though they are motionless and impermanent, not all conditions give rise to all effects. Effects arise from potential conditions. Thus, conditioned by ignorance, there are karmic formations, and so on, up to: conditioned by birth, there is aging and death.

original: du'o // ma rig pa la sogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis rnam par phye ba gang yin pa de dag ni mdor bsdus yan lag bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: du'o // ma rig pa la sogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis rnam par phye ba gang yin pa de dag ni mdor bsdus yan lag bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: The twelve members of dependent arising that are distinguished are summarized as four members:

original: 'phen pa'i yan lag la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phen pa'i yan lag la sogs pa'o //
translated: the member that projects, and so on.

original: 'byung ba bstan pa la ni 'di dag tsam zhig bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba bstan pa la ni 'di dag tsam zhig bstan par bya ste /
translated: In the teaching on the origin of suffering, only this much should be taught:

original: 'di ltar rgyu'i dus na gang gi 'phen pa dang / gang 'phen pa dang / 'bras bu'i dus na gang gis mngon par 'grub par dang / gnang mngon par 'grub pa ste /üîΩde dag thams cad ni yan lag 'di rnams kyis bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu'i dus na gang gi 'phen pa dang / gang 'phen pa dang / 'bras bu'i dus na gang gis mngon par 'grub par dang / gnang mngon par 'grub pa ste / de dag thams cad ni yan lag 'di rnams kyis bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: and that which is actualized at the time of the effect, and that which is actualized.

original: @23b de la 'phen pa'i yan lag ni ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: @23b de la 'phen pa'i yan lag ni ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The member of projection is ignorance, the karmic forces, and consciousness.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba mngon par 'grub par 'gyur par bden pa rnams mi shes pa sngon du 'gro ba'i las kyi bag chags sems la bsgo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba mngon par 'grub par 'gyur par bden pa rnams mi shes pa sngon du 'gro ba'i las kyi bag chags sems la bsgo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-understanding of the truths, which precedes the actualization of future birth, the instinct for action is implanted in the mind.

original: 'phangs pa'i yan lag ni ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba ste /
analyzed: 'phangs pa'i yan lag ni ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba ste /
translated: The member of projection is name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, and feeling.

original: sems kyi bag chags kyi ming dang gzugs la sogs pa snga ma la phyi ma brten nas rim gyis mngon par 'grub par bya ba'i ched du sems kyi bag chags de dag gi sa bon brtas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi bag chags kyi ming dang gzugs la sogs pa snga ma la phyi ma brten nas rim gyis mngon par 'grub par bya ba'i ched du sems kyi bag chags de dag gi sa bon brtas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The seeds of those latent impressions of mind are strengthened in order to bring about the gradual actualization of the later stages in dependence on the earlier ones, such as the name/form of the latent impressions of mind.

original: mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i yan lag gi sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i yan lag gi sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa ste /
translated: The limbs of actualization are craving, grasping, and becoming.üîΩDue to the power of not abandoning craving and so on, one delights in the practice of virtue and nonvirtue in the desire realm and so on.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i srid pa ma spangs pa'i dbang gis 'dod pa la sogs par legs par spyod pa dang / nyes par spyod pa'i rnam pa la goms par dga' ba sngon du 'gro ba'i 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags kyis nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes par yod par gyur ba na 'chi ba'i dus na 'bras bu 'byin par bya ba la 'dun pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i srid pa ma spangs pa'i dbang gis 'dod pa la sogs par legs par spyod pa dang / nyes par spyod pa'i rnam pa la goms par dga' ba sngon du 'gro ba'i 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags kyis nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes par yod par gyur ba na 'chi ba'i dus na 'bras bu 'byin par bya ba la 'dun pa dang /
translated: When consciousness is possessed with grasping due to attachment, at the time of death, one has aspiration for the result.

original: 'dod chags kyi rjes su mthun pa'i las gang yang rung ba'i bag chags mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi rjes su mthun pa'i las gang yang rung ba'i bag chags mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the latent tendencies of any karma compatible with attachment manifest.

original: mngon par grub pa'i yan lag ni skye ba dang rga shi ste /
analyzed: mngon par grub pa'i yan lag ni skye ba dang rga shi ste /
translated: The member that is actualized is birth and aging-and-death.

original: rnam pa des de las gzhan gyi bag chags mngon du gyur na ji ltar 'phangs pa bzhin du 'gro ba dang skye gnas la sogs pa'i bye brag tha dad pa'i ris mthun pa gang yang rung bar ming dang gzugs la sogs pa mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: rnam pa des de las gzhan gyi bag chags mngon du gyur na ji ltar 'phangs pa bzhin du 'gro ba dang skye gnas la sogs pa'i bye brag tha dad pa'i ris mthun pa gang yang rung bar ming dang gzugs la sogs pa mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro
translated: By that aspect, when the latent tendencies of the other members are actualized, name-and-form, etc., are actualized in any of the various classes of beings, such as the destinies, the wombs, etc., in accordance with the projection.

original: // skye ba dang rga shi smos pa ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum gyi skabs kyis skyo bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: // skye ba dang rga shi smos pa ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum gyi skabs kyis skyo bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Birth and aging-and-death are mentioned in order to generate disgust with the three characteristics of the conditioned.

original: rga ba dang 'chi ba yan lag gcig tu bya ba ni rga ba med par yang 'chi ba'i srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rga ba dang 'chi ba yan lag gcig tu bya ba ni rga ba med par yang 'chi ba'i srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Aging and death are made into one member because it is possible to die without aging.

original: mngal nas skye ba'i gnas su ming dang gzugs la sogs pa med par skye mched drug la sogs pa 'byung ba ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: mngal nas skye ba'i gnas su ming dang gzugs la sogs pa med par skye mched drug la sogs pa 'byung ba ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: Name-and-form, etc., do not occur without name-and-form, etc., in the womb, but it is not so for the six sense bases, etc.

original: de'i phyir de dag yan lag so sor bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag yan lag so sor bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they should be understood as separate members.

original: yan lag rkyen nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ni rkyen bzhi'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: yan lag rkyen nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ni rkyen bzhi'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: The establishment of the members as conditions is from the viewpoint of the four conditions.

original: de la ma rig pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen te /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen te /
translated: Therein, ignorance is the condition of the formative forces,

original: snga logs su byung ba'i bag chags kyis rgyu'i rkyen to //üîΩdes yongs su bsgos pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i las rnams yang srid par mngon @24a * //
analyzed: snga logs su byung ba'i bag chags kyis rgyu'i rkyen to // des yongs su bsgos pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i las rnams yang srid par mngon @24a * //
translated: because it is the causal condition of the formative forces, since it is a latent impression that has arisen previously.

original: bar 'du byed par nus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bar 'du byed par nus pa'i phyir te /
translated: The formative forces are the condition for the karmic forces that arise from the cause that is impregnated by that, because they are capable of actualizing a new existence.

original: de'i tshe kun tu 'byung ba'i tshul can no //
analyzed: de'i tshe kun tu 'byung ba'i tshul can no //
translated: At that time, they are the condition in the sense of a universal cause.

original: shugs kyis zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen te /
analyzed: shugs kyis zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates the condition as the antecedent,

original: de'i tshe 'phen pa'i bye brag gis 'du byed kyi rgyun gyi rgyun chags par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'phen pa'i bye brag gis 'du byed kyi rgyun gyi rgyun chags par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time the continuum of the formative forces arises uninterruptedly by the power of the projecting cause.

original: yid la byed pas zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i rkyen te /
analyzed: yid la byed pas zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i rkyen te /
translated: The word ‚Äúattention‚Äù indicates the objective condition,

original: rmongs pa'i dus na mchog la sogs par tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pas dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmongs pa'i dus na mchog la sogs par tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pas dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at the time of delusion, the formative forces are the objective domain of incorrect mental attention in regard to the supreme, etc.

original: lhan cig byung bas zhes bya ba ni bdag po'i rkyen te /
analyzed: lhan cig byung bas zhes bya ba ni bdag po'i rkyen te /
translated: The word ‚Äúsimultaneous‚Äù indicates the dominant condition,üîΩbecause the formative forces are the dominant condition for the other members that arise simultaneously with them.

original: de'i dbang gis de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba rnams dmigs pa la phyin ci log tu mngon bar 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba rnams dmigs pa la phyin ci log tu mngon bar 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, the mental factors that are concomitant with it are the formative forces that wrongly engage their object.

original: ma rig pa ni srid pa la sems can rnams rmongs par byed ces bya ba ni des bsgribs pa rnams sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang bar gyi mtha' yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir te /üîΩ'di ltar ci bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung ba zhig gam /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni srid pa la sems can rnams rmongs par byed ces bya ba ni des bsgribs pa rnams sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang bar gyi mtha' yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir te / 'di ltar ci bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung ba zhig gam /
translated: Ignorance causes sentient beings to be confused about existence means that those who are obscured by it do not understand the beginning, end, and middle just as they are.

original: 'on te ma byung ba zhig snyam pa la sogs pa de ltar the tshom za ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te ma byung ba zhig snyam pa la sogs pa de ltar the tshom za ba'o //
translated: Thus, they doubt whether they existed in the past or not, and so on.

original: 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i dbang gis yang srid pa'i las la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i dbang gis yang srid pa'i las la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also a condition of formative forces because existence and so on are generated by the power of that.

original: 'du byed rnams ni yang 'gro ba rnams su sems can dag rnam par 'byed ces bya ba ni las kyi dbang gis sems can rnams 'gro ba gzhan du 'gro ba sna tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni yang 'gro ba rnams su sems can dag rnam par 'byed ces bya ba ni las kyi dbang gis sems can rnams 'gro ba gzhan du 'gro ba sna tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Formations cause the differentiation of sentient beings into the various destinies.

original: rnam par shes pa'i bag chags kyi rkyen kyang yin zhes bya ba ni phyi ma la ming dang gzugs la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur bar sa bon gso bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bag chags kyi rkyen kyang yin zhes bya ba ni phyi ma la ming dang gzugs la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur bar sa bon gso bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Consciousness is the condition for the latent impressions of karma, because it plants the seeds for the future establishment of name-and-form, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa ni sems can rnams kyi las kyi 'ching ba 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyis bskyed pa'i bag chags dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni sems can rnams kyi las kyi 'ching ba 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyis bskyed pa'i bag chags dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Consciousness is the support for the bondage of sentient beings by karma, because it arises together with the latent impressions produced by formations.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen kyang yin zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du zhugs na ming dang gzugs kyi lus 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen kyang yin zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du zhugs na ming dang gzugs kyi lus 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Name-and-form is the condition for consciousness, because when consciousness enters the mother's womb, the body of name-and-form increases.

original: ming dang gzugs ni sems can rnams lus len du 'jug ces bya ba ni de grub na sems can rnams ris mthun par gzhan la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni sems can rnams lus len du 'jug ces bya ba ni de grub na sems can rnams ris mthun par gzhan la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Name-and-form causes sentient beings to take up a body. This is because, when that is established, sentient beings rely on another body in the same life-stream.

original: ming dang gzugs la sogs pa skye mched drug la sogs pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba ni yan lag snga ma la brten nas yang lag phyi ma 'grub par blta'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs la sogs pa skye mched drug la sogs pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba ni yan lag snga ma la brten nas yang lag phyi ma 'grub par blta'o //
translated: Name-and-form becomes the condition for the six sense bases, etc. This should be seen as the establishment of the later members in dependence on the earlier members.

original: skye mched drug ni sems can rnams @24b lus rdzogs par len du 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni de 'grub na dbang po gzhan ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye mched drug ni sems can rnams @24b lus rdzogs par len du 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni de 'grub na dbang po gzhan ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The six sense bases cause sentient beings to take up a complete body. This is because, when that is established, the other faculties are not incomplete.

original: reg pa ni yul gyi longs spyod la sems can rnams 'dzud pa zhes bya ba ni de'i sgo nas bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i yul rnam pa gsum la longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg pa ni yul gyi longs spyod la sems can rnams 'dzud pa zhes bya ba ni de'i sgo nas bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i yul rnam pa gsum la longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Contact causes sentient beings to engage in the enjoyment of objects. This is because, through that, one enjoys the three kinds of objects that are the basis of the experience of pleasure, etc.

original: tshor ba ni skye ba'i longs spyod la sems can rnams 'dzud pa zhes bya ba ni de la brten nas 'dod pa la sogs pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa la nye bar spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba ni skye ba'i longs spyod la sems can rnams 'dzud pa zhes bya ba ni de la brten nas 'dod pa la sogs pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa la nye bar spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Feeling is the entry of sentient beings into the enjoyment of birth, because they experience the maturation of karma in desire, etc. on the basis of that.

original: srid pa'i rkyen kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni de dang phrad pa la sogs par 'dod pa'i sgo nas sred pa 'byung pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni de dang phrad pa la sogs par 'dod pa'i sgo nas sred pa 'byung pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also a condition of craving, because craving arises through the desire to meet with, etc.

original: sred pa ni sems can rnams kyi skye ba 'dren pa zhes bya ba ni de'i dbang gis tshe gzhan du brgyud pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sred pa ni sems can rnams kyi skye ba 'dren pa zhes bya ba ni de'i dbang gis tshe gzhan du brgyud pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Craving is the guide of sentient beings into birth, because the continuum is uninterrupted in another life through its power.

original: len pa'i rkyen kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni ro myang bar 'dod pa'i sgo nas 'dod pa la sogs ba la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: len pa'i rkyen kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni ro myang bar 'dod pa'i sgo nas 'dod pa la sogs ba la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also a condition of grasping, because desire and attachment to desire, etc. arise through the desire to savor.
