original: len pa ni yang srid pa len pa'i phyir sems can rnams kyi rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa dang bcas par byed ces bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro ba bye brag can du yang srid pa'i nying mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ba'i
analyzed: len pa ni yang srid pa len pa'i phyir sems can rnams kyi rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa dang bcas par byed ces bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro ba bye brag can du yang srid pa'i nying mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ba'i
translated: It is the appropriator of consciousness because it appropriates rebirth.üîΩIt is the appropriator of consciousness because it connects to a specific rebirth in a specific realm, such as a hell being.

original: las kyi bag chags nges par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las kyi bag chags nges par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Appropriation is the appropriation of consciousness by sentient beings because of the taking up of rebirth. This is because the latent impressions of karma that will definitely lead to rebirth in a specific realm, such as the hells, are created.

original: srid pa'i rkyen kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i dbang gis 'du byed kyi bag chags 'byung ba rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i dbang gis 'du byed kyi bag chags 'byung ba rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Existence is the condition of becoming because the latent impressions of the formative forces are obtained through its power.

original: srid pa ni yang srid par sems can rnams mngon du phyogs par byed ces bya ba ni de ma thag tu 'gro ba gzhan 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa ni yang srid par sems can rnams mngon du phyogs par byed ces bya ba ni de ma thag tu 'gro ba gzhan 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Becoming is the orientation of sentient beings toward rebirth because it leads to another realm immediately after death.

original: skye ba'i rkyen kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni de las ris mthun pa gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni de las ris mthun pa gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Birth is the condition of old age and death because another life in a homogeneous class arises from it.

original: skye ba ni ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rim gyis sems can mngon par 'grub par byed pa ni phyi ma phyi ma'i gnas skabs gzhan 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba ni ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rim gyis sems can mngon par 'grub par byed pa ni phyi ma phyi ma'i gnas skabs gzhan 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Birth is the establishment of sentient beings in the successive stages of name-and-form, etc. It is the cause of the subsequent stages.

original: rga shi'i rkyen kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni skye ba yod na de'i rgyus gzhan du 'gyur ba dang / 'jig pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rga shi'i rkyen kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni skye ba yod na de'i rgyus gzhan du 'gyur ba dang / 'jig pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Aging-and-death is the condition of birth, because when there is birth, then through its cause, there is the possibility of change and destruction.

original: rga shi ni yang dang yang na tshod 'gyur ba dang / srog 'gyur ba la sems can rnams sbyor ba'o zhes bya ba ni dar la bab pa dang / tshe rnam par 'jig pa la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rga shi ni yang dang yang na tshod 'gyur ba dang / srog 'gyur ba la sems can rnams sbyor ba'o zhes bya ba ni dar la bab pa dang / tshe rnam par 'jig pa la sbyor ba'o //
translated: Aging-and-death is the connection of sentient beings with the repeated changes in their life-stages and the destruction of their life-force. It is the connection with the destruction of youth and life.

original: rnam par shes pa las kyi kun nas nyon mongs par bsdu ba ni rnam par shes pa'i yan lag 'du byed kyi bag chags kyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //üîΩbyed pa po @25a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las kyi kun nas nyon mongs par bsdu ba ni rnam par shes pa'i yan lag 'du byed kyi bag chags kyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro // byed pa po @25a * //
translated: Consciousness is included in the moral defilement of karma, because the member of consciousness is distinguished by the latent impressions of the formative forces.

original: med pa'i don zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug la spags pa'i byed pa po dang bral ba phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i don zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug la spags pa'i byed pa po dang bral ba phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the absence of an agent is the absence of an agent who is independent, i.e. one who is not dependent on the conditions of consciousness, etc.üîΩThe meaning of the absence of an experiencer is the absence of an experiencer who is independent, i.e. one who is not dependent on the conditions of name-and-form, etc.

original: rgyu dang bcas pa las byung ba'i don zhes ba ba ni ma rig pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa las byung ba'i don zhes ba ba ni ma rig pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúarising from a cause‚Äù is because it arises from the cause of ignorance.

original: sems can med pa'i don zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis bdag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can med pa'i don zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis bdag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúno sentient beings‚Äù is because of the absence of a self by nature.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gis don zhes bya ba ni skyen la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gis don zhes bya ba ni skyen la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúdependent‚Äù is because of dependence on conditions for arising.

original: g-yo ba med pa'i don zhes bya ba ni rkyen rnams byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa'i don zhes bya ba ni rkyen rnams byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúunmoving‚Äù is because conditions are without activity.

original: mi rtag pa'i don zhes bya ba ni ther zug ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i don zhes bya ba ni ther zug ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù is because of not being permanent.

original: skad cig ma'i don zhes bya ba ni skyes pa'i dus las pha rol tu mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i don zhes bya ba ni skyes pa'i dus las pha rol tu mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúmomentary‚Äù is because of not remaining beyond the time of arising.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyud rgyun mi 'chad pa'i don zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i skad cig 'gag pa dus mnyam du 'bras bu'i skad cig 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyud rgyun mi 'chad pa'i don zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i skad cig 'gag pa dus mnyam du 'bras bu'i skad cig 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe continuum of cause and effect is uninterrupted‚Äù is because the moment of the cause ceases simultaneously with the arising of the moment of the effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu mthun ba'i don zhes bya ba ni thams cad las thams cad mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu mthun ba'i don zhes bya ba ni thams cad las thams cad mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of cause and effect being in accordance is that everything does not arise from everything.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu sna tshogs kyi don zhes bya ba ni rgyu du ma dang gcig gi rnam pa las 'bras bu'i rnam pa gcig dang du ma 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu sna tshogs kyi don zhes bya ba ni rgyu du ma dang gcig gi rnam pa las 'bras bu'i rnam pa gcig dang du ma 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of cause and effect being various is that from the aspect of many causes and one effect, or one cause and many effects, there is the arising of many effects.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu so sor nges pa'i don zhes bya ba ni rgyu gzhan las 'bras bu gzhan mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu so sor nges pa'i don zhes bya ba ni rgyu gzhan las 'bras bu gzhan mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of cause and effect being individually distinct is that from another cause, another effect does not arise.

original: yang don 'di dag gis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnams pa ldas zab par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang don 'di dag gis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnams pa ldas zab par rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, these meanings should be known as the five profound aspects of dependent origination.

original: rgyus zab pa ni mi mthun pa'i rgyud dang / rgyu med par smra ba'i gnyen por don gnyis kyis zab bo //
analyzed: rgyus zab pa ni mi mthun pa'i rgyud dang / rgyu med par smra ba'i gnyen por don gnyis kyis zab bo //
translated: Profound in terms of cause is the antidote to the proponents of an incompatible continuum and causelessness, and is profound in two ways.

original: mtshan nyid kyis zab pa ni bdag med pa nyid kyis te don gcig gis so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis zab pa ni bdag med pa nyid kyis te don gcig gis so //
translated: Profound in terms of characteristic is through selflessness, and is profound in one way.

original: skye pas zab ba ni rkyen rnams las 'bras bu 'byung ba yang des ma byas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skye pas zab ba ni rkyen rnams las 'bras bu 'byung ba yang des ma byas pa'i phyir te /
translated: Profundity of origination is that the effect arises from conditions without being produced by them.

original: don gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: don gnyis kyis so //
translated: This is by means of two topics.

original: gnas pas zab pa ni gnas med kyang gnas par snang ba'i phyir te //
analyzed: gnas pas zab pa ni gnas med kyang gnas par snang ba'i phyir te //
translated: Profundity of duration is that, although there is no enduring, it appears to endure.

original: don gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: don gnyis kyis so //
translated: This is by means of two topics.

original: 'byung bas zab pa ni rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung ba rnam par shes par dka' ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'byung bas zab pa ni rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung ba rnam par shes par dka' ba'i phyir te /
translated: Profundity of emergence is that the effect arises from the cause, which is difficult to know.

original: don bzhis zab pa'o //
analyzed: don bzhis zab pa'o //
translated: This is by means of four topics.

original: byed pa po med kyang las dang byed pa dang / de'i 'bras bu la spyod pa yod de /
analyzed: byed pa po med kyang las dang byed pa dang / de'i 'bras bu la spyod pa yod de /
translated: Although there is no agent, there is action, the performer, and the experience of its effect.

original: 'di ni 'dir las dang 'bras bu chud mi za bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir las dang 'bras bu chud mi za bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand that action and effect are not lost.

original: chos ni bdag nyid kyis ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: chos ni bdag nyid kyis ma byas pa ste /
translated: A phenomenon is not produced by itself.

original: gang gis byed pa de ma skyes te med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis byed pa de ma skyes te med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That by which it is produced is not arisen, because it does not exist.

original: gzhan gyis kyang ma byas te rkyen rnams byed pa po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang ma byas te rkyen rnams byed pa po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it produced by another, because conditions are not agents.

original: gnyis kas kyang ma byas te /
analyzed: gnyis kas kyang ma byas te /
translated: Nor is it produced by both,

original: rgyu de gnyis kyis ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu de gnyis kyis ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not produced by those two causes.

original: rang gis byed pa dang / gzhan gyis byed pa dang / rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma @25b yin no zhes bya ba ni rkyen rnams 'bras bu skyed nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gis byed pa dang / gzhan gyis byed pa dang / rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma @25b yin no zhes bya ba ni rkyen rnams 'bras bu skyed nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not produced by itself, by another, or without a cause. This is because conditions have the ability to produce effects.

original: rnam grangs gzhan du na bdag nyid kyis ma byas pa ni rkyen la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan du na bdag nyid kyis ma byas pa ni rkyen la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In another enumeration, it is not produced by itself because it depends on conditions.

original: gzhan gyis ma byas pa ni rkyen yod du zin kyang sa bon med pa ni mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ma byas pa ni rkyen yod du zin kyang sa bon med pa ni mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not produced by another because, even when conditions are present, it does not arise if the seed is absent.

original: gnyi gas ma byas pa ni de gnyi ga la g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi gas ma byas pa ni de gnyi ga la g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not produced by both because neither of them moves.

original: rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin ba ni sa bon dang rkyen rnams la nus pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin ba ni sa bon dang rkyen rnams la nus pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not produced without a cause because seeds and conditions have the ability to produce.

original: gzhan yang / rang gis bon las te gzhan las min //üîΩde la ltos phyir bdag gis byas ma yin //üîΩg-yo ba med phyir gnyis kyis ma byas la //
analyzed: gzhan yang / rang gis bon las te gzhan las min // de la ltos phyir bdag gis byas ma yin // g-yo ba med phyir gnyis kyis ma byas la //
translated: Moreover: It is not from itself, nor from another,üîΩNor from both, nor without a cause.

original: de ni nus pas rgyu med byung ma yin //
analyzed: de ni nus pas rgyu med byung ma yin //
translated: Because it is not produced by itself, by another,üîΩBy both, or without a cause, therefore all things are devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las ma yin zhes bya bas /
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las ma yin zhes bya bas /
translated: The phrase not from self, not from anotherüîΩrefutes two alternatives.

original: mu rnam pa gnyis spong yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab par 'gyur na /
analyzed: mu rnam pa gnyis spong yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab par 'gyur na /
translated: But if dependent origination is profound even in this way,

original: gang du mu bzhi char spong ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gang du mu bzhi char spong ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: what need is there to mention the refutation of all four alternatives?

original: de lta bas na 'di mchog tu zab par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di mchog tu zab par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood as being supremely profound.üîΩThe classification of the arising of consciousness refers to the statement,

original: rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form.üîΩThe classification of death and rebirth refers to the world of sentient beings.

original: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: It is stated:

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩphyi'i lo tog 'byung ba'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni sa bon la brten nas myu gu /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // phyi'i lo tog 'byung ba'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni sa bon la brten nas myu gu /
translated: Conditioned by ignorance, there are the karmic predispositions.üîΩThe classification of the arising of external crops refers to the statement:üîΩIn dependence on the seed, the sprout;

original: myu gu la brten nas sdong bu ste /
analyzed: myu gu la brten nas sdong bu ste /
translated: in dependence on the sprout, the stem.

original: de bzhin du sbu gu dang 'dab ma dang // me tog dang 'bras bu rnams kyang sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbu gu dang 'dab ma dang // me tog dang 'bras bu rnams kyang sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should understand the application of the tubes, leaves, flowers, and fruits.

original: 'jig pa dang chags pa'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi thun mong gi las kyi dbang la brten nas sa chen po la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa dang chags pa'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi thun mong gi las kyi dbang la brten nas sa chen po la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The differentiation of dissolution and evolution is because the great earth, etc., arise in dependence on the power of the karma common to all sentient beings.

original: zas kyis brten pa'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni zas bzhi la brten nas sems can rnams khams gsum na gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zas kyis brten pa'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni zas bzhi la brten nas sems can rnams khams gsum na gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The differentiation of sustenance is because sentient beings abide in the three realms in dependence on the four sustenances.

original: 'dod dang mi 'dod pa'i 'gro ba rnam par 'byed pa'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa la brten nas bde 'gro dang ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod dang mi 'dod pa'i 'gro ba rnam par 'byed pa'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa la brten nas bde 'gro dang ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The differentiation of the discrimination of desirable and undesirable destinies is because one goes to good or bad destinies in dependence on good or bad conduct.

original: rnam par dag pa'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa la brten nas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'byung ba nas mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi rim gyis dgra bcom pa thob pa'i bar dang /üîΩgzhan gyi sgra la brten nas nang du tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba dang gang @26a * //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa la brten nas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'byung ba nas mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi rim gyis dgra bcom pa thob pa'i bar dang / gzhan gyi sgra la brten nas nang du tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba dang gang @26a * //
translated: The analysis of purification is from the aids to penetration based on the aids to liberation, up to the attainment of arhatship through the stages of the paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: zag pa thams cad zad pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: zag pa thams cad zad pa'i bar du'o //
translated: It is from the proper mental attention internally based on the words of another, up to the correct view and the exhaustion of all defilements.

original: mthu stobs kyis rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni thob ba la brten nas mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can rnams 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthu stobs kyis rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni thob ba la brten nas mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can rnams 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The analysis of power is from the attainment of the special qualities such as the superknowledges, etc.

original: de ltar rab tu dbye ba 'di dag gis 'du byed rnams rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rgya cher rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rab tu dbye ba 'di dag gis 'du byed rnams rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rgya cher rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Thus, through these analyses, one should understand the extensive dependent origination of the formations.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs dang mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i rim pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs dang mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i rim pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: The order of the process of affliction and the order of the process of purification are in accordance with the order of the arising of the elements.üîΩThe order of the process of affliction is taught in the statement, ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are karmic formations,‚Äù and so on.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lugs dang mthun par ston to //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lugs dang mthun par ston to //
translated: The order of the process of purification is taught in the statement, ‚ÄúWith the cessation of ignorance, karmic formations cease,‚Äù and so on.

original: rga shi dang rga shi kun 'byung ba dang / rga shi 'gog pa dang / rga shi 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam zhes bya ba ni /üîΩbden pa rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /üîΩlugs dang mi mthun pa bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rga shi dang rga shi kun 'byung ba dang / rga shi 'gog pa dang / rga shi 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam zhes bya ba ni / bden pa rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas pa ste / lugs dang mi mthun pa bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The order of the process of purification is also taught in the statement, ‚ÄúOld age and death, the arising of old age and death, the cessation of old age and death, and the path that leads to the cessation of old age and death.‚ÄùüîΩThe order of the process of purification is also taught in the statement, ‚ÄúWith the cessation of ignorance, karmic formations cease,‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe order of the process of purification is also taught in the statement, ‚ÄúWith the cessation of ignorance, karmic formations cease,‚Äù and so on.

original: de bzhin du ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par byang ba'i lugs dang mthun pa ston to //üîΩgang med na rga shi mi 'byung ba dang / gang 'gags na rga shi 'gags pa zhes bya ba ni lugs dang mi mthun pa ston to //üîΩrgyu'i rkyen gang zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par byang ba'i lugs dang mthun pa ston to //üîΩgang med na rga shi mi 'byung ba dang / gang 'gags na rga shi 'gags pa zhes bya ba ni lugs dang mi mthun pa ston to //üîΩrgyu'i rkyen gang zhe na /
translated: The order of the process of purification is also taught in the statement, ‚ÄúWith the cessation of ignorance, karmic formations cease,‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe order of the process of purification is also taught in the statement, ‚ÄúWith the cessation of ignorance, karmic formations cease,‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe order of the process of purification is also taught in the statement, ‚ÄúWith the cessation of ignorance, karmic formations cease,‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe order of the process of purification is also taught in the statement, ‚ÄúWith the cessation of ignorance, karmic formations cease,‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe order of the process of purification is also taught in the statement, ‚ÄúWith the cessation of ignorance, karmic formations cease,‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe order of the process of purification is also taught in the statement, ‚ÄúWith the cessation of ignorance, karmic formations cease,‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe order of the process of purification is also taught in the statement, ‚ÄúWith the cessation of ignorance, karmic formations cease,‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe order of the process of purification is also taught in the statement, ‚ÄúWith the cessation of ignorance, karmic formations cease,‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe order of the process of purification is also taught in the statement, ‚ÄúWith the cessation of ignorance, karmic formations cease,‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe order of the process of purification is also taught in the statement, ‚ÄúWith the cessation of ignorance, karmic formations cease,‚Äù and so on.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / dge ba'i bag chags so zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i 'du byed rnams dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / dge ba'i bag chags so zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i 'du byed rnams dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: The store-consciousness and the impressions of the wholesome are the cause of the defiled and the undefiled formative forces respectively.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The store-consciousness is twofold:

original: rnam par smin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba'o //
translated: as a result of retribution and as a result of accumulated action.

original: de la rnam par smin pa ni skye bas 'thob pa rnams kyi rgyu'i rkyan to //
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa ni skye bas 'thob pa rnams kyi rgyu'i rkyan to //
translated: Of these, the store-consciousness as a result of retribution is the causal condition for those that are acquired at birth.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba ni sbyor ba las byung ba rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba ni sbyor ba las byung ba rnams kyi ste /
translated: The store-consciousness as a result of accumulated action is the causal condition for those that are acquired through application.

original: phyi ma la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi rgyu'i rkyen du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi ma la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi rgyu'i rkyen du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The latter should be regarded as the causal condition for another store-consciousness in the future.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa las byung pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa las byung pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: The store-consciousness as a result of accumulated action

original: tshe de'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i bag chags bsgos par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe de'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i bag chags bsgos par rig par bya'o //
translated: should be known as the perfuming of the impressions of the actual consciousness that occurs simultaneously with it.

original: dge ba'i bag chags ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyi bag chags su blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i bag chags ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyi bag chags su blta bar bya ste /
translated: The latent impressions of virtue should be regarded as the latent impressions of those factors conducive to liberation.

original: de dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa thob pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i chos kyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir de'i bag chags ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi rgyu nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa thob pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i chos kyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir de'i bag chags ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi rgyu nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Since they are the natural outflow of the cause of the supramundane, the latent impressions of those are the cause of the supramundane.

original: yang ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas ni rgyu drug po dag rgyu'i rkyen du ston to //
analyzed: yang ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas ni rgyu drug po dag rgyu'i rkyen du ston to //
translated: Moreover, the statement beginning with ‚Äúown-being‚Äù indicates the six causes as the causal condition.

original: de la ngo bo nyid dang rab tu dbye ba ni byed pa'i rgyur rnam par @26b gzhag go //
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid dang rab tu dbye ba ni byed pa'i rgyur rnam par @26b gzhag go //
translated: Therein, own-being and differentiation are respectively determined as the efficient cause.

original: tshig lhag ma rnams ni go rims bzhin du lhan cig 'byung ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang / skal pa mnyam pa dang / kun tu 'gro ba dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu rnams su rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig lhag ma rnams ni go rims bzhin du lhan cig 'byung ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang / skal pa mnyam pa dang / kun tu 'gro ba dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu rnams su rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The remaining terms should be understood as respectively determining the co-existent, the associated, the universal, the pervasive and the ripening causes.

original: rgyu'i ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du byas nas byed pa'i rgyu rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir rgyu thams cad ni byed pa'i rgyu'i nang du 'dus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du byas nas byed pa'i rgyu rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir rgyu thams cad ni byed pa'i rgyu'i nang du 'dus par rig par bya'o //
translated: In terms of the nature of the cause, the active cause is posited. Therefore, it should be understood that all causes are included in the active cause.

original: grogs la sogs pa ni bye brag bstan pa'i phyir so sor rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: grogs la sogs pa ni bye brag bstan pa'i phyir so sor rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The cooperative cause and so on are posited separately in order to teach their specific characteristics.

original: byed pa'i rgyu'i rab tu dbye ba la /
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu'i rab tu dbye ba la /
translated: The classification of the active cause is as follows.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs la sogs gang bstan pa de ni dpe tsam du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs la sogs gang bstan pa de ni dpe tsam du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The group of consciousnesses and so on that are taught should be seen as mere examples.

original: phyogs 'dis ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin can gzhan la yang mngon bar brtag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs 'dis ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin can gzhan la yang mngon bar brtag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in this way, others with such a nature should be inferred.

original: de la 'byung ba'i byed rgyu ni de las 'bras bu ma byung ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'byung ba'i byed rgyu ni de las 'bras bu ma byung ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, the active cause of origination is because the effect arises from it when it has not yet arisen.

original: gnas pa'i byed rgyu ni skyes pa'i rgyud rgyun mi 'chad par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa'i byed rgyu ni skyes pa'i rgyud rgyun mi 'chad par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The active cause of endurance is because it makes the continuum of what has arisen continue without interruption.

original: rten pa'i byed rgyu ni ltung ba'i gegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten pa'i byed rgyu ni ltung ba'i gegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The active cause of support is because it prevents falling.

original: gsal ba'i byed rgyu ni sgrib pa bsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i byed rgyu ni sgrib pa bsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The illuminating cause is the cause of the removal of obscurations.

original: 'gyur ba'i byed rgyu ni rgyud gzhan du 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i byed rgyu ni rgyud gzhan du 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The transforming cause is the cause of the transformation of the continuum.

original: 'bral ba'i byed rgyu ni 'brel ba gnyis su gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bral ba'i byed rgyu ni 'brel ba gnyis su gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The separating cause is the cause of the separation of the two bonds.

original: bsgyur ba'i byed rgyu ni de'i cha shas yul gzhan du 'pho bar byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyid ches pa'i byed rgyu ni des lkog tu gyur pa rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgyur ba'i byed rgyu ni de'i cha shas yul gzhan du 'pho bar byed pa'i phyir ro // yid ches pa'i byed rgyu ni des lkog tu gyur pa rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The changing cause is the cause of the transference of a part of that to another place.üîΩThe convincing cause is the cause of the inference of the hidden.

original: yid ches par byed pa'i byed rgyu ni des yang dag par nges par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid ches par byed pa'i byed rgyu ni des yang dag par nges par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The convincing-making cause is the cause of the ascertainment of that.

original: thob pa'i byed rgyu ni des thob par byed pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa'i byed rgyu ni des thob par byed pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: The obtaining cause is the cause of the attainment of that.

original: tha snyad kyi byed rgyu ni ming ji lta ba bzhin du mtshan mar 'dzin pas mngon bar zhen nas rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi byed rgyu ni ming ji lta ba bzhin du mtshan mar 'dzin pas mngon bar zhen nas rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The conventional cause is the cause of the conventional designation of the object by the name, through the adherence to the sign in accordance with the name.

original: ltos pa'i byed rgyu ni gzhan du 'dod pa 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltos pa'i byed rgyu ni gzhan du 'dod pa 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The active cause is the cause of the arising of another.

original: 'phen pa'i byed rgyu ni de'i rgyu las byung ba gnas skabs gzhan du gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'byung bas 'phen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phen pa'i byed rgyu ni de'i rgyu las byung ba gnas skabs gzhan du gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'byung bas 'phen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The projecting cause is the cause of the projecting of a subsequent state, which occurs in a series from one to another, due to its cause.

original: mngon bar 'grub pa'i byed rgyu ni de ma thag tu 'byung ba bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon bar 'grub pa'i byed rgyu ni de ma thag tu 'byung ba bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The actualizing cause is the cause of the generation of that which immediately arises.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa'i byed rgyu ni rang gi sa bon las byung ba stobs bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa'i byed rgyu ni rang gi sa bon las byung ba stobs bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The maintaining cause is the cause of the development of its own seed.

original: chud par byed pa'i byed rgyu ni de'i rjes su mthun pas 'grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩso sor nges pa'i byed rgyu ni rang bzhin tha dad pas 'bras bu gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩlhan cig byed pa'i byed rgyu ni rang gi 'bras @27a * //
analyzed: chud par byed pa'i byed rgyu ni de'i rjes su mthun pas 'grub pa'i phyir ro // so sor nges pa'i byed rgyu ni rang bzhin tha dad pas 'bras bu gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir ro // lhan cig byed pa'i byed rgyu ni rang gi 'bras @27a * //
translated: The cause of perishing is the cause of the establishment of that which is compatible with it.üîΩThe cause of determination is the cause of the arising of other and other effects due to the difference of intrinsic nature.

original: bu 'grub par byed pa la rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bu 'grub par byed pa la rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cooperating cause is the cause of the establishment of its own effect due to the dependence on other causes.

original: mi mthun pa'i byed rgyu ni gegs byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmi mthun pa ma yin pa'i byed rgyu ni de las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i byed rgyu ni gegs byed pa'i phyir ro // mi mthun pa ma yin pa'i byed rgyu ni de las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
translated: The non-unfavorable cause is the opposite of the above.üîΩThe elements and the derivative material elements are the homogeneous cause of the elements and the derivative material elements, respectively.üîΩThe elements and the derivative material elements are the pervasive cause of the derivative material elements.üîΩThe elements are the pervasive cause of the derivative material elements.üîΩThe derivative material elements are not the pervasive cause of the elements, because the elements arise in a multitude.

original: 'di lta ste 'byung ba rnams dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mthun mthun du snang gyi  tshogs pa thams cad dang / gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba las gyur pa la 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'byung ba rnams dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mthun mthun du snang gyi  tshogs pa thams cad dang / gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba las gyur pa la 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The elements are the pervasive cause of the derivative material elements, because the derivative material elements do not arise without the elements.üîΩThe elements are not the pervasive cause of the elements, because the elements arise in a multitude.üîΩThe elements and the derivative material elements are the homogeneous cause of the derivative material elements.

original: de'i phyir gang na gang yod pa de ni de dang lhan cig 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang na gang yod pa de ni de dang lhan cig 'byung ste /
translated: The elements are the homogeneous cause of the elements, because the elements are the homogeneous cause of the elements of their own category.üîΩThe elements are not the homogeneous cause of the derivative material elements, because the elements are not the homogeneous cause of the derivative material elements of their own category.

original: gang yang rung ba zhig med na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhig med na ni ma yin no //
translated: The derivative material elements are not the homogeneous cause of the elements, because the derivative material elements are not the homogeneous cause of the elements of their own category.

original: de ltar na grogs su nges pas lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyur rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar na grogs su nges pas lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyur rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The derivative material elements are the homogeneous cause of the derivative material elements, because the derivative material elements are the homogeneous cause of the derivative material elements of their own category.üîΩThe derivative material elements are not the homogeneous cause of the elements, because the derivative material elements are not the homogeneous cause of the elements of their own category.üîΩThe elements and the derivative material elements are the pervasive cause of the derivative material elements.

original: 'byung ba dag dang 'byung ba las gyur pa zhes bya bas de ni dper brjod pa tsam du zad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba dag dang 'byung ba las gyur pa zhes bya bas de ni dper brjod pa tsam du zad par rig par bya'o //
translated: The elements are the pervasive cause of the derivative material elements, because the derivative material elements do not arise without the elements.üîΩThe derivative material elements are the pervasive cause of the derivative material elements, because the derivative material elements do not arise without the derivative material elements.üîΩThe elements are not the pervasive cause of the elements, because the elements arise in a multitude.üîΩThe derivative material elements are not the pervasive cause of the elements, because the derivative material elements are not the pervasive cause of the elements of their own category.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni gang yang rung ba zhig med na mi 'byung bar nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni gang yang rung ba zhig med na mi 'byung bar nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is certain that no mental factor or mental activity arises without a mind.

original: gal te de ltar na mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu logs shig tu gzhag tu med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu logs shig tu gzhag tu med par 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then the associated cause cannot be posited separately,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because mental factors and activities are included in the co-existent cause.

original: de ltar yin du zin kyang don gzhan gyis mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yin du zin kyang don gzhan gyis mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: Even though that is so, they become the associated cause by a different meaning.

original: chos gang dag lhan cig 'byung bas dmigs pa mthun par rtogs kyi gang yang rung ba zhig ma tshang na ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: chos gang dag lhan cig 'byung bas dmigs pa mthun par rtogs kyi gang yang rung ba zhig ma tshang na ma yin pa ste /
translated: Those phenomena that are concomitant in their arising and realization of a similar objective reference, but not if any one of them is incomplete.

original: 'di lta ste sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
translated: They are, for example, mind and mental activities.

original: sngon dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos bsgoms pa rnams zhes bya ba ni sngon goms par byas pa rnams te /
analyzed: sngon dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos bsgoms pa rnams zhes bya ba ni sngon goms par byas pa rnams te /
translated: Those previously cultivated virtuous, non-virtuous, and neutral phenomena are those previously habituated.

original: sngon kun tu spyad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sngon kun tu spyad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are called previously practiced.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' gong nas gong du shin tu rgyas pa dang mchog tu rgyas par 'byung ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni de dag gi sa bon yongs su gsos ba rnams te /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' gong nas gong du shin tu rgyas pa dang mchog tu rgyas par 'byung ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni de dag gi sa bon yongs su gsos ba rnams te /
translated: The future is the increase of the seed of those that have been nourished, and the increase of the superior and the most superior.

original: de'i rgyu las byung ba rnams ma 'ongs pa'i dus na khyad par can du 'byung bar blta'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu las byung ba rnams ma 'ongs pa'i dus na khyad par can du 'byung bar blta'o //
translated: The increase of the seed of those that have been nourished is the cause of the increase of the superior and the most superior in the future.

original: de ltar na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu 'di ni 'dra ba rnams kyi rgyas par byed pa'i rgyur rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu 'di ni 'dra ba rnams kyi rgyas par byed pa'i rgyur rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, the homogeneous cause is established as the cause of the increase of similar types.

original: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu ni 'dra ba rgyas par byed pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu ni 'dra ba rgyas par byed pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: The universal cause is not only the cause of the increase of similar types.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa gang yang rung ba goms par byas pas zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rgyun rgyas par bstan par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa gang yang rung ba goms par byas pas zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rgyun rgyas par bstan par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: It is also the cause of the increase of the continuum of attachment and so on, since any affliction such as attachment is cultivated.

original: de'i phyir dam du 'ching bar byed pas na thar pa thob pa'i bar du gcod pa'i phyir rnam par gzhag @27b par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dam du 'ching bar byed pas na thar pa thob pa'i bar du gcod pa'i phyir rnam par gzhag @27b par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that it is established as an obstruction to attaining liberation, since it binds one tightly.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni phyi ma la gcig tu mi 'dra ba bsgribs la lung du mi ston pa'i lus su bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni phyi ma la gcig tu mi 'dra ba bsgribs la lung du mi ston pa'i lus su bsdus pa ste /
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is the future, which is exclusively dissimilar, subsumed by the neutral obstructed states.

original: rnam par smin pa 'phen pa'i phyir yongs su 'dzin pa'i don gyis rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa 'phen pa'i phyir yongs su 'dzin pa'i don gyis rnam par gzhag go //
translated: It is posited as the cause of karmic maturation because it projects karmic maturation.

original: dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa smos pa ni zag pa med pa rnams kyi skye ba dang mi mthun pas 'phen pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa smos pa ni zag pa med pa rnams kyi skye ba dang mi mthun pas 'phen pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term virtuous contaminated states is stated because uncontaminated states do not project birth because they are incompatible with birth.

original: rgyun mi 'chad par chad med pa zhes bya ba ni gdon mi za bar skad cig gi bar chad med pa ma yin gyi sems gzhan gyi bar chad med pa yang 'dir bar chad med bar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par chad med pa zhes bya ba ni gdon mi za bar skad cig gi bar chad med pa ma yin gyi sems gzhan gyi bar chad med pa yang 'dir bar chad med bar blta bar bya ste /
translated: The term uninterrupted and without interval means that it is not necessarily without interruption for a moment, but here the absence of an interval should be viewed as the absence of an interval between other minds.

original: gzhan du na snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems ni sems med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa las langs pa'i sems kyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen du ni mi 'gyur ba'i rigs na 'gyur bas de'i phyir rgyud gcig la phyi ma'i sems dang / snga ma'i sems kyi bar du sems gzhan gyis bar du ma chod pa ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
analyzed: gzhan du na snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems ni sems med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa las langs pa'i sems kyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen du ni mi 'gyur ba'i rigs na 'gyur bas de'i phyir rgyud gcig la phyi ma'i sems dang / snga ma'i sems kyi bar du sems gzhan gyis bar du ma chod pa ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
translated: But since it is, the mind of meditative attainment is the immediately preceding condition of the mind that arises from meditative attainment.

original: sems la ji lta bar sems las byung ba rnams kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems la ji lta bar sems las byung ba rnams kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as it is for minds, so it is for mental factors.

original: mthun pa dang mi mthun pa las sems dang sems las byung ba 'byung ba'i de ma thag pas kyang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mthun pa dang mi mthun pa las sems dang sems las byung ba 'byung ba'i de ma thag pas kyang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The immediately preceding condition is also that which arises from compatible and incompatible minds and mental factors.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i dge ba rnams ni mthun pa dge ba rnams dang / mi mthun pa mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa de ma thag tu 'byung ba rnams kyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i dge ba rnams ni mthun pa dge ba rnams dang / mi mthun pa mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa de ma thag tu 'byung ba rnams kyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
translated: Virtuous minds and mental factors are the immediately preceding condition of subsequent virtuous minds and mental factors and also of subsequent nonvirtuous and neutral minds and mental factors.

original: de bzhin tu mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyang rang dang gzhan gyi rnam pa rnams dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin tu mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyang rang dang gzhan gyi rnam pa rnams dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: So too, nonvirtuous and neutral minds should be connected with their own and other types.

original: de bzhin tu 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang / zag pa med pa de ma thag tu 'byung ba rnams kyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin tu 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang / zag pa med pa de ma thag tu 'byung ba rnams kyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
translated: Similarly, desire realm minds are the immediately preceding condition of desire realm minds and of form and formless realm minds and uncontaminated minds that arise immediately after.

original: de bzhin gzugs na spyod pa la sogs pa yang so sor gzugs na spyod pa la sogs pa dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa la sogs pa de ma thag tu 'byung ba rnams kyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen to zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gzugs na spyod pa la sogs pa yang so sor gzugs na spyod pa la sogs pa dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa la sogs pa de ma thag tu 'byung ba rnams kyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen to zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: So too, form realm minds and so on are the immediately preceding condition of form realm minds and so on and of desire realm minds and so on that arise immediately after.

original: ci sems can thams cad kyi de ma thag tu sems thams cad 'byung ngam /
analyzed: ci sems can thams cad kyi de ma thag tu sems thams cad 'byung ngam /
translated: Do all minds arise immediately after all minds?

original: 'on te nges pa yod ce na /
analyzed: 'on te nges pa yod ce na /
translated: Or is there certainty?

original: nges pa yod ces bya ste sems 'di'i 'og tu sems 'di dang 'di 'byung ngo zhes brjod na ni brjod pa mang bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: nges pa yod ces bya ste sems 'di'i 'og tu sems 'di dang 'di 'byung ngo zhes brjod na ni brjod pa mang bar 'gyur ro /
translated: If one were to say, ‚ÄúThis mind arises after that mind,‚Äù the expression would be too long.

original: de lta bas na spyir sems 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid tsam rnam par gzhag go //üîΩ'di ltar stobs bcus sems 'byung bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na spyir sems 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid tsam rnam par gzhag go // 'di ltar stobs bcus sems 'byung bar rig par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the characteristics of the arising of mind are established in a general way.

original: 'dris @28a * //üîΩpa'i stobs dang / 'dun pa'i stobs dang / sbyor ba'i stobs dang / snyom par 'jug pa'i stobs dang / 'phen pa'i stobs dang / rgyu'i stobs dang / yul gyi stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / yid la byed pa'i stobs dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: 'dris @28a * // pa'i stobs dang / 'dun pa'i stobs dang / sbyor ba'i stobs dang / snyom par 'jug pa'i stobs dang / 'phen pa'i stobs dang / rgyu'i stobs dang / yul gyi stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / yid la byed pa'i stobs dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i stobs kyis so //
translated: The arising of mind should be understood through the power of the ten causes.

original: 'dris pa'i stobs ni rnam pa gsum ste /üîΩchung ngu 'bring dang / chen po'o //üîΩsnyoms par 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang / ldang ba'i rgyu rnams mi mngon pa'i phyir chung ngo //
analyzed: 'dris pa'i stobs ni rnam pa gsum ste /üîΩchung ngu 'bring dang / chen po'o //üîΩsnyoms par 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang / ldang ba'i rgyu rnams mi mngon pa'i phyir chung ngo //
translated: The power of familiarity, the power of desire, the power of application, the power of meditative development, the power of projection, the power of cause, the power of object, the power of mindfulness, the power of attention, and the power of linking.

original: mngon par legs par ma 'dris pa'i phyir 'bring ngo //
analyzed: mngon par legs par ma 'dris pa'i phyir 'bring ngo //
translated: It is middling because it is not well-cultivated.

original: legs par 'dris pa'i phyir chen po'o //
analyzed: legs par 'dris pa'i phyir chen po'o //
translated: It is great because it is well-cultivated.

original: de la 'dris pa chung ngu'i stobs kyis ni bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa rnams la mthar gyis snyoms par 'jug par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'dris pa chung ngu'i stobs kyis ni bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa rnams la mthar gyis snyoms par 'jug par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that by the power of small cultivation, one enters meditative concentration and formlessness in sequence.

original: 'bring gis ni gcig gis bar du gcod pa'i tshul gyis thod rgal du snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: 'bring gis ni gcig gis bar du gcod pa'i tshul gyis thod rgal du snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: By the power of middling cultivation, one enters meditative concentration and formlessness in a skipping manner, by the method of skipping over one.

original: chen pos ni ji ltar 'dod pa'am thams cad la thod rgal du zhugs nas lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs dang mi mthun par snyoms par 'jug par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chen pos ni ji ltar 'dod pa'am thams cad la thod rgal du zhugs nas lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs dang mi mthun par snyoms par 'jug par rig par bya'o //
translated: By the power of great cultivation, one enters meditative concentration and formlessness in a skipping manner, as one wishes or in all ways, in an order that accords with the norm and in a way that does not accord with the norm.

original: 'dun pa'i stobs kyis ni bsam gtan gnyis pa thob pa bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs la /
analyzed: 'dun pa'i stobs kyis ni bsam gtan gnyis pa thob pa bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs la /
translated: By the power of aspiration, one who has attained the second meditative concentration enters the first meditative concentration.

original: gal te 'dod na bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa las ldang ba'i sems mngon du byed do //
analyzed: gal te 'dod na bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa las ldang ba'i sems mngon du byed do //
translated: If one wishes, one manifests a thought that emerges from the level of the second meditative concentration.

original: gzhan du 'dod na yang 'dod pa na spyod pa dge ba'am ma bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa mngon du byed do //
analyzed: gzhan du 'dod na yang 'dod pa na spyod pa dge ba'am ma bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa mngon du byed do //
translated: If you assert otherwise, then you would have to assert that virtuous minds or unobscured neutral minds active in the desire realm manifest.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la'ang rgya cher sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la'ang rgya cher sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be extensively applied in the same way to other states.

original: sbyor ba'i stobs kyis ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba nyid kyi mjug thogs su thog ma kho nar gzugs na spyod pa'i sems 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i stobs kyis ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba nyid kyi mjug thogs su thog ma kho nar gzugs na spyod pa'i sems 'byung ngo //
translated: The power of preparation is that at the conclusion of a virtuous mind active in the desire realm, a form realm mind arises for the first time.

original: mi lcogs pa med pa'i dge ba'i mjug thogs su dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: mi lcogs pa med pa'i dge ba'i mjug thogs su dngos gzhi'o //
translated: The power of the actual basis is that at the conclusion of a virtuous mind of unrestricted access concentration, the actual basis arises.

original: dngos gzhi'i mjug thogs su bsam gtan gnyis pa'i nyer bsdogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas rgya cher srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i mjug thogs su bsam gtan gnyis pa'i nyer bsdogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas rgya cher srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du rig par bya'o //
translated: At the conclusion of the actual basis, the preparation of the second absorption arises and so on, up to the peak of existence.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i stobs kyis ni dag pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems res 'ga' ni dag pa pa gnyis skye'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i stobs kyis ni dag pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems res 'ga' ni dag pa pa gnyis skye'o //
translated: The power of meditative equipoise is that sometimes two pure minds arise from a pure mind entering meditative attainment.

original: res 'ga' ni nyon mongs pa can no //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni nyon mongs pa can no //
translated: Sometimes an afflicted mind arises.

original: 'phen pa'i stobs kyis ni ting nge 'dzin las langs nas rgyu ba na ji srid du de dang mi mthun pa nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung bas yongs su nyams par ma gyur ba de srid du mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i sems dang / mnyam @28b par ma bzhag pa'i skad cig 'dren mar rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: 'phen pa'i stobs kyis ni ting nge 'dzin las langs nas rgyu ba na ji srid du de dang mi mthun pa nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung bas yongs su nyams par ma gyur ba de srid du mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i sems dang / mnyam @28b par ma bzhag pa'i skad cig 'dren mar rjes su 'jug go //
translated: By the power of projection, when one has arisen from meditative concentration and is moving about, one is engaged in the mind of the stage of meditative concentration and in the mind of the stage of non-meditative concentration, as long as one has not fallen away through the arising of the passions that are adverse to it.

original: de dang mi mthun pa nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems ni rgyu la sogs pa'i stobs bzhis kun tu 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems ni rgyu la sogs pa'i stobs bzhis kun tu 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The mind associated with the passions that are adverse to it should be understood as arising by the power of the four causes, etc.

original: de la rgyu'i stobs kyis ni gal te gdon mi za bar yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i sgrib pa sngon bsags par gyur pa'o //üîΩyul gyi stobs kyis ni gal te 'dod chags la sos pa 'byung ba dang mthun pa /
analyzed: de la rgyu'i stobs kyis ni gal te gdon mi za bar yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i sgrib pa sngon bsags par gyur pa'o // yul gyi stobs kyis ni gal te 'dod chags la sos pa 'byung ba dang mthun pa /
translated: By the power of cause, if there is an obstruction previously accumulated that one must necessarily fall away from.üîΩBy the power of object, if there is an object that appears with a powerful sign of the agreeable, etc., favorable to the arising of passion.

original: sdug pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i stobs shas che ba'i yul snang bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sdug pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i stobs shas che ba'i yul snang bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By the power of attention, if one attends to the object in a way that is favorable to the arising of passion.

original: dran pa'i stobs kyis ni gal te dran pa'i kun tu rtog pa dag gis 'das pa'i yul la 'pho bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa'i stobs kyis ni gal te dran pa'i kun tu rtog pa dag gis 'das pa'i yul la 'pho bar byed pa'o //
translated: By the power of memory, if one is carried away by the memory of past objects.

original: yid la byed pa'i stobs kyis ni gal te spyod pa'i yid la byed pas sdug pa'i mtshan ma gang yang rung ba yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i stobs kyis ni gal te spyod pa'i yid la byed pas sdug pa'i mtshan ma gang yang rung ba yid la byed pa'o //
translated: By the power of attention, if one attends to any sign of beauty through the attention of practice.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i stobs kyis ni /
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i stobs kyis ni /
translated: By the power of rebirth,

original: 'chi ba'i sems rnam pa dgu ste lus la sred pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa khams gsum du so sor 'dod pa dang gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa dag go //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i sems rnam pa dgu ste lus la sred pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa khams gsum du so sor 'dod pa dang gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa dag go //
translated: there are nine kinds of death-states of mind: those associated with craving for the body in the three realms, each of which is distinct, and those in the desire, form, and formless realms.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams de nyid du nying mtshams sbyor ba'i 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus la sred pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni 'chi 'pho ba'i sems su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams de nyid du nying mtshams sbyor ba'i 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus la sred pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni 'chi 'pho ba'i sems su rig par bya'o //
translated: Among them, the death-state of mind associated with craving for the body in the desire realm should be known as the death-state of mind of one who dies in the desire realm and is reborn in the desire realm.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i 'chi ba'i sems su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i 'chi ba'i sems su rig par bya'o //
translated: The mind that enters the form and formless realms should be understood as the death mind of the form and formless realms.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas de nyid dang / gzhan du skyes pa'i sems kyang drug tu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas de nyid dang / gzhan du skyes pa'i sems kyang drug tu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the mind that dies in the form and formless realms and is born in those realms and other realms should be applied in six ways.

original: lus la sred pa de ni lhan cig skyes pa dang / dmigs pa la mi spyod pa dang / bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan ba'o //
analyzed: lus la sred pa de ni lhan cig skyes pa dang / dmigs pa la mi spyod pa dang / bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan ba'o //
translated: Craving for the body is innate, does not engage its object, and is an obscured neutral state.

original: lus dang lhan cig skyes pa 'di ni dmigs pa ni rnam pa yongs su mi gcod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lus dang lhan cig skyes pa 'di ni dmigs pa ni rnam pa yongs su mi gcod par rig par bya ste /
translated: This craving for the body is innate and does not fully eliminate its object.

original: de'i dbang gis de ma thag tu so so'i skye bo rnams ni bar ma do'i srid par nying mtshams sbyor ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis de ma thag tu so so'i skye bo rnams ni bar ma do'i srid par nying mtshams sbyor ro //
translated: Through its power, ordinary beings immediately connect to intermediate existence.

original: 'phags pa 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams ni 'chi ba'i dus na ji tsam du 'du shes mi gsal ba'i gnas skabs su ma gyur pa de srid du sred pa de kun tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams ni 'chi ba'i dus na ji tsam du 'du shes mi gsal ba'i gnas skabs su ma gyur pa de srid du sred pa de kun tu 'byung ngo //
translated: For noble ones who are not detached, craving arises as long as the state of non-clarity of ideation at the moment of death has not occurred.

original: de dag ni yongs su rtogs nas gnyen pos tshar gcod do //
analyzed: de dag ni yongs su rtogs nas gnyen pos tshar gcod do //
translated: But when they have fully understood it, they destroy it by means of the antidote.

original: 'phags pa 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams ni ma spongs su zin kyang gnyen po'i stobs che bas de kun tu mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams ni ma spongs su zin kyang gnyen po'i stobs che bas de kun tu mi 'byung ngo //
translated: For noble ones who are detached, craving does not arise, even though it has not been abandoned, because the power of the antidote is strong.

original: de'i bag la nyal gyi dbang gis ni de dag nying mtshams @29a * //üîΩsbyor ro // bar ma do'i srid pa'i nying mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ni rtag tu ma bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i bag la nyal gyi dbang gis ni de dag nying mtshams @29a * // sbyor ro // bar ma do'i srid pa'i nying mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ni rtag tu ma bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa nyid de /
translated: They are reborn by the power of the latent tendencies of craving.

original: rnam par smin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The moment of conception of the intermediate existence is always unobscured-non-defined, because it is the result.

original: de'i 'og tu ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar te /
translated: After that, it is virtuous, non-virtuous, or non-defined, as is appropriate.

original: 'chi 'pho ba'i sems ma gtogs so //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba'i sems ma gtogs so //
translated: Except for the mind of death.

original: bar mdo'i srid pa'i 'chi 'pho ba'i sems ni rtag tu nyon mongs pa can te /
analyzed: bar mdo'i srid pa'i 'chi 'pho ba'i sems ni rtag tu nyon mongs pa can te /
translated: The mind of death and transmigration in the intermediate existence is always defiled.

original: 'chi 'pho ba'i srid pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba'i srid pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the existence at death.

original: skye ba'i nying mtshams sbyor ba ni rtag tu ma bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i nying mtshams sbyor ba ni rtag tu ma bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The mind of rebirth is always unobscured-indeterminate.

original: byang chub sems dpa' smon lam gyi stobs kyis skye ba rnams kyi 'chi ba'i sems la sogs pa ni thams cad kyang gcig tu dge bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' smon lam gyi stobs kyis skye ba rnams kyi 'chi ba'i sems la sogs pa ni thams cad kyang gcig tu dge bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The minds of death, etc., of bodhisattvas who are reborn through the power of their vow are all wholesome.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The section on the condition as immediate antecedent is completed.

original: // / yul yongs su chad pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: // / yul yongs su chad pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The object that is a limited domain

original: rnam par shes pa tshogs lnga po dag gi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tshogs lnga po dag gi dmigs pa ste /
translated: is the object of the five collections of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag gi yul so sor nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag gi yul so sor nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object of the five collections of consciousness is a limited domain because their objects are specific.üîΩThe object that is not a limited domain

original: yul yongs su ma chad pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: yul yongs su ma chad pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ste /
translated: is the object of mental consciousness.

original: chos thams cad yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all dharmas are the object of mental consciousness.

original: yul la bkra bar 'dzin pa med pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni ming lam byang ba rnams kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: yul la bkra bar 'dzin pa med pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni ming lam byang ba rnams kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ste /
translated: The object of the mental consciousness of those who are skilled in names is called the object of the non-apprehension of the variety of objects.

original: ming dang yi ger byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming dang yi ger byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it cannot be made into a name or a letter.

original: yul la bkra bar 'dzin pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yul la bkra bar 'dzin pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The object of the mental consciousness of those who are not skilled in names is called the object of the apprehension of the variety of objects.

original: de las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as the opposite of the former.

original: dngos po dang bcas pa'i yul gyi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang / nga rgyal dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa dag gi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang bcas pa'i yul gyi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang / nga rgyal dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa dag gi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object of those other than the views, pride, and the dharmas associated with them is called the object of the object with entity.

original: dngos po med ba'i yul gyi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni ma gtogs pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po med ba'i yul gyi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni ma gtogs pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ste /
translated: The object of those excluded is called the object of the object without entity.

original: bdag gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the self is the basis.

original: dngos po'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dngos po'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The object of the views, pride, and the dharmas associated with them is called the object of the object without entity.

original: zag pa med pa la dmigs pa dang / skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams dang / sa'i kun tu 'gro ba rnams dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dmigs pa gzhi gtan la phebs pa med pa ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa dag gi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa la dmigs pa dang / skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams dang / sa'i kun tu 'gro ba rnams dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dmigs pa gzhi gtan la phebs pa med pa ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa dag gi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object of the uncontaminated, the universal of different realms and stages, and the future, are excluded.

original: kun tu brtags pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni ma gtogs pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni ma gtogs pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ste /
translated: The object of the imagined is the object of those excluded.

original: rang gi kun brtags pa tsam la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩphyin ci @29b log gi dmigs pa zhes bya ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par byung ba rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi kun brtags pa tsam la dmigs pa'i phyir ro // phyin ci @29b log gi dmigs pa zhes bya ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par byung ba rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Because it is the object of mere imagination of what is self-imagined.üîΩThe object of the inverted is the object of those that arise in the aspect of permanence, etc.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'byung ba rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'byung ba rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object of the non-inverted is the object of those that arise in the aspect of impermanence, etc.

original: thogs pa dang bcas ba'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas ba'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object of the obstructed is the object of those that have not abandoned the obscurations to omniscience.

original: thogs pa med pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa spong ba rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa spong ba rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object of the absence of obstruction is the object of those who eliminate obscurations.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen gyi rnam par nges pa ni mtshan nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba dang ; bzhag pa dang / yongs su shes pa dang spangs pas kyang dmigs pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen gyi rnam par nges pa ni mtshan nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba dang ; bzhag pa dang / yongs su shes pa dang spangs pas kyang dmigs pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The definition of the objective condition should be understood as follows: by way of characteristic, differentiation, establishment, thorough knowledge, and abandonment.

original: mtshan nyid kyis ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How so by way of characteristic?

original: don gang der snang ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / de dag byung nas kyang don de la mngon par zhen pa dang / tha snyad 'dogs pa dang / so so rang gis rig par 'gyur ba ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: don gang der snang ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / de dag byung nas kyang don de la mngon par zhen pa dang / tha snyad 'dogs pa dang / so so rang gis rig par 'gyur ba ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The objective condition is the cause of the occurrence of mind and mental functions in regard to an object that appears as an object, and, after they have occurred, it is the adherence to that object, the verbal expression of it, and the individual intuitive knowledge of it.

original: rab tu dbye bas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rab tu dbye bas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How so by way of differentiation?

original: med pa'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: med pa'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The nonexistent object is as follows:

original: sems dang sems las byung ba phyin ci log pa rnams kyi dmigs pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / rmi lam dang / gzugs brnyan dang / sgyu ma la sogs pa'i dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba phyin ci log pa rnams kyi dmigs pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / rmi lam dang / gzugs brnyan dang / sgyu ma la sogs pa'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object of the mind and mental activities that are erroneous, the object of the past, future, dreams, reflections, illusions, etc.

original: yod pa'i dmigs pa ni de las gzhan pa dag gi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa'i dmigs pa ni de las gzhan pa dag gi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The existent object is the object of the rest.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i dmigs pa ni gzugs dang / sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas so //üîΩdmigs pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i dmigs pa ni gzugs dang / sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas so // dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The nonexistent object is form, the unconditioned, and the mental activities that do not accompany the mind.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: The object that is both existent and nonexistent is the mind and mental activities.üîΩThe object that is neither existent nor nonexistent is the object of the knowledge of reality.

original: yang dag pa nyid kyi dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste dge ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid kyi dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste dge ba'o //
translated: The object of reality is the wholesome.

original: log pa nyid kyi dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste nyon mongs pa can no //
analyzed: log pa nyid kyi dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste nyon mongs pa can no //
translated: The object of unreality is the defiled.üîΩThe object that is both real and unreal is the obscured indeterminate.

original: yang dag pa nyid kyang ma yin la log pa nyid kyang ma yin pa'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste ma bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid kyang ma yin la log pa nyid kyang ma yin pa'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste ma bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: The object that is neither real nor unreal is the unobscured indeterminate.

original: tshul bzhin gyi dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshul bzhin gyi dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The proper object of meditation is as follows.üîΩ

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i dge ba rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //üîΩtshul bzhin ma yin pa'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i dge ba rnams kyi dmigs pa'o // tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The proper object is the object of the wholesome thoughts and thoughtconcomitants.

original: nyon mongs pa can rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The improper object is the object of the defiled thoughts and thoughtconcomitants.

original: tshul bzhin yang ma yin la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yang ma yin pa'i dmigs pa ni de dag ma gtogs pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //üîΩ'dra ba'i dmigs pa @30a * //üîΩni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshul bzhin yang ma yin la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yang ma yin pa'i dmigs pa ni de dag ma gtogs pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'o // 'dra ba'i dmigs pa @30a * // ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The object that is neither proper nor improper is the object of the thoughts and thoughtconcomitants that are neither defiled nor wholesome.

original: dge ba la sogs pa rnams kyi dge ba la sogs pa dang / rang gis pa rnams kyi rang gis pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa rnams kyi zag pa med pa'o //üîΩmi mthun pa'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa rnams kyi dge ba la sogs pa dang / rang gis pa rnams kyi rang gis pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa rnams kyi zag pa med pa'o //üîΩmi mthun pa'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The similar object is the object of the wholesome, etc., thoughts and thoughtconcomitants, of the thoughts and thoughtconcomitants that are associated with a certain stage, of the thoughts and thoughtconcomitants that are associated with a certain realm, and of the thoughts and thoughtconcomitants that are associated with a certain spiritual level.üîΩThe dissimilar object is the object of the thoughts and thoughtconcomitants that are not associated with a certain stage, that are not associated with a certain realm, and that are not associated with a certain spiritual level.

original: dge ba la sogs pa rnams kyi mi dge ba la sogs pa dang / sa gzhan pa rnams kyi sa gzhan pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa rnams kyi zag pa med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa rnams kyi mi dge ba la sogs pa dang / sa gzhan pa rnams kyi sa gzhan pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa rnams kyi zag pa med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The object of nonvirtue, etc. is the object of virtue, etc.üîΩThe object of the same stage is the object of the dharmas of the same stage.üîΩThe object of the other stage is the object of the dharmas of the other stage.

original: sna tshogs kyi dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The object of the contaminated is the object of the uncontaminated, and vice versa.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //üîΩgcig bu'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'o // gcig bu'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The object of the various is the object of the mind and mental factors that are with initial and sustained thought.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba mi rtog mi dpyod pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //üîΩ'bral ba'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba mi rtog mi dpyod pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'o // 'bral ba'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The object of the single is the object of the mind and mental factors that are without initial and sustained thought.

original: 'du shes med pa la sogs pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / nam mkha' dang rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa la sogs pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / nam mkha' dang rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi dmigs pa'o //
