translated: The object of separation is the object of the mind and mental factors of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, the sphere of infinite consciousness, and the sphere of infinite space.

original: 'bral ba ni med par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'bral ba ni med par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Separation means non-existence.

original: gzhan du na 'bral ba chen po nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na 'bral ba chen po nyid la bya'o //
translated: Or else, it should be understood as a great separation.

original: bsdus pa phra ba'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsdus pa phra ba'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The subtle object of concentration is as follows:

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //
translated: the object of the sphere of nothingness.

original: mthar phyin pa'i phra ba'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mthar phyin pa'i phra ba'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The subtle object of perfection is as follows:

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //
translated: the object of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dmigs pa ni des dmigs par byed pa'i phyir dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dmigs pa ni des dmigs par byed pa'i phyir dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The object of defilement is called an object because it is perceived by that.

original: mdo sde'i tshig la yod pa'i chos kyi dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mdo sde'i tshig la yod pa'i chos kyi dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The object of the Dharma that exists in the words of the sutras is as follows:

original: gtsug lag rnams kyi ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams so /
analyzed: gtsug lag rnams kyi ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams so /
translated: the collection of names, the collection of words, and the collection of letters in the scriptures.

original: don gyi dmigs pa ni de la brten pa brjod par bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: don gyi dmigs pa ni de la brten pa brjod par bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: The object of meaning is the meaning to be expressed that is based on that.

original: chung ngu'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: chung ngu'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The small object is as follows:

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa'o //
translated: the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle.

original: rgya chen po'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgya chen po'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The great object is as follows:

original: theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'o //
translated: the Great Vehicle.

original: mtshan ma'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The object of signs is as follows:

original: zhi gnas dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma rnams so //üîΩmtshan ma med pa'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma rnams so // mtshan ma med pa'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: the signs of serenity, of exertion, and of equanimity.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'o //üîΩde kho na'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste //üîΩde bzhin nyid dang / rnam pa bcu drug po dag gi dmigs pa'i bden pa rnams so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'o // de kho na'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste // de bzhin nyid dang / rnam pa bcu drug po dag gi dmigs pa'i bden pa rnams so //
translated: The signless object refers to nirvana and the summit of existence.

original: gnas par bya ba'i @30b dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /üîΩ'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sbyor ba sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas par bya ba'i @30b dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sbyor ba sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object of reality refers to the suchness of the truths that are the objects of the sixteen aspects such as impermanence.

original: dbang bsgyur ba'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dbang bsgyur ba'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The object of abiding refers to the object of the mind and mental activities that are applied to the attainment of cessation.

original: rnam par thar pa la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i yon tan rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //üîΩskad cig pa'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i yon tan rnams kyi dmigs pa'o // skad cig pa'i dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The object of mastery refers to the object of all the qualities of the transcendences, etc., up to and including omniscience.

original: mi slob pa rnams kyi tshe de nyid do //
analyzed: mi slob pa rnams kyi tshe de nyid do //
translated: The momentary object refers to the object of the nonlearner, who is in his final existence.

original: rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyi dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyi dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The object of those who follow is as follows:

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: gzhan pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the other?

original: de bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir dmigs pa yongs su ma grub pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir dmigs pa yongs su ma grub pas so //
translated: The object is not established in the same way, because it is not established.

original: rnam pa bzhis yongs su ma grub pa'i dmigs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhis yongs su ma grub pa'i dmigs par rig par bya ste /
translated: The object that is not established should be known as fourfold:

original: rnam par shes pa ji mthun pa'i rgyu dang / dmigs pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa dmigs pa dang / bsgribs pa med par yang phyin ci log med par 'gyur ba dang / shes pa gsum gyi rjes su mthun par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ji mthun pa'i rgyu dang / dmigs pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa dmigs pa dang / bsgribs pa med par yang phyin ci log med par 'gyur ba dang / shes pa gsum gyi rjes su mthun par 'gyur bas so //
translated: the cause that is in accordance with consciousness, the object of consciousness that is without an object, the non-obstruction that is without error, and the conformity with the three knowledges.

original: de'i phyir 'dzin pa yang yongs su ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dzin pa yang yongs su ma grub pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the grasping is also not established.

original: shes pa rnam pa gsum ni dbang gi shes pa dang / lhag mthong gi shes pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa rnam pa gsum ni dbang gi shes pa dang / lhag mthong gi shes pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of knowledge are the knowledge of power, the knowledge of insight, and the non-conceptual knowledge.

original: de la rnam pa bzhi'i dper brjod pa ni //
analyzed: de la rnam pa bzhi'i dper brjod pa ni //
translated: Here, the four kinds are illustrated by examples.

original: yi dgas dud 'gro mi rnam dang // lha rnams ji ltar rigs rigs su //
analyzed: yi dgas dud 'gro mi rnam dang // lha rnams ji ltar rigs rigs su //
translated: In accordance with their respective karma,

original: dngos gcig yid ni tha dad phyir //
analyzed: dngos gcig yid ni tha dad phyir //
translated: Perceive a single thing in different ways.

original: don ma grub par 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: don ma grub par 'dod pa yin //
translated: Therefore, the object is not established.

original: 'das sogs de bzhin rmi lam dang // gzugs brnyan rnam pa gnyis po yang //
analyzed: 'das sogs de bzhin rmi lam dang // gzugs brnyan rnam pa gnyis po yang //
translated: The past and so forth, as well as the two types of illusions,

original: med phyir dmigs pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: med phyir dmigs pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: Are not perceived because they do not exist.

original: de ni dmigs par rung ma yin /
analyzed: de ni dmigs par rung ma yin /
translated: Therefore, they are not suitable to be perceived.

original: don ni don du grub gyur na //üîΩmi rtog ye shes med par 'gyur //
analyzed: don ni don du grub gyur na // mi rtog ye shes med par 'gyur //
translated: If the object were established as an object,üîΩNon-conceptual wisdom would not exist.

original: shes pa rtog pa med mi 'gyur //
analyzed: shes pa rtog pa med mi 'gyur //
translated: Consciousness would not be non-conceptual.

original: de med pas na sangs rgyas nyid //
analyzed: de med pas na sangs rgyas nyid //
translated: Without that, buddhahood

original: thob par 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thob par 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Would not be tenable.üîΩFor the bodhisattvas who have attained mastery

original: byang chub sems dpa' dbang thob dang // rnal 'byor pa la 'di ltar yang //üîΩmos pa'i dbang gis sa la sogs //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dbang thob dang // rnal 'byor pa la 'di ltar yang // mos pa'i dbang gis sa la sogs //
translated: And for the yogis, in the same way,üîΩEarth and so forth are perceived

original: dngos po de ltar dmigs par 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos po de ltar dmigs par 'gyur //
translated: In accordance with their aspirations.üîΩHere, for those who have attained the accomplishment of discernment

original: 'di la rnam par 'byed grub dang // blo ldan zhi ba thob pa yi //
analyzed: 'di la rnam par 'byed grub dang // blo ldan zhi ba thob pa yi //
translated: And for the wise who have attained peace,

original: chos kun yid la byed pa la //
analyzed: chos kun yid la byed pa la //
translated: When all phenomena are brought to mind,

original: de ltar don ni snang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de ltar don ni snang ba'i phyir //
translated: In that way, objects appear.

original: mi rtog ye shes rgyu ba la //
analyzed: mi rtog ye shes rgyu ba la //
translated: The non-conceptual intuition is the cause of the non-perception of all objects.

original: don kun snang ba med phyir yang //
analyzed: don kun snang ba med phyir yang //
translated: And also, because of the non-perception of all objects,

original: don med khong du chud bar bya //
analyzed: don med khong du chud bar bya //
translated: one should understand that there is no object.

original: de med pas na rnam rig med //
analyzed: de med pas na rnam rig med //
translated: And because of the non-existence of that, there is no consciousness.

original: yongs su shes pas ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩmtshan nyid @31a * //
analyzed: yongs su shes pas ji lta bu zhe na / mtshan nyid @31a * //
translated: How is it through thorough knowledge?üîΩThrough thorough knowledge of the characteristics,

original: dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / gzhag pa rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / gzhag pa rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the differentiation, and the establishment of the three kinds of objects.

original: spong bas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: spong bas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it through abandonment?

original: nyan thos dang theg pa chen pos gnas gyur pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang theg pa chen pos gnas gyur pa ste /
translated: Through the transformation of the disciples and the universal vehicle.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pas gnas gyur pas ni /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pas gnas gyur pas ni /
translated: Through the transformation of the disciples' vehicle,

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi dmigs pa dag las rnam par thar gyi /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi dmigs pa dag las rnam par thar gyi /
translated: one is liberated from the objective supports of the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields,

original: de dag la dbang 'byor pa thob pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag la dbang 'byor pa thob pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but one does not attain mastery over them.

original: theg pa chen pos gnas gyur pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen pos gnas gyur pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: Through the transformation of the universal vehicle, one attains both.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhung ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par nges pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhung ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par nges pa rdzogs so /
translated: The ascertainment of the objective condition according to the treatise is completed.

original: // / rten la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba la rlung gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ni chu'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa la rten la dbang byed pas bdag po'i rkyen to //
analyzed: // / rten la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba la rlung gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ni chu'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa la rten la dbang byed pas bdag po'i rkyen to //
translated: The wind ma·πá·∏çala, etc. are the dominant condition for the water ma·πá·∏çala, etc.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten ni sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi'o //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten ni sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi'o //
translated: The world of sentient beings is for the world of the physical cosmos.

original: 'byung ba rnams ni 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams ni 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The primary elements are for the derivative form.

original: dbang po rnams ni rnam par shes pa rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni rnam par shes pa rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The sense faculties are for the consciousnesses, and so on.üîΩThe condition of projecting

original: 'phen pa la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba la sems can thams cad kyi thun mong gi las ni snod kyi 'jig rten 'phen pa la dbang byed bas bdag po'i rkyen to //
analyzed: 'phen pa la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba la sems can thams cad kyi thun mong gi las ni snod kyi 'jig rten 'phen pa la dbang byed bas bdag po'i rkyen to //
translated: means the condition of dominance. The collective karma of all sentient beings is the dominant condition for projecting the physical cosmos.

original: sngon gyi zag pa dang bcas pa'i las rnams ni rnam par smin pa'i'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi zag pa dang bcas pa'i las rnams ni rnam par smin pa'i'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Previous contaminated karma is for the karmic maturation, and so on.üîΩThe condition of simultaneous arising

original: lhan cig 'byung ba la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: means the condition of dominance.

original: sems ni sems las byung ba rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung ba la dbang byed pas bdag po'i rkyen to //
analyzed: sems ni sems las byung ba rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung ba la dbang byed pas bdag po'i rkyen to //
translated: The mind is the dominant condition of the mental factors in their co-arising.

original: yid la byed pa ni sems kyi'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni sems kyi'o //
translated: Attention is the dominant condition of the mind.

original: reg pa ni tshor ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa ni tshor ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Contact is the dominant condition of feeling.

original: 'di man chad ni dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: 'di man chad ni dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: From here on, the twenty-two faculties are presented as the dominant condition.

original: bdag por rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag por rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that they are established as the dominant condition in relation to their own effects.

original: de la yul la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid kyi dbang po rnams te /
analyzed: de la yul la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid kyi dbang po rnams te /
translated: Among them, the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind faculties are the dominant conditions for the objects,

original: de'i dbang gis gzugs la sogs pa mngon par 'grub ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis gzugs la sogs pa mngon par 'grub ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because form, etc. are manifested by their power.

original: skye bar dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni pho dang mo'i dbang po ste /
analyzed: skye bar dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni pho dang mo'i dbang po ste /
translated: The male and female faculties are the dominant conditions for birth,

original: de'i dbang gis mngal du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis mngal du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they enter the womb by their power.

original: gnas par dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni srog gi dbang po ste /
analyzed: gnas par dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni srog gi dbang po ste /
translated: The life faculty is the dominant condition for abiding,

original: de'i dbang gis ris mthun par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis ris mthun par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one abides in a homogeneous group by its power.

original: 'bras bu la nye bar spyod par dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams te /
analyzed: 'bras bu la nye bar spyod par dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams te /
translated: The faculties of pleasure, pain, mental pleasure, mental pain, and indifference are called the faculties of experiencing the result.üîΩ

original: de'i @31b dbang gis sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i rnam par smin pa so sor nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩ'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi dbang po rnams te /
analyzed: de'i @31b dbang gis sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i rnam par smin pa so sor nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro // 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi dbang po rnams te /
translated: The faculties of pleasure, mental pleasure, mental pain, and indifference are called the faculties of experiencing the result, because one experiences the agreeable, disagreeable, etc., results of good and bad actions.

original: de dag gis nyon mongs pa rnam par gnon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis nyon mongs pa rnam par gnon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The faculties of faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom are called the faculties of purification of the mundane world, because by them one conquers the defilements.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po la rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po la rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The faculty of mastery over supramundane purity is to be known as the faculty of the conviction that the dharmas are not produced, the faculty of perfect knowledge, and the faculty of the final and perfect knowledge.

original: de dag gis bag la nyal legs par bcom pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrnam par shes pa dang ma bral zhing de dang 'dra ba'i dbang po yul la rgyun du 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni brten pa mtshungs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gis bag la nyal legs par bcom pa'i phyir ro // rnam par shes pa dang ma bral zhing de dang 'dra ba'i dbang po yul la rgyun du 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni brten pa mtshungs par rig par bya ste /
translated: Because they completely destroy the latent impressions.üîΩThe faculty of the same nature as the consciousness is to be known as the faculty of the same nature as the support.

original: rnam par shes pa dang ldan zhing rnam par shes pa dang 'dri ba'i dbang po yul rnams la rgyun du 'byung zhing rnam par shes pa 'byung ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir dbang po de ni brten pa dang mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ldan zhing rnam par shes pa dang 'dri ba'i dbang po yul rnams la rgyun du 'byung zhing rnam par shes pa 'byung ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir dbang po de ni brten pa dang mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The faculty of the same nature as the consciousness is the faculty of the same nature as the support, because it is associated with consciousness and because it is the support for the arising of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa dang bral zhing rang dang 'dra ba rgyun du 'byung bas zhes bya ba ni de dag dang mtshungs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang bral zhing rang dang 'dra ba rgyun du 'byung bas zhes bya ba ni de dag dang mtshungs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSimilar to itself‚Äù means that it is similar to those, because it is always present, being free from consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa dang mi ldan pa'i dbang po bdag nyid dang 'dra ba ni rgyun du 'byung zhing dbang po'i mtshan nyid dang 'dra ba'i phyir de dang mtshungs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang mi ldan pa'i dbang po bdag nyid dang 'dra ba ni rgyun du 'byung zhing dbang po'i mtshan nyid dang 'dra ba'i phyir de dang mtshungs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The sense faculty that is not associated with consciousness is similar to itself, because it is always present and similar to the characteristics of the sense faculty.

original: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig ces bya ba ni mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig ces bya ba ni mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúOne part of the form aggregate‚Äù refers to the five sense faculties such as the eye, etc.

original: gzugs can gyi khams dang skye mched lnga'o zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs ba nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs can gyi khams dang skye mched lnga'o zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs ba nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe five elements and sense bases that have form‚Äù refers to the eye, etc.

original: tshor ba 'byung ba'i gnas kyi gzugs kyi zhes bya ba ni gzugs gang la brten nas tshor ba 'byung ba de zin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba 'byung ba'i gnas kyi gzugs kyi zhes bya ba ni gzugs gang la brten nas tshor ba 'byung ba de zin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe form that is the basis for the arising of feeling‚Äù means that form upon which feeling arises is called ‚Äúappropriated.‚Äù

original: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig ces bya ba ni gnas dang bcas pa'i dbang pos bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig ces bya ba ni gnas dang bcas pa'i dbang pos bsdus pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne part of the form aggregate‚Äù refers to that included in the sense faculties together with their bases.

original: khams dang skye mched gzugs can lnga //
analyzed: khams dang skye mched gzugs can lnga //
translated: The five that are elements and sense bases are form.

original: zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'o //
translated: The five that are elements and sense bases are the eye, etc.

original: bzhi'i phyogs gcig go zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dbang po las gzhan du ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi'i phyogs gcig go zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dbang po las gzhan du ma gyur pa'o //
translated: One part of four is form, smell, taste, and the tangible that are not faculties.

original: yul la 'dzin par dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa drug ste /
analyzed: yul la 'dzin par dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa drug ste /
translated: The six beginning with the eye are the controlling faculties with regard to the apprehension of the object-field.

original: de'i dbang gis gzugs la sogs pa'i dmigs pa la sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩrigs kyi rgyud la dbang byed pa zhes @32a * //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis gzugs la sogs pa'i dmigs pa la sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'byung ba'i phyir ro // rigs kyi rgyud la dbang byed pa zhes @32a * //
translated: Because the mind and mental activities arise with regard to the object-field of form, etc., through the power of the eye, etc.

original: bya ba ni pho dang mo'i dbang po ste /
analyzed: bya ba ni pho dang mo'i dbang po ste /
translated: The two sexual organs are the controlling faculties with regard to the continuity of the family.

original: de las bu dang tsha bo la sogs pa'i rigs 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las bu dang tsha bo la sogs pa'i rigs 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the family of sons and grandsons, etc., continues through them.

original: lhag ma ni bdag po'i rkyen ji skad bstan pa de bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni bdag po'i rkyen ji skad bstan pa de bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood according to the principle of the dominant condition as it has been explained.

original: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig ces bya ba ni /
translated: One part of the aggregate of form is the controlling faculty of the body.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / pho dang mo'i dbang po'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / pho dang mo'i dbang po'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The eye faculty, the ear faculty, the nose faculty, the tongue faculty, the body faculty, the mind faculty, the male faculty, and the female faculty.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig ces bya ba ni srog dang / dad ba dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig ces bya ba ni srog dang / dad ba dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: One part of the aggregate of formations is the vitality faculty, and the faculties of faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: khams bcu gnyis zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams so //
analyzed: khams bcu gnyis zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams so //
translated: Twelve elements are the faculties and the consciousness elements.

original: skye mched drug ces bya ba ni nang gi rnams so //
analyzed: skye mched drug ces bya ba ni nang gi rnams so //
translated: Six sense bases are the internal ones.

original: chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig go zhes bya ba ni srog gi dbang po dang / bde ba la sogs pa dang dad pa la sogs pa lnga lnga'o //üîΩsdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig go zhes bya ba ni srog gi dbang po dang / bde ba la sogs pa dang dad pa la sogs pa lnga lnga'o // sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid yin te /
translated: One part of the element and the sense base of mental objects is the vitality faculty, and the five faculties beginning with pleasure and the five faculties beginning with faith.üîΩThe faculty of suffering is suffering by the very nature of suffering.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kho nas sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kho nas sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid do //
translated: It is the suffering of suffering because of its very nature.

original: de las 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa dbang po dang / don rnams dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams ni sdug bsngal myong bar byed pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid du blta'o //
analyzed: de las 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa dbang po dang / don rnams dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams ni sdug bsngal myong bar byed pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid du blta'o //
translated: The faculties, objects, and their concomitants, which are the causes of that, are seen as the suffering of suffering because they cause the experience of suffering.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba dang / de myong bar byed pa'i chos rnams 'gyur bas yid mi bde ba 'byung ba'i phyir de 'gyur ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid do //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba dang / de myong bar byed pa'i chos rnams 'gyur bas yid mi bde ba 'byung ba'i phyir de 'gyur ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid do //
translated: The suffering of change is the change of pleasant feelings and the dharmas that cause their experience, because mental dissatisfaction arises from their change.

original: de la yang rjes su chags pas sems 'gyur ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la yang rjes su chags pas sems 'gyur ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid du rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the change of the mind due to attachment should be known as the suffering of change.

original: ji skad du zhen nas gyur pa'i sems kyis zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du zhen nas gyur pa'i sems kyis zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said, ‚Äúwith a mind that is changed due to attachment.‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / de myong bar byed pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyi gnas ngan len dang ldan pa dang /üîΩsdug bsngal de gnyis las rnam par ma grol bas res 'ga' ni bde ba'i gnas skabs la brten /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / de myong bar byed pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyi gnas ngan len dang ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal de gnyis las rnam par ma grol bas res 'ga' ni bde ba'i gnas skabs la brten /
translated: The feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant is associated with the store consciousness, and the formative forces that experience it are associated with the negative reflex actions of the suffering of pain and the suffering of change.

original: res 'ga' ni sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs la brten te /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs la brten te /
translated: Since one is not liberated from these two kinds of suffering, sometimes one experiences a state of pleasure and sometimes one experiences a state of pain.

original: rtag tu khor mor sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs su 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag tu khor mor sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs su 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But one never experiences a state that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: de lta bas na mi rtag pa rjes su bcings pas grub pa dang / bde ba ma yin pa'i phyir 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na mi rtag pa rjes su bcings pas grub pa dang / bde ba ma yin pa'i phyir 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because of the bondage to impermanence and because of the absence of pleasure, the suffering of the formative forces should be understood.

original: phung po @32b rnams dang khams gsum ni yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams so //
analyzed: phung po @32b rnams dang khams gsum ni yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams so //
translated: The aggregates and three realms are the mind, the entity, and the mind consciousness realms.

original: skye mched gnyis ni yid dang chos kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: skye mched gnyis ni yid dang chos kyi skye mched do //
translated: The two bases are the mind and entity bases.

original: phyogs gcig ma gtogs pa ni zag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: phyogs gcig ma gtogs pa ni zag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: One part is excluded, which is the uncontaminated characteristic.

original: thams cad do zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa dag go //
analyzed: thams cad do zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa dag go //
translated: All means the others.

original: mi dge ba dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par smin pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa ni phyi ma la yod de /
analyzed: mi dge ba dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par smin pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa ni phyi ma la yod de /
translated: The unwholesome and wholesome contaminated store consciousnesses, along with their associates, exist in the future.

original: de'i phyir rnam par smin pa des na de gnyis rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par smin pa des na de gnyis rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because of that maturation, those two are said to have maturation.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa mig la sogs pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa ni rnam par smin pa de las byung ba zhes brjod pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa mig la sogs pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa ni rnam par smin pa de las byung ba zhes brjod pa 'thob ste /
translated: The others, which are different from the store consciousness, such as the eye, etc., and pleasure, pain, etc., are said to be derived from that maturation,

original: de las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are born from it.

original: phung po rnams dang khams bcu zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa bdun dang / gzugs dang sgra dang / chos kyi khams rnams so //
analyzed: phung po rnams dang khams bcu zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa bdun dang / gzugs dang sgra dang / chos kyi khams rnams so //
translated: The aggregates and the ten elements are the seven consciousnesses, the form, sound, and entity elements.

original: skye mched bzhi zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang sgra dang / yid dang / chos kyi skye mched rnams so //
analyzed: skye mched bzhi zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang sgra dang / yid dang / chos kyi skye mched rnams so //
translated: The four bases are the form, sound, mind, and entity bases.

original: phyogs gcig go zhes bya ba ni lung du ma bstan pa dang / zag pa med pa ma rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig go zhes bya ba ni lung du ma bstan pa dang / zag pa med pa ma rtogs pa'o //
translated: One part is the indeterminate and uncognized.

original: 'ju bas kyang 'ju ba las gyur pa zhes bya ba ni kham gyi zas 'ju ba'i dus na dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po brtas par byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyul gyis kyang yul las gyur pa zhes bya ba ni reg pa'i zas te /üîΩyid du 'ong ba'i yul gyi gnas kyis reg pas lus la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ju bas kyang 'ju ba las gyur pa zhes bya ba ni kham gyi zas 'ju ba'i dus na dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po brtas par byed pa'i phyir ro // yul gyis kyang yul las gyur pa zhes bya ba ni reg pa'i zas te / yid du 'ong ba'i yul gyi gnas kyis reg pas lus la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is derived from grasping is also called ‚Äúderived from grasping‚Äù because at the time of the digestion of oral food, the great elements of the sense faculties are nourished.üîΩThat which is derived from objects is also called ‚Äúderived from objects‚Äù because the food of contact is the cause of the nourishment of the great elements of the sense faculties.

original: re bas kyang re ba las gyur pa zhes bya ba ni yid la sems pa'i zas te /
analyzed: re bas kyang re ba las gyur pa zhes bya ba ni yid la sems pa'i zas te /
translated: That which is derived from desire is also called ‚Äúderived from desire‚Äù because the food of volition is the cause of the nourishment of the great elements of the sense faculties.

original: 'dod pa'i dngos po dang 'brel ba'i re ba'i dbang gis lus la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dngos po dang 'brel ba'i re ba'i dbang gis lus la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it benefits the body by the power of hope for a desired object.

original: len pas kyang len pa las gyur pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i zas te /
analyzed: len pas kyang len pa las gyur pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i zas te /
translated: Also, appropriation is called ‚Äúarisen from appropriation‚Äù because it is the nutriment of consciousness.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i dbang gis lus gnas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i dbang gis lus gnas pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the body is maintained by the power of appropriating the store consciousness.

original: 'di ltar de dang bral na lus ru la bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro /üîΩyang zas rnam pa bzhi po dag ni bsdus nas rnam pa bzhis rnam par gzhag go /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dang bral na lus ru la bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro / yang zas rnam pa bzhi po dag ni bsdus nas rnam pa bzhis rnam par gzhag go /
translated: For, if it were separated from that, the body would perish.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, the four kinds of nutriment are established as four by their inclusion in the following four categories.

original: ma dag pa'i lus gnas par byed pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: ma dag pa'i lus gnas par byed pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyi ste /
translated: The nutriment that maintains the impure body is that of sentient beings in the realm of desire.

original: mtha' dag ni 'ching ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ma dag pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: mtha' dag ni 'ching ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ma dag pa'i gnas so //
translated: The body is impure because it is bound by all the bonds.

original: dag pa dang ma dag pa'i lus gnas par byed pa ni slob pa rnams dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo @33a * //üîΩrnams kyi ste /
analyzed: dag pa dang ma dag pa'i lus gnas par byed pa ni slob pa rnams dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo @33a * //üîΩrnams kyi ste /
translated: The nutriment that maintains the body that is both pure and impure is that of sentient beings in the realm of form and the formless realm.

original: 'ching ba'i lhag ma las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ching ba'i lhag ma las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the remainder of the fetters is karma.

original: dag pa'i lus gnas par byed pa ni dgra bcom pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: dag pa'i lus gnas par byed pa ni dgra bcom pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: The body of the pure is that of the arhats,

original: 'ching ba thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ching ba thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are completely liberated from all the fetters.

original: gnas par kun tu ston pa ni sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' mthu chen po thob pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: gnas par kun tu ston pa ni sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' mthu chen po thob pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: The body of the display of abiding is that of the Buddhas and of the bodhisattvas who have attained the great superknowledges,

original: zas kyi dbang gis gnas par kun tu ston pa tsam gyi phyir ro //üîΩ'dus ma byas kyi phyogs gcig gis kyang gong ma dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ma gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: zas kyi dbang gis gnas par kun tu ston pa tsam gyi phyir ro // 'dus ma byas kyi phyogs gcig gis kyang gong ma dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ma gtogs pa ste /
translated: because they display abiding only through the power of food.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid yin pas de ni chos thams cad kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid yin pas de ni chos thams cad kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The highest is also said to be the unconditioned, because it is the highest of all dharmas.

original: bsdus pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /üîΩgang zag la bdag med pa'i tshul gyis ngo bo nyid gsum gyi dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /üîΩgang zag la bdag med pa'i tshul gyis ngo bo nyid gsum gyi dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
translated: The classification of the body of the Dharma is threefold:üîΩthe body of the Dharma as teaching, the body of the Dharma as realization, and the body of the Dharma as the result of realization.üîΩThe body of the Dharma as teaching is the twelve constituent parts of the scriptures, i.e., discourses, etc.üîΩThe body of the Dharma as realization is the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, the three doors of liberation, etc.üîΩThe body of the Dharma as the result of realization is the ten masteries, etc.

original: de la kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni phung po la sogs pa la brten nas med par yang bdag la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du gang kun tu rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de la kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni phung po la sogs pa la brten nas med par yang bdag la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du gang kun tu rtog pa'o //
translated: The imagined reality is the imagination of a self, etc. in the absence of a self, etc. in regard to the aggregates, etc.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni phung po la sogs pa de dag ni gang du yang dag pa ma yin pa bdag la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa de 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni phung po la sogs pa de dag ni gang du yang dag pa ma yin pa bdag la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa de 'byung ba'o //
translated: The other-dependent reality is the aggregates, etc. from which the imagination of what is unreal arises as a self, etc.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang mi ldan pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang mi ldan pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The perfected reality is the characteristic of the possession of existence and non-existence,

original: phung po la sogs pa la bdag la sogs pa med pa pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa la bdag la sogs pa med pa pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the aggregates, etc. are characterized by the existence of selflessness, etc. and the non-existence of a self, etc.

original: mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba ni chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba ni chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi dbang du byas te /
translated: The differentiation according to characteristic refers to the individual natures of the dharmas.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: These are the form aggregate, the feeling aggregate, etc.

original: rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni khyad par gyi dbang du byas nas rdzas su yod pa dang / btags pa'i yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni khyad par gyi dbang du byas nas rdzas su yod pa dang / btags pa'i yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The classification of aspects is from the point of view of distinctions, such as substantially existent and imputedly existent.

original: lus kyi rab tu dbye ba ni so so'i lus te /
analyzed: lus kyi rab tu dbye ba ni so so'i lus te /
translated: The classification of bodies is the individual bodies,

original: phung po la sogs pa tha dad pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa tha dad pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: from the point of view of the distinctions of the aggregates, etc.

original: rgyun gyis rab tu dbye ba ni lus gcig la yang phung po la sogs pa'i skad cig so so gzhan gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun gyis rab tu dbye ba ni lus gcig la yang phung po la sogs pa'i skad cig so so gzhan gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The classification of continua is in regard to the individual moments of the aggregates, etc., in a single body.

original: phyi rol tu bltas pas rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /üîΩphal cher 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu mthun pa'i chos kyi rgyu las byung ba'i thos pa dang / sems pa las byung ba ma rtogs pa ston pa'i phyir ro /üîΩ// / bam po bzhi pa /
analyzed: phyi rol tu bltas pas rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na / phal cher 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu mthun pa'i chos kyi rgyu las byung ba'i thos pa dang / sems pa las byung ba ma rtogs pa ston pa'i phyir ro / // / bam po bzhi pa /
translated: What is the classification of external objects?

original: mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa ni gzugs kyi phung po nyid kyis gzugs kyi phung po bsdus pa nas /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa ni gzugs kyi phung po nyid kyis gzugs kyi phung po bsdus pa nas /
translated: It is said that they are mostly in the realm of desire, because they are the teachings that have arisen from the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause of the Dharma of the cause

original: rgya @33b cher chos kyi skye mched kyis chos kyi skye mched bsdus pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rgya @33b cher chos kyi skye mched kyis chos kyi skye mched bsdus pa'i bar du'o //
translated: and so on up to the element of mental objects being included in the element of mental objects.

original: khams kyis bsdus pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: khams kyis bsdus pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is inclusion by the realms?

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched thams cad kun gzhi rnam par shes pas bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched thams cad kun gzhi rnam par shes pas bsdus pa ste /
translated: All the aggregates, elements and sense-fields are included in the store-consciousness,

original: de la de dag thams cad kyi sa bon yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la de dag thams cad kyi sa bon yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the seeds of all of them are present there.

original: rigs kyis bsdus pa ni phung po rnams kyis spungs pa la sogs pa'i don dang ldan pa gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyis bsdus pa ni phung po rnams kyis spungs pa la sogs pa'i don dang ldan pa gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: What is inclusion by the families? The aggregates, beginning with form, are included in the aggregates, because they have the meaning of being heaped up, and so on.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis phan tshun mtshan nyid mi 'dra yang rigs gcig pa'i phyir thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis phan tshun mtshan nyid mi 'dra yang rigs gcig pa'i phyir thams cad bsdus so //
translated: Although they are not similar in their individual characteristics, they are all included because they belong to the same family.

original: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams kyis kyang nye bar spyod pa 'dzin pa'i don dang ldan pa dang / skye ba'i sgo'i don dang ldan pa mig la sogs pa bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams kyis kyang nye bar spyod pa 'dzin pa'i don dang ldan pa dang / skye ba'i sgo'i don dang ldan pa mig la sogs pa bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the elements and sense-fields should be understood as being included in the sense-fields, beginning with the eye, because they have the meaning of grasping the objects of experience and the meaning of being the door of the arising of the mind.

original: gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa ni phung po rnams rigs gcig tu zin kyang bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs nges par byas nas bde ba'i gnas skabs ni bde ba'i gnas skabs nyid kyis bsdus kyi /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa ni phung po rnams rigs gcig tu zin kyang bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs nges par byas nas bde ba'i gnas skabs ni bde ba'i gnas skabs nyid kyis bsdus kyi /
translated: The aggregates are included in the state of pleasure, etc., when they are definitely determined as the state of pleasure, etc., even though they are of the same type.

original: sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: The state of pleasure is included in the state of pleasure itself, but not in the state of pain.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs kyang de nyid kyi gnas skabs kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs kyang de nyid kyi gnas skabs kyis bsdus so //
translated: Similarly, the state of pain is included in the state of pain itself.

original: phung po rnams ji lta bar khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: phung po rnams ji lta bar khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The elements and sense bases should be understood in the same way as the aggregates.

original: grogs kyis bsdus pa zhes bya ba la /üîΩgzugs kyi phung po ni sdud pa na de la brten pa tshor ba la sogs pa grogs rnams dang lhan cig tu phung po lnga po dag gis bsdus so //
analyzed: grogs kyis bsdus pa zhes bya ba la / gzugs kyi phung po ni sdud pa na de la brten pa tshor ba la sogs pa grogs rnams dang lhan cig tu phung po lnga po dag gis bsdus so //
translated: Inclusion by companions refers to the following.üîΩWhen the form aggregate is included, it is included in the five aggregates together with its companions, such as feeling, which are based on it.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa 'khor dang bcas pa rnams kyang sdud pa na so sor phung po lnga po dag gis bsdus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa 'khor dang bcas pa rnams kyang sdud pa na so sor phung po lnga po dag gis bsdus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, when feeling, etc., together with their retinues, are included, they are included in the five aggregates individually.

original: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched 'khor dang bcas pa rnams kyang so sor khams dang skye mched thams cad kyis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched 'khor dang bcas pa rnams kyang so sor khams dang skye mched thams cad kyis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the elements and the sense bases, together with their retinue, should be understood as being included in each of the elements and sense bases.

original: phyogs gcig gis bsdus pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyogs gcig gis bsdus pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Inclusion by one part.

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po ni gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig gis bsdus so //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po ni gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig gis bsdus so //
translated: The aggregate of morality is included in one part of the form aggregate.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi phung po ni 'du byed kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig gis bsdus so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi phung po ni 'du byed kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig gis bsdus so //
translated: The aggregates of concentration and wisdom are included in one part of the formation aggregate.

original: 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams ni chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig gis bsdus so //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams ni chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig gis bsdus so //
translated: The elements of desire, malice, and violence are included in one part of the element of mental objects.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa ni yid dang chos kyi skye mched kyi phyogs gcig gis bsdus so //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa ni yid dang chos kyi skye mched kyi phyogs gcig gis bsdus so //
translated: The sense bases of the sphere of infinite space and so on are included in one part of the mind and mental object sense bases.

original: de ltar byas na mdo sde gzhan dag tu phung po dang @34a * //
analyzed: de ltar byas na mdo sde gzhan dag tu phung po dang @34a * //
translated: If this is so, then in other s≈´tras the aggregates, elements, and sense bases are said to be exhaustive and all-inclusive.

original: khams dang skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i chos ji snyed pa de dag gang yang rung bas bsdus pa ni phyogs gcig gis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khams dang skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i chos ji snyed pa de dag gang yang rung bas bsdus pa ni phyogs gcig gis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: The inclusion of any of the phenomena included in the elements and sense bases should be understood as inclusion by one part.

original: mtha' dag gis bsdus pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtha' dag gis bsdus pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Inclusion by the whole is as follows.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po lnga po nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag gis bsdus so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po lnga po nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag gis bsdus so //
translated: The five aggregates of clinging are included in the five aggregates of suffering.

original: 'dod pa'i khams ni bco brgyad po dag gis bsdus so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ni bco brgyad po dag gis bsdus so //
translated: The desire realm is included in the eighteen elements.

original: 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyi skye mched ni dri dang ro'i skye mched ma gtogs pa skye mched bcu po dag gis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyi skye mched ni dri dang ro'i skye mched ma gtogs pa skye mched bcu po dag gis bsdus pa'o //
translated: The sense base of beings devoid of discernment is included in the ten sense bases, excluding the sense bases of smell and taste.

original: de ltar byas na mdo sde gzhan dag tu phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams kyis bsdus pa'i chos ji snyed pa de dag ni mtha' dag gis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byas na mdo sde gzhan dag tu phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams kyis bsdus pa'i chos ji snyed pa de dag ni mtha' dag gis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: When this is done, the phenomena included by the aggregates, elements, and sense bases in other s≈´tras should be understood as included by the whole.

original: gcig gis gcig bsdus pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gcig gis gcig bsdus pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Inclusion by each other is as follows.

original: phung po rnams ni so sor khams dang skye mched rnams kyis bsdus te /üîΩji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //üîΩde bzhin du khams rnams kyang phung po dang skye mched rnams kyis bsdus shing /
analyzed: phung po rnams ni so sor khams dang skye mched rnams kyis bsdus te / ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro // de bzhin du khams rnams kyang phung po dang skye mched rnams kyis bsdus shing /
translated: The aggregates are included in the elements and sense bases, each according to its type.üîΩThe elements are included in the aggregates and sense bases, each according to its type.

original: skye mched rnams kyang phung po dang khams kyis bsdus par rgya cher khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched rnams kyang phung po dang khams kyis bsdus par rgya cher khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The sense bases are included in the aggregates and elements, each according to its type.üîΩThis should be understood in detail.

original: yang bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'jig rten gyi grags pas bsdus pa dang mthun par rnam pa drug tu blta ste /
analyzed: yang bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'jig rten gyi grags pas bsdus pa dang mthun par rnam pa drug tu blta ste /
translated: The characteristic of inclusion should be understood in six ways, in accordance with the way inclusion is understood in the world.

original: de yang gang zhen /
analyzed: de yang gang zhen /
translated: What is that?

original: gzhi'i gnas kyis bsdus pa ni dper na mi 'dzam bu'i gling gis bsdus so //
analyzed: gzhi'i gnas kyis bsdus pa ni dper na mi 'dzam bu'i gling gis bsdus so //
translated: Inclusion by the location of the basis, for example, a person is included in Jambudvipa.

original: ri dags rnams ni dgon pas bsdus so zhes 'jig rten na brjod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang mig la sogs pas mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ri dags rnams ni dgon pas bsdus so zhes 'jig rten na brjod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang mig la sogs pas mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: In the world, it is said that deer are included in the forest. In the same way, here, the eye, etc. should be understood to include the eye consciousness, etc.

original: 'ching bas bsdus pa ni dper na thag pa la sogs pas shing khur ba la sogs pa bcings pa de bzhin du lus kyis mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams bcings so //
analyzed: 'ching bas bsdus pa ni dper na thag pa la sogs pas shing khur ba la sogs pa bcings pa de bzhin du lus kyis mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams bcings so //
translated: That which is included by binding is like a load of wood bound by ropes and so on. In the same way, the body binds the sense faculties such as the eyes.

original: don mthun pas bsdus pa ni dper na dgos pa thams cad mthun pa'i mi yid gcugs pa rnams phan tshun brten pa de bzhin du dmigs pa gcig la 'byung ba mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyang gcig gis gcig bsdus so /
analyzed: don mthun pas bsdus pa ni dper na dgos pa thams cad mthun pa'i mi yid gcugs pa rnams phan tshun brten pa de bzhin du dmigs pa gcig la 'byung ba mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyang gcig gis gcig bsdus so /
translated: That which is included by having a common object is like trustworthy people who have a common purpose and mutually support each other. In the same way, those that are concomitant have a common object and mutually include each other.

original: nye bar 'dzin pas bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: nye bar 'dzin pas bsdus pa ni /
translated: That which is included by grasping is

original: dper na jo bos bran la sogs pa bdag gir yongs su bzung ba de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pas kyang lus bzung ngo //
analyzed: dper na jo bos bran la sogs pa bdag gir yongs su bzung ba de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pas kyang lus bzung ngo //
translated: like a master who completely grasps a slave and so on as his own. In the same way, the foundation consciousness also grasps the body.

original: rnam par mi 'phro bas bsdus pa ni dper na bu ma pas chu bzung ba de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin gyis de las gzhan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams bzung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par mi 'phro bas bsdus pa ni dper na bu ma pas chu bzung ba de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin gyis de las gzhan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams bzung ngo //
translated: That which is included by not scattering is like a dam that holds back water. In the same way, samƒÅdhi holds back the mind and mental factors that are other than that.

original: @34b mngon bar sdud pas bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: @34b mngon bar sdud pas bsdus pa ni /
translated: The aggregate of form is included in the sense-sphere of form.üîΩThe sense-sphere of form is included in the element of form.üîΩThe element of form is included in the sense-sphere of the mental object and in the element of mental objects.üîΩThe element of mental objects is included in the sense-sphere of mental objects.üîΩThe sense-sphere of mental objects is included in the element of mental objects.

original: dper na rgya mtshos 'bab chu rnams bsdus pa de bzhin du gzugs kyi phung pos mig la sogs pa bsdus so //üîΩ'dir mngon par sdud pas bsdus pa'i dbang du byas nas bsdus pa rnam pa bcu gcig tu rig par bya'o /
analyzed: dper na rgya mtshos 'bab chu rnams bsdus pa de bzhin du gzugs kyi phung pos mig la sogs pa bsdus so // 'dir mngon par sdud pas bsdus pa'i dbang du byas nas bsdus pa rnam pa bcu gcig tu rig par bya'o /
translated: The element of mental objects is included in the sense-sphere of mental objects.üîΩThe sense-sphere of mental objects is included in the element of mental objects.üîΩThe element of mental objects is included in the sense-sphere of mental objects.üîΩThe sense-sphere of mental objects is included in the element of mental objects.üîΩThe element of mental objects is included in the sense-sphere of mental objects.üîΩThe sense-sphere of mental objects is included in the element of mental objects.üîΩThe element of mental objects is included in the sense-sphere of mental objects.üîΩThe sense-sphere of mental objects is included in the element of mental objects.üîΩThe element of mental objects is included in the sense-sphere of mental objects.üîΩThe sense-sphere of mental objects is included in the element of mental objects.üîΩThe element of mental objects is included in the sense-sphere of mental objects.üîΩThe sense-sphere of mental objects is included in the element of mental objects.üîΩThe element of mental objects is included in the sense-sphere of mental objects.üîΩThe sense-sphere of mental objects is included in the element of mental objects.üîΩThe element of mental objects is included in the sense-sphere of mental objects.üîΩThe sense-sphere of mental objects is included in the element of mental objects.

original: rdul phra rab kyi phyogs la phyogs can thams cad ces bya ba ni rdul phra rab gcig tu gtogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni phyogs mthun pas tha dad pa med par rig par bya'o /üîΩrdul phra rab las gong ma phyogs can rnams 'dres par gyur pa ni 'di lta ste /üîΩchu rnyog ma can gyi nang na chu dang sa'i rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun du 'dres pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi phyogs la phyogs can thams cad ces bya ba ni rdul phra rab gcig tu gtogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni phyogs mthun pas tha dad pa med par rig par bya'o / rdul phra rab las gong ma phyogs can rnams 'dres par gyur pa ni 'di lta ste / chu rnyog ma can gyi nang na chu dang sa'i rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun du 'dres pa lta bu'o //
translated: The element of mental objects is included in the sense-sphere of mental objects.üîΩThe sense-sphere of mental objects is included in the element of mental objects.üîΩThe element of mental objects is included in the sense-sphere of mental objects.üîΩThe sense-sphere of mental objects is included in the element of mental objects.üîΩThe element of mental objects is included in the sense-sphere of mental objects.üîΩThe sense-sphere of mental objects is included in the element of mental objects.üîΩThe element of mental objects is included in the sense-sphere of mental objects.üîΩThe sense-sphere of mental objects is included in the element of mental objects.

original: phyogs can 'dus pa rnams phan tshun du phrad pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: phyogs can 'dus pa rnams phan tshun du phrad pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The element of mental objects is included in the sense-sphere of mental objects.

original: rtsig pa la 'jim gong dang 'jim gong gzhan phrad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rtsig pa la 'jim gong dang 'jim gong gzhan phrad pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a lump of clay and another lump of clay coming together.

original: lhan cig 'byung bas mtshungs par ldan pa ni lus gcig la phung po la sogs pa skad cig pa rnams so //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung bas mtshungs par ldan pa ni lus gcig la phung po la sogs pa skad cig pa rnams so //
translated: Conjoined by co-occurrence is, for example, the momentary aggregates, etc. in one body.

original: bya ba grub pas mtshungs par ldan pa ni dgos pa cig la zhugs pa rnams phan tshun du'o //
analyzed: bya ba grub pas mtshungs par ldan pa ni dgos pa cig la zhugs pa rnams phan tshun du'o //
translated: Conjoined by the accomplishment of action is, for example, the mutual conjoining of those engaged in a common purpose.

original: mthun par rtogs pas mtshungs par ldan pa ni gzhan gyi dngos po dang yin gyi rang gi dngos po dang ni ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: mthun par rtogs pas mtshungs par ldan pa ni gzhan gyi dngos po dang yin gyi rang gi dngos po dang ni ma yin pa ste /
translated: Conjoined by the understanding of the similar is, for example, the conjoining of the object of another, but not of one‚Äôs own.

original: 'di ltar sems ni sems gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin zhing tshor ba yang tshor ba gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems ni sems gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin zhing tshor ba yang tshor ba gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: For example, mind is not conjoined with another mind, and feeling is not conjoined with another feeling, and so on.

original: mi mthun pa gnyis ma yin pa ni dper na 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gnyis dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba gnyis la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa gnyis ma yin pa ni dper na 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gnyis dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba gnyis la sogs pa'o //
translated: Not conjoined by the dissimilar is, for example, desire and hatred, virtue and nonvirtue, and so on.

original: dus mi 'dra ba gnyis ma yin pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dus mi 'dra ba gnyis ma yin pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Not conjoined by a different time is, for example, the past with the past.

original: da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa gnyis dang / 'das pa dang da ltar gnyis so //
analyzed: da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa gnyis dang / 'das pa dang da ltar gnyis so //
translated: the two, present and future, and the two, past and present.

original: mi mthun pa'i khams dang sa pa gnyis ma yin pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i khams dang sa pa gnyis ma yin pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The two, dissimilar realms and stages, do not exist.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa gnyis dang / bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa'i sa pa gnyis la sogs pa'o //üîΩmthun par gtogs pas mtshungs par ldan pa tshor ba la sogs pa drug pa 'di dag ni kun tu 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa gnyis dang / bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa'i sa pa gnyis la sogs pa'o // mthun par gtogs pas mtshungs par ldan pa tshor ba la sogs pa drug pa 'di dag ni kun tu 'gro ba ste /
translated: For example, the two, the desire realm and the form realm, and the two, the first and second absorptions, and so on.

original: gnas skabs thams cad du 'di dag las gang yang rung ba gcig med na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad du 'di dag las gang yang rung ba gcig med na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These six, feeling and so on, that are concomitant with the omnipresent mental factors are omnipresent because if any one of them is absent in any state, then all are absent.üîΩSome are mixed, such as those that are learner and nonlearner.

original: 'dres pa ni slob pa dang mi slob pa dag las kyang kha cig go zhes bya ba ni gcig tu 'jig rten pa'i dge ba rnams dang / mi dge ba rnams dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyis te /üîΩji ltar @35a * //
analyzed: 'dres pa ni slob pa dang mi slob pa dag las kyang kha cig go zhes bya ba ni gcig tu 'jig rten pa'i dge ba rnams dang / mi dge ba rnams dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyis te / ji ltar @35a * //
translated: Some are mixed, such as the virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral minds of the world.

original: mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
analyzed: mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
translated: They are applied as appropriate.

original: dang po de dang de'i 'og ma rnams zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa skad cig dang po las byung ba rnams dang / skad cig gnyis pa la sogs pa las byung ba rnams kyang sngon gyi rang bzhin ma yin pas ma 'dris pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po de dang de'i 'og ma rnams zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa skad cig dang po las byung ba rnams dang / skad cig gnyis pa la sogs pa las byung ba rnams kyang sngon gyi rang bzhin ma yin pas ma 'dris pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first and those that follow it are the supramundane dharmas that arise in the first moment, and those that arise in the second moment, etc. They are not of the nature of the former, and so they are taught to be unmixed.

original: ldan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ldan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is possession?

original: mtshan nyid kyis ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: By its characteristics, it is like the former.

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi 'phel ba dang 'grib pa la 'thob pa dang rnyed pa dang ldan pa gdags so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi 'phel ba dang 'grib pa la 'thob pa dang rnyed pa dang ldan pa gdags so zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the designation of acquisition, attainment, and possession is made in regard to the increase and decrease of wholesome, etc., dharmas.

original: sa bon dang ldan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sa bon dang ldan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is possession of seeds?

original: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes par gyur ba ni khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes par gyur ba ni khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan te /
translated: One who is born in the desire realm possesses the afflictions and secondary afflictions of the three realms.

original: de ni so so'i skye bo 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni so so'i skye bo 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in terms of the ordinary man who is not free from desire.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni de 'am /üîΩgong mar skyes kyang rung ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni de 'am / gong mar skyes kyang rung ste /
translated: Those who are free from attachment to the realm of desire or to a higher stageüîΩare endowed with the wholesome of the stage that they have left behind,

original: sa gong gis 'dod chags dang bral bar sa de pa rnams dang / de dag dang mi ldan pa dang / ldan pa yang yin te /
analyzed: sa gong gis 'dod chags dang bral bar sa de pa rnams dang / de dag dang mi ldan pa dang / ldan pa yang yin te /
translated: and also with those of the stage that they have attained, and with those of the stage that they have not attained.

original: gnyen pos gnod par byas pa dang / bag la nyal legs par ma bcom pa'i phyir go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyen pos gnod par byas pa dang / bag la nyal legs par ma bcom pa'i phyir go rims bzhin no //
translated: This is because they have been harmed by the antidote and because the latent dispositions have not been completely destroyed.

original: skye bas thob pa'i dge ba rnams zhes bya ba ni gong du skyes pa'i sa pa de'i sa pa rnams nyid dang ldan no //üîΩkhams gsum pa'i gnyen po thob pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thob pa'o //
analyzed: skye bas thob pa'i dge ba rnams zhes bya ba ni gong du skyes pa'i sa pa de'i sa pa rnams nyid dang ldan no // khams gsum pa'i gnyen po thob pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thob pa'o //
translated: Those who are born in a higher stage are endowed with the wholesome of that stage.üîΩThose who have obtained the antidote of the three realms are endowed with the wholesome of the stage that they have attained and also with those of the stage that they have not attained.

original: rnam pa gang dang gang gi gnyen po byung ba zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pas spong bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa chen po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gang dang gang gi gnyen po byung ba zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pas spong bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa chen po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those who have obtained the supramundane path are endowed with the wholesome of the stage that they have attained and also with those of the stage that they have not attained.

original: de dang de'i sa bon dang mi ldan pas ldan pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dang de'i sa bon dang mi ldan pas ldan pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those who have obtained the antidote of a certain type are not endowed with the seeds of that type.

original: bag la nyal legs par bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag la nyal legs par bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the latent states are well destroyed.

original: dbang dang ldan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbang dang ldan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is mastery?

original: sbyor ba las byung ba dge ba'i chos 'jig rten pa rnams zhes bya ba ni thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i sa bon yod du zin kyang de goms par ma byas pas tshe de'i sa bon brtas pa med pas mngon du byed mi nus pa'i phyir
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba dge ba'i chos 'jig rten pa rnams zhes bya ba ni thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i sa bon yod du zin kyang de goms par ma byas pas tshe de'i sa bon brtas pa med pas mngon du byed mi nus pa'i phyir
translated: The wholesome mundane dharmas that are acquired through practice, even though the seeds of those derived from listening, etc. exist, one is not able to manifest them because the seeds have not been strengthened in this life through cultivation.

original: ro // de dag las kyang lung du ma bstan pa kha cig ces bya ba ni bzo'i gzas nas sprul pa'i sems la sogs pa'o //üîΩthar pa'i rgyu dang mi ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ro // de dag las kyang lung du ma bstan pa kha cig ces bya ba ni bzo'i gzas nas sprul pa'i sems la sogs pa'o // thar pa'i rgyu dang mi ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: And also some of the indeterminate ones, i.e., the volition of skill in arts and crafts, etc.üîΩThey are not endowed with the cause of liberation,

original: de dag gtan du rgyu dang mi ldan te /
analyzed: de dag gtan du rgyu dang mi ldan te /
translated: because they are not endowed with the cause of liberation forever.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams dang / thar pa thob pa'i rgyu dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams dang / thar pa thob pa'i rgyu dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The mundane dharmas are not endowed with the cause of attaining liberation, i.e., the supramundane dharmas.

original: thar pa thob pa'i rgyu gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: thar pa thob pa'i rgyu gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of attaining liberation?

original: de bzhin nyid la nyon mongs @35b pa'i gnas ngan len gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la nyon mongs @35b pa'i gnas ngan len gnas pa yin te /
translated: The reality of the dharmas is the abode of the negative reflex actions of the defilements.

original: rgyu gang gnyen po'i rjes su mthun pa'i rkyen rnyed na legs par 'joms nus pa de skal ba dang ldan pa'i phyir rgya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu gang gnyen po'i rjes su mthun pa'i rkyen rnyed na legs par 'joms nus pa de skal ba dang ldan pa'i phyir rgya zhes bya'o //
translated: The cause is called ‚Äúseed‚Äù because it is endowed with the fortune of being able to destroy the defilements when it encounters the proper conditions of the antidotes.

original: bzlog pa ni rgyu dang mi ldan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni rgyu dang mi ldan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of this should be understood as being ‚Äúdevoid of the cause.‚ÄùüîΩIt is also in terms of the birth and place of birth of sentient beings.

original: de ni sems can gyi skye ba dang skye ba'i gnas kyis kyang zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi 'jig rten gang skye ba dang snod kyi 'jig rten gang du skye ba de gnyi ga sdug bsngal gyi bden pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni sems can gyi skye ba dang skye ba'i gnas kyis kyang zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi 'jig rten gang skye ba dang snod kyi 'jig rten gang du skye ba de gnyi ga sdug bsngal gyi bden pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The world of sentient beings and the world of the physical cosmos that is the place of birth of sentient beings are both taught as the truth of suffering.

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten gang yin pa dang / snod kyi 'jig rten gang yin ba de las dang nyon mongs pas skyed pa dang / las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis byung ba zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin te /
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten gang yin pa dang / snod kyi 'jig rten gang yin ba de las dang nyon mongs pas skyed pa dang / las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis byung ba zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin te /
translated: The world of sentient beings and the world of the physical cosmos are produced by karma and the afflictions and arise through the power of karma and the afflictions, respectively.

original: de gnyis kyis ni sdug bsngal nyid kyi rgyu ston to //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis ni sdug bsngal nyid kyi rgyu ston to //
translated: These two show the cause of suffering.

original: yang skye ba ni sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar mdor bsdus te sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: yang skye ba ni sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar mdor bsdus te sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid bstan nas /
translated: The characteristic of the truth of suffering was previously taught in brief.

original: da ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: da ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa las brtsams te /
translated: Now, beginning with the truth of suffering,

original: mdo sde las byung ba bstan pa'i don rnam par dbye bar brtsams te /üîΩskye ba'i sdug bsngal ni dog pa'i sdug bsngal nyid dang / de las gzhan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ma'i mngal na zhu ba dang ma zhu ba gnyis kyi bar na 'dug pa las 'byung ba dang / mngal na mi gtsang ba'i rdzas sna tshogs kyis gzir te /
analyzed: mdo sde las byung ba bstan pa'i don rnam par dbye bar brtsams te / skye ba'i sdug bsngal ni dog pa'i sdug bsngal nyid dang / de las gzhan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ma'i mngal na zhu ba dang ma zhu ba gnyis kyi bar na 'dug pa las 'byung ba dang / mngal na mi gtsang ba'i rdzas sna tshogs kyis gzir te /
translated: the meaning of the teachings that appear in the sutras will be analyzed.üîΩThe suffering of birth is the suffering of confinement and the basis for other sufferings.üîΩThis is because one experiences the suffering of emerging from the womb,üîΩand the suffering of being squeezed by various impure substances in the womb.

original: lus kyi yan lag kun tu btsir ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi yan lag kun tu btsir ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal myong ba'i phyir ro //
