translated: After birth, the suffering of aging, etc., is experienced.

original: btsas nas kyang rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal zhar la 'byung ba'i phyir te /üîΩgo rims bzhin no //
analyzed: btsas nas kyang rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal zhar la 'byung ba'i phyir te /üîΩgo rims bzhin no //
translated: This is because the suffering of aging, etc., is experienced after birth.

original: brgyad yin yang drug tu 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gsum 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brgyad yin yang drug tu 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gsum 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although there are eight, they are said to be six because the three that are transformations are included in the suffering of change.

original: skye ba la sogs pas sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan to zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i chos kyi rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pas sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan to zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i chos kyi rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The suffering of suffering is fully explained by birth and so on, because it is the intrinsic identity of phenomena that are experienced as suffering.

original: sdug pa dang bral ba'i dngos po la sogs pas 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan to zhes bya ba'i tshig ni phrad pa dang ma phrad pas bde pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i chos 'gyur ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug pa dang bral ba'i dngos po la sogs pas 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan to zhes bya ba'i tshig ni phrad pa dang ma phrad pas bde pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i chos 'gyur ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The suffering of change is fully explained by things such as being separated from what is attractive, because it is the intrinsic identity of the change of phenomena that are experienced as pleasure through contact and noncontact.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyi yongs su bstan to zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di gnyis las rnam par ma grol zhing mi rtag pa nyid rjes su @36a * //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyi yongs su bstan to zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di gnyis las rnam par ma grol zhing mi rtag pa nyid rjes su @36a * //
translated: The two phrases ‚Äúthe five appropriated aggregates are suffering‚Äù and ‚Äúthe suffering of conditioned existence‚Äù are not distinguished, because impermanence is the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: 'brel te grub pa dang bde ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel te grub pa dang bde ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not established as being related to happiness.

original: skye ba ni sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden par sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: skye ba ni sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden par sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúBirth is suffering‚Äù and so on refers to the suffering that is conventional truth,

original: 'jig rten pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the object of mundane knowledge.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba ni gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi sgo nas don dam pa'i bden par sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba ni gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi sgo nas don dam pa'i bden par sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe five appropriated aggregates are suffering‚Äù refers to the suffering that is ultimate truth, from the perspective of the reality of abiding,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the object of supramundane knowledge.

original: sdug bsngal gyi spyi'i mtshan nyid ni rnal 'byor bas rnam pa gang dag gis sdug bsngal gyi bden par spyad pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi spyi'i mtshan nyid ni rnal 'byor bas rnam pa gang dag gis sdug bsngal gyi bden par spyad pa ste /
translated: The general characteristic of suffering is the object of the yogi‚Äôs practice in terms of the truth of suffering.

original: 'di lta ste mi rtag pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste mi rtag pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid kyis so //
translated: It is as follows: impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness.

original: de la mtshan nyid rnam pa bcu gnyis kyis mi rtag pa sdug bsngal gyi bden par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid rnam pa bcu gnyis kyis mi rtag pa sdug bsngal gyi bden par rig par bya ste /
translated: The truth of suffering should be known through twelve characteristics.

original: de yang med pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang med pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The characteristic of non-existence is as follows:

original: bdag dang bdag gi ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi sdug bsngal pa'i bden pa rtag tu med pa'i don gang yin pa'i don de ni mi rtag pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi sdug bsngal pa'i bden pa rtag tu med pa'i don gang yin pa'i don de ni mi rtag pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the truth of suffering as non-existence is the meaning of the truth of suffering as impermanent,

original: mi zhes bya ba ni dgag pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi zhes bya ba ni dgag pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the term ‚Äúnon-‚Äù has the meaning of negation.

original: rtag ces bya ba'i sgra ni dus thams cad pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag ces bya ba'i sgra ni dus thams cad pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúpermanent‚Äù has the meaning of all times.

original: rnam par 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'du byed rnams byung nas med par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'du byed rnams byung nas med par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The characteristic of destruction is the non-existence of formations after they have arisen.

original: 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ni rgyu mi 'dra ba nyid du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ni rgyu mi 'dra ba nyid du 'byung ba'o //
translated: The characteristic of change is the arising of a different cause.

original: 'bral ba'i mtshan nyid ni dngos po'i gnas skabs de dag nyid la rang bzhin gyi dbang nyams pa dang / kha cig tu ni gzhan dag gis bdag gir byas par yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bral ba'i mtshan nyid ni dngos po'i gnas skabs de dag nyid la rang bzhin gyi dbang nyams pa dang / kha cig tu ni gzhan dag gis bdag gir byas par yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of separation is the loss of power over those very states of things, and in some cases, the appropriation of them by others.

original: nye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi tshe na mi rtag pa nyid myong ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi tshe na mi rtag pa nyid myong ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of experience is the experience of impermanence at the time of the proximate characteristic.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid ni gang gdon mi za bar myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid ni gang gdon mi za bar myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The characteristic of dharma is that which is necessarily experienced.

original: skad cig gi mtshan nyid ni bdag nyid rnyed nas de ma thag tu gdon mi za bar rnam par 'jig pa nyid do //
analyzed: skad cig gi mtshan nyid ni bdag nyid rnyed nas de ma thag tu gdon mi za bar rnam par 'jig pa nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of momentariness is that, having arisen, there is certain destruction immediately afterwards.

original: rgyun gyi mtshan nyid ni thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba nas 'ong ba dang / 'gro bar 'gyur bas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyun gyi mtshan nyid ni thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba nas 'ong ba dang / 'gro bar 'gyur bas 'byung ba'o //
translated: The characteristic of continuity is the arising of that which comes from beginningless sa·πÉsƒÅra and goes to the future.

original: na ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid ni khams ma snyoms pa dang / spyi cer du gyur pa dang / gnas pa'i dus kyi 'phen pa zad pa'o //
analyzed: na ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid ni khams ma snyoms pa dang / spyi cer du gyur pa dang / gnas pa'i dus kyi 'phen pa zad pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of sickness, aging, and death is the imbalance of the elements, the wrinkling of the skin, and the exhaustion of the impetus of duration.

original: sems sna tshogs kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i gnas la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sems sna tshogs kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i gnas la gnas pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the mind is the transformation of various aspects, which is based on the adverse side and the antidote.

original: longs spyod 'byor pa rgud pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'jig rten @36b pa'i 'byor ba thams cad gtan du 'dug pa ma yin pas mthar nyes pa nyid do //üîΩsnod 'jig pa dang chags pa'i mtshan nyid ni sa chen po la sogs pa me la sogs pas yang dang yang 'jig pa dang 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: longs spyod 'byor pa rgud pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'jig rten @36b pa'i 'byor ba thams cad gtan du 'dug pa ma yin pas mthar nyes pa nyid do // snod 'jig pa dang chags pa'i mtshan nyid ni sa chen po la sogs pa me la sogs pas yang dang yang 'jig pa dang 'byung ba ste /
translated: The characteristic of the enjoyment of wealth is that all worldly enjoyments are not permanent, so they are ultimately faulty.üîΩThe characteristic of the destruction and evolution of the world is that the great earth, etc., are repeatedly destroyed and evolved by fire, etc.

original: me dang chu dang rlung 'tshig par byed pa dang rul bar byed pa dang skam par byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'jig pa rnams dang go rims bzhin du bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang gsum pa'i gnas kyi mthar thug par 'jig rten gnas pa 'jig go //
analyzed: me dang chu dang rlung 'tshig par byed pa dang rul bar byed pa dang skam par byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'jig pa rnams dang go rims bzhin du bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang gsum pa'i gnas kyi mthar thug par 'jig rten gnas pa 'jig go //
translated: The destructions by fire, water, and wind, which have the nature of burning, rotting, and drying up, respectively, destroy the world up to the limit of the first, second, and third absorptions.

original: de'i gong ma lhag ma lus pa bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa'i gnas gzhan gang yin pa de dag ni de dag gis bsdus bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gong ma lhag ma lus pa bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa'i gnas gzhan gang yin pa de dag ni de dag gis bsdus bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The remaining abodes of the second, third, and fourth absorptions are included in those two.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa rnams kyi gzhal med khang rnams gang gis 'jig cing chags she na /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa rnams kyi gzhal med khang rnams gang gis 'jig cing chags she na /
translated: By what are the celestial palaces of the fourth absorption destroyed and formed?

original: phyi rol gang gis kyang ma yin gyi gzhal med khang de dag ni sems can de dag nyid skye ba dang lhan cig tu 'grub cing 'chi ba dang lhan cig tu 'gag ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gang gis kyang ma yin gyi gzhal med khang de dag ni sems can de dag nyid skye ba dang lhan cig tu 'grub cing 'chi ba dang lhan cig tu 'gag ste /
translated: They are not destroyed and formed by anything external. Those celestial palaces are formed simultaneously with the birth of those sentient beings and cease simultaneously with their death.

original: de nyid de dag gi 'jig pa dang chags par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid de dag gi 'jig pa dang chags par rig par bya'o //
translated: That is their destruction and formation.

original: de dag gis bskal ba tshar phyin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag gis bskal ba tshar phyin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The eon is completed by them means that it is fully completed.

original: chags pa'i dus na mar 'bri ba bar gyi bskal pa gcig dang / yar 'phel ba dang mar 'bri ba bco brgyad de bcu dgu'o //
analyzed: chags pa'i dus na mar 'bri ba bar gyi bskal pa gcig dang / yar 'phel ba dang mar 'bri ba bco brgyad de bcu dgu'o //
translated: In the period of formation, there is one intermediate eon of formation and eighteen intermediate eons of formation and destruction, making nineteen.

original: de'i 'og tu tha mar yar skye ba gcig go //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu tha mar yar skye ba gcig go //
translated: Then, finally, there is one more birth.

original: tshe zang ces bya ba ni 'chi ba ste /
analyzed: tshe zang ces bya ba ni 'chi ba ste /
translated: Death is the exhaustion of life.

original: tshe'i 'phen pa ji tsam yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir dus su 'chi ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: tshe'i 'phen pa ji tsam yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir dus su 'chi ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: This refers to death at the proper time, because the impetus of life is completely exhausted.

original: bsod nams zad ces bya ba ni dus ma yin par 'chi ba'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: bsod nams zad ces bya ba ni dus ma yin par 'chi ba'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: The exhaustion of merit refers to untimely death.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myong bar byed pas de'i tshe 'phen par byed pa'i las bsgos pa las gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myong bar byed pas de'i tshe 'phen par byed pa'i las bsgos pa las gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the karma that impels the life span is damaged by the experience of the taste of meditative concentration.

original: las kyang zad nas zhes bya ba ni rgyun chad nas 'chi ba'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: las kyang zad nas zhes bya ba ni rgyun chad nas 'chi ba'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: The exhaustion of karma refers to death when the continuum is severed.

original: gnas der skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las spyad zin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: gnas der skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las spyad zin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: This is because karma to be experienced after rebirth in that realm and karma to be experienced in a third life have already been exhausted,

original: med pa'i phyir der yang mi skye bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir der yang mi skye bar rig par bya'o //
translated: or because they do not exist.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad ces bya ba ni dog pa'i sdug bsngal nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad ces bya ba ni dog pa'i sdug bsngal nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The eight kinds of suffering are the suffering of pain and so on.

original: skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ni ma byung ba las 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ni ma byung ba las 'byung ba ste /
translated: Impermanence belonging to the arising part is the arising of what did not exist before.

original: de ni sdug bsngal gyi phyogs kyi 'du byed rnams la gnod pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal gyi phyogs kyi 'du byed rnams la gnod pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: That is the nature of harm for the formations on the side of suffering.

original: mi rtag pa nyid de la brten nas @37a * //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid de la brten nas @37a * //
translated: In dependence on that impermanence,

original: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid rab tu shes so //
translated: one understands the truth of suffering as suffering.

original: 'jig pa'i char gtogs pa na byung nas med par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i char gtogs pa na byung nas med par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Impermanence belonging to the ceasing part is the non-existence of what has arisen.

original: de ni bde ba'i phyogs kyi 'du byed rnams kyi mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bde ba'i phyogs kyi 'du byed rnams kyi mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: That is not desired for the formations on the side of pleasure.

original: de la brten nas 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de la brten nas 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid rab tu shes so //
translated: In dependence on that, one understands the truth of suffering as change.

original: gnas ngan len dang bcas pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi rgyun du 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa yang 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas ngan len dang bcas pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi rgyun du 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa yang 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: The arising in a continuum and the ceasing of formations that possess negative tendencies are not desired.

original: de gnyi ga'i char gtogs pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la brten nas 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i char gtogs pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la brten nas 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid rab tu shes so //
translated: In dependence on impermanence belonging to both of those, one understands the truth of suffering as the formations.

original: ngas 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed 'gyur ba nyid la dgongs nas gang ci tshor yang rung 'di ni 'dir sdug bsngal du gsungs so zhes bya ba ni 'dir sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / bde ba myong ba ni sdug bsngal nyid kyi tshig tu dgongs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ngas 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed 'gyur ba nyid la dgongs nas gang ci tshor yang rung 'di ni 'dir sdug bsngal du gsungs so zhes bya ba ni 'dir sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / bde ba myong ba ni sdug bsngal nyid kyi tshig tu dgongs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand that the intention is that the experience of neither pleasure nor suffering and the experience of pleasure are words for suffering.

original: sdug bsngal myong ba ni sdug bsngal nyid du 'jig rten na grags pa'i phyir der yang dgongs pa brjod mi dgos so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong ba ni sdug bsngal nyid du 'jig rten na grags pa'i phyir der yang dgongs pa brjod mi dgos so //
translated: The experience of suffering is well known in the world as suffering, so it is unnecessary to state the intention there.

original: 'du byed mi rtag pa gang dag la skye ba la sogs par snang ba de dag ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal du dgongs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed mi rtag pa gang dag la skye ba la sogs par snang ba de dag ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal du dgongs par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that whatever conditioned phenomena appear as arising and so on are intended as suffering because they are impermanent.

original: gzhan du na ni lam yang mi rtag pa'i phyir sdug bsngal du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni lam yang mi rtag pa'i phyir sdug bsngal du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the path would be suffering because it is impermanent.

original: stong ba'i mtshan nyid ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag 'du byed rnams las don gzhan du gyur ba ste /
analyzed: stong ba'i mtshan nyid ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag 'du byed rnams las don gzhan du gyur ba ste /
translated: The characteristic of emptiness is the selflessness of the imagined, which is the reality of the imagined characteristic of permanence, etc.

original: de dag la med pa'o /
analyzed: de dag la med pa'o /
translated: It does not exist in the constructed entities.

original: 'du byed de dag ni rtag tu de dang bral ba'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid kyi bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'du byed de dag ni rtag tu de dang bral ba'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid kyi bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: Those constructed entities are by nature the reality of the selflessness of the imagined, which is always devoid of that imagined characteristic.

original: 'di gnyi ga yang stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyi ga yang stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Both of these are called emptiness.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid nye bar bzung ba ste //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid nye bar bzung ba ste //
translated: Emptiness by intrinsic identity is the reality of the imagined,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kho nas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kho nas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist by its own intrinsic identity.

original: de bzhin du yod pa ma yin pa'i stong pa nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid nye bar bzung ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du yod pa ma yin pa'i stong pa nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid nye bar bzung ba ste /
translated: Similarly, emptiness of what does not exist is the reality of the relative,

original: de ni rnam pa gang dang gang kun tu brtag par bya ba'i rnam pa de dang de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gang dang gang kun tu brtag par bya ba'i rnam pa de dang de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because whatever aspect of it is imagined does not exist in that way.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid nye bar bzung ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid nye bar bzung ba ste /
translated: The emptiness of intrinsic nature is the perfected nature.

original: de ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the nature of emptiness.

original: bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'du byed de dag nyid bdag tu smra ba rnams kyis kun tu brtags pa'i bdag gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'du byed de dag nyid bdag tu smra ba rnams kyis kun tu brtags pa'i bdag gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of selflessness is the nonexistence of the self imagined by those who advocate a self among those very formations.

original: 'du byed thams cad 'jig pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid mi rtag pa nyid du ni grags la /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad 'jig pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid mi rtag pa nyid du ni grags la /
translated: Impermanence, the characteristic of the destruction of all formations, is well known.

original: skad cig pa'i mtshan nyid @37b du ni ma grags te /
analyzed: skad cig pa'i mtshan nyid @37b du ni ma grags te /
translated: But momentariness is not well known.

original: de'i phyir de bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it must be proven.

original: de la sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la ni skad cig pa nyid du 'jig rten du grags te /
analyzed: de la sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la ni skad cig pa nyid du 'jig rten du grags te /
translated: In the world, mind and mental factors are well known to be momentary.

original: de'i phyir des ma grub pa'i gzugs kyi skad cig pa nyid bsgrub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir des ma grub pa'i gzugs kyi skad cig pa nyid bsgrub bo //
translated: Therefore, momentariness is proven for form, which is not established by that.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: sems kyis zin pa zhes bya ba ni sems skad cig pas lus zin pa'o /
analyzed: sems kyis zin pa zhes bya ba ni sems skad cig pas lus zin pa'o /
translated: ‚ÄúHeld by mind‚Äù means the body is held by the momentary mind.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na //
translated: Why is that?

original: grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i phyir te //
translated: because it is established and happy in the same way.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi lus ni yang dag par 'grub kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi lus ni yang dag par 'grub kyi /
translated: Thus, the body is established as being endowed with consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa dang bral ba ni rul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang bral ba ni rul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But when it is devoid of consciousness, it decays.

original: de lta bas na sems dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i phyir de bzhin du 'di yang skad cig pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na sems dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i phyir de bzhin du 'di yang skad cig pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because the mind and the body are established and happy in the same way, the body should be understood as momentary in the same way that the mind is.

original: sems gyur na de 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na sems 'gyur bas lus 'gyur bar snang ste /
analyzed: sems gyur na de 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na sems 'gyur bas lus 'gyur bar snang ste /
translated: Because when the mind changes, the body changes. When the mind changes in the states of pleasure, pain, desire, hatred, etc., the body is seen to change.

original: de'i phyir skad cig re re la 'gyur ba'i sems kyi rjes su 'gyur bas lus skad cig pa nyid du grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig re re la 'gyur ba'i sems kyi rjes su 'gyur bas lus skad cig pa nyid du grub bo //
translated: Therefore, because the body changes in accordance with the changing mind from moment to moment, the body is established as momentary.

original: sems kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is the basis of the mind.

original: dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus ni sems kyi gnas su rab tu grub pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus ni sems kyi gnas su rab tu grub pa ste /
translated: The body together with the sense faculties is well known as the basis of the mind.

original: gang zhig gang gi skye ba'i gnas yin pa de bdag 'jig pa med par de'i gnas su 'gyur bar mi snang ste /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi skye ba'i gnas yin pa de bdag 'jig pa med par de'i gnas su 'gyur bar mi snang ste /
translated: That which is the basis of the arising of something does not appear to be its basis without the destruction of itself.

original: dper na me dang myu gu la sogs pa'i shing dang sa bon la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na me dang myu gu la sogs pa'i shing dang sa bon la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the wood and seed, etc. which are the causes of fire and sprout, etc.

original: de bas na skad cig re re la sems kyi gnas su gyur pas skad cig re re kho na la rnam par 'jig pa grub bo //
analyzed: de bas na skad cig re re la sems kyi gnas su gyur pas skad cig re re kho na la rnam par 'jig pa grub bo //
translated: Therefore, because it is the basis of the mind in each moment, it is established that it is destroyed in each moment.

original: sems kyi dbang gis 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la nang dang phyi'i gzugs thams cad ni sems kyi dbang gis byung ba ste /
analyzed: sems kyi dbang gis 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la nang dang phyi'i gzugs thams cad ni sems kyi dbang gis byung ba ste /
translated: Because it arises by the power of mind, all internal and external form arises by the power of mind.

original: de bas na rgyu skad cig pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na rgyu skad cig pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the cause is momentary,

original: 'bras bu yang skad cig pa nyid du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang skad cig pa nyid du rig par bya ste /
translated: the effect should be understood as momentary.

original: gzugs 'byung ba'i rgyu gang dag yin pa dang / rkyen gang dag yin pa de dag ni mi rtag pa yin na /
analyzed: gzugs 'byung ba'i rgyu gang dag yin pa dang / rkyen gang dag yin pa de dag ni mi rtag pa yin na /
translated: Those which are the causes and conditions of the arising of form are impermanent.

original: rgyu rkyen mi rtag pa la brten nas 'byung ba'i gzugs rtag par ga las 'gyur zhes mdo las byung ba'i tshig gi tshul du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen mi rtag pa la brten nas 'byung ba'i gzugs rtag par ga las 'gyur zhes mdo las byung ba'i tshig gi tshul du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in the manner of the words of the sutra.

original: sems dbang bsgyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mthu khyad par du 'phags pa'i sems gzugs la dbang bsgyur ba ste /
analyzed: sems dbang bsgyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mthu khyad par du 'phags pa'i sems gzugs la dbang bsgyur ba ste /
translated: Because it controls the mind, the mind that is superior in power controls form.

original: de ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it transforms form in accordance with its wishes.

original: de'i phyir skad cig re re la rnam pa gzhan du mos na rnam pa gzhan 'byung bas skad cig pa nyid du grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig re re la rnam pa gzhan du mos na rnam pa gzhan 'byung bas skad cig pa nyid du grub po //
translated: Therefore, if one wishes for a different aspect in each moment, another aspect arises. Thus momentariness is established.

original: yang @38a * //
analyzed: yang @38a * //
translated: Again,

original: mthar 'gyur bar dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mthar 'gyur bar dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: because its final state is observed.

original: skad cig re re la rang bzhin gyis 'gyur ba med par glo bur du gzugs kyi tha mar 'gyur ba'i mi rigs na zhes dpe gzhan las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: skad cig re re la rang bzhin gyis 'gyur ba med par glo bur du gzugs kyi tha mar 'gyur ba'i mi rigs na zhes dpe gzhan las 'byung ngo //
translated: It is unreasonable that form suddenly changes in its final state without changing in nature moment by moment. This is stated in another example.

original: mtha' mi 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
analyzed: mtha' mi 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
translated: If it is reasonable that the final state does not change,

original: de yang dmigs pa de bas na mtha' ma'i gzugs kyi 'gyur ba'i rang gi rgyud kyi skad cig re re 'gyur ba 'phel ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir gzugs skad cig par grub bo //
analyzed: de yang dmigs pa de bas na mtha' ma'i gzugs kyi 'gyur ba'i rang gi rgyud kyi skad cig re re 'gyur ba 'phel ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir gzugs skad cig par grub bo //
translated: Moreover, because of that object, the change of form in the final moment arises from a cause that increases the change in each moment of its own continuum. Therefore, form is established as momentary.

original: skyes nas kyang rkyen la mi ltos par rang gi ngang gis rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skyes pa thams cad ni rkyen la mi ltos par rang gi ngang nyid kyis 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes nas kyang rkyen la mi ltos par rang gi ngang gis rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skyes pa thams cad ni rkyen la mi ltos par rang gi ngang nyid kyis 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because, having arisen, it perishes by itself without depending on conditions. All that has arisen perishes by itself without depending on conditions.

original: de'i phyir rkyen gzhan la mi ltos par gdon mi za bar 'jig ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rkyen gzhan la mi ltos par gdon mi za bar 'jig ste /
translated: Therefore, without doubt, it perishes without depending on other conditions.

original: dngos po skyes pa tsam nyid kyis 'jig pa ma yin la /
analyzed: dngos po skyes pa tsam nyid kyis 'jig pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not that an entity perishes merely by arising.

original: phyis 'jig go zhes bya bar ni bye brag cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: phyis 'jig go zhes bya bar ni bye brag cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is not the slightest difference in saying that it perishes later.

original: de lta bas na rnam par 'jig pa'i tshul can thams cad ni skyes pa tsam gyis 'jig par 'gyur bas skad cig pa nyid du grub bo //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par 'jig pa'i tshul can thams cad ni skyes pa tsam gyis 'jig par 'gyur bas skad cig pa nyid du grub bo //
translated: Therefore, because all that has the mode of perishing perishes merely by arising, momentariness is established.

original: phyogs gcig la brten pa'i dngos po'i don ni rgyur byas pa'i don to zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i phyogs la mi ltos par 'byung bar gyur pa logs shig tu rang dbang du 'byung ba'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs gcig la brten pa'i dngos po'i don ni rgyur byas pa'i don to zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i phyogs la mi ltos par 'byung bar gyur pa logs shig tu rang dbang du 'byung ba'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúbased on one part‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúderived from the primary elements,‚Äù because the derived form does not have the power to arise independently, without relying on the primary elements.

original: 'byung ba gcig las gyur ba'i 'dus pa yang yod de /
analyzed: 'byung ba gcig las gyur ba'i 'dus pa yang yod de /
translated: There is a combination that is derived from one primary element.

original: 'di lta ste sa rdog skam po lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste sa rdog skam po lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a dry lump of clay.

original: 'byung ba gnyis las gyur pa yang yod de /
analyzed: 'byung ba gnyis las gyur pa yang yod de /
translated: There is a combination that is derived from two primary elements.

original: de nyid gsher ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsher ba'o //
translated: That same lump of clay when it is moist.

original: 'byung ba gsum las gyur pa yang yod de de nyid dro ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba gsum las gyur pa yang yod de de nyid dro ba'o //
translated: There is a combination that is derived from three primary elements. That same lump of clay when it is warm.

original: 'byung ba thams cad las gyur pa yang yod de /
analyzed: 'byung ba thams cad las gyur pa yang yod de /
translated: There is a combination that is derived from all four primary elements.

original: sa rdog de nyid gsher ba dang dro ba dang 'dril zhing 'gro ba'i tshe'o //
analyzed: sa rdog de nyid gsher ba dang dro ba dang 'dril zhing 'gro ba'i tshe'o //
translated: That same lump of clay when it is moist, warm, and pliable.

original: 'dus pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gcig pa yang yod de /
analyzed: 'dus pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gcig pa yang yod de /
translated: There is derived form that is a combination of one type.

original: 'di lta ste 'od lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'od lta bu'o //
translated: For example, light.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gnyis dang ldan pa yang yod de 'di lta ste sgra dang / dri dang bcas pa'i rlung lta bu'o //üîΩrgyur byas pa'i gzugs gsum dang ldan pa yang yod de /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gnyis dang ldan pa yang yod de 'di lta ste sgra dang / dri dang bcas pa'i rlung lta bu'o // rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gsum dang ldan pa yang yod de /
translated: There is a second type of derivative form that is associated with two primary elements, for example, wind that is accompanied by sound and odor.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: There is a third type of derivative form that is associated with three primary elements, for example,

original: du ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: du ba lta bu'o //
translated: smoke.

original: de ni gzugs dang dri dang reg bya'i bye brag gis rab tu phye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni gzugs dang dri dang reg bya'i bye brag gis rab tu phye ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is classified as such because it is a particular type of form, odor, and tactility.

original: reg bya'i bye brag ni 'dir yang pa nyid du rig par bya'o //üîΩyang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gsum dang ldan pa yang yod de /
analyzed: reg bya'i bye brag ni 'dir yang pa nyid du rig par bya'o // yang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gsum dang ldan pa yang yod de /
translated: The tactility in this case is lightness.üîΩThere is a fourth type of derivative form that is associated with three primary elements, for example, water that is contained in a jeweled vessel that is devoid of odor.

original: dri rnam pa med pa'i nor bu'i snod kyi nang na yod pa'i chu la gzugs dang @38b ro dang reg bya yod pa'o //üîΩrgyur byas pa'i gzugs bzhi dang ldan pa yang yod de /
analyzed: dri rnam pa med pa'i nor bu'i snod kyi nang na yod pa'i chu la gzugs dang @38b ro dang reg bya yod pa'o // rgyur byas pa'i gzugs bzhi dang ldan pa yang yod de /
translated: It is a particular type of form, taste, and tactility.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: There is a fifth type of derivative form that is associated with four primary elements, for example,

original: bu ram gyi ling lta bu'o //üîΩrgyur byas pa'i gzugs lnga dang ldan pa yang yod de /
analyzed: bu ram gyi ling lta bu'o // rgyur byas pa'i gzugs lnga dang ldan pa yang yod de /
translated: molasses.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: There is a sixth type of derivative form that is associated with five primary elements, for example,

original: de nyid sgra dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid sgra dang bcas pa'o //
translated: molasses that is accompanied by sound.

original: de ltar gzhan la yang 'byung ba'am 'byung ba las gyur ba gang na gang dmigs pa de na yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan la yang 'byung ba'am 'byung ba las gyur ba gang na gang dmigs pa de na yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: Thus, it should be understood that whatever is perceived in a certain place is present there, whether it is another primary element or something derived from the primary elements.

original: gzhan du na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not present in any other way.

original: rdul phra rab lus med pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: rdul phra rab lus med pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
translated: The particle is without body means that it is without intrinsic nature.

original: rnam par gzhag pa tsam du zad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa tsam du zad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it is merely a designation.

original: bshig na mu thug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshig na mu thug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there would be no end to the process of breaking down.

original: blos mthar rab tu phye nas rdul phra rab tu rnam par gzhag ces bya ba ni blos ji tsam du cha shas kyis bshig pa'i mthar rab tu dbye bar nus pa de tsam du rdul phra rab tu rnam par 'jog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: blos mthar rab tu phye nas rdul phra rab tu rnam par gzhag ces bya ba ni blos ji tsam du cha shas kyis bshig pa'i mthar rab tu dbye bar nus pa de tsam du rdul phra rab tu rnam par 'jog par byed pa'o //
translated: The particle is posited as the limit of divisibility by the intellect means that the particle is posited as the limit of divisibility by the intellect, to the extent that it is able to divide it into parts.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar lus med kyang rdul phra rab tu rnam par 'jog ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar lus med kyang rdul phra rab tu rnam par 'jog ce na /
translated: Why is it posited as a particle, even though it is without body?

original: ril po'i 'du shes rnam par bshig pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ril po'i 'du shes rnam par bshig pa'i phyir te /
translated: In order to destroy the notion of a whole.

original: gzugs la blos cha shas kyis bshig na 'di thams cad ni gzugs gcig go zhes ril por 'du shes pa dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs la blos cha shas kyis bshig na 'di thams cad ni gzugs gcig go zhes ril por 'du shes pa dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: If form is destroyed by the mind through its parts, then one becomes free from the notion that all of this is a single form.

original: 'di ltar gang zag la bdag med par 'jug pa'i rjes su mthun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zag la bdag med par 'jug pa'i rjes su mthun par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, it becomes a concordant cause for the penetration of the selflessness of persons.

original: gzugs la rdzas su yongs su grub pa med par 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs la rdzas su yongs su grub pa med par 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In order to penetrate the non-substantial establishment of form.

original: de ltar blos rab tu phye na gzugs ci yang med par rtogs nas gzugs la rdzas su yongs su grub pa med par 'jug ste /
analyzed: de ltar blos rab tu phye na gzugs ci yang med par rtogs nas gzugs la rdzas su yongs su grub pa med par 'jug ste /
translated: In this way, having realized that there is no form at all when it is distinguished by the mind, one penetrates the non-substantial establishment of form.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rig pa tsam du 'jug pas chos la bdag med pa la 'jug pa'i rjes su mthun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rig pa tsam du 'jug pas chos la bdag med pa la 'jug pa'i rjes su mthun par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, it becomes a concordant cause for the penetration of the selflessness of dharmas, since one penetrates mere representation.

original: blo'i dbye ba dang rdzas kyi dbye bas rdul phra rab rnam par gzhag par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: blo'i dbye ba dang rdzas kyi dbye bas rdul phra rab rnam par gzhag par shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that the atom is posited by the division of the mind and the division of substance.

original: tshig gnyis dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig gnyis dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: In accordance with the two phrases.

original: sdug bsngal shin tu rgyas la ma bsrabs pa ni 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal shin tu rgyas la ma bsrabs pa ni 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: The suffering that is very extensive and not reduced is that of those who do not accumulate roots of virtue in the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa'i khams ni sdug bsngal nyid thams cad dang / 'gro ba dang skye gnas kyis rab tu phye ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pas na /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ni sdug bsngal nyid thams cad dang / 'gro ba dang skye gnas kyis rab tu phye ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pas na /
translated: The desire realm is distinguished by all the sufferings, by the destinies and birth processes, and by not accumulating roots of virtue.

original: thogs pa med par 'gro ba thams cad du 'gro ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: thogs pa med par 'gro ba thams cad du 'gro ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not obstructed, one goes to all destinies.

original: go rims bzhin du de ni shin tu rgyas la ma bsrabs par rig par bya'o //üîΩbsrabs pa ni de nyid thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa skye pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du de ni shin tu rgyas la ma bsrabs par rig par bya'o // bsrabs pa ni de nyid thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa skye pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: Thus it should be understood that the desire realm is very extensive and not reduced.

original: gdon mi za bar yongs @39a * //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar yongs @39a * //
translated: The suffering that is reduced is that of those who are born in the desire realm and who are suitable for the factors of liberation.

original: su mya ngan las 'das par nges par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: su mya ngan las 'das par nges par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are certain to attain nirvana.

original: bsrabs pa'ang ma yin la ma bsrabs pa'ang ma yin pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal de nyid 'jig rten pas 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: bsrabs pa'ang ma yin la ma bsrabs pa'ang ma yin pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal de nyid 'jig rten pas 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: It is neither reduced nor not reduced for those who have generated the roots of virtue in order to become free from attachment to the suffering of the desire realm itself,

original: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid la sogs pa las yang dag par shin tu 'da' bar nges par byas pa dang / gtan du ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid la sogs pa las yang dag par shin tu 'da' bar nges par byas pa dang / gtan du ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because they are certain to completely transcend the suffering of suffering, etc., but not permanently.

original: go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin no //
translated: It is as stated.

original: bar ma bsrabs pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin du ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bar ma bsrabs pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin du ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The intermediate, etc., should be applied in the same way, as is fitting.

original: bsrabs pa chen pos nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sems can du ma'i rgyud la yod pa'i sdug bsngal bsal bar nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsrabs pa chen pos nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sems can du ma'i rgyud la yod pa'i sdug bsngal bsal bar nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great reduction is called ‚Äúabiding in the reduction‚Äù because it abides in the removal of the suffering that exists in the mindstreams of many sentient beings.

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i sems yod pa la 'chi ba zhes bya ba ni bdag la chags pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'chi 'pho ba'i sems kyi snga rol gyi gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i sems yod pa la 'chi ba zhes bya ba ni bdag la chags pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'chi 'pho ba'i sems kyi snga rol gyi gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
translated: Death is said to exist for those who have a virtuous mind, etc. This should be understood as referring to the period prior to the mind of death and rebirth that is associated with attachment to a self.

original: yid las byung ba zhes bya ba ni rdzus te skye ba nyid de /
analyzed: yid las byung ba zhes bya ba ni rdzus te skye ba nyid de /
translated: Arisen from mind means born supernaturally.

original: sems tsam gyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems tsam gyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises from the cause of mind alone.

original: dri za zhes bya ba ni dris 'gro ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dri za zhes bya ba ni dris 'gro ba'i phyir te /
translated: Gandharva means moving by smell.

original: dri dang mthun par skye ba'i yul du 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dri dang mthun par skye ba'i yul du 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that it goes to the place of birth in accordance with smell.

original: de ltar thogs na zhag bdun gnas te /
analyzed: de ltar thogs na zhag bdun gnas te /
translated: It remains in the intermediate state for seven days at the longest.

original: de tshun chad kyis 'chi 'pho'o zhes bya ba ni gal te skye ba'i rkyen rnyed na'o //
analyzed: de tshun chad kyis 'chi 'pho'o zhes bya ba ni gal te skye ba'i rkyen rnyed na'o //
translated: It dies and passes on within that period if it finds the conditions for birth.

original: ci ste ma rnyed na zhag bdun gyi 'og tu shi 'phos nas yang bar do'i srid pa nyid 'grub bo //
analyzed: ci ste ma rnyed na zhag bdun gyi 'og tu shi 'phos nas yang bar do'i srid pa nyid 'grub bo //
translated: If it does not find them, it dies and passes on after seven days and again establishes an intermediate state existence.

original: de ltar lan bdun gyi bar du byas nas ci ste na ldog go zhes bya ba ni gal te gnas skabs de na gzhan du skye ba'i rkyen stobs dang ldan pa zhig mngon du gyur na ste /üîΩbsam gtan bzhi pa thob pa'i dge slong dgra bcom pa'o snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can sa de pa'i bar mdo'i srid pa mngon par grub pa na thar pa la skur ba 'debs pa log par lta ba rnyed nas sems can dmyal ba'i bar mdo'i srid pa
analyzed: de ltar lan bdun gyi bar du byas nas ci ste na ldog go zhes bya ba ni gal te gnas skabs de na gzhan du skye ba'i rkyen stobs dang ldan pa zhig mngon du gyur na ste / bsam gtan bzhi pa thob pa'i dge slong dgra bcom pa'o snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can sa de pa'i bar mdo'i srid pa mngon par grub pa na thar pa la skur ba 'debs pa log par lta ba rnyed nas sems can dmyal ba'i bar mdo'i srid pa
translated: If at that time, a powerful condition for birth elsewhere manifests,

original: mngon par 'grub pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa bzhin no //
translated: for example, a bhik·π£u who has attained the fourth meditation, who has the pride of thinking he is an arhat, who has attained the intermediate existence of the level of that meditation, who then finds the wrong view that denies liberation, and who then attains the intermediate existence of a hell being.

original: de na gnas pa yang las bsogs so zhes pa ni sngon gyi 'phen pa'i dbang gis dge ba la sogs pa'i sems kun tu 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na gnas pa yang las bsogs so zhes pa ni sngon gyi 'phen pa'i dbang gis dge ba la sogs pa'i sems kun tu 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And while abiding there, one accumulates karma, because virtuous and nonvirtuous minds arise due to the power of previous projection.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i sems can rnams kyang mthong zhes bya ba ni gang dag dang lhan cig tu sngon dge ba'am //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i sems can rnams kyang mthong zhes bya ba ni gang dag dang lhan cig tu sngon dge ba'am //
translated: And one sees sentient beings of the same fortune, because one sees those with whom one previously engaged in virtue or nonvirtue.

original: mi dge ba kun tu spyod par gyur pa de dag dang bdag lhan cig tu 'dug par rmi @39b lam tsam gyi tshod du shes so //
analyzed: mi dge ba kun tu spyod par gyur pa de dag dang bdag lhan cig tu 'dug par rmi @39b lam tsam gyi tshod du shes so //
translated: I know that I will be with those who are practicing nonvirtue, even if it is only in a dream.

original: gang du skye bar 'gyur ba de'i sngon logs kyi srid pa'i byad gzugs grub bo //
analyzed: gang du skye bar 'gyur ba de'i sngon logs kyi srid pa'i byad gzugs grub bo //
translated: Wherever I will be born, the form of the prior existence is established there.

original: de'i 'og tu dbang po rnams mngon par 'grub ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dbang po rnams mngon par 'grub ste /
translated: After that, the faculties are established.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba las ji skad du 'byung ba de bzhin zhes bya ba ni ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba las ji skad du 'byung ba de bzhin zhes bya ba ni ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rim pas so //
translated: As it occurs in the dependent origination, ‚Äújust as it occurs,‚Äù means by the order of name and form, etc.

original: ji skad du /üîΩthog ma nyid du nur nur 'gyur //
analyzed: ji skad du / thog ma nyid du nur nur 'gyur //
translated: As it is said:üîΩFirst, there is the kalala.

original: nur nur po las mer mer 'gyur //üîΩmer mer po las nar nar 'gyur //
analyzed: nur nur po las mer mer 'gyur // mer mer po las nar nar 'gyur //
translated: From the kalala, there is the arbuda.üîΩFrom the arbuda, there is the pe≈õin.

original: nar nar po las gor gor 'gyur //
analyzed: nar nar po las gor gor 'gyur //
translated: From the pe≈õin, there is the ghana.

original: gor gor po las rkang lag 'gyus //üîΩskra spu sen mo la sogs 'byung //
analyzed: gor gor po las rkang lag 'gyus // skra spu sen mo la sogs 'byung //
translated: From the ghana, there are the hands and feet.

original: dbang po gzugs can rnams dang ni //
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can rnams dang ni //
translated: The hair of the head, body hair, and nails, etc., arise.üîΩThe material faculties

original: mtshan rnams mthar gyis 'byung bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mtshan rnams mthar gyis 'byung bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: and the secondary signs gradually arise.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa ni gang las sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa ni gang las sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba ste /
translated: The truth of origin is that from which suffering originates.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba'i las te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba'i las te /
translated: It is the afflictions and karma that arises under the influence of the afflictions.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the same as saying ‚Äúthat which is contaminated.‚Äù

original: gal te de lta ma yin na kun 'byung ba zhes bstan pa la ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis sred pa nyid bstan ce na /
analyzed: gal te de lta ma yin na kun 'byung ba zhes bstan pa la ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis sred pa nyid bstan ce na /
translated: If it were not so, why would the Lord teach craving alone as the origin when he taught the four truths?

original: thams cad du 'gro bas gtso bor gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro bas gtso bor gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because craving is the most important, since it pervades all.

original: ji ltar sred pa dngos po thams cad du 'gro ba ni thob pa dang ma thob pa'i yul dang yul gyi dngos po thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar sred pa dngos po thams cad du 'gro ba ni thob pa dang ma thob pa'i yul dang yul gyi dngos po thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Craving pervades all things, since it pervades all objects, both those that are obtained and those that are not obtained.

original: de la lus thob pa ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: de la lus thob pa ni sred pa'o //
translated: In this regard, craving for what is obtained is attachment to pleasure.

original: ma thob pa ni yang 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ma thob pa ni yang 'byung ba'o //
translated: Craving for what is not obtained is the desire for it to occur.

original: thob pa'i yul rnams ni dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: thob pa'i yul rnams ni dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Craving for the objects of what is obtained is attachment to pleasure.

original: ma thob pa'i yul rnams ni /
analyzed: ma thob pa'i yul rnams ni /
translated: Craving for the objects of what is not obtained is the desire for it to occur.

original: de dang de la mngon par dga' bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dang de la mngon par dga' bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that it is the craving for that and that.

original: gnas skabs thams cad du 'gro ba ni /üîΩ'du byed rnams kyi sdug bsngal la sogs pa gnas skabs gsum po dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad du 'gro ba ni / 'du byed rnams kyi sdug bsngal la sogs pa gnas skabs gsum po dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the craving for all states.üîΩBecause conditioned states are associated with the three states of suffering.

original: de la sdug bsngal nyid yi gnas skabs thob pa la ni 'bral bar srid do //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal nyid yi gnas skabs thob pa la ni 'bral bar srid do //
translated: In regard to the state of obtaining the suffering of suffering, there is the possibility of separation.

original: ma thob pa la ni mi phrad par srid do //
analyzed: ma thob pa la ni mi phrad par srid do //
translated: In regard to the state of not obtaining it, there is the possibility of non-contact.

original: 'gyur ba'i sdig bsngal nyid kyi gnas skabs la ni thob pa dang ma thob pa'i bye brag gis mi 'bral ba'i srid pa dang phrad pa'i sred pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i sdig bsngal nyid kyi gnas skabs la ni thob pa dang ma thob pa'i bye brag gis mi 'bral ba'i srid pa dang phrad pa'i sred pa'o //
translated: In regard to the state of the suffering of change, there is the craving for separation and the craving for contact, respectively, due to the distinction of obtaining and not obtaining.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyi gnas skabs la ni gti mug gi sred pa ste /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyi gnas skabs la ni gti mug gi sred pa ste /
translated: In regard to the state of the suffering of the formative forces, there is the craving for delusion.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len gyis rab tu phye ba dang // sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len gyis rab tu phye ba dang // sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is distinguished by the negative reflex action of the mental addictions and by the sensation that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: bye brag tu ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni @40a * //
analyzed: bye brag tu ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni @40a * //
translated: In particular, the foundation consciousness isüîΩ

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyi gnas skabs te /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyi gnas skabs te /
translated: In particular, the foundation consciousness is the state of the suffering of the formative forces.

original: de la bdag tu rmongs pa'i sgo nas srid pa 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la bdag tu rmongs pa'i sgo nas srid pa 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that existence arises through the door of delusion of self.

original: dus thams cad du 'gro ba ni dus gsum po dag ni rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du 'gro ba ni dus gsum po dag ni rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is omnipresent in time because it is present in the three times.

original: 'das pa'i dus la ni bltas pa'i rnam pas rjes su 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus la ni bltas pa'i rnam pas rjes su 'gro'o //
translated: It is present in the past time through the aspect of looking.

original: ma 'ongs pa la ni mngon par dga' ba'i rnam pas rjes su 'gro'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la ni mngon par dga' ba'i rnam pas rjes su 'gro'o //
translated: It is present in the future through the aspect of delight.

original: da ltar byung ba la ni lhag par chags pas rjes su 'gro'o //üîΩkhams thams cad du 'gro ba ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa dag gi sred pa dag gis khams gsum khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba la ni lhag par chags pas rjes su 'gro'o // khams thams cad du 'gro ba ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa dag gi sred pa dag gis khams gsum khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is present in the present through the aspect of attachment.üîΩIt is omnipresent in the realms because craving for the desire, form and formless realms pervades the three realms.

original: tshor ba thams cad du 'gro ba ni des 'dod pa dang sred pa dang log pas tshangs par spyod pa tshol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba thams cad du 'gro ba ni des 'dod pa dang sred pa dang log pas tshangs par spyod pa tshol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is omnipresent in feeling because it seeks the pure state through craving for desire and craving for feeling.

original: 'dod pa'i tshol bas ni 'dod pa'i khams las yongs su ma grol ba de nyid du sdug bsngal 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i tshol bas ni 'dod pa'i khams las yongs su ma grol ba de nyid du sdug bsngal 'grub par byed do //
translated: The search for sensual pleasure causes the suffering of those who are not liberated from the realm of desire.

original: de bzhin du srid pa tshol bas ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su sdug bsngal 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du srid pa tshol bas ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su sdug bsngal 'grub par byed do //
translated: Similarly, the search for existence causes the suffering of those who are not liberated from the realms of form and the formless.

original: log pas tshangs par spyod pa tshol bas ni 'khor ba las yongs su ma grol bar der 'khor ro //
analyzed: log pas tshangs par spyod pa tshol bas ni 'khor ba las yongs su ma grol bar der 'khor ro //
translated: The search for a false holiness causes those who are not liberated from cyclic existence to revolve in it.

original: rnam pa thams cad du 'gro ba ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i sred pas rtag pa dang chad pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du 'gro ba ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i sred pas rtag pa dang chad pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The search that goes in all directions is so called because it is associated with the aspects of eternalism and nihilism through craving for origination and craving for destruction.

original: lta ba rnam pa lnga'i bye brag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba rnam pa lnga'i bye brag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The five types of views are the view of the perishable composite, the extreme views, the false views, the esteeming of views, and the esteeming of morality and asceticism.

original: rab tu ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of complete lack of peace should be understood as the general characteristic of the defilements.

original: de la rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: de la rnam pa drug ste /
translated: It is of six kinds:

original: 'di ltar g-yeng bas rab tu ma zhi ba dang / phyin ci log gis rab tu ma zhi ba dang / rgod pas rab tu ma zhi ba dang / rmugs pas rab tu ma zhi ba dang / bag med pas rab tu ma zhi ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar g-yeng bas rab tu ma zhi ba dang / phyin ci log gis rab tu ma zhi ba dang / rgod pas rab tu ma zhi ba dang / rmugs pas rab tu ma zhi ba dang / bag med pas rab tu ma zhi ba dang /
translated: lack of peace due to distraction, lack of peace due to the perversions, lack of peace due to agitation, lack of peace due to torpor, lack of peace due to carelessness,

original: 'dzem pa med pas rab tu ma zhi ba'o //
analyzed: 'dzem pa med pas rab tu ma zhi ba'o //
translated: and lack of peace due to lack of restraint.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ma spangs par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni de'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len legs par ma bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ma spangs par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni de'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len legs par ma bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The latent tendency of the defilements is not destroyed means that the dissonant mental factor that accompanies it is not well subdued.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gnas kyi chos snang bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni chags par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gnas kyi chos snang bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni chags par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The appearance of the object of the defilements is manifest means that there is attachment and so on.

original: de la yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa nye bar gnas pa yin zhes bya ba ni yul de la sdug @40b pa'i mtshan ma la sogs pa 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: de la yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa nye bar gnas pa yin zhes bya ba ni yul de la sdug @40b pa'i mtshan ma la sogs pa 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the statement ‚Äúincorrect mental activity is present‚Äù means that one grasps the sign of beauty, etc. with regard to that object.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ba dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ba dang mthun pa'o //
translated: It is compatible with the arising of passion, etc.

original: ma rig pa dang lta ba dang the tshom sa gong ma pa la dmigs pa yang yod mod kyi /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang lta ba dang the tshom sa gong ma pa la dmigs pa yang yod mod kyi /
translated: Although there is ignorance, view, and doubt that have a higher stage as their object,

original: de dag ni ji ltar rang gi sa pa la dmigs pa bzhin dus de mngon sum du dmigs pa ni ma yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag ni ji ltar rang gi sa pa la dmigs pa bzhin dus de mngon sum du dmigs pa ni ma yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: it should be understood that they do not have that stage as their direct object, as they do with regard to their own stage.

original: de la kun tu brtags pa'i sgo nas zhugs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la kun tu brtags pa'i sgo nas zhugs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are engaged through imagination,

original: de la dmigs par rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs par rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: they should be understood as being established as having that as their object.

original: de la ma rig pas gong ma pa la dmigs pa ni gang lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma rig pas gong ma pa la dmigs pa ni gang lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: Among them, ignorance that has a higher stage as its object is that associated with view.

original: lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma gtogs te /
analyzed: lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma gtogs te /
translated: View is all views except for the view of the aggregates.

original: gzhan gyi sa pa'i 'du byed la nga'o snyam du mngon par zhen pa ni ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sa pa'i 'du byed la nga'o snyam du mngon par zhen pa ni ma mthong ngo //
translated: One does not see the conceit ‚ÄúI am‚Äù with regard to the formative forces of another stage.

original: sa gong ma'i nyon mongs pa ni sa 'og ma dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa gong ma'i nyon mongs pa ni sa 'og ma dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The afflictions of higher levels do not focus on lower levels, because one is free from attachment to those.

original: 'gog pa dang lam la dmigs pa ni de gnyis la dmigs pa ma yin te //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam la dmigs pa ni de gnyis la dmigs pa ma yin te //
translated: Those that focus on cessation and the path do not focus on those two,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes dang / de'i rjes la thob pa so so rang rang gis rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i dmigs pa ni des yongs su rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni de'i dmigs pa ni des yongs su brtags pa'o zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes dang / de'i rjes la thob pa so so rang rang gis rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro // de'i dmigs pa ni des yongs su rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni de'i dmigs pa ni des yongs su brtags pa'o zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: because they are objects to be realized by supramundane wisdom and by the subsequent wisdom that is attained subsequently.üîΩThe object of that is fully understood by that means that the object of that is fully investigated by that.

original: de'i dmigs pa ni des yongs su rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig de las yongs su brtags pa gud na med do //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa ni des yongs su rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig de las yongs su brtags pa gud na med do //
translated: The words ‚Äúthe object of that is fully understood by that‚Äù are not different from ‚Äúthe object of that is fully investigated by that.‚Äù

original: 'dod chags ni khong khro dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni shin tu mi mthun pa gnyis gcig tu 'byung ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni khong khro dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni shin tu mi mthun pa gnyis gcig tu 'byung ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Attachment is not concomitant with anger, because it is illogical for two mutually opposing minds to occur together.

original: the tshom dang yang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: the tshom dang yang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa ni /
translated: It is also not concomitant with doubt,

original: the tshom du gyur na blo gnas pa med pas chags par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom du gyur na blo gnas pa med pas chags par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when there is doubt, the mind is unstable and there is no attachment.üîΩThe remaining ones are concomitant with it,

original: lhag ma ni de dang zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal la sogs pa dang mi mthun pa med pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni de dang zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal la sogs pa dang mi mthun pa med pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan par rig par bya'o //
translated: because there is no incompatibility with pride, etc.üîΩAnger is not concomitant with pride or views,üîΩbecause one who is angry does not become proud or conceptualize.üîΩIt is also not concomitant with regret,

original: khong khro ba yang nga rgyal dang lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni su zhig dngos po gang la zhe 'gras par gyur pa des de khengs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khong khro ba yang nga rgyal dang lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni su zhig dngos po gang la zhe 'gras par gyur pa des de khengs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because one who is angry does not reflect on what he has done.

original: der yang rtog par mi nus so //
analyzed: der yang rtog par mi nus so //
translated: It is also not concomitant with sleep,üîΩbecause one who is angry does not sleep due to mental disturbance.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It is also not concomitant with investigation,üîΩbecause one who is angry does not investigate the meaning of words.üîΩIt is also not concomitant with analysis,üîΩbecause one who is angry does not analyze the meaning of words.

original: khong khro ba la sogs pa phan tshun mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khong khro ba la sogs pa phan tshun mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Anger is not concomitant with any of the other mental factors.

original: dper na 'dod chags kyi char gtogs pa rnams zhe sdang gi char gtogs pa dag dang ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'dod chags kyi char gtogs pa rnams zhe sdang gi char gtogs pa dag dang ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, those belonging to the category of attachment are not those belonging to the category of aversion.

original: mi mthun pa @41a * //
analyzed: mi mthun pa @41a * //
translated: There is no incompatibility.

original: med pa dag ni nyon mongs pa bzhin du mtshungs par ldan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: med pa dag ni nyon mongs pa bzhin du mtshungs par ldan par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that these are associated like the defilements.

original: ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa ni mi dge ba thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan no zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan la mi lta ba med par kun tu 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa ni mi dge ba thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan no zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan la mi lta ba med par kun tu 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Lack of self-respect and lack of modesty are associated with all that is unwholesome, because they occur without regard for self or other.

original: de bzhin du rmugs pa la sogs pa yang nyon mongs pa can thams cad dang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rmugs pa la sogs pa yang nyon mongs pa can thams cad dang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Similarly, torpor, etc. should be applied to all that is defiled.

original: las su mi rung ba nyid la sogs pa med par nyon mongs pa can mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las su mi rung ba nyid la sogs pa med par nyon mongs pa can mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for there to be defilement without unserviceability, etc.

original: gang zhig rnam pa gang gi dngos po gang la kun tu sbyor ba de bstan pas kun tu sbyor ba bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rnam pa gang gi dngos po gang la kun tu sbyor ba de bstan pas kun tu sbyor ba bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the explanation of the fetters is the explanation of the fetter that is associated with a certain thing in a certain way.

original: kun tu sbyor ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba ci zhe na /
translated: What are the fetters?

original: rjes su chags pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ni khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags kyi ngo bo nyid de kun tu sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ni khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags kyi ngo bo nyid de kun tu sbyor bar byed do //
translated: The fetter of attachment is the nature of desire for the three realms. It fetters because it causes one to be bound to the three realms.

original: rnam pa gang gis kun tu sbyor zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis kun tu sbyor zhe na /
translated: By what mode does it fetter?

original: de dang ldan pa khams gsum pa la yid mi 'byung ba ni mi dge ba kun tu spyod cing dge ba mi spyod pas so //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa khams gsum pa la yid mi 'byung ba ni mi dge ba kun tu spyod cing dge ba mi spyod pas so //
translated: One who is endowed with it does not take pleasure in the three realms, does not engage in virtue, and engages in non-virtue.

original: gang kun tu sbyor zhe na /
analyzed: gang kun tu sbyor zhe na /
translated: To what does it fetter?

original: phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par ro //
analyzed: phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par ro //
translated: To the future manifestation of suffering.

original: de bzhin du khong khro'i kun tu sbyor ba la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khong khro'i kun tu sbyor ba la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The fetter of aversion should be applied in the same way.

original: mi rig pa'i kun tu spyod pa dang ldan pa ni sdug bsngal gyi chos rnams dang / kun 'byung ba'i chos rnams la lhag par chags te 'bras bu dang rgyur gyur pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'du byed rnams dang de'i nyes dmigs yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rig pa'i kun tu spyod pa dang ldan pa ni sdug bsngal gyi chos rnams dang / kun 'byung ba'i chos rnams la lhag par chags te 'bras bu dang rgyur gyur pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'du byed rnams dang de'i nyes dmigs yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One who is endowed with the fetter of ignorance is attached to the phenomena of suffering and the phenomena of origination, because one does not fully understand the conditioned phenomena with outflows that are the causes and effects, and their disadvantages.

original: lta ba'i kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni log pas nges par 'byung ba kun tu tshol te bdag grol bar 'gyur ro //üîΩbdag grol lo //
analyzed: lta ba'i kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni log pas nges par 'byung ba kun tu tshol te bdag grol bar 'gyur ro // bdag grol lo //
translated: Those who are attached to views seek liberation through wrong means, thinking, ‚ÄúI will be liberated.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúI am liberated.‚ÄùüîΩ

original: grol nas kyang rtag par 'gyur ro snyam pa dang chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: grol nas kyang rtag par 'gyur ro snyam pa dang chad par 'gyur te /
translated: One who is bound by the fetter of views seeks a false liberation, thinking, I will be liberated, I am liberated, and having been liberated, I will be permanent.

original: sangs rgyas pa la thar pa med do snyam pa'o //üîΩmchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni log pas nges par 'byung ba'i thabs la rtog ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa la thar pa med do snyam pa'o // mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni log pas nges par 'byung ba'i thabs la rtog ste /
translated: Or, I will be annihilated.üîΩOne who is bound by the fetter of clinging to those views as supreme seeks a false means of liberation,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa por nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa dang / de sngon du 'gro ba'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyis lhag par yid ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa por nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa dang / de sngon du 'gro ba'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyis lhag par yid ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he superimposes the view of the transitory collection and so on and the discipline and ritual of that view on the eightfold noble path.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching bas 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid la sogs pa la 'ching bar bstan pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ni bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba la phra rgyas su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching bas 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid la sogs pa la 'ching bar bstan pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ni bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba la phra rgyas su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The teaching that the suffering of change is bound by the bonds of attachment, etc., is because attachment, etc., increase in relation to the feeling of pleasure, etc.

original: phyi rol gyi 'ching bas bcings pa ni gnyis mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi 'ching bas bcings pa ni gnyis mi 'thob ste /
translated: One who is bound by external bonds does not obtain two things:

original: 'gro ba mi @41b thob pa dang / 'dug kyang ji ltar 'dod pa dang / bsam pa dang / spyod pa dang 'dod pa bzhin du byed pa mi thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba mi @41b thob pa dang / 'dug kyang ji ltar 'dod pa dang / bsam pa dang / spyod pa dang 'dod pa bzhin du byed pa mi thob pa'o //
translated: he does not obtain the going he desires, and he does not obtain the sitting, lying down, etc., he desires, nor the thoughts, conduct, and activities he desires.

original: nang gi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching ba yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nang gi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching ba yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The internal bonds of attachment, etc., should be understood in the same way.

original: 'dod pa 'tshol ba ma spangs pa'i 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba'i bag la nyal phra rgyas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod pa 'tshol ba ma spangs pa'i 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba'i bag la nyal phra rgyas su 'gyur te /
translated: The latent tendencies of attachment to pleasure and irritation increase in one who has not abandoned the search for pleasure,

original: de'i sgo nas de gnyis rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas de gnyis rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because both of them increase through that.

original: log par thar pa dang / thar pa'i thabs la rtog par byed do zhes bya ba ni kun tu sbyor ba'i nang du lta ba gsum dang mchog tu 'dzin pa gnyis ji skad du bshad pa dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: log par thar pa dang / thar pa'i thabs la rtog par byed do zhes bya ba ni kun tu sbyor ba'i nang du lta ba gsum dang mchog tu 'dzin pa gnyis ji skad du bshad pa dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: The three views and the two convictions, as they have been explained, are the three fetters and the two convictions.

original: gang 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa sems las byung ba'i 'du byed kyi phung po nyon mongs pa can no zhes bya ba ni khro ba la sogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa sems las byung ba'i 'du byed kyi phung po nyon mongs pa can no zhes bya ba ni khro ba la sogs par rig par bya'o //
