translated: The afflicted class of volition that is other than attachment, etc., is anger, etc.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi dge ba'i phyogs kyi bar chad bya ba'i phyir yang dang yang shas cher sems la kun nas 'khril bar byed pas kun nas dkris pa dag go //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi dge ba'i phyogs kyi bar chad bya ba'i phyir yang dang yang shas cher sems la kun nas 'khril bar byed pas kun nas dkris pa dag go //
translated: The entanglements are so called because they repeatedly and strongly entangle the mind in the wholesome side of the yogis.

original: dge ba'i phyogs ni zhi gnas dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs ni zhi gnas dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa ste /
translated: The wholesome side is the cultivation of the signs of serenity, full awareness, and equanimity.

original: dus ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dus ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: It is in accordance with the time.

original: de dag gi gzhi ni tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa dag pas bsdus pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: de dag gi gzhi ni tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa dag pas bsdus pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: Their basis is morality that is included in the purity of pure morality, etc.

original: de la zhi gnas kyi dus ni rmugs pa dang gnyid par chad byed de /
analyzed: de la zhi gnas kyi dus ni rmugs pa dang gnyid par chad byed de /
translated: At the time of serenity, drowsiness and sleep are obstacles,

original: nang du zhum par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang du zhum par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they cause the mind to become internally withdrawn.

original: rab tu 'dzin pa'i dus na ni rgod pa dang 'gyod pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu 'dzin pa'i dus na ni rgod pa dang 'gyod pa ste /
translated: At the time of full attention, agitation and regret are obstacles,

original: phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they cause the mind to become externally distracted.

original: btang snyoms kyi dus na ni /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi dus na ni /
translated: At the time of equanimity,

original: phrag dog dang ser sna ste /
analyzed: phrag dog dang ser sna ste /
translated: envy and avarice are obstacles,

original: de dang ldan na gzhan dang bdag gi phun sum tshogs pa la mi bzod pa dang / kun tu 'dzin pa'i sgo nas yang dang yang sems g-yo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang ldan na gzhan dang bdag gi phun sum tshogs pa la mi bzod pa dang / kun tu 'dzin pa'i sgo nas yang dang yang sems g-yo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one who possesses them is intolerant of the excellence of others and of oneself, and because the mind is agitated again and again through grasping.

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i dus na ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i dus na ni /
translated: At the time of pure morality,

original: ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa ste /
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa ste /
translated: lack of shame and lack of dread are obstacles,

original: de gnyi ga dang ldan na rnam pa thams cad du ltung ba'i gnas kyis mi 'dzem pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyi ga dang ldan na rnam pa thams cad du ltung ba'i gnas kyis mi 'dzem pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one who possesses both of them is not afraid of any downfall.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rjes su mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyir chu bo dang sbyor ba go rims bzhin du rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rjes su mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyir chu bo dang sbyor ba go rims bzhin du rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The floods and the yokes are respectively established as being in conformity with and in opposition to the defilement of the realms of existence and the purification of the realms of existence.

original: gnas pa dang gnas 'brel ba'i tshul gyis so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas pa dang gnas 'brel ba'i tshul gyis so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The floods and the yokes are respectively established as being in conformity with and in opposition to the defilement of the realms of existence and the purification of the realms of existence.

original: lta ba'i chu bo ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i chu bo ni gnas pa'o //
translated: The flood of views is the basis,

original: ma rig pa'i chu bo ni gnas te /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i chu bo ni gnas te /
translated: the flood of ignorance is the basis of the basis,

original: @42a * // rmongs par gyur na thar pa dang de'i thabs la log par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @42a * // rmongs par gyur na thar pa dang de'i thabs la log par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when one is confused, one wrongly imagines liberation and the means to attain it.

original: lta ba dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi nye bar len pa gnyis kyis mu stegs can rnams nang rtsod de /
analyzed: lta ba dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi nye bar len pa gnyis kyis mu stegs can rnams nang rtsod de /
translated: The tirthikas dispute among themselves because of the two clingings to views and to morality and rituals,

original: de la blo du mar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la blo du mar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their minds are divided.

original: bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pas ni nang mi rtsod de ;
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pas ni nang mi rtsod de ;
translated: The Buddhists do not dispute among themselves because of the clinging to the belief in a self,

original: thams cad kyang bdag yod pa nyid du blo mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang bdag yod pa nyid du blo mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all of them agree that the self exists.

original: chos 'di pa rnams dang ni rtsod de /
analyzed: chos 'di pa rnams dang ni rtsod de /
translated: They dispute with those who are outside this doctrine,

original: bdag med par smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med par smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they profess the non-existence of the self.

original: brnab sems la sogs pa lus kyi mdud pa zhes bya ba ni de dag gzugs kyi lus kyi mdud pa ma yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: brnab sems la sogs pa lus kyi mdud pa zhes bya ba ni de dag gzugs kyi lus kyi mdud pa ma yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Covetousness, etc. are called ‚Äúknots of the body‚Äù because they are not knots of the body that are material forms.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin gyi lus kyi bar du bcod pas mdud pa dag go //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin gyi lus kyi bar du bcod pas mdud pa dag go //
translated: They are knots because they obstruct the body that is the nature of the mind in meditative equipoise.

original: so so'i lta ba la brten nas 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni don med pa'o zhes mngon par zhen nas shes bya la kun tu rtog pas tshul bzhin ma yin par shes bya la log par rtog pa'i rgyus sems rnam par g-yeng bar byed do //
analyzed: so so'i lta ba la brten nas 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni don med pa'o zhes mngon par zhen nas shes bya la kun tu rtog pas tshul bzhin ma yin par shes bya la log par rtog pa'i rgyus sems rnam par g-yeng bar byed do //
translated: One becomes distracted by the mind because of incorrect conceptualization of the object of knowledge, due to the cause of incorrect conceptualization of the object of knowledge, i.e., the adherence to the view of the reality of the perishable aggregates, thinking ‚Äúthis alone is the truth, the rest is meaningless.‚Äù

original: gang las rnam par g-yeng bar byed ce na /
analyzed: gang las rnam par g-yeng bar byed ce na /
translated: From what does one become distracted?

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa mthong ba la sogs /üîΩdge ba'i phyogs mi rtogs par 'gyur bar sems la sgrib par byed pas sgrib pa rnams te /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa mthong ba la sogs / dge ba'i phyogs mi rtogs par 'gyur bar sems la sgrib par byed pas sgrib pa rnams te /
translated: From the virtuous side, i.e., from the knowledge and insight of the mind in meditative equipoise, just as it is.üîΩThe obscurations are so called because they obscure the mind, i.e., prevent the understanding of the virtuous side.

original: dge ba la 'jug pa'i bar chad byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge ba la 'jug pa'i bar chad byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are called ‚Äúobstacles to engagement in the virtuous‚Äù because they are obstacles to engagement in the virtuous.

original: de la 'dod pa la 'dun pa ni rab tu 'byung ba la mngon par dga' ba'i bar chad byed de /üîΩyul la nye bar spyod par 'dod pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa la 'dun pa ni rab tu 'byung ba la mngon par dga' ba'i bar chad byed de / yul la nye bar spyod par 'dod pa'i sgo nas /
translated: Desire for sensual pleasure is an obstruction to delight in going forth,

original: de la mngon par mi dga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mngon par mi dga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not delight in going forth due to the desire to enjoy sensual objects.

original: gnod sems ni bskul ba'i dus na ste /
analyzed: gnod sems ni bskul ba'i dus na ste /
translated: Malice is an obstruction at the time of urging,

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis yang dag par bsgrub pa'i bslab pa'i gnas la bskul nas gnod sems kyi sems kyis yang dag par mi slob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis yang dag par bsgrub pa'i bslab pa'i gnas la bskul nas gnod sems kyi sems kyis yang dag par mi slob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not properly learn due to a malicious mind when urged by fellow brahmafarers to observe the rules of training.

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid dang / rgod pa dang 'gyod pa ni zhi gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa gnyis snga ma bzhin du zhum pa dang / rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid dang / rgod pa dang 'gyod pa ni zhi gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa gnyis snga ma bzhin du zhum pa dang / rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Dullness and drowsiness and excitedness and regret are obstructions to serenity and insight, respectively, because they cause depression and distraction, as before.

original: the tshom ni btang snyoms kyi dus na ste /
analyzed: the tshom ni btang snyoms kyi dus na ste /
translated: Doubt is an obstruction to equanimity,

original: gtan la phebs pa med par btang snyoms su byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan la phebs pa med par btang snyoms su byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is unable to be equanimous without determining the object.

original: gnyen po thong gshol gyis rlog par dka' ba'i phyir tha bar rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gnyen po thong gshol gyis rlog par dka' ba'i phyir tha bar rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that the term ‚Äúhardness‚Äù is established because it is difficult to plow with a counteragent.

original: tshe rabs gzhan na goms par byas pas spyod pas tha bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan na goms par byas pas spyod pas tha bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is hard because it is practiced in other lives through habituation.

original: 'chal @42b pa'i tshul khrims mi gtsang bar yid ches pa'i rgyu yin pas dri ma rnams so //
analyzed: 'chal @42b pa'i tshul khrims mi gtsang bar yid ches pa'i rgyu yin pas dri ma rnams so //
translated: The term ‚Äúdefilements‚Äù is used because they are the cause of confidence in impure morality.

original: yang dang yang 'khor bar skye ba dang 'chi ba'i tshul gyis gnod par byed pas sdig pa rnams so //
analyzed: yang dang yang 'khor bar skye ba dang 'chi ba'i tshul gyis gnod par byed pas sdig pa rnams so //
translated: The term ‚Äúsins‚Äù is used because they harm through the mode of birth and death in cyclic existence again and again.

original: srid pa dang srid pa'i yo byad rnams dang / dkon mchog rnams la sred pa dang / the tshom gyi sgo nas zhugs pas gnod pa'i phyir zug rdu rnams so //
analyzed: srid pa dang srid pa'i yo byad rnams dang / dkon mchog rnams la sred pa dang / the tshom gyi sgo nas zhugs pas gnod pa'i phyir zug rdu rnams so //
translated: The term ‚Äúthorns‚Äù is used because they harm through craving for existence, the requisites of existence, and the three jewels, and through doubt.

original: yo byad mang po yongs su 'dzin pas lci yang dang bcas par byas nas 'jig pa la sogs pa dang sbyor ba'i phyir lci yang rnams so //
analyzed: yo byad mang po yongs su 'dzin pas lci yang dang bcas par byas nas 'jig pa la sogs pa dang sbyor ba'i phyir lci yang rnams so //
translated: The term ‚Äúheavy and light‚Äù is used because they are connected with destruction, etc., having been made heavy and light through the possession of many requisites.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i mi dge ba spyod pa 'dres pas nyes par spyod pa rnams so //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i mi dge ba spyod pa 'dres pas nyes par spyod pa rnams so //
translated: The wrongdoers are those who engage in nonvirtuous actions such as killing, etc.

original: chags pa dang zhe sdang dang gti mug nyid mi dge ba'i rtsa bar rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: chags pa dang zhe sdang dang gti mug nyid mi dge ba'i rtsa bar rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Greed, hatred, and delusion are established as the roots of nonvirtue

original: de dag gi sgo nas sems can rnams nyes par spyad pa spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi sgo nas sems can rnams nyes par spyad pa spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because sentient beings engage in wrongdoings through their influence.

original: de la zang zing cung zad tsam gyi rgyus sems can longs spyod don du gnyer ba rnams chags pas nyes par spyad pa spyod do //
analyzed: de la zang zing cung zad tsam gyi rgyus sems can longs spyod don du gnyer ba rnams chags pas nyes par spyad pa spyod do //
translated: Among them, those who seek wealth engage in wrongdoings through greed, because of the cause of a slight material gain.

original: gnod par byas pa'i rgyu la yongs su rtog pa'i rgyus gzhan gyi nyes pa mi bzod pa rnams zhe sdang gis nyes par spyad pa spyod do //
analyzed: gnod par byas pa'i rgyu la yongs su rtog pa'i rgyus gzhan gyi nyes pa mi bzod pa rnams zhe sdang gis nyes par spyad pa spyod do //
translated: Those who do not tolerate the faults of others engage in wrongdoings through hatred, because of the cause of investigating the reason for the harm.

original: chos log pa la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyus phyin ci log tu lta ba la mchod sbyin la sogs pa dag gti mug gis nyes par spyad pa spyod do //
analyzed: chos log pa la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyus phyin ci log tu lta ba la mchod sbyin la sogs pa dag gti mug gis nyes par spyad pa spyod do //
translated: Those who are attached to false doctrines engage in wrongdoings through delusion, because of the cause of perverse views such as the performance of sacrifices.

original: sems rnam par 'phro bar zag par byed pa'i phyir zag pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems rnam par 'phro bar zag par byed pa'i phyir zag pa rnams so //
translated: They are called ‚Äúdefilements‚Äù because they cause the mind to flow out and be carried away.

original: lus dang sems la phongs par byed pas phongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: lus dang sems la phongs par byed pas phongs pa rnams so //
translated: They are called the poor because they are impoverished in body and mind.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i mtshan ma dang mngon rtags 'dzin du bcug nas lus dang sems la yongs su gdung bar byed pas yongs su gdung ba rnams so //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i mtshan ma dang mngon rtags 'dzin du bcug nas lus dang sems la yongs su gdung bar byed pas yongs su gdung ba rnams so //
translated: They are called the tormented because they are tormented in body and mind by being made to grasp and display improper signs.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po la dga' ba'am lhag par chags par byed du bcug nas de rnam par gyur na mya ngan la sogs pas sems can rnams nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir 'khrug ba rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po la dga' ba'am lhag par chags par byed du bcug nas de rnam par gyur na mya ngan la sogs pas sems can rnams nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir 'khrug ba rnams so //
translated: They are called the agitated because they are agitated by the suffering of change, etc., after being made to delight in and be attached to things such as form.

original: mtshon cha len pa la sogs pas 'thab par byed pas 'thab pa rnams so //
analyzed: mtshon cha len pa la sogs pas 'thab par byed pas 'thab pa rnams so //
translated: They are called the quarrelsome because they quarrel with one another through taking up weapons, etc.

original: chos ma yin pa la 'dod chags la sogs pa ni yongs su gdung ba chen po byed pas rims nad dang 'dra bas na rims nad rnams su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa la 'dod chags la sogs pa ni yongs su gdung ba chen po byed pas rims nad dang 'dra bas na rims nad rnams su rig par bya'o //
translated: The attachment to what is contrary to the Dharma, etc., should be known as the fevers because they cause great torment, like a fever.

original: de la chos ma yin pa la 'dod chags ni gang mi dge ba'i las kyi lam rnams la rjes su chags pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos ma yin pa la 'dod chags ni gang mi dge ba'i las kyi lam rnams la rjes su chags pa'o //
translated: Among them, attachment to what is contrary to the Dharma is the passion for the paths of unwholesome action.

original: mi mthun pas chags pa ni mi rigs pa'i chos ma yin pas yul kun tu 'tshol ba'o //üîΩchos log pa ni nyes par @43a * //
analyzed: mi mthun pas chags pa ni mi rigs pa'i chos ma yin pas yul kun tu 'tshol ba'o // chos log pa ni nyes par @43a * //
translated: Attachment to the unwholesome is the search for objects through unrighteous means.

original: bshad pa'i chos 'dul bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bshad pa'i chos 'dul bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The perverted Dharma is the teaching of a perverted Dharma and Vinaya.

original: skye ba'i rtsa ba 'du byed kyi shing gi nags tshal la chags par byed pas nags sbyor rnams so //
analyzed: skye ba'i rtsa ba 'du byed kyi shing gi nags tshal la chags par byed pas nags sbyor rnams so //
translated: The forest-like entanglements are so called because they are attached to the forest of the tree of karma, which is the root of birth.

original: lus la lta ba la sogs pa dang bcas pas dge ba la sbyor ba'i gegs byed pas gegs rnams so //
analyzed: lus la lta ba la sogs pa dang bcas pas dge ba la sbyor ba'i gegs byed pas gegs rnams so //
translated: The obstructions are so called because they obstruct the practice of virtue, since they are associated with the view of the body, etc.

original: lus la lta ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa ni sems kyi gegs lnga'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: lus la lta ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa ni sems kyi gegs lnga'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The five obstructions are taken as the basis, since they are associated with the view of the body, etc.

original: 'dod chags ni yul dang lta ba la sogs par rtog pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang go rims bzhin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni yul dang lta ba la sogs par rtog pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang go rims bzhin te /
translated: Attachment is the conception of objects and views, etc. , in order, as that which is to be abandoned by cultivation and that which is to be abandoned by the path of insight.

original: 'dod chags ni sdug pa tsam du dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni sdug pa tsam du dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Attachment is the apprehension of mere beauty.

original: gang yang sems can la 'dod chags pa de ni yul gyi sgo nyid nas log par rtog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang sems can la 'dod chags pa de ni yul gyi sgo nyid nas log par rtog par rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, that attachment to sentient beings should be known as a false imagination in terms of the door of objects.

original: de bzhin du khong khro ba ni mi mthun pa'i rgyu tsam du dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du khong khro ba ni mi mthun pa'i rgyu tsam du dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, aversion is a false imagination in terms of the door of objects, since it is observed as a mere cause of non-concordance.

original: sems can rnams la 'byung ba ni yul gyi sgo nyid nas log par rtog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la 'byung ba ni yul gyi sgo nyid nas log par rtog par rig par bya'o //
translated: That which occurs in relation to sentient beings should be known as a false imagination in terms of the door of objects.

original: nga rgyal ni sems can rnams dang lta ba log par rtog pa'o zhes bya ba ni chung du bas bdag che'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par 'byung ba'i phyir sems can rnams la log par rtog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal ni sems can rnams dang lta ba log par rtog pa'o zhes bya ba ni chung du bas bdag che'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par 'byung ba'i phyir sems can rnams la log par rtog par rig par bya'o //
translated: Pride is a false imagination in relation to sentient beings and views. It should be known as a false imagination in relation to sentient beings, since it occurs in the form of ‚ÄúI am superior to those who are inferior,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba ni shes bya la log par rtog pa'o zhes bya ba ni sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur ba'i sgo nas ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba ni shes bya la log par rtog pa'o zhes bya ba ni sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur ba'i sgo nas ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
translated: The false views of the perishable composite, extreme views, and wrong views are false imaginations in regard to objects of knowledge. They should be known as false imaginations in regard to objects of knowledge, since they are superimpositions and denials, respectively, in accordance with their individual natures.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni lta ba la log par rtog pa'o zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i nyes pa nyid kyis tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs la lhag par mchog tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni lta ba la log par rtog pa'o zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i nyes pa nyid kyis tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs la lhag par mchog tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The grasping of morality and rituals as paramount is a misconception about views means that because of the fault of views, one grasps morality and rituals as paramount.

original: the tshom ni gnyen po la log par rtog pa'o zhes bya ba ni bden pa rnams la blo rnam pa gnyis su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom ni gnyen po la log par rtog pa'o zhes bya ba ni bden pa rnams la blo rnam pa gnyis su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Doubt is a misconception about the antidote means that because of the two aspects of the mind with regard to the truths, there is doubt about the antidote.

original: nyon mongs pa bcu char yang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bcu char yang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: All ten afflictions are causes of suffering and origination.

original: de gnyis kyang de dag gi gzhi'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyang de dag gi gzhi'i gnas yin no //
translated: And those two are the basis of those.

original: de'i phyir de'i rgyu dang gzhi'i gnas kyis log par rtog pa rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rgyu dang gzhi'i gnas kyis log par rtog pa rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called misconceptions by way of their causes and basis.

original: 'gog pa dang lam la yang skrag pa skyes pas log par zhugs pa'o zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'khor ba la mngon bar dga' ba dang / rnam par byang ba la g-yeng bar 'du shes nas skrag pa dang / phyin ci log tu rtog pas 'gog pa dang lam la log par @43b rtog par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam la yang skrag pa skyes pas log par zhugs pa'o zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'khor ba la mngon bar dga' ba dang / rnam par byang ba la g-yeng bar 'du shes nas skrag pa dang / phyin ci log tu rtog pas 'gog pa dang lam la log par @43b rtog par blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the fear of cyclic existence through the power of the afflictions, and the fear of distraction in regard to purification, and the wrong understanding of cessation and the path through wrong conceptualization.

original: mu stegs can rnams kyis ni rnam pa gzhan du kun du brtags nas de la log par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams kyis ni rnam pa gzhan du kun du brtags nas de la log par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the tƒ´rthikas imagine in another way and wrongly understand it.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'dod chags rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa ni bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'dod chags rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa ni bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Attachment in the desire realm is associated with pleasure when it is associated with the five collections of consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa ni yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa ni yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: When associated with mental consciousness, it is associated with mental pleasure.

original: 'dod chags thams cad ni rgyun chad pa'i dus na btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: 'dod chags thams cad ni rgyun chad pa'i dus na btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: All attachment is associated with equanimity when it is interrupted.

original: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba gnyis dang mi mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba gnyis dang mi mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not concomitant with either pain or sorrow,

original: dga' ba'i rnam par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ba'i rnam par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises in the aspect of joy.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa'i khong khro ba ni sdug bsngal dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa'i khong khro ba ni sdug bsngal dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Anger concomitant with the five collections of consciousness is concomitant with pain.

original: drug pa yid kyi sa pa ni yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: drug pa yid kyi sa pa ni yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Anger on the level of the sixth mental consciousness is concomitant with mental pleasure.

original: thams cad ni btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: thams cad ni btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: All are concomitant with equanimity, as before.

original: bde ba dang yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not concomitant with pleasure or mental pleasure,

original: dman pa'i rnam par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dman pa'i rnam par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises in the aspect of inferiority.

original: nga rgyal ni 'dod pa'i khams na bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nga rgyal ni 'dod pa'i khams na bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Pride is not concomitant with pleasure in the desire realm,

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not concomitant with the five collections of consciousness.

original: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis par bde ba dang ji ltar ldan zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis par bde ba dang ji ltar ldan zhe na /
translated: How is it concomitant with pleasure in the first and second absorptions?

original: yid kyi sa pa'i bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: yid kyi sa pa'i bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: It is associated with the pleasure of the mental faculty.

original: de ni yid kyi sa pa'i bde ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de ni yid kyi sa pa'i bde ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What kind of pleasure of the mental faculty is it?

original: dga' ba dang bde ba zhes gang 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: dga' ba dang bde ba zhes gang 'byung ba ste /
translated: It is the pleasure and joy that occur.

original: ji skad du dga' ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du dga' ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is joy?

original: gang gnas gyur pa'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la brten pa'i sems tshim pa dang sems shin tu dga' ba dang / sems rangs pa dang / sems dga' ba dang / bde ba myong ba ste /
analyzed: gang gnas gyur pa'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la brten pa'i sems tshim pa dang sems shin tu dga' ba dang / sems rangs pa dang / sems dga' ba dang / bde ba myong ba ste /
translated: It is the satisfaction of mind, the delight of mind, the pleasure of mind, the experience of pleasure, based on the transformation of the active forms of consciousness.

original: tshor bar gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshor bar gtogs pa'o //
translated: It is included among the feelings.

original: bde ba gang zhe na gang gnas gyur pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la brten pa'i gnas la phan pa dang / gnas kyi tshim pa dang / bde ba myong ba ste /
analyzed: bde ba gang zhe na gang gnas gyur pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la brten pa'i gnas la phan pa dang / gnas kyi tshim pa dang / bde ba myong ba ste /
translated: What is pleasure? It is the benefit of the basis, the satisfaction of the basis, the experience of pleasure, based on the transformation of the container consciousness.

original: tshor bar gtogs pa'o zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshor bar gtogs pa'o zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is included among the feelings.

original: de ni 'di skad du bstan to //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du bstan to //
translated: This is what is taught.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la brten pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la brten pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la brten pa yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbased on the active forms of consciousness‚Äù means based on the mental consciousness.

original: gzhan la mnyam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la mnyam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no meditative equipoise in the other two.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa la 'byung ba na /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa la 'byung ba na /
translated: When the feeling of pleasure occurs in the first and second meditative absorptions,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs gang yang mtshungs par ldan pa de @44a * //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs gang yang mtshungs par ldan pa de @44a * //
translated: the aggregate of mind and the aggregate of the mental concomitants are associated with it.

original: dga' ba'i rnam pas tshim par byed pa dang / gnas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid shin tu sbyongs pa'i bde bas tshim par byed pa ste //
analyzed: dga' ba'i rnam pas tshim par byed pa dang / gnas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid shin tu sbyongs pa'i bde bas tshim par byed pa ste //
translated: It is satisfied by the satisfaction that is due to joy and by the satisfaction that is due to the pleasure of fitness which has the essential nature of the store-consciousness.

original: de lta bas na de gnyis ka'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir 'di ni dga' ba dang bde ba zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyi gar rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na de gnyis ka'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir 'di ni dga' ba dang bde ba zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyi gar rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because it performs the function of both, it is to be known that it is established as being of two kinds, namely, joy and pleasure.

original: de bas na de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nga rgyal ni bde ba dang yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nga rgyal ni bde ba dang yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Hence, the pride that is associated with it is said to be associated with pleasure and mental happiness.

original: log par lta ba ni 'dod pa'i khams na yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya ste //
analyzed: log par lta ba ni 'dod pa'i khams na yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya ste //
translated: Wrong view is associated with mental pleasure and mental pain in the desire realm.

original: legs par bya ba dang nyes par bya ba byed pa rnams kyi de'i 'bras bu med par mthong nas mi mos pa dang dga' ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par bya ba dang nyes par bya ba byed pa rnams kyi de'i 'bras bu med par mthong nas mi mos pa dang dga' ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when one sees that the results of good and bad actions do not exist, one generates non-faith and joy.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma yin te //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma yin te //
translated: It is not associated with pleasure or pain.

original: lta ba thams cad ni yid kyi sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba thams cad ni yid kyi sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all views are on the level of the mental faculty.

original: the tshom ni 'dod pa'i khams na yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin te //
analyzed: the tshom ni 'dod pa'i khams na yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin te //
translated: Doubt is not associated with mental pleasure in the desire realm.

original: sems gtan la phab pa med pa ni mos pa med pas yid bde ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems gtan la phab pa med pa ni mos pa med pas yid bde ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because without certainty in the mind, there is no faith and therefore no mental pleasure.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni the tshom gyi shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa rnams kyi dga' ba dang / bde ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs bskyed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba nyid de //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni the tshom gyi shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa rnams kyi dga' ba dang / bde ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs bskyed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba nyid de //
translated: In the form realm, the joy and pleasure of those who are predominantly absorbed in doubt is due to the power of concentration.

original: de na bde ba dang yid bde ba dang yang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: de na bde ba dang yid bde ba dang yang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: It is associated with pleasure and mental satisfaction.

original: ma rig pa ma 'dres pa yang bde ba dang yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa las brtsams te tshul 'di 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa ma 'dres pa yang bde ba dang yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa las brtsams te tshul 'di 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Ignorance unmixed with other defilements is associated with pleasure and mental satisfaction, and also with indifference. This same principle should be understood in the case of ignorance unmixed with other defilements, which is associated with pleasure and mental satisfaction, and also with indifference.

original: ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan zhe na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan zhe na //
translated: Why is it that all defilements are associated with indifference?

original: tha mal par 'dug pa la brten nas nub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyun je chung je chung du 'gro bas rgyun chad pa'i shugs kyis rgyun chad pa'i phyir tha mar gdon mi za bar tha mal par 'jug pa'i sgo nas
analyzed: tha mal par 'dug pa la brten nas nub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyun je chung je chung du 'gro bas rgyun chad pa'i shugs kyis rgyun chad pa'i phyir tha mar gdon mi za bar tha mal par 'jug pa'i sgo nas
translated: Because they are extinguished by the support of indifference, i.e. because the stream of defilements is extinguished by the force of the stream becoming ever more attenuated. Therefore, at the end, they are necessarily associated with indifference, by the door of the state of indifference.

original: btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in the case of the defilements.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan te //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan te //
translated: In the realm of form, they are associated with the four aggregates.

original: de na sna dang lce'i rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na sna dang lce'i rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nose and tongue consciousnesses are absent there.

original: nga rgyal la sogs pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa nyid de //
analyzed: nga rgyal la sogs pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa nyid de //
translated: Pride, etc., are associated with the group of the mental consciousness,

original: yongs su 'jal ba'i sgo nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su 'jal ba'i sgo nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they occur by way of thorough evaluation.

original: @44b nga rgyal ni phyogs gcig la 'jug pa nyid de //
analyzed: @44b nga rgyal ni phyogs gcig la 'jug pa nyid de //
translated: Pride occurs in relation to a single object,

original: gang yang rung ba'i yan lag gis khengs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba'i yan lag gis khengs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one becomes inflated by any of the limbs.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag ni bcu'o zhes bya ba ni de na gang dag de'i rgyu dang / gzhi'i gnas kyis kyang log par rtog pa dag go //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag ni bcu'o zhes bya ba ni de na gang dag de'i rgyu dang / gzhi'i gnas kyis kyang log par rtog pa dag go //
translated: In the realm of desire, there are ten that are to be abandoned by the vision of suffering, because there is wrong view in relation to its cause and basis.

original: / de bzhin du kun 'byung ba la sogs pa yang ji ltar mthun mthun du log par rtog pa dag ste //
analyzed: / de bzhin du kun 'byung ba la sogs pa yang ji ltar mthun mthun du log par rtog pa dag ste //
translated: Similarly, there are wrong views in relation to the origination, etc., of suffering, as is appropriate in each case.

original: de ni mthong bas spang bar bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni mthong bas spang bar bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as being abandoned by the path of vision.

original: ci'i phyir gang dag gang gi tshe dmigs pa de dag de la ci log par rtog par rig par bya zhe na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir gang dag gang gi tshe dmigs pa de dag de la ci log par rtog par rig par bya zhe na //
translated: Why are the objects of these views considered to be mistaken?

original: zag pa med pa'i dmigs pa dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po nyid gdon mi za bar phra rgyas su byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dmigs pa dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po nyid gdon mi za bar phra rgyas su byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Undoubtedly, the uncontaminated objects are not the cause of the increase of the contaminated entities.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni khong khro ba med pas sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag ni dgu'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni khong khro ba med pas sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag ni dgu'o //
translated: In the form realm, there are nine objects abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and so on, because anger does not exist there.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na'ang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true for the formless realm.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba lhan cig skyes pa ni bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba lhan cig skyes pa ni bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba ste /
translated: The innate afflicted view of the self is to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: mthong ba'i lam skyes su zin yang gang la brten nas 'phags pa nyan thos la nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal kun tu 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam skyes su zin yang gang la brten nas 'phags pa nyan thos la nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal kun tu 'byung ba'o //
translated: Even though the path of seeing has arisen, it is the innate afflicted view of the self that is the support of the pride thinking I that arises in ƒÅrya ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: ji skad du tshe dang ldan pa bran can kho bos ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag la bdag gam bdag gir rjes su mi mthong mod kyi /
analyzed: ji skad du tshe dang ldan pa bran can kho bos ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag la bdag gam bdag gir rjes su mi mthong mod kyi /
translated: As the sutra says:üîΩVenerable Upali, I do not see the five appropriated aggregates as a self or as belonging to a self.

original: 'on kyang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag la nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i 'dun pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i bag la nyal ma spangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag la nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i 'dun pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i bag la nyal ma spangs pa'o //
translated: However, I have not abandoned the pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù with regard to the five appropriated aggregates, nor the intention of thinking ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù nor the latent predispositions of thinking ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: yongs su ma shes so //üîΩma bkag go //
analyzed: yongs su ma shes so // ma bkag go //
translated: I have not completely understood them.üîΩI have not stopped them.

original: mtha' med par ma byas so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mtha' med par ma byas so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: I have not brought them to an end.

original: dper na ma ma'i gos dri ma can du gyur pa bul tog la sogs pas legs par bkrus te dri ma med par gyur kyang de zhen par gos pas dri ma nam pa'i bag yod de /
analyzed: dper na ma ma'i gos dri ma can du gyur pa bul tog la sogs pas legs par bkrus te dri ma med par gyur kyang de zhen par gos pas dri ma nam pa'i bag yod de /
translated: For example, a mother‚Äôs garment becomes soiled. It is well washed with lye and so forth, and becomes free of stains, but it still has the smell of the lye.

original: de spos dri zhim po bsgo bas yang bsal bar bya dgos pa de bzhin du mthong ba'i lam gyis 'jig tshogs la lta ba kun tu brtags pa'i dri ma spangs pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos la yang sngon mngon par zhen te goms par byas pa dngos po maüîΩgtogs pa'i bdag tu lta ba rjes su 'brang ste /
analyzed: de spos dri zhim po bsgo bas yang bsal bar bya dgos pa de bzhin du mthong ba'i lam gyis 'jig tshogs la lta ba kun tu brtags pa'i dri ma spangs pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos la yang sngon mngon par zhen te goms par byas pa dngos po ma gtogs pa'i bdag tu lta ba rjes su 'brang ste /
translated: The smell of the path of seeing is the smell of the path of seeing.

original: de ni lam bsgoms pas spang bar bya dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni lam bsgoms pas spang bar bya dgos pa yin no //
translated: The smell of the path of meditation is the smell of the path of meditation.üîΩThe smell of the view of the transitory collection is the smell of the view of the transitory collection.üîΩThe smell of the view of the transitory collection is the smell of the view of the transitory collection.

analyzed: mthar 'dzin par lta ba lhan cig skyes pa ni chad par lta bas bsdus par rig par bya ste / des bdag gi bdag gang yin zhes @45a * // yongs su mi chad pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la yid phyir ldog par byed do //
translated: The smell of the view of the transitory collection is the smell of the view of the transitory collection.üîΩThe smell of the view of the transitory collection is the smell of the view of the transitory collection.üîΩThe smell of the view of the transitory collection is the smell of the view of the transitory collection.üîΩThe smell of the view of the transitory collection is the smell of the view of the transitory collection.üîΩThe smell of the view of the transitory collection is the smell of the view of the transitory collection.üîΩThe smell of the view of the transitory collection is the smell of the view of the transitory collection.üîΩThe smell of the view of the transitory collection is the smell of the view of the transitory collection.üîΩThe smell of the view of the transitory collection is the smell of the view of the transitory collection.üîΩThe smell of the view of the transitory collection is the smell of the view of the transitory collection.üîΩThe smell of the view of the transitory collection is the smell of the view of the transitory collection.üîΩThe smell of the view of the transitory collection is the smell of the view of the transitory collection.üîΩThe smell of the view of the transitory collection is the smell of the view of the transitory collection.üîΩThe smell of the view of the transitory collection is the smell of the view of the transitory collection.üîΩThe smell of the view of the transitory collection is the smell of the view of the transitory collection.üîΩThe smell of the view of the transitory collection is the smell of the view of the transitory collection.üîΩThe smell of the view of the transitory collection is the smell of the view of the transitory collection.

original: lta ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa ma gtogs par 'dod chags la sogs pa ni bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba dag go //
analyzed: lta ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa ma gtogs par 'dod chags la sogs pa ni bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba dag go //
translated: The smell of the view of the transitory collection is the smell of the view of the transitory collection.üîΩThe smell of the view of the transitory collection is the smell of the view of the transitory

original: de'i gzhi'i dngos po yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ma spangs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i gzhi'i dngos po yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ma spangs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The so-called thorough knowledge of the thing as it is is the non-abandonment of the latent impressions of the afflictions, as before.

original: ngo bo nyid yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba ni sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi nyon mongs pa ni 'byung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba ni sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi nyon mongs pa ni 'byung po zhes bya'o //
translated: The so-called thorough knowledge of the essence is the afflictions that are the nature of afflicting the mind are called the arising.

original: nyes dmigs yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba ni bdag la gnod pa dang gzhan la gnod pa dang // gnyi ga la gnod par 'gyur ba dang // mthong ba'i chos kyi kha na ma thob ba bskyed pa rnams dang // tshe phyi'i ma'i kha na ma thob pa bskyed pa dang /
analyzed: nyes dmigs yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba ni bdag la gnod pa dang gzhan la gnod pa dang // gnyi ga la gnod par 'gyur ba dang // mthong ba'i chos kyi kha na ma thob ba bskyed pa rnams dang // tshe phyi'i ma'i kha na ma thob pa bskyed pa dang /
translated: The so-called thorough knowledge of the disadvantages is the generation of the misdeeds of this life that harm oneself, harm others, harm both, and generate the misdeeds of the next life.

original: de las byung ba'i sems las byung ba sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba myong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i sems las byung ba sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba myong bar byed pa'o //
translated: And the mental factors that arise from that cause the experience of suffering and mental unease.

original: de ltar rnam pa gsum gyis yongs su shes nas nyon mongs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba dbang du mi len pa'i tshul gyis yongs su spang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gsum gyis yongs su shes nas nyon mongs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba dbang du mi len pa'i tshul gyis yongs su spang ngo //
translated: Having thus fully understood in three ways, he abandons the defilements by not taking hold of them in such a way that they would arise.

original: ma skyes pa mi bskyed pa'i phyir lam bsgom mo //
analyzed: ma skyes pa mi bskyed pa'i phyir lam bsgom mo //
translated: He cultivates the path in order not to produce what has not yet arisen.

original: 'dres pa la dmigs pas yid la byed pas zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa la dmigs pa ste //
analyzed: 'dres pa la dmigs pas yid la byed pas zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa la dmigs pa ste //
translated: By means of attention that has a mixed object, i.e., by means of attention that has a differentiated object.

original: chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In the form of the general characteristics of all dharmas.

original: gal te chos thams cad bdag med do zhes bdag med par shes pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur na //
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad bdag med do zhes bdag med par shes pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur na //
translated: If the defilements are abandoned by the mere knowledge of non-self, i.e., by the knowledge that all dharmas are without self,
